 title : The gnudental Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>First and ForemostIf you&#39;d like to contribute code to this project, please send email to info@gnudental.org and include the word, &#39;GNUdental&#39; somewhere in the subject.  Also include your GMail username which is a prerequisite to being a member of this development project while it is hosted by Google (though not a requirement for joining our community and contributing in other ways than through writing code). </p>

<p>Also, feel free to join the GNUdental-dev mailing list at http://lists.gnudental.org/mailman/listinfo/gnudental-dev </p>

<p>Feel free to ignore the big fork language below.  It&#39;s here strictly to annoy the man who had the audacity to &#39;...insist that we should not be talking about &#39;GNUDental&#39; as a separate project.   We should be talking about OpenDental (sic) and in addition to that an effort to package it for Linux.&#39; </p>

<p>NOT !! </p>

<p>I&#39;ll say nothing more about him publicly, but I consider this man to be (currently) ethically bankrupt (if technically perhaps a genius). </p>

<p>FORKGNUdentalTM is a FORK of Jordan Sparks&#39; Windows®-only Open Dental application.  The primary goal of GNUdentalTM is to support other operating systems aside from the Microsoft® Windows® family of commercial operating systems that Open Dental has run on exclusively for several years. </p>

<p>FORKCross-platform support in Open Dental has long (3+ years) been promised by the author of that application, but those promises were shown to be empty until the announcement of GNUdentalTM. </p>

<p>FORKThe GNUdentalTM project members have wearied of waiting any longer. </p>

<p>FORKLong live free software that is truly free!</p>

 summary : <p>iPhoneListiPhoneList is a Windows-based folder browser for your iPhone. It supports copying files to and from the iPhone (Drag and drop to iPhone), as well as basic file-management functions for the iPhone itself (create folder, delete files and folders). </p>

Version 0.9.8.70:Added full iPhoneLinks (Favorites menu) with ability to add new links - they are stored in Prefs. Office 2003-like toolbars Copy to deivce fixed Configurable file / folder recognition Performance improvements Added the foundations for &quot;Favorites&quot; User Preferences saved and reloaded REALLY CLOSE to decoding binary plists  Version 0.9.1.40Features: </p>

Convert binary Property list files on Copy (both directions) Convert Apple-formatted PNG files (both directions) Theme Installer (working with digitalKid) RingTone Installer System Sounds Replacement Application / Package Installer / Manager </p>

<p>If you don&#39;t have a &quot;phonedmg&quot; folder, you can get the iTunesMobileDevice.dll that&#39;s required in your C:\Program Files\Common Files\Apple\Mobile Device Support\bin folder. Make sure it&#39;s in the same folder as iPhoneList. </p>

 title : The iphonelist Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The iplab Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Image Processing Lab is an image processing application written in C#, which includes different filters and tools to analyze images available in AForge.NET Framework. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>The following filters are available in the IPLab application: </p>

<p>Color filters (grayscale, sepia, invert, rotate, channel extraction, channel replacing, channel filtering, color filtering, Euclidean color filtering); HSL filters (linear correction, brightness, contrast, saturation, hue modifier, HSL filtering);  YCbCr filters (linear correction, YCbCr filtering, channel extraction/replacement); Binarization filters (threshold, threshold with carry, ordered dithering, Bayer dithering, Floyd-Steinberg, Burkes, Jarvis-Judice-Ninke, Sierra, Stevenson-Arce, Stucki dithering methods); Automatic binarization (simple image statistics); Mathematical morphology filters (erosion, dilatation, opening, closing, hit &amp; miss, thinning, thickening); Convolution filters (mean, blur, sharpen, edges, Gaussian); 2 Source filters (merge, intersect, add, subtract, difference, move towards, morph); Edge detectors (homogeneity, difference, sobel, canny); Blob counter, Connected components labeling; Pixellate, Simple skeletonization, Jitter, Shrink, Oil painting; Levels linear filter, gamma correction; Median filter, Adaptive smoothing, Conservative smoothing; Resize and Rotate; Texture generators based on Perlin noise;  Texture filters (texturer, textured filtering, textured merging); Fourier transformation (low-pass and hi-pass filters). </p>

<p>It is possible to create (save and load) your own convolution filters or filters based on standard mathematical morphology operators. Colorized grid makes it very convenient to work with custom convolution filters. </p>

<p>A preview window allows to view results of changing filters&#39; parameters on the fly. It is possible to scroll an image using mouse in preview area. All filters are applied only to the portion of image currently viewed to speed up preview. </p>

<p>A Photo Shop like histogram allows to get information about mean, standard deviation, median, minimum and maximum values. </p>

<p>The application allows to copy to or paste from clipboard, save and print images.</p>
 title : The itunesringtonepath Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>When using a 1.1.1 Apple iPhone, if you create ringtones using SendSong or a program like that, when you sync your iPhone with iTunes, it will erase your ringtones. So, to solve this problem, I made this program that will path iTunes so it won&#39;t erase them anymore. But, if you use this, I think (I haven&#39;t tested it) you won&#39;t be able to trasnfer the ringtones you created using iTunes (i.e from iTunes Music Store) to the phone. This program is a windows executable, but will path both Windows and Mac OS iTunes.</p>

Feel free to copy and redistribute this software.  </p>

 title : The keithnote Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Keithnote is a presentation generator. You tell it the name of your presentation, your name and affiliation, and optionally some extra keywords, and it downloads matching images from Flickr. The images are stored locally so you can run the presentation whilst off line. You can target Flickr images by interestingness or relevance. </p>

<p>TechnicalKeithnote is a Python application using wxPython. It is tested on Ubuntu Linux and Windows Vista. Should run as is on Mac OS X as well, and anywhere Python and wxWidgets runs. </p>

<p>ImprovKeithnote can be used as a game for improvised comedy. The audience chooses the title, speaker name and affiliation, and an improviser has to deliver the speech. </p>

<p>InstallWindows users download the installer from the Downloads tab, and run it. You don&#39;t need anything else. </p>

<p>Linux users and everyone else download the .tar.bz2 archive from the Downloads tab, you will also need: </p>

<p>Python (2.5 although 2.4 might work) wxPython flickrapi easy_install will install them both for you, or fetch them yourself from the PythonCheeseshop.</p>

 summary : <p>This suit of programs allow using any cellphone equipped with stereo output to be used as a remote control for device controlled by infared remote control. </p>

 title : The logscrobbler Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>LogScrobbler is a Windows utility written to allow users of Portable Digital Audio Players, that are running Rockbox or other firmware that generates a log file that stores which songs you have played, to later be synchronized to last.fm using my LogScrobbler Tool. </p>

<p>Changelog0.15 (July 2007) </p>

<p>Simplified interface Track list is hidden by default unless you want to select which tracks to upload Fewer options/buttons as some were redundant Added status bar to track progress of log file reading/uploading Customised Audioscrobbler.NET library to return a slightly more meaningful error message when an upload fails Massive code cleanups  </p>

<p>0.14c(Dec 2006) </p>

<p>Fixed exception when opening window from tray with select files left open. </p>

 summary : <p>Program to help manage playing ABC files in the game Lord of the Rings Online (LOTRO). </p>

<p>Not Dead Yet!I have almost dug myself out of the hole I got into by doing LOMM beta 2 instead of some high-priority and paying) work :-) I have some nice improvements for the final release and am excited to get it out to you all. </p>

<p>Also, I&#39;m thinking of moving from code.google.com to codeplex for hosting. There isn&#39;t anything really wrong with code.google, but codeplex is much nicer to use (for example, you can get email notification when a release is available and it has discussion threads as well as wiki). I doubt anyone cares, but if so, speak up! </p>

<p>See you all in-game soon... as soon as I get my client happy again. </p>

<p>Thank you!Version 1.0.4 has passed 800 downloads! And 150+ of the 2.0 beta! For something I wrote for my own use and put out there for fun, I&#39;m amazed. Thank you all.  </p>

<p>LOMM 2.0 Beta 2 is hereCheck it out in the downloads page. This release includes toolbars and macros as well as a partial help file.  </p>

<p>New preview with screenshots of Beta 2 macro featuresNew preview! </p>

<p>2.0 Beta 2 is almost ready. It will include macros, some cleanup to the overall UI, and icons! Icons in the menus, on relevant buttons, on the tab panes, ... Icon everywhere! I think it makes the app a lot easier to use quicky and generally ties things together helpfully. That is thanks to the FamFamFam Silk Icon set (http://www.famfamfam.com/lab/icons/silk/). </p>

<p>2.0 Beta 1 is here!Adventurous users can download the 2.0 beta. This new release includes: </p>

<p>Support for multiple songs in one abc file Syntax highlighting in the ABC editor Lyrics support when playing The next beta should include the advanced macros. I have them working here but need to polish up the editor so you can create your own without editing xml files :-) This is beta software: I haven&#39;t had any problems, but back up your abc files before installing. This software does edit files, after all, and I don&#39;t want you to lose anything if you uncover a bug. </p>

<p>Speaking of bugs, please send any bug reports or questions to me here by (in order of preference) this web site, email (carborunda.riverside@pobox.com), PM on the LOTRO forums (username Xowl), or in-game mail (Carborunda on Brandywine). Thanks! </p>

<p>Enjoy! </p>

<p>LOMM Features:See the UI page for screenshots! </p>

<p>Lists all ABC files visible to play in-game Shows the title as well as filename (display can be sorted on title) Area to edit ABC files for quick edit/play turnaround Shows line and column numbers to decode LOTRO error messages Sends commands to LOTRO to:  toggle /music mode on and off play a chosen file queue a file to play synchronized with your fellowship initiate synchronized play Quick access to emotes  dances (base and learned) /moods (all) emotes likely to be used when socializing (greetings, sitting, responding to music, etc.) Grouped as Meet and Greet, Converse, Settle In, Respond, and Hobbits Emotes that bestow a title or new emote on the target when used often enough Quick reference page of LOTRO ABC syntax Can run always-on-top and semi-transparent over LOTRO if desired Known issues: Reports that commands aren&#39;t sent to LOTRO on 64 bit windows. </p>

<p>AcknowledgmentsLOMM would like to thank: </p>

<p>The Dawnsong Explorers for having a great list of bestowal emotes. Wyatt O&#39;Day&#39;s WyDay forum and blog for the excellent update to JFo&#39;s already excellent splitter button Veltkreeg of the in-game music group The Mighty Might Bree Tones for excellent feedback and feature suggestions.</p>

 title : The magicwords Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MagicWords is an improved command line tool, that give you the ability to create &#39;Magic Word&#39; that can run any program (with parameters), launch any url or files. </p>

<p>The user interface consists of a simple textbox, that is hidden in the tray bar by default, and that can be activated by pressing the CTRL-F12 combinaison.  </p>

<p>The textbox has auto-completion, so you actually just need to type 2 or 3 letters to launch your application; which is the far more easy and instictive than desktop shortcuts or menus. </p>

<p>This application is inspired by the awesome SlickRun, and intend to give users an OpenSource alternative. </p>

<p>Changes:v1.4 - 13 Feb 2008: </p>

<p>New magicwords were not save correctly Addition of a new browse button in the magicword form Many minor bug fixes </p>

<p>V1.3 - 09 Feb 2007: </p>

<p>Missing bidings on MagicWord edition (working directory was not saved) Add a Cancel button on the argument form Add history on argument form Qrs exporter added Better focusing on hotkey press Translator plugin (google based, Hotkey: SHIFT-F3) Variables plugins ($W$, $C$, $I$) </p>

<p>V1.2 - 07 Feb 2007: </p>

<p>Extensibility framework Screenshot plugin (Hotkey: SHIFT-F1) ScratchPad (SlickRun Jot clone) (Hotkey: SHIFT-F2) </p>

<p>V1.1: </p>

<p>Bugs fixes and optimizations SlickRun file importer(qrs extension) </p>

<p>V1.0: </p>

<p>Initial release</p>

<p>Para realizar el desarrollo del sistema seguiremos los siguientes pasos, comenzando por la realización de un informe preliminar acerca de la empresa bajo estudio, dicho informe tiene por finalidad describir la empresa, mencionando un poco de su historia y algunos rasgos característicos que sean significantes para poder llevar a cabo la captura de requerimientos. Luego nos abocaremos a realizar el análisis del sistema de negocio y la posterior derivación del sistema de información para lograr una correcta entrada hacia el diseño del mismo, utilizando en estas etapas todas las herramientas definidas en la metodología correspondiente (Proceso Unificado de Desarrollo con UML).  title : The MijnGeldConverter Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Financial institutions typically offer downloads in various formats, none of which standardised.
<br/>MGC supports the following formats:</p>

<p>	- ABN AMRO (Tab)
<br/>	- Rabobank (ASC, CSV, ERI)
<br/>	- Postbank / ING (ASC)
<br/>	- SNS bank (CSV)
<br/>	- Dexia bank (CSV)
<br/>	- German Sparkasse (CSV)
<br/>	- Citibank Canada (CSV)</p>

<p>New formats are added on request. MijnGeldConverter or MGC converts these formats into XML, OFX, or QIF, and these can then subsequently used to import into financial software. </p>

<p>End users are requested to go to the user forums on http://forum.sepher.nl (there are forums in Dutch and in English) for asking questions, getting answers, and for announcements of new versions etc.</p>

 title : The myrs Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MyRS 是一个粗糙集计算工具，实现了粗糙集中一些常用的算法 </p>

<p>安装说明: </p>

<p>程序要求机子上已经安装了java虚拟机,最低要1.5以上,1.6最好... 
<br/>  下载 在页面右上角选取合适的版本 
<br/>http://www.blogjava.net/wangbnu 
<br/>2.  解压: 
<br/>a.   文件用7zip 和 自己写的小压缩工具压的,所以解压分2步 
<br/>先用 7zip 解压(winrar高版本也可以支持7zip格式) </p>

<p>b.    再用解压开的目录里面的myunpack200.jar 解压. 
<br/>            </p>

<p>Linux/Unix 可以直接在命令行执行:   java -jar MyUnpack200.jar   -x ./ </p>

<p>window 可以直接双击 run.bat批处理文件自动解压. 
<br/>3.   运行: </p>

<p>Linux/Unix    命令行输入  :   ./MyRS  回车 </p>

<p>window   :    双击startup.jar  或双击 MyRS   或直接在dos下启动... 
<br/>enjoy  it!</p>

 title : The notable Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Notable is a simple, completely free note-taking application for Windows that is optimized for people who make lots bulleted lists. I was inspired to make it after having worked in the computer industry for a while, and I realized that no note-taking option really suited my need to manage my large number of meetings and task lists. </p>

<p>Notable is organized as an inbox of rich text notes - essentially, Notepad with an inbox on top. However, unlike Notepad, the text editor supports formatting and is heavily optimized for bulleted lists, which makes taking down notes quickly (e.g., taking notes in a meeting) extremely easy. You can archive notes to your hard disk easily, and there is a shortcut to open up a note in Microsoft Word/Wordpad. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>For more information, check out the Notable home page.</p>
 title : The nstub Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>NStub? What&#39;s NStub? NStub is a unit test generator for .NET assemblies. You simply point NStub at the assembly containing the types you wish to test, pick the types and methods that your interested in from interface, choose where you want the resulting source files to be created at, and click GO!. That&#39;s all there is to it! </p>

<p>What do I get? Your resulting group of source files will contain one stubbed test method for each method that you selected. The code is clean, clearly documented and is already decorated to work with your chosen test framework. All you have to do is fill in the logic. Each group of source files even comes with an associated project allowing you to quickly open the files in Visual Studio and start editing. Not using Visual Studio? No problem! Just open the files individually in your chosen development environment and go to work. </p>

<p>That sounds great...except for... NStub is fully extensible, allowing you to create plug-ins not only to support multiple testing frameworks but also to generate the testing code in any .NET compliant language. The sky is the limit to what you can accomplish. </p>

<p>There a few driving principles behind NStub, we consider these our &#39;bill of rights&#39; so to speak and hold them in highest regarding when making all design and development decisions. No matter what functionality is added to NStub, you can always rest assured that none of these inalienable rights will ever be violated. </p>

<p>All projects will compile immediately after generation NStub will not &#39;lock you into&#39; any particular testing framework or language There will be no aspect of NStub that you can&#39;t extend, alter, or modify to suit your own purposes This sounds like something I could use! Great, then give it a shot! Just download our current stable build and let us know what you think. Have a suggestion or want to help out? Even better! Just drop us a line and we&#39;ll be happy to listen to what you have to say!</p>
 title : The objeck Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The odbc-dbd Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>odbc-dbdDriver for the Apache Portable Runtime to connect via ODBC to various databases.   </p>

<p>This project is now obsolete.   The ODBC driver is included with Apache APR 1.3 and with Apache httpd 2.2   Please use the Apache ODBC driver instead of this one.  </p>

<p>   </p>

<p>odbc-dbd is now included in APR 1.3odbc-dbd is now included in the Apache APR Utilities - apr-util - starting with version 1.3. </p>

<p>Of course I will keep the APR 1.2 version alive here for some time, and address any issues reported with it.  Eventually, however, this project will be discontinued.   </p>

<p>Projects get discontinued for many reasons of course, but I cannot think of a better reason than having it included in a larger, more well-know project like Apache/APR. </p>

<p>C Source Code (Windows and Unix)This driver is named apr_dbd_odbc.so on Unix, and apr_dbd_odbc.dll on Windows. It can be used: </p>

<p>... with Apache version 2.2.4+ and mod_dbd to perform user authentication against any SQL database which provides ODBC access.  Note that it may be necessary to re-compile Apache to enable DBD drivers as described in the Linux or Windows instructions. </p>

<p>... with a program built using the Apache Portable Runtime (APR) version 1.2.8+ to access SQL databases in a database-independent way via the APR DBD module. Most database vendors provide ODBC driversOracle, PostgreSQL, IBM-DB2, MySQL, Informix, Sybase, SQLServer, MS Access, Foxpro, and many others provide ODBC drivers.  </p>

<p>Apache Derby databases can be accessed using the IBM DB2-Connect ODBC driver which is included in IBM DB2 Express-C </p>

<p>Apache 2.2.4 (or later), or APR 1.2.8 (or later) is required for odbc-dbd v1.0.  </p>

<p>ModulesApache 2.2 includes a module for authentication. For access logging and virtual host configuration using DBD, see dbd-modules. </p>

<p>ContactVisit the discussion group for odbc-dbd. </p>

<p>Please feel free to send email to the Project Owner @gmail.com with ideas, comments, or reports about how odbc-dbd is working for you.  There is also a discussion about odbc-dbd in the Apache Lounge Apache/Windows forum. </p>

<p>Release HistoryVersion 1.3.0 June 16, 2008 - APR 1.3 now includes odbc-dbd.   Version 1.3.0 May 28, 2008 - Version to work with APR 1.3 or APR 1.4/Apache 2.3 is no longer experimental.  CLOB and BLOB datatypes supported. Source for 1.3.x is SVN /trunk. Most users should continue to use odbc-dbd 1.0.x with released versions of Apache 2.2 or APR 1.2.  Version 1.0.10 March 19, 2008 - Fix problems when a connection is explicitly closed, and an associated statement is closed at a later time. Added support for ODBC-V2 builds and linking with a user-specified ODBC library. Handle NULL CLOBs. Reports the original error when there is a subsequent SQLHANDLE error. Version 1.0.9 February 10, 2008 - Fix &amp;nbsp;Issue #4&amp;nbsp; - string length when binary SELECT columns are automatically converted to strings. Version 1.0.8 January 7, 2008 - Minor Unix build change. gcc 4.1+ requires the &#39;-fno-strict-aliasing&#39; compiler switch.  Version 1.0.7 is still current for Windows. Version 1.0.7 December 2, 2007 - Better handling of drivers which return &quot;Driver not capable&quot; for column length or octet-length (specifically: Oracle TimesTen ODBC driver). Version 1.0.6 November 13, 2007 - Accepts NULL parameters Version 1.0.5 October 27, 2007 - Re-packaged into separate Windows and Unix downloads. Updated the GNU autobuild files for Unix. Source for 1.0.x is now SVN /branches/1.0. No functional changes from version 1.0.4. Version 1.3.0 October 24, 2007 - Experimental version to work with APR 1.3/Apache 2.3 .  Source for 1.3.x is SVN /trunk. Most users should continue to use odbc-dbd 1.0.x with released versions of Apache 2.2 or APR 1.2.  Version 1.0.4 September 15, 2007 - Fixed &amp;nbsp;Issue #3&amp;nbsp; - incorrect argument to cleanup from odbc_select.  Open errors are now always written to stderr (i.e. to the Apache error log). Version 1.0.3 September 1, 2007 - Improved open error message retention when apr_dbd is initialized from a different thread, also added missing files for Unix build. Version 1.0.2 August 12, 2007 - Fixes &amp;nbsp;Issue #2&amp;nbsp; - Additional fix for prepared statements close. Version 1.0.1 July 10, 2007 - Fixes &amp;nbsp;Issue #1&amp;nbsp; - Prepared statements are implicitly closed when connection is closed.</p>

 title : The p4shelf Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OverviewA Visual Studio Team Studio feature that had immediate appeal for me is shelving. The goal of this tool is to dupe the core of that functionality in Perforce, the source control solution used at my workplace. </p>

<p>What this app does is take a series of files that you have checked out from a P4 depot, bundle them up, and then set them aside for you to work on again later. A very handy trick when you&#39;re hip deep in a code change and an emergency crash bug comes in that same code file. This tools lets you shelve and set aside the changes you&#39;re working on now and come back to them after you&#39;ve fixed the bug.  </p>

<p>I&#39;m very interested in getting feedback on this app. Please direct any comments, questions and especially complaints to p4shelf@natecleveland.org. </p>

<p>StatusI&#39;ve ceased working on this project. There are many things I&#39;d like to add (better UI or diff functionality for example) but I&#39;ve got other projects I&#39;d rather spend my free time on. In its current state it works well enough for my day to day use and I find myself using it quite a bit.  </p>

<p>I&#39;d like to return and finish it up some point in the future. Probably. I could easily be convinced to do this sooner rather than later if interest was expressed. Lacking that interest however its difficult to dedicate the time to it when it really does everything I need it to right now.  </p>

<p>Known IssuesUI SucksYep. It does. Really, really hard. You can probably feel the pull from your computer screen, because I certainly can. </p>

<p>COM WoesIf you just download the binaries and run them the app will crash. Issue goes away if you run &quot;install.bat&quot; in the bin directory. This will install the Perforce COM object that the application depends on. </p>

<p>Manage Tab FilesThe files window in the manage tab doesn&#39;t scroll. This means you can only see the first few files that are in the shelf.</p>
 title : The pgrep Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>An open source and free command line grep like tool. </p>

<p>It prints out the paragraphs which contains the pattern instead of lines. </p>

<p>------------------------------------
<br/>pgrep v1.00.x071127
<br/>by Programus (programus@gmail.com)
<br/>------------------------------------
<br/>An open source and free command line grep like tool.
<br/>It prints out the paragraphs which contains the pattern instead of lines.</p>

<p>Usage: pgrep [OPTION]... PATTERN [FILE] ...
<br/> python pgrep [OPTION]... PATTERN [FILE] ...</p>

<p>Search for PATTERN in each FILE or standard input and output a paragraph separated by separator.
<br/>Example: python pgrep.py -i &#39;hello world&#39; menu.h main.c</p>

<p>OPTIONS:
<br/>-c, --count
<br/>        Suppress normal output; instead print a count of matching lines for each input file.
<br/>        With the -v, --invert-match option, count non-matching lines.
<br/>-e, --regexp=PATTERN
<br/>        Use pattern as the pattern; useful to protect patterns beginning with a -.
<br/>-f, --file=FILE
<br/>        Obtain patterns from file, one per line.  The empty file contains zero patterns, and therefore matches nothing.
<br/>-h, --help
<br/>        Print this help
<br/>-i, --ignore-case
<br/>        Ignore case distinctions in both the pattern and the input files.
<br/>-l, --files-with-matches
<br/>        Suppress normal output; instead print the name of each input file from which output would normally have been printed.
<br/>        The scanning of every file will stop on the first match.
<br/>-p, --separator=SEPARATOR
<br/>        Specify a separator. The default separator is &#39;\n\s*\n&#39;.
<br/>-v, --invert-match
<br/>        Invert the sense of matching, to select non-matching parts.</p>

<p>PHP Obfuscator is an unsupported PHP Encoder released by Raizlabs Corporation. Raizlabs makes no guarantees or claims regarding the performance or functionality of this application. This application is being developed with a very specific set of PHP source code in mind for encoding and obfuscation, so your results with your own PHP source code may vary based on the syntax and coding style used. </p>

<p>This obfuscator will not work on PHP code in which PHP variable names are derived from HTML </p>

<p> tags. Use gloabl variables such as $REQUEST, $POST or $GET to access your HTML form data. </p>

 title : The powerman-wzero3 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>About this project.PowerManZero3 is a power management software for WILLCOM Advanced/W-ZERO3[es], a Windows Mobile 6 Classic equipped smart phone available in Japanese local market. </p>

<p>The goal of this software is to control the device power according to user&#39;s state of use.  </p>

<p>At present, the device power will be suspended when the lock key is enabled. </p>

<p>Further information is available at http://blog.project92.com (in Japanese). </p>

<p>このプロジェクトについてPowerManZero3は、Advanced/W-ZERO3[es]向けの電源管理ソフトウェアです。 </p>

<p>現状の仕様としては、 </p>

<p>Lockキーがオンになった状態でサスペンドを試みる モデム接続（ダイヤルアップ接続）の状態が変化したときにサスペンドを試みる モデム接続が有効な場合はサスペンドせず画面を消すのみとする Bluetooth（外付）と無線LANはLockキーがオンになった時点で無効になります（これは設定可能にする予定） といったものとなっています。つまり、Lockキーがオンの状態では、ダイヤルアップ接続が切断されている間は可能な限りサスペンド状態となるようになっています。 </p>

<p>音楽再生中などの扱いについては、仕様を検討中です。 </p>

<p>動作の確認は現状 Advanced/W-ZERO3[es](WS011SH) のみで行われています。 </p>

<p>プロジェクトメンバーを募集していますこのソフトウェアはGNU General Public License v2で提供されており、ご自身で好きなように改造するなどして使っていただいてかまいません。しかし、もし、その改良やデバッグが、多くのユーザーにとって有益だと考えるのなら、ぜひとも本プロジェクトにフィードバックしていただけると助かります。そのような方は、ぜひとも当プロジェクトに参加してください。プロジェクトメンバーは直接ソースツリーへSubversion経由でコミットできますので、ぜひとも改良の手助けをしてください。よろしくお願いいたします。</p>
 summary : <p>PriithonPriithon is a platform for image analysis and image analysis algorithm development. </p>

<p>While the focus here is on algorithm development, it makes it very easy to develop applications that would not require any programming skills, i.e. making &quot;end user&quot; biologist&#39;s or astronomer&#39;s applications. </p>

<p>Priithon is easy to install: download a single zip archive and unpack. (It requires Python to be installed. More info is on the PriithonWiki.) </p>

<p>Target audienceWhile Priithon is mainly used (by myself) as a daily work horse for looking at microscope images of some cell nuclei or other biology, there are many aspects that are not primarily geared for my own benefit:  
<br/>I want others to be able to install Priithon with minimal effort.  This means: 
<br/>Simple one-step unpacking of a package file  No system administrator permissions, or system knowledge, is required     </p>

<p>It is easy to make custom application, that allow someone to perform advanced image analysis tasks, who does not have any prior training in programming or scripting   It is the best platform I know, to teach (complete) programming novices some basic skills in scripting The Python programming language is generally considered clean and easy to learn The PyShell interface gives helpful function descriptions and pop-up lists of available functions as you type  </p>

<p>Transparent modular multi-tier design going from interactive explorations to algorithms to scientist-oriented applications Priithon sessions are (auto-) saved into text files, documenting every step of interactive explorations Copy and paste into a Python-module file creates reusable functions Functions are then fine-tuned into cleanly parametrized algorithms Simple GUI interfaces visualize the set of &quot;most-used&quot; parameters and allow execution per mouse-click Organizing multiple GUI windows with few-line setup functions into a &quot;drag-into-Priithon-to-execute&quot; script file</p>

 summary : <p>PuTTYcyg is a patched version of PuTTY that, in addition to telnet, rlogin, ssh, and serial connections, can also be used as a local Cygwin terminal instead of the Windows console or xterm.  See README.txt for more information. </p>

 title : The scripts-for-windows-shells Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>What It IsScripts For Windows Shells is a growing collection of scripts and batch files that run from the Windows command line (Windows console) using one of several possible shells, such as JPSoft&#39;s 4NT or TCC, Microsoft&#39;s CMD, etc. </p>

<p>CompatibilityUnless otherwise noted, these files were tested on and are compatible with version 8.02 and newer versions of 4NT. TCC is version 9.0 of 4NT. 4NT/TCC are supersets of CMD, thus they can run a CMD batch file while the converse is not always true. </p>

<p>InstallationNo installation is necessary, simply download and copy each script into a corresponding batch file (.btm or .bat), then run the batch file from the 4NT/TCC/CMD shell prompt. </p>

<p>ContributionsContributions to this project are encouraged. Please review here the liberal terms of this project New BSD License. Further information can be found in (1), and in (2). </p>

<p>(1) Overview of New BSD License, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BSD_License (2) Overview of the eight license types that are permitted on Google Code Project Hosting, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/License_proliferation</p>
 title : The seam-carving-gui Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Seam Carving GUI is a GUI front end to CAIR, which is an implementation of Arial Shamir&#39;s seam carving algorithm (aka content aware image resizing, aka image retargeting). </p>

<p>A Little HistoryI ran into a comment by Andy Owen re the Slashdot article about Content-Aware Image Resizing and decided his late night hack was cool enough to deserve an easy to use interface. Besides, after a few days of seeing the impressive demonstration video about the SIGGRAPH paper on seam carving I found myself wishing I could be doing seam carving on some images of my own. </p>

<p>Thus version 1.0 through 1.3 of the Seam Carving GUI came to be. Andy has moved onto other things and I got an email from Brain_Recall (Joe) about his work on writing a more true-to-the-paper form of the algorithm. His stuff looked really quite impressive so I egged him on. Once his code was functionally complete I change the Seam Carving GUI to use CAIR for the backend. Not only does his code work much better for stretching images (and in general), but it&#39;s also multi-threaded and has a couple cool new features. So with the new backend, the Seam Carving GUI reached version 1.4. Since then I have been keeping up with improvements done in CAIR by Joe and adding features and documentation as requested from users came in. </p>

<p>Version History1.11 </p>

<p>Update to latest CAIR 2.19 with speed improvements (Brain_ReCall) Ported latest CAIR to Mac OS X (use mach semaphores) (Gabe) Windows build with MSVC 2008 for speed improvements (Gabe) Windows build has installer (Gabe) Updated to Qt 4.5.2 (Gabe) </p>

<p>1.10 </p>

<p>Update to latest CAIR 2.17 with speed improvements (Brain_ReCall) Update progress bars to use new CAIR callbacks. (Gabe) </p>

<p>1.9 </p>

<p>Update to latest CAIR 2.15.1 (Brain_ReCall) Added forward energy parameter (Brain_ReCall) Progress bar for HD Quality (Brain_ReCall) Retain/Remove/Clear Brush now scaled to zoom level (Brain_ReCall) Upgraded to Qt 4.4.1 (Gabe) Save/Load Mask as PNG (Gabe) The Mask is saved/restored in undo/redo operations (Gabe) Shortcuts changed to be platform specific (Gabe) </p>

<p>1.8 </p>

<p>Update to latest CAIR 2.13 Performance improvements CAIR license change to LGPL v2.1 seam-carving-gui license change to GPL v2.0 </p>

<p>1.7 </p>

<p>Update to latest CAIR New choice of edge filter Reorganized GUI a bit around “Remove” function Added a few more tool tips </p>

<p>1.6: </p>

<p>Update to latest CAIR Removed marked button (will shrink to remove marked, then expand to original size)  HD Mode More parameters to teak hoe CAIR works CAIR performance improvements </p>

<p>1.5:  </p>

<p>Upgraded to CAIR 2.6.1 Can view images horizontal energy function as well as vertical Created a cursor when hovering over the image to represent the mark area size Retain/Remove marks are also shrunk with the image (will not disappear) You can select to erase areas marked for retain/remove </p>

<p>Features and ScreenshotsFeatures and screenshots can be found on the static Content Aware Image Resizing google page for the program. </p>

<p>Technical DetailsThe GUI is written in Qt 4, and should be capable of being built on Mac, Linux and Windows. CAIR is written in C++ and is mostly unmodified from it&#39;s source besides some hooks for progress and canceling. It depends on pthreads which are native on Mac/Linux but have a port for building on Win32 (dll included for easy building). All platforms with the proper build environment (libqt4-dev in Ubuntu, otherwise get Qt4 from Trolltech) should be able to build the application. Under Linux run qmake seam-carving-gui.pro (or under some distros qmake-qt4 seam-carving-gui.pro) and then make. </p>

<p>The Windows binary I provide is built with mingw and the mingw redistributable dll is included. </p>

<p>Platform Specific InstructionsUnder Mac OS X with Qt Open Source Edition installed (from the pre-built dmg image), you can build the application from the command line as follows: </p>

<p>$ qmake -spec macx-g++ seam-carving-gui.pro
<br/>$ make
<br/>$ open SeamCarvingGui.appTo package Qt into the application to make it relocatable to another computer, you can run </p>

<p>$ bash packageMac.shUnder Windows with MinGW, set your QMAKESPEC environment variable to win32-g++ and your QTDIR properly (usually handled by the installer). Then run the following commands: </p>

<p>&gt;qmake seam-carving-gui.pro
<br/>&gt;mingw32-makeThe executable will be placed in the &quot;release&quot; directory. Copy mingwm10.dll and pthreadVSE2.dll into the same directory to be self contained. </p>

<p>A Little Wrap UpEnjoy! If you have questions, complaints, or have a cool project you used this on, feel free to try and reach me at gaberudy+seamcarving@gmail.com, and if I haven’t completely abandoned this project I may get back to you! </p>

<p>For more information and updates goto my weblog: http://gabeiscoding.com </p>

<p>Cheers -- Gabe Rudy</p>

 title : The servicios-windows-vista Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The simple-timer Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is an activity timer written in C# .NET. It features the global key commands, alt+spc to start/stop the timer and crtl+alt+spc to reset the time, allowing for unobtrusive and simple time tracking. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>ExplanationI wrote this timer because there were no simple timers out there on the &#39;net worth using. The total size of the EXE is less than 36kb. It utilizes the UserActivityHook class introduced on codeproject.com for the global key commands. Everything else is stock .NET. This would work great as an example of using the UserActivityHook class (everything from KeyDown, KeyPress and KeyUp usage to canceling the bubbling of events). </p>

<p>As of 1.1, users are able to run multiple instances and give them names. I also added the ability to control the timer from a context menu on the taskbar. While the timer is running, right-click on the taskbar item to use this functionality. When more than one timer is opened, global key commands work only for the first-opened timer (this is why I added the taskbar functionality). </p>

<p>As of 1.2, users can keep track of their start and stopping times using the new built-in logger. The triangle-button on the bottom slides out a log window which displays a log of starting, stopping and total times. This data can be selected using the top-left button and pasted into an Excel document for printing or reporting. </p>

<p>As of 1.3 a ton of functionality has been added while simplifying the interface. The main interface buttons all now use images in addition to text for both recognizability and accessibility. Users now can right-click anywhere on the form to access a contextual menu with preferences and new modes of operation. Timer now provides a countdown timer as well as the regular stopwatch. Switch between them using the contextual menu. Users can now also change the transparency of their timers and set them to always stay on top, as well as tell the timer to alert them at preset intervals of time. All of this new functionality and imagery has come at a small cost--the executable is now just over 110kb. </p>

<p>As of 1.4 Beta 1 I&#39;ve added the ability to save and open timers, the ability to print the timer log, the option to shrink the interface to a 120x40 box (mini-interface), a few bugs fixed and the right-click menu (the main entry point to the extended functionality of Timer) will now work on the entire surface of Timer. </p>

<p>UseKey Commands: </p>

<p>Start Timer/Stop Timer Alt + Space (from anywhere in the system while the app is running) Reset Timer Crtl + Alt + Space (from anywhere in the system while the app is running) Quit Escape (while the app is in focus) </p>

<p>To use, open Timer from your Start Menu; enter a name for the timer; and start using! You can do this with as many Timers as you need, simply rinse-lather-repeat! </p>

<p>ContributingPlease feel free to contribute to this project. Just email me to get commit access. If you want to contribute monetarily, do so via Paypal; my Paypal address is samuraiblog@gmail.com. This is my first C#/.NET project. If there is anything you&#39;d like to recommend but don&#39;t have time to write code for, I&#39;d greatly appreciate the advise via email. :)</p>
 title : The swath Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>สำหรับโครงการนี้เป็นการสร้างตัวไบนารีของโปรแกรมตัดคำภาษาไทยที่เชื่อ SWATH ตัวรหัสต้นนั้นนำมาจาก swath-0.3.4 ซึ่งดูรายละเอียดการปรับปรุงแก้ไขล่าสุดได้จาก บล็อกของคุณเทพพิทักษ์  ทั้งนี้และทั้งนั้น เนื่องจากตัวรหัสต้นนั้นทำขึ้นเพื่อใช้กับ linux เป็นหลัก  ผู้ใช้บนวินโดวส์จึงไม่มีตัวโปรแกรมรุ่นใหม่ให้ใช้งาน แท้ จริงแล้วการสร้างตัวไบนารีจากรหัสต้นดังกล่าวไม่ได้ยากอะไร เพียงแต่ผู้ใช้วินโดวส์ที่ไม่ได้เป็นโปรแกรมเมอร์ก็ จะไม่คุ้นเคย (ตัวผมเองก็ไม่คุ้นเคย เพราะไม่ใช่โปรแกรมเมอร์) โครงการนี้จึงถือกำเนิดขึ้นเพื่อให้ผู้ใช้โปรแกรม SWATH บนวินโดวส์มีตัวไบนารีใ้ช้โดยที่ไม่ต้องสร้างเอง อนึ่งตัวแปลภาษานั้นเจ้าของโครงการใช้เครื่องมือทั้ง หมดจาก minGW และมีหน้าที่เพียงทำตามไฟล์ INSTALL ของรหัสต้นเท่านั้นเอง </p>

<p>การใช้งาน swath นั้นถ้าต้องการดู help ก็สั่ง swath -h ส่วนการใช้งานกับ LaTeX ก็ใช้คำสั่งดังนี้ครับ </p>

<p>d:\folder\swath.exe -f latex -d d:\folder\SWATH\ &lt; %1.ttx &gt; %1.tex </p>

<p>สำหรับ d:\folder\ ก็คือที่เก็บ swath.exe ส่วน d:\folder\SWATH\ คือที่เก็บพจนานุกรม</p>
 summary : <p>Talkipedia is a project focusing on creating application that enable computer to speak meaning of terms as user requests. </p>

<p>It consists of both client and server modules. The service referred to as WhatIsX resolves meaning of requested terms through a simple http protocol. Clients are available in both Windows (XP and Vista) and Mac OS X (10.5 Leopard). </p>

<p>The client collects a request from user, from keyboard or mouse input, sends a query to WhatIsX service and obtains meaning of that term. The resulting statement is then synthesized with a operating system&#39;s built-in speech engines. </p>

<p>Users can check the meaning of a term they are not familiar with while surfing or reading, without interrupting their current activity.</p>

 summary : <p>University students&#39; projects and research about networking: wiring, network configuration and administration.</p>
 title : The tallerderedes Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The teletwitter Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project&#39;s goal is to create a feature rich twitter client for Windows, with the simplicity and beauty of it&#39;s web 2.0 namesake. </p>

<p>Got a question, idea or just want to talk about TeleTwitter? Join the Google Group. </p>

<p>Screenshots</p>

 title : The tumguiimageviewer Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Imageviewer for PocketPCs., </p>
 title : The tweened Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The main purpose of this project is to provide a very simple way to animate any Xaml Objects you want in Silverlight. To reach this goal you just have to Reference Tweened.dll in a Silverlight 2 project. You will have access to color, RenderTransform and simple propertie Animation easily with many options like AutoReverse, BeginTime, SpeedRatio . </p>

<p>It&#39;s released and maintained for Silverlight 2 or higher. In layman&#39;s terms, Tweened helps you move things around on the screen using only code, instead of the timeline.  The general idea of a tweening Class is that dynamic animation and transitions (created by code) are easier to maintain and control, and more stable than animation based on the regular Silverlight timeline. The Tweened syntax is created with simplicity of use in mind, while still allowing access to more advanced features.  </p>

<p>the general idea is to make the automatic creation of resource types Storyboard. Internally class Tween operates two Storyboards, the first is used for animation to go, the other is used if necessary to animation back. Storyboards Each of these contains a number of objects DoubleAnimation XAML. They serve as animated sequences. Each DoubleAnimation refers to an Xaml object and a lively targeted property, for example X or ScaleX. So a tween can animate lot of objects in several different equation of movement with different duration and behavior. For example a double animation could loop. </p>

<p>Online Documentation :: http://library.tweened.org/doc/html/  Chm Documentation :: http://library.tweened.org/doc/Tweened.chm Blog around Silverlight :: http://www.tweened.org</p>
 summary : <p>Creation and management of the backoffice for TZN, the Techzone Newsletter. </p>

<p>Techzone</p>

 title : The vodserver Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Construct youtube video share website easilyIntroductionThis software help you setup a cdn network for a video share website. you can upload your videos files in one server, which acts as a media center, when netizens watch videos from a vodserver,  files would transfered from a relay server to vodserver then to user player. </p>

<p>This software vodserver can be acted as vod server or relay sever, then you can add a apache or a iis as media center and upload your media files only to this media center, when netizen acess your media contents from vodservers, if vodserver has media contents, then it will give media contents to netizen, if it has&#39;nt, it will pull the meida contents from a relay server on packets. In a simple words, vodserver and relay server all has it&#39;s own cache. Try once, Your media cdn networks would run... </p>

<p>change logfinished changing network layer from ACE platfrom to boost ASIO...[2008-08-13] add some signal handler...[2008-07-20] restruct the program. now the program is stable...[2008-07-11] vodserver cluster feature windows and linux edition release, now you can setup several ip separeated by &quot;,&quot;, like p2p, and set proxy_connect_time_out to limit connect timeout [2008-05-20] vodserver first edition release,you can setup a cdn network by this software [2008-05-07] blog linkhttp://blog.sina.com.cn/liujie </p>

<p>system top graph </p>

<p>featuresFeatures: </p>

<p>Run on all popular platforms.Such as Windows2000,WindowsXP,Windows2003,SunOS,Linux,Unix Because of based on asynch call techs,it Supports huge concurrent Http Acesses to Media File Requests(wmv,flv,mov...) Save mony in net band.Supporting config connection&#39;s download speed, for example you can limit download speed of wmv file(400kbps) in 400kbps Simple media content delivery in pull mode, so you don&#39;t care file transfer from media center to vod servers.When people demand a media file in a vod server, if this file don&#39;t exists in it, it will get this file through Relay Server. When it gets blocks of file, it sends it to people immediatly, not waiting for whole file downloaded from Relay Server. So reacts is very quickly setupconfig filefile in ini type </p>

<p>[server]
<br/>;port number
<br/>port=80</p>

<p>;proxy address for exmple 202.108.156.133:8080,202.108.156.134:8080
<br/>;you can set serveral proxys to makeup a cluster,for exmaple, you set
<br/>;your brothers all in proxy, then only all brothers havn&#39;t block you
<br/>;need, then you ask block to father proxy
<br/>proxy=xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx:xxx</p>

<p>;setup proxy connect timeout, in second, for example 1 mean when can not
<br/>;connect a proxy after 1 second then connect next proxy....
<br/>proxy_connect_time_out=1</p>

<p>;max thread count in pool
<br/>max_threads=20</p>

<p>;min thread count in pool
<br/>min_threads=4</p>

<p>;max concurrent connection count
<br/>max_connections=1000</p>

<p>;one connection buffer in IO (8K bytes)
<br/>session_buffer_size=8192</p>

<p>;proxy connection buffer in IO (64K bytes)
<br/>proxy_session_buffer_size=65536</p>

<p>;cache block count. Such as 10000 blocks,each one block is 1M bytes. 
<br/>;you should setup max as large as possible according hard storage
<br/>max_blocks=xxxx</p>

<p>;bdb cache size. Such as 64M bytes.
<br/>cache_size=67108864</p>

<p>;max concurrent proxy connection count.
<br/>max_proxy_sessions=100</p>

<p>;max write speed in bytes. Such as 51200 bytes(400Kbps)
<br/>max_write_speed=xxxx</p>

<p>;max unlimit write buffer size in bytes. When start to write.Such as 1M bytes.
<br/>max_unlimit_write_buffer_size=1048576</p>

<p>;max error response count. when error count exceed it, error buffer will clear again.
<br/>max_error_responses=5000;</p>

<p>;max cache timeout in seconds. When in error response. 
<br/>;you always get same error response in the specified interval.
<br/>max_error_timeout=60</p>

<p>;max timeout of idle connection
<br/>max_idle_timeout=60
<br/>;max wait time in seconds when data not received from proxy
<br/>wait_proxy_timeout=3</p>

<p>;you can put your rewrite url in the file point by this url
<br/>;the file format is 
<br/>; /a/b/sex1.flv /delete.flv
<br/>; /a/b/sex2.flv /delete.flv
<br/>; /a/b/sex3.flv /delete.flv
<br/>; 
<br/>; in one line, first url will be replace by second, and 
<br/>;separated by tab. You can use it to delete sex file or 
<br/>;use in advertisments.
<br/>url_rewrite=http://10.210.131.2/url_rewrite.txt
<br/>;max wait time in url_rewrite connect
<br/>url_rewrite_timeout=3
<br/>;max interval time to refresh url_rewrite
<br/>url_rewrite_interval=600road mapwindows edition first, then solaris, and linux </p>

<p>windows and linux2.6 executable has released on May.</p>
 title : The walkmanmtp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>WalkmanMTPOpen source utility that allows for the creation/modification of playlists, the addition of album art to files without embedding cover images into each file (thus saving space and eliminating redundancy).  It also allows for the uploading of video/image files.  All of this is accomplished without having to install Windows Media Player 11 (WMP10 is the minimum requrement).   </p>

<p>This is meant to be a simple way to make playlists out of files already on the player, and add files to the player without having to install WMP11 and mess around with creating a library.  It will never be a replacement for Windows Media Player, or any other kind of media manager or ID3 tag manager/editor. </p>

<p>Dr. Zoidberg
<br/>test118 @ Hotmail Dot ComRequirementsWindows XP (Vista may cause problems. See below) Windows Media Player 10 .Net Framework 2.0 or above MTPAxe (included in the package) ffmpeg.exe for video thumbnails(not included. download from Gianluigi Tiesi http://oss.netfarm.it/mplayer-win32.php) Possible requirement for MTPAxe: Visual C++ Runtime 9.0 Tested on NWZ-S615F, should work on NWZ-S616F, NWZ-S618F, NWZ-A815, NWZ-A816, NWZ-A818. Possibly works on other MTP based players Windows Vista note: Sometimes function calls will fail for no reason, other times garbage data is returned (even when using windows explorer drag and drop) .  As a result, windows vista is a hit and miss. If there are problems, close the program, then unplug and reconnect the device. </p>

<p>Compiled UsingVisual Basic 2008 for WalkmanMTP front end Visual C++ 2008, Windows Media Device Manager 10 SDK for MTPAxe MTPAxe is a custom communications interface written in C++ to communicate with MTP devices.  If you want to get in the code, http://connect.creativelabs.com/opensource/Wiki/MTP%20Programming.aspx is a good MTP programming resource that helped me a lot.  </p>

 title : The wavtoac3encoder Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>WAV to AC3 Encoder 4.5 (Using Aften A/52 Audio Encoder) </p>

<p>ABOUTWAV to AC3 Encoder is an audio encoder which generates compressed  audio streams based on ATSC A/52 specification. This type of audio  is also known as AC-3 or Dolby® Digital and is one of the audio codecs  used in DVD-Video content. The program is a simple GUI for Aften A/52  audio encoder  created by Justin Ruggles. WAV to AC3 Encoder  project was started on 27th January 2007 by Wiesław Šoltés and is still maintained and actively developed. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Main Program FeaturesHigh-quality output audio files. Vary fast encoder. Multi-threaded encoding. Milti-channel file input. Multiple-mono file input. Advanved mux wizard. Optimized for modern CPUs. Small program size. Load and save all program settings. Load and save encoder presets. Avisynth scripting support (Win32 only). Full UNICODE and ANSI support. Very simple to use. Options for advanced users. Sources available under GNU GPLv2 license. CONFIGURATIONAll confguration files are in plain text format. Each configuration file  has different structure. Edit the files and check the sources to find  out more about how this files are created. Each configuration file is  automaticaly loaded/saved by program every time the program is started/closed. </p>

<p>Program configuration is stored in EncWAVtoAC3.config file. </p>

<p>Presets for encoder are stored in EncWAVtoAC3.presets file. </p>

<p>Paths to libaften.dll engines are stored in EncWAVtoAC3.engines file. </p>

<p>SOURCESSource code is managed by the Subversion repository. </p>

<p>svn checkout http://wavtoac3encoder.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ wavtoac3encoder-read-only </p>

<p>BUILDDownload latest Aften sources from http://code.google.com/p/wavtoac3encoder/ Extract them in aften sub-directory in project source tree. Use Miscroft Visual Studio 2008 to build Release binaries. Distribute Release binaries with libaften.dll. You can also build installer using Inno Setup. LICENSEWAV to AC3 Encoder Copyright (C) 2007, 2008, 2009 Wiesław Šoltés  </p>

<p>This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; version 2 of the License. </p>

<p>This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU General Public License for more details. </p>

<p>You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA </p>

<p>COPYRIGHTSWAV to AC3 Encoder, Copyright (C) 2007, 2008, 2009 Wiesław Šoltés </p>

<p>Aften, Copyright (c) 2006-2007 Justin Ruggles  </p>

<p>2006-2007 Prakash Punnoor  </p>

<p>WEBSITESWAV to AC3 Encoderhttp://code.google.com/p/wavtoac3encoder/ Aftenhttp://aften.sourceforge.net/ http://sourceforge.net/projects/aften/ DOWNLOAD MIRRORS</p>

 title : The windows-application-downloader Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The windows-itunes-album-art-importer Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>iTunes album art importer for WindowsA command line script that imports music and album art into iTunes on Windows. </p>

<p>usage: import_to_itunes.bat -s directory directory directory directory </p>

<p>-s  Sync iTunes with the current state of the file system.  If files have been moved or deleted remove them from iTunes.   -d  Add a directory of files to iTunes.   -dr  Recursively add files within a directory to iTunes.   -r  Remove a directory of files from iTunes.   -rr:  Recursively remove files within a directory from iTunes.  </p>

<p>How it worksFor each track added to iTunes the script searches for artwork associated with the track using the following steps... </p>

<p>Use artwork with the same filename (minus the file extension) as the track.  For example, the artwork somesong.jpg would be added for somesong.mp3. If no song specific artwork exists use the first image file in the directory containing the track.  For example, music/someartist/somealbum/folder.jpg would be added for music/someartist/somealbum/somesong.mp3. If no artwork is in the track&#39;s folder each parent folder containing the track is searched for an image file to associate with the song.  For example, music/someartist/someartist.jpg would be used for music/someartist/somealbum/somesong.mp3</p>
 title : The windows-live-gowh Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The xdebugclient Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>XDebugClientxdebugclient is a simple Microsoft Windows frontend for the PHP debugger, Xdebug, by Derick Rethans, offering a way to debug your PHP scripts without having to switch to a complete new IDE / editor just for debugging.  </p>

<p>News24/04/2009 - XdebugClient 1.0-beta5 is available. Changes in Beta 5 are: </p>

<p>Listening port is configurable Breakpoints can be toggled using the F9 key Properties are displayed in tooltip Optionally debugging can be started automatically on script load Bugfixes Download XDebugClient 1.0-beta5 </p>

<p>22/04/2009 - XdebugClient 1.0-beta4 is available. Changes in Beta 4 are: </p>

<p>Long strings can be displayed in a new window Only breaks on notices when configured to do so Identifier doesn&#39;t need to be selected to be inspected Automatically restart debugging after script finished Log is top-down instead of bottom-up Bugfixes Download XDebugClient 1.0-beta4 </p>

<p>30/04/2007 - XdebugClient 1.0-beta3 is available. Changes in Beta 3 are: </p>

<p>Restore ability to open files when using the filename rewriting functionality Further improve filename rewriting functionality in regards to opening files manually Properly redraw remaining breakpoints after terminating debugging session Status form is now readonly  29/04/2007 - XdebugClient 1.0-beta2 has been released. XDebug 1.0-beta2 is available. Check out the downloads. Changes in Beta 2 are : </p>

<p>Improved directory rewriting, enabling XDC to open files through the Window XP Network Location service and supporting UNC paths. Ability to open files through XDebug&#39;s &#39;Source&#39; command  Binary built with non-debug TreeAdvView component (removes annoying FPS message) Binary built with DockSuite 2.0 Enhanced file closing behaviour 14/04/2007 - Xdebug 1.0-beta1 has been released.  XDebug 1.0-beta1 is available. Check out the downloads. Bugreports and suggestions are very much appreciated. </p>

<p>FeaturesSmall / lightweight - no install required Line-based breakpoints Property inspector  Call stack overview at breakpoints Should would fairly well with remote scripts when combined with, say, Samba. Run, Step In, Step Out, Step Over RequirementsMicrosoft Windows .NET 2.0 framework (download) Screenshot </p>

<p>Stepping through &amp; inspecting variables of phpMyAdmin </p>

<p>Cross-platformSorry, at this time xdebugclient only works on Microsoft Windows. It may be possible to port XdebugClient to Mono fairly easily. Especially since the MonoDevelop project has a port of the Sharpdevelop text editor component used by XDebug but presently  no work in this direction has been done. </p>

<p>AuthorsMathieu Kooiman &lt; xdc@scriptorama.nl &gt; </p>

<p>XDebugClient makes fond use of:1. The text editor component by the SharpDevelop team http://www.icsharpcode.net/ </p>

<p>2. The Dockpanel Suite by Weifen Luo http://sourceforge.net/projects/dockpanelsuite/ </p>

<p>3. The Advanced Treeview component by Andrey Gliznetsov http://www.codeproject.com/cs/miscctrl/treeviewadv.asp </p>

 title : The decentxml Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Since there wasn&#39;t a decent XML parser, I&#39;ve started writing one myself. Main features: </p>

<p>Allows 100% round-tripping, even for weird whitespace between attributes in the start tag or in the end tag Suitable for building editors and filters which want/need to preserve the original file layout as much as possible Error messages have line and column information Easy to reuse individual components XML 1.1 compatible Needs Java 5 or better. </p>

<p>Note to other projects: If you want to use DecentXML in your project and you&#39;re worried that the licenses would clash, let me know. I&#39;m willing to relicense this code under any OSS license out there.</p>

 title : The jslint4java Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is a java wrapper around the fabulous tool by Douglas Crockford, jslint. It provides a simple interface for detecting potential problems in JavaScript code. </p>

<p>The usage is simple: </p>

<p>  % java -jar jslint4java-1.3.3.jar application.js
<br/>  jslint:application.js:11:9:Line breaking error &#39;)&#39;.
<br/>  jslint:application.js:11:10:Missing semicolon.There are a multitude of options; try --help for more details. </p>

<p>You might also be interested in the ant task.  This lets you run jslint as part of your  builds.  For documentation, see the jslint4java-ant page.  If you find this useful, you may also like the jsmin ant task for reducing the size of your JavaScript files. </p>

<p>News2009-12-02. jslint4java 1.3.3 is released.  Noteworthy alterations: </p>

<p>Add support for the predef option, to allow specifying a list of predefined global variables. Update to JSLint 2009-11-24.  This brings the devel option. 2009-11-12. jslint4java 1.3.2 is released.  Changes include: </p>

<p>Allow use of an external jslint.js. Update to JSLint 2009-10-04.  This includes a new maxerrs option. Tidy up the docs a little. My thanks to Simon Kenyon Shepard and Ryan Alberts for helping me to fix portability issues in my unit tests. 2009-07-31. jslint4java 1.3.1 is released.  This release fixes: </p>

<p>Improved support for  NetBeans thanks to Ari Shamash! Correct line numbers (previously off by one). The ant task now states the full path to the file being checked. The build failure now includes the total number of errors found. Updated to JSLint 2009-07-25. 2009-07-23. jslint4java 1.3 is released.  This release features: </p>

<p>An upgrade to jslint 2009-07-08. The indent option is now supported. Add getEdition() call. The ant task can now work with any kind of nested resource, not just files. Improved documentation. The build system has been switched to maven.  This means jslint4java is now available as a maven dependency: 
<br/>  com.googlecode.jslint4java
<br/>  jslint4java
<br/>  1.3
<br/>NB: The package names have changed from net.happygiraffe.jslint to com.googlecode.jslint4java.  The most likely place this will affect you is if you are using the antlib support. </p>

<p>2008-12-23.  Development of the code has moved to github.  Feel free to visit http://github.com/happygiraffe/jslint4java or: </p>

<p>$ git clone git://github.com/happygiraffe/jslint4java.git2008-09-07. jslint4java 1.2.1 was released. </p>

<p>Recompiled with Java 5 instead of Java 6. 2008-09-07. jslint4java 1.2 was released. </p>

<p>Update to latest version of jslint. Rework the ant task to be more flexible.</p>

 summary : <p>Welcome to scalaxx - scala Xml eXtensionsWe are planing to make some changes to scala.xml: </p>

<p>implement hierarchy of parent nodes add parent axis for XPath projections Evaluate Zipper approach (cf. [1], [2], and [3]) and a QName type to have typed {uri}localName (and conceivably a conversion from string to QName in these cases) prefixed / unprefixed attribute constructor functions (based on QName though) convert it to case classes (with nice wrapping functions for some default cases) IRI support (cf. [4], [5]) RelaxNG support    and then... </p>

<p>an internal dsl for &quot;mutating&quot; trees and if it is really wanted </p>

<p>the namespace map in projections solution (but I really just prefer using a proper qname for this) All these initial suggestions are originated at scala&#39;s user mailing-list, in particular, discussions with Chris Twiner, Jamie Webb, and Burak Emir.</p>

 title : The sheeplib Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>SheepLibI intend SheepLib to be a set of math and utility libraries for OpenGL programmers. The plan is to provide the following: </p>

<p>A C math library loosely based on the D3DX math functions but for OpenGL A higher level C++ object oriented math library that builds on the C one Another separate library to provide simple: Model loading (MS3D, OBJ and X formats) Texture loading (TGA and BMP) Font output Currently an alpha release of the math library is available from the Downloads section. This version is not complete or tested and definitely not optimized. It is still worth taking a look though most of the functionality is there and I welcome any improvements or suggestions.  </p>

<p>For more information on the math functions available take a look at the MathAPI.</p>

 title : The system-xml-optimization Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>XML Optimization is a set of method that reformat the XML metadata for use with XML stream. The process is used in websites to minimize network bandwidth consumption and increase the memory space for the applications who store them locally. XML metadata is used by modern applications like OpenOffice.org, GNOME, Evolution, Rhythmbox, GDM, etc., and is used in SVG graphic rendering. By Optimizing the XML metadata that those applications use, the application who parse them will require less memory usage, and less time parsing, thus improving speed and responsiveness.</p>

<p>   
<br/>   
<br/>both pass Test::XML.  This package tests the order of the tags, but does not test that the XML is valid.</p>

 title : The xml-data-service Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A web service framework using a provider model pattern, </p>
 summary : <p>Summaryxml-doclet converts java-specific comments from source code into an XML representation.   </p>

<p>Type information about the parsed source code, such as class, interface, and generics definitions, provides the structure of the XML content. </p>

<p>The project is a Maven-based project with integrated unit tests. </p>

<p>RecentMay 3, 2008FIX: Annotation argument values were emitted directly &#39;as-is&#39; from source.  Now the real value is emitted to the XML. </p>

<p>ExampleIf an entire source tree consisted of the below class, </p>

<p>package foo.bar;</p>

<p>/**
<br/> * A test class
<br/> */
<br/>public class Test
<br/>{
<br/>    /** A test method
<br/>     * @param arg1 A sample argument
<br/>     * @return Always returns 0
<br/>     */
<br/>    public int method1(String arg1)
<br/>    {
<br/>        return 0;
<br/>    } 
<br/>}The resulting XML would be: </p>

<p>  
<br/>    
<br/>      foo.bar
<br/>      
<br/>      
<br/>        
<br/>          Test
<br/>          foo.bar.Test
<br/>          
<br/>          true
<br/>          false
<br/>          false
<br/>          false
<br/>          false
<br/>          false
<br/>          public
<br/>          java.lang.Object
<br/>          
<br/>            
<br/>              Test
<br/>              
<br/>            
<br/>          
<br/>          
<br/>            
<br/>              method1
<br/>              foo.bar.Test.method1
<br/>              
<br/>              (java.lang.String)
<br/>              8a8b9d921db976aeae3c17957b40e460
<br/>              false
<br/>              false
<br/>              false
<br/>              false
<br/>              false
<br/>              public
<br/>              
<br/>                
<br/>                  arg1
<br/>                  
<br/>                  
<br/>                    java.lang.String
<br/>                    
<br/>                  
<br/>                
<br/>              
<br/>              
<br/>                
<br/>                
<br/>                  int</p>
 title : The xml-doclet Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The xml-expert Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Background of the ProjectNmap (&#39;Network Mapper&#39;) is a free open source utility for network exploration or security auditing. It was designed to rapidly scan large networks, although it works fine against single hosts. Nmap uses raw IP packets in novel ways to determine what hosts are available on the network, what services (application name and version) those hosts are offering, what operating systems (and OS versions) they are running, what type of packet filters/firewalls are in use, and dozens of other characteristics. Nmap runs on most types of computers and both console and graphical versions are available. Nmap is free and open source (license). </p>

<p>Visit the Nmap homepage at http://insecure.org/nmap/ </p>

<p>The ProjectThe XML expert helps evangelize the Nmap XML format file that can be obtained after a Nmap scan . The proposed application shall have the following deliverables: </p>

<p>1. Move Nmap XML files into a database.The first version of the project shall support only PostgreSQL and MySQL. The database schema will be predefined </p>

<p>2. Compare two Nmap XML output files and producing a 3rd XML file which describes the differences (newly up/down hosts, open port changes, etc. ). This will be useful to see the change the status of a target Host at different times </p>

<p>3. A simple Command Line utility and tutorials demonstrating how to use Nmap XML output effectively. </p>

<p>Language/ tools / LibrariesXML Expert will use  </p>

<p>1. Python as the programming language </p>

<p>2. wxPython GUI toolkit </p>

<p>3. MySql and PostGRE Sql as the target databases </p>

<p>Current StatusPlanning &amp; Learning </p>

<p>Tutorials &amp; Docs# Nmap XML How-To (http://docs.google.com/Doc?id=dcf7n4rz_38fm4cn2)   </p>

<p>Project Log 01-May-2007 Nmap XML HOWTO Version-0.1Published </p>

<p>Contactamitsaha DOT in AT gmail DOT com</p>
 summary : <p>This project is a PEAR-style collection of PHP 5 classes that ease the creation of XML feed documents.</p>

 title : The xml-opt Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>XMLOpt is an XML editing and processing environment. It supports XML, DTD, XML Schema, XSLT, and Docbook editing. Also included is support for the XML database eXist. </p>

<p>XMLOpt is based on the Eclipse 3.4 platform. </p>

<p>FeaturesXML and XSLT editing XSLT processing XPath view DTD and XML schema validation Conversion of HTML to XHTML with HTMLTidy Apache FOP rendering eXist XML database support CVS and Subversion support Includes Docbook and XML documentation PlatformsCurrently only Linux is supported. </p>

<p>PrerequisitesJava must be installed on the system </p>

<p>InstallationJust unzip the download file into a folder called &quot;XMLOpt&quot;. Go into the &quot;eclipse&quot; folder and start XMLOpt with &quot;./eclipse&quot;.</p>

 title : The xml-pipeline Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Simple XML Pipeline is primarily intended to make complex, multi-stage XML transformations easy by allowing the developer to create stages that specialize in particular operations and independently chain them together into pipelines. The pipeline framework uses SAX, a stream-based XML parsing technology, to maximize speed and memory efficiency. The technology is based off of concepts and code developed by Apache Cocoon rewritten to minimize external dependencies with the goal of making the pipeline framework easy to embed and develop with.</p>

 title : The xml-test Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Checks that an XML document is included in another document. It is handy when testing an application output against a document where element order is different (GData and Atom specs are examples of specifications where element order is unimportant). It has a relaxed notion of containment: </p>

<p>element order is ignored. whitespace is trimmed. comments are ignored. specific elements can be ignored by passing XPath-like paths on the command line. text nodes (element and attribute content) can be ignored by passing &#39;-notext&#39; on the command line. Only document structure is checked. You need a working Scala installation to run this program. Then you can run it like this: </p>

<p>scala -cp xmldiff.jar com.google.xmldiff.Main feed.xml feed-out.xml -i feed/totalResults feed/startIndex \
<br/>feed/itemsPerPage feed/entry/published //updated /feed/entry/contentThe above command will compare feed.xml and feed-out.xml, ignoring all updated elements, openSearch elements under feed, and content or published elements inside feed entries.</p>
 title : The xml-text-editor Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Subclass of JTextPane that is capable of syntax highlighting XML text. </p>

<p>The component is written in the Java language. The build tool used is Maven 2. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>After I wrote the initial version of this code I made a small blog entry on my wiki. It turned out there was quite some interest in the community so I decided to publish the code here. </p>

<p>Please feel free to download the code, use it and comment on it. Please let us know if you are using the code!! </p>

<p>The original wiki entry can be found here: http://www.boplicity.nl/confluence/display/Java/Xml+syntax+highlighting+in+Swing+JTextPane </p>

<p>Projects using xml-text-editor code or derivatives: </p>

<p>Apertium Viewer: http://wiki.apertium.org/wiki/Apertium-viewer</p>

 summary : <p>The XML Toolbox provides helper utilities and wrappers for handling of XML documents in Java : Extra URI resolvers for XML documents and entities (e.g. from inside JAR files or XML:DB resources) Java 1.5 generics enabled XML:DB API helper classes XML object models converters (from and to DOM, SAX, XOM, XPP...) XML:DB unit testing classes and helpers (e.g. automatic setup and disposal of an in-memory XML database) Schema validation utilities (e.g. Schematron) XSLT and XQuery unit testing framework</p>
 title : The xml-toolbox Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project includes XML::TreePP and its family modules below. </p>

<p>XML::TreePP - A pure Perl implementation for parsing/writing xml fileXML::TreePP module parses XML file and expands it for a hash tree.  And also generate XML file back from a hash tree. This is a pure Perl implementation.  You can also download XML from remote web server like XMLHttpRequest object on JavaScript. </p>

<p>XML::FeedPP - Parse/write/merge/edit RSS/RDF/Atom syndication feedsXML::FeedPP is an all-purpose syndication utility that parses and publishes RSS 2.0, RSS 1.0 (RDF), Atom 0.3 and 1.0 feeds. It allows you to add new content, merge feeds, and convert among various formats. </p>

<p>XML::OverHTTP - A base class for XML over HTTP-styled web service interfaceThis module is not used directly from end-users. As a child class of this, module authors can easily write own interface module for XML over HTTP-styled web service.</p>

 title : The Scambio Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Scambio aims to be a free and simple unified communication system.</p>

<p>What it does is simple : convert all kind of incoming messages/communication stream to a simple yet flexible format, easy to synchronize to all of a user devices, and the other way around.</p>

<p>A set of small client softwares (currently GTK/Maemo) allow to send messages, chat (to be done), share calendar events, files, manage bookmarks and contacts, and so on. Actually, the underlying protocol being &quot;usage-agnostic&quot;, many other uses are possible, including real-time communication (VoIP).</p>

 title : The aidear Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>education management, health management, money management ..., </p>
 summary : <p>A social networking, user content-driven website designed around interactive learning and ease of use.  A user can enter the website, write an article or lesson that the user believes will benefit others&#39; knowledge.  Other users can leave comments about the article, add more useful knowledge to the article, and rate the article on a scale (for example 0-5 stars where 5 stars is best) that will directly affect the rating/standing of the author.  The website is essentially a mix between Facebook.com, About.com and eHow.com.  While a user is writing an article, the editing process contains a wiki feel where other users can add input into the article.  However, once the article is finalized, the original content cannot be edited except by the original author.</p>

 title : The e4e Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Aim:  </p>

<p>To create a better and free education environment. </p>

<p>Project Details: </p>

<p>In the current global learning environment education is expensive and also not available to everyone.It also became a profitable business instead of a social service.This inequality in education brings problems in all walks of life for the global community.This project tries to address this problem by creating a virtual school similar to the real one.Once this is completed it will be merged with the real school for example high school,arts,engineering ,medical,management schools etc..to achieve its mission of education(any degree) for everyone.  </p>

<p>Assumption: </p>

<p>It assumes in future everyone will have a digital device(Laptop) and a Net(internet) connection. </p>

<p>Deliverables: </p>

<p>A web based online school with the following four major deliverables. </p>

<p>1.School management -software/tools for managing a school 2.Teaching-software/tools for teaching online (for teachers) 3.Learning- software for the students 4.Examin- Software for managing exams and study materials. </p>

<p>Things will be updated as the project progresses....</p>

 title : The fssamples Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OverviewGAAS or Google Apps™ Authentication Service let users of a premier or education edition Google Apps™ domain authenticate against a supported data source (LDAP directory, database, file, POP3 server, RADIUS or by any other implemented PEAR::Auth Storage Container). </p>

<p>GoalThe main goal of GAAS is to provide a simple drop-in solution to centralize the authentication and authorization processes with popular (and even not so popular!) existing user management systems for the average organization. </p>

<p>GAAS is an extension of the sample PHP implementation for the SAML-SSO feature of Google Apps Premier and Education. However it re architects the main components into maintainable and loosely coupled units. </p>

<p>ImplementationGAAS is 100% implemented in PHP and uses some powerful third party lib</p>

 title : The guide-to-japanese-translation-de Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is the project page of the German translation of Tae Kim&#39;s &quot;A Japanese guide to Japanese grammar&quot;. See http://www.guidetojapanese.org or visit the forum http://www.guidetojapanese.org/forum for details. </p>

<p>If you want to participate, please send a short mail to Daniel dot Gronau ät gmx dot de. </p>

<p>License note: The available licenses on Google Code do not contain the right one, but I had to select one. The original work and the translation are under Creative Commons License. Please note that I neither have the right nor the intent to change the license. The Creative Commons License is the only valid one (as stated on all HTML pages of the project). </p>

 title : The gurkulindia Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Years of research in ancient indian gurukulams helped to the world to understand the scertes of complex educational concepts. During those golden days of indian histroy gurukulams were called as temples of education where guru(master) is the god, and the student is the devotee and the education was treated as the way of manifestation of the perfection already in man. </p>
