 title : The icenv Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The icsiboost Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Boosting is a meta-learning approach that aims at combining an ensemble of weak classifiers to form a strong classifier. Adaptive Boosting (Adaboost) is a greedy search for a linear combination of classifiers by overweighting the examples that are misclassified by each classifier. icsiboost implements Adaboost over stumps (one-level decision trees) on discrete and continuous attributes (words and real values). See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AdaBoost and the papers by Y. Freund and R. Schapire for more details. This approach is one of the most efficient and simple to combine continuous and nominal values. Our implementation is aimed at allowing training from millions of examples by hundreds of features (or millions of sparse features) in a reasonable time/memory. </p>

<p>Here is an excellent tutorial on Boosting: http://nips.cc/Conferences/2007/Program/event.php?ID=575 </p>

<p>NEWS: </p>

<p>2010-01-24: Added Stanislas&#39; patch to display error rates based on argmax instead of sign decisions. 2009-10-19: Added a rudimentary java implementation of the classifier. 2009-10-10: Released the optimal_threshold.pl script to get a better decision threshold on unbalanced data (for binary problems only). 2009-07-29: There is now a decoder in pure python. It&#39;s quite slow (and could be optimized), but is useful for small projects in python and educational purposes. 2009-04-08 WARNING: On multiclass problems, icsiboost does not compute the error rates the same way boostexter does. This does not result in lower performing models, and an option for getting compatible values will be implemented in the future. 2009-03-30 You can now specify the type of text expert and its length on a per-column basis in the names file (previously set globally with -N ngram -W 3...). Example: &quot;words:text.&quot; becomes &quot;words:text:expert_type=ngram expert_length=5 cutoff=3.&quot; which is equivalent to -N ngram -W 5 --cutoff 3, only for that the words column. You should use the svn version to get the latest fixes (change log). do not use r96: a bug made training fail (all users should upgrade to r102 which fixes major bugs) WARNING: if you trained a model with -N ngram -W length, you have to pass the same options at test time, otherwise the related weak classifiers will be ignored (unless you specify it in the names file). Get and Compile (you need PCRE &gt;= 01-December-2003): </p>

<p>svn checkout http://icsiboost.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ .
<br/>cd icsiboost
<br/>./configure CFLAGS=-O3
<br/>makeProgram usage (revision r124): </p>

<p>USAGE: ./icsiboost [options] -S 
<br/>  --version               print version info
<br/>  -S                defines model/data/names stem
<br/>  -n          number of boosting iterations (also limits test time classifiers, if model is not packed)
<br/>  -E           set smoothing value (default=0.5)
<br/>  -V                      verbose mode
<br/>  -C                      classification mode -- reads examples from 
<br/>  -o                      long output in classification mode
<br/>  -N         choose a text expert between fgram, ngram and sgram (also &quot;:text:expert_type=&quot; in the .names)
<br/>  -W        specify window length of text expert (also &quot;:text:expert_length=&quot; in .names)
<br/>  --dryrun                only parse the names file and the data file to check for errors
<br/>  --cutoff          ignore nominal features occuring unfrequently (also &quot;:text:cutoff=&quot; in .names)
<br/>  --drop           drop text features that match a regular expression (also &quot;:text:drop=&quot; in .names)
<br/>  --no-unk-ngrams         ignore ngrams that contain the &quot;unk&quot; token
<br/>  --jobs         number of threaded weak learners
<br/>  --do-not-pack-model     do not pack model (this is the default behavior)
<br/>  --pack-model            pack model (for boostexter compatibility)
<br/>  --output-weights        output training examples weights at each iteration
<br/>  --posteriors            output posterior probabilities instead of boosting scores
<br/>  --model          save/load the model to/from this file instead of .shyp
<br/>  --resume                resume training from a previous model (can use another dataset for adaptation)
<br/>  --train           bypass the .data filename to specify training examples
<br/>  --dev             bypass the .dev filename to specify development examples
<br/>  --test            bypass the .test filename to specify test examples
<br/>  --names           use this column description file instead of .names
<br/>  --ignore       ignore a comma separated list of columns (synonym with &quot;ignore&quot; in names file)
<br/>  --ignore-regex   ignore columns that match a given regex
<br/>  --only         use only a comma separated list of columns (synonym with &quot;ignore&quot; in names file)
<br/>  --only-regex     use only columns that match a given regex
<br/>  --interruptible         save model after each iteration in case of failure/interruption
<br/>  --optimal-iterations    output the model at the iteration that minimizes dev error (or max fmeasure if specified)
<br/>  --max-fmeasure   display maximum f-measure of specified class instead of error rate
<br/>  --fmeasure-beta  specify weight of recall compared to precision in f-measure
<br/>  --abstaining-stump      use abstain-on-absence text stump (experimental)
<br/>  --no-unknown-stump      use abstain-on-unknown continuous stump (experimental)
<br/>  --sequence              generate column __SEQUENCE_PREVIOUS from previous prediction at test time (experimental)
<br/>  --anti-prior            set initial weights to focus on classes with a lower prior (experimental)
<br/>  --display-maxclass      display the classification rate obtained by selecting only one class by exemple, the one that obtains the maximum score (boostexter-compatible)The input data is defined in a format similar to the UCI repository (http://www.ics.uci.edu/~mlearn/MLRepository.html). You will have to remove blank lines, comments and add a period at the end of each lines. The data must contain a stem.data file with training examples, a stem.names file describing the classes/features and may contain a .dev and .test file that will be used for error rate computation. </p>

<p>Currently, icsiboost is used at ICSI (http://www.icsi.berkeley.edu/) for sentence boundary detection and other speech understanding related classification tasks. If you find icsiboost useful, please send us an email describing your work. </p>

<p>Papers referring to icsiboost: </p>

<p>Eric Charton, Nathalie Camelin, Rodrigo Acuna-Agost, Pierre Gotab, Remy Lavalley, Remy Kessler and Silvia Fernandez, &quot;Pretraitements classiques ou par analyse distributionnelle: application aux methodes de classification automatique deployees pour DEFT08&quot;, TALN 2008 Benoit Favre, Dilek Hakkani-Tur, Slav Petrov and Dan Klein, &quot;Efficient Sentence Segmentation Using Syntactic Features&quot;, SLT 2008 Jachym Koliar, &quot;A Comparison of Language Models for Dialog Act Segmentation of Meeting Transcripts&quot;, TSD 2008 Susmit Biswas, Diana Franklin, Alan Savage, Ryan Dixon, Timothy Sherwood, Frederic T. Chong, &quot;Multi-Execution: Multicore Caching for Data-Similar Executions&quot;, ISCA&#39;09 Doetsch, P. and Buck, C. and Golik, P. and Hoppe, N. and Kramp, M. and Laudenberg, J. and Oberdorfer, C. and Steingrube, P. and Forster, J. and Mauser, A., &quot;Logistic Model Trees with AUCsplit Criterion for the KDD Cup 2009 Small Challenge&quot; Dufour R., Estève Y., Deléglise P., Béchet F. (2009), &quot;Local and global models for spontaneous speech segment detection and characterization&quot;, IEEE ASRU 2009, December 13-17, 2009, Merano (Italy). For more papers, see http://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=icsiboost </p>

<p>NOTES: </p>

<p>64-bit compatible multi-threaded training MISSING: </p>

<p>more performance measures (average F-measure, one-class error rate, AUC) scored text (unlikely to be implemented) discrete AdaBoost.MR/MH (unlikely to be implemented) unlearning (for online learning) n-fold Here is a picture from google analytics of the distribution of traffic sources that come to this website (as of Feb 2010):</p>

 title : The ironhand Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The iupp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IUP Portfolio is an education platform for Swedish schools, focused around the students individual development plan (&#39;Individuell utvecklingsplan&#39;, IUP) and learning portfolio. </p>

<p>HistoryIn 2006 Swedish government created a new law.  It said that every pupil in K-12 schools, has to have an Individual Development Plan called &#39;IUP&#39;(Individuell Utveckling Plan). </p>

<p>This plan will contain the goals that will be created in connection with parent/teacher/pupil talks that are held two times a year. </p>

<p>The purpose of having an online IUP is that all parties should be able to access the document at any time and be able to follow up on the goals that were created. </p>

<p>Goals for the IUP Portfolio projectRolled based System 2 basic views </p>

<p>Teacher Pupil/parents(separate login above grade 6) </p>

<p>Teachers viewThe first thing that a teacher sees is a matrix with students name in the rows and semester in the columns. </p>

<p>In each cell there will be of a Web form ready to be filled in by a teacher who will write down what was agreed upon during the talks. </p>

<p>This form will be separated in to this basic formulaWhere do we stand now? Where are we going? How will the home help the student? How shall the school help the student? What will the student do him or herself? </p>

<p>The result of this form will be saved in the pupil cell in his/her matrix. </p>

<p>So there are two basic matrices we want to build, one for the teacher to get an overview of all his/her pupils and one for the pupil to have a matrix for his IUP and portfolio work. </p>

<p>Pupil/Parent viewMatrix with the rows </p>

<p>Development plan &#39;IUP&#39; Documents Pictures Media </p>

<p>Columns again stand for time. </p>

<p>The IUP or development plan should appear the same way it does for the teacher. </p>

<p>The pupil and parent will be able to verify and comment the IUP from this view. </p>

<p>PortfolioThe rows for documents, pictures, media allow for uploading, viewing, and sharing, of the digital resources the pupil has gathered during the school year. </p>

<p>Other tools (In development)CalendarThe teacher will administer the calendar. </p>

<p>The pupil and the parent should see their own activities and those in common for the pupils class. </p>

<p>Chat boxThis is where the teacher will have the ongoing communication with the home. There should be a message for the teacher when there is an unanswered message. Maybe notification by e-mail. The parent teacher will only use to communicate with the teacher. </p>

<p>External linksIUP Portfolio Homepage (In Swedish)</p>
 summary : <p>education package for data algorithm in java, </p>

 title : The jogodopiano Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Jogo do PianoO Jogo do Piano é voltado pra crianças de 6 a 12 anos.  Este jogo tem por objetivo iniciar o contato das crianças com o mundo da música.  Há alguns desafios e, para cada um deles, as crianças devem escutar um trecho de música e reproduzir em um piano na ordem as notas desse trecho. </p>

<p>Originalmente, esse jogo foi feito em flash e é um dos jogos do PortalEduMusical (www.edumusical.org.br). Agora está sendo portado para python (usando pygame), visando uso em laptops educacionais. </p>

 title : The jseeedc Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Why JSeeeDC? It&#39;s just a university task, but you can use it to show children (or pupils) how big world of languages is. </p>

<p>Why Distinguished? Here is no number types. (But if you want to here is boolean, and &#39;if&#39; operator. Use it ) and have a lot of fun. </p>

<p>Why compiler? Some one may told that this program is just &#39;interpretor&#39; whell, I use term from &quot;Red Dragon Book&quot;. </p>

<p>What about? Here&#39;s only three types: boolean, char, string. Here&#39;s global and local scopes. Here&#39;s &#39;if&#39;, &#39;while&#39;, &#39;repeat&#39;, &#39;forup&#39; and other operators. Here&#39;s functions, functions with different types. It&#39;s strong typed language. And many other details. </p>

<p>Gaven result?  Error list. (if you make errors in code). 2. Genered result_code.java (interpetted code to java language). 
<br/>What More? Look to current wiki.</p>

 title : The logicparser Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Este parser de expressões lógicas, examina uma expressão e gera uma árvore. Futuramente o valor final da expressão pode ser calculado. Será primariamente desenvolvido em Linux, mas pode ser compilado para Win32 com MinGW/MSys ou Cygwin.</p>
 title : The marchfluxmenu Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>What is it?Marchfluxmenu is an attempt to have the fluxbox menu emulate the Gnome (or XFCE) menu, in both looks and functionallity. It first generates a fluxbox menu for the current user from all the valid .desktop files  found in /usr/share/applications/ The menu entries are categorized in a similar way as Gnome menu, viz as Accessories, Games, Graphics, Internet, etc etc. The program then uses a daemon like script (mfmdaemon) to watch for changes in the directory    /usr/share/applications/ If a new .desktop file is added/removed (for installation/removal of a package), the fluxbox menu auto-refreshes to reflect the change! You can also make changes manually to the menu items (NOT the submenu names themselves, yet!). They won&#39;t be lost while refreshing the menu. </p>

<p>NOTE: mfm requires Python &gt;=2.5.2 </p>

<p>Changelogver 1.2Implemented a new icon finding algorithm for the apps appearing in the menu. Now it searches for icons  in the directories /usr/share/pixmaps and /usr/share/icons/48x48/apps. It matches the icon file names with the Icon entry in the respective .desktop files One can also add more directories easily. </p>

<p>Screenie </p>

<p>Getting startedMarchfluxmenu is written in python, which you need to have in your system. To run the GUI menu editor, fluxMenu, you&#39;ll also need pygtk. </p>

<p>Get the tarball, untar it and run the installer script there. This will create a ~/.marchfluxmenu directory where the program will be &#39;installed&#39;.The installer also generates a new fluxbox menu. The current menu will be backed up as ~/.fluxbox/menu.mfm.bak The mfmdaemon is also started by the installer. You might want to add the &#39;daemon&#39; to your fluxbox startup file as well, if you want it to run everytime fluxbox starts (Recommended!). Just add the line  </p>

<p>~/.marchfluxmenu/.mfmdaemon &amp; 
<br/>at the appropriate place of ~/.fluxbox/startup</p>

 title : The open-source-physics Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The continued use of procedural languages in education is due, in part, to the lack of up-to-date curricular materials that combine science topics with an object-oriented programming framework. Although there are many resources for teaching computational physics, few are object-oriented. What is needed by the broader science education community is not another computational physics, numerical analysis, or Java programming book (although such books are essential for discipline-specific practitioners), but a synthesis of curriculum development, computational physics, computer science, and physics education that will be useful for scientists and students wishing to write their own simulations and develop their own curricular material. The Open Source Physics (OSP) project was established to meet this need. OSP is an NSF-funded curriculum development project that is developing and distributing a code library, programs, and examples of computer-based interactive curricular material. </p>

<p>You are free to use Open Source Physics source code or compiled programs consistent with the GNU GPL license, but please note that the narratives of books and manuals associated with OSP code are usually copyrighted by their respective authors and/or publishers.  Source code for Open Source Physics programs is available from the OSP Developer website.</p>

 title : The openlearningexchange Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The opennero Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>NOTE: as with any active project, OpenNERO is a work in progress and many updates are frequently being made. If you have trouble with OpenNERO, check the discussion group and then consider submitting an issue. We also welcome any helpful comments or suggestions on this site or the platform at opennero-questions. And of course, if you would like to contribute, let us know! </p>

<p>About OpenNEROOpenNERO is an open source software platform designed for research and education in Artificial Intelligence. The project is based on the Neuro-Evolving Robotic Operatives (NERO) game developed by graduate and undergraduate students at the  Neural Networks Research Group and Department of Computer Science at the University of Texas at Austin. </p>

<p>In particular, OpenNERO has been used to implement several demos and exercises for the Russell and Norvig&#39;s textbook Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach.  These demos and exercises illustrate AI methods such as brute-force search, heuristic search, scripting, reinforcement learning, and evolutionary computation, and AI problems such as maze running, vacuuming, and robotic battle. The methods and problems are implemented in three different environments (or &quot;mods&quot;), as described below. </p>

<p>More environments, problems, and methods, as well as demos and exercises illustrating them, will be added in the future. The current ones are intended to serve as a starting point on which new ones can be built, by us, but also by the community at large. If you&#39;d like to contribute something you have built, you can reach project managers at opennero-questions. </p>

<p>Getting startedYou can download a binary build of OpenNERO for your platform, or checkout the current source and build it yourself. You can then try out the various demos, work on the exercises, or explore the various mods on your own. </p>

<p>Building from source Demos Depth First Search `A*` Search Q-Learning Sarsa(λ) Neuroevolution Co-evolution Human-generated solutions Exercises RunningOpenNeroExercise AddingStuffExercise CreateRoombaAgentExercise MazeGeneratorExercise MazeSolverExercise MazeLearnerExercise Running The Maze mod 
<br/>  The Roomba mod 
<br/> The NERO mod 
<br/> ComponentsOpenNERO is built using open source components, including: </p>

<p>Irrlicht 3D Engine - released under the Irrlicht Engine License Boost C++ libraries - governed by the Boost Software License Python scripting language - governed by the Python License rtNEAT algorithm - created by Ken Stanley and Risto Miikkulainen at UT Austin. </p>

<p>ContributorsThere are many people who have contributed and continue to contribute to OpenNERO. Here is a list in progress. </p>

<p>Igor V. Karpov John B. Sheblak Adam Dziuk Minh Pham Dan Lessin Members of the Neural Networks Research Group at UT Austin Students and alumni of the Freshman Research Initiative Computational Intelligence and Game Design stream.</p>
 summary : <p>SummaryThis project provides an api for working with sensors in Java.  The current focus of the project are sensor devices mainly used in education.   </p>

<p>Some vendors that provide sensor devices used in education: </p>

<p>Vernier Data Harvest  Fourier Pasco </p>

<p>The ProblemAll of the vendors of these sensor devices provide software for working with their sensors.  Most of this vendor software allows writing activities or labs which use the sensors.  But if an author uses this approach, their activity or lab will only work with one vendor&#39;s sensors.  Within a district or even a school there can be multiple types of devices from different vendors.   </p>

<p>Part of the SolutionThe org-concord-sensor api provides a solution to part of the problem.  It allows a programmer to work with these sensors independent of which device is actually being used. To completely solve the problem, the api needs to be embedded inside of a content framework so authors can create activities which use the api. </p>

<p>There are open source implementations of the org-concord-sensor api for Vernier LabPro, and Vernier Go! Link.  There are closed source implementations for some of the other devices. </p>

<p>The DetailsThe wiki pages for this project are currently located here: http://confluence.concord.org/display/SENS/Sensor+Device+System Some of those pages are out of date.   </p>

<p>To get started by checking out the code and running examples  go to the Getting Started page.</p>

 summary : <p>ABOUTpygpslog is a GPS logger for S60  smartphones that uses Nokia&#39;s internal location and landmarks API and thus can co-exist with other navigation applications (e.g. Nokia Maps) running at the same time. </p>

<p>It&#39;s features include </p>

<p>Record data in standard GPX or OziExplorer format. Easy marking of waypoints (with or without confirmation). Easy marking of six different track segment types (e.g. speed limits). The usual: Data view, Satellite View, Compass View... Simultaneous logging and navigation (e.g. with Nokia Maps). Integration with Nokia&#39;s landmarks. </p>

<p>WHAT&#39;S NEWPlease see the History page. </p>

<p>LICENSEsee LICENSES and COPYING 
<br/>REQUIREMENTSA device running S60 3rd edition. An internal or external GPS device. Python for S60, v1.4.2 or higher. Versions 1.9.x and higher are not supported at this time. You may get it from SourceForge. 
<br/>If you&#39;re new to Python on S60 it&#39;s probably better to read the 
<br/>PyS60 Wiki first. 
<br/>The LocationRequestor module (see below!). The Landmarks module (see below!). All installation files have to be Symbian Signed by yourself in order to be really useful. Please see the DOCUMENTATION The LocationRequestor module above is packaged with an UID that cannot be used for Symbian&#39;s Open Signed process. Therefore I&#39;m making a  re-packaged version available here. </p>

<p>Unfortunately, the Landmarks module, as of Mar. 7, 2008, contains a few bugs that prevent it from working with pygpslog. Until I receive word from the authors, you may download a patched version from this site. </p>

<p>In fact, the LocationRequestor and Landmarks modules are not absolutely required to run pygpslog, but the functionality will be severely limited. Please see below. </p>

 title : The revolutionary-elearning-in-singapore Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Traditional teaching methods of developing academic materials have resulted in &quot;reinventing the wheel&quot;. Therefore, there is a need to utilize the open source model to assist educators by creating a repository of materials freely available to all. </p>

<p>1. Introduction </p>

<p>Rationale: Despite the aim of education being common enlightenment, it is not uncommon for schools in the competitive education market to hoard educational resources. Many schools have developed excellent teaching resources and methods only to “waste” them by granting exclusive access to this invaluable material. Therefore, we suggest the adaptation of the Open Source Development Model, with its hallmarks of innovation and openness, to build an open repository of academic material would promote cooperation between educators, as well as providing an economical alternative to commercial textbooks. </p>

<p>Overview of Project: This project places great emphasis on the sharing of materials, as well as constant updating and improving teaching materials by the various schools in Singapore so as to provide freely available academic material for use by students and teachers. In order to achieve the objective, I studied the current practices of the Open Source Model. Also, I investigated how Open Source managed to involve various users in the development of computer code and how I can propose to adapt these practices to the education community. </p>

<p>Proposed Plan: To meet the needs of the Education Community, it is proposed that a central repository be set up, to serve as an official platform for public cooperation to develop free (“free” as in free speech, not free beer) material. It is recommended that the repository be based online.  </p>

<p>Organizational Structure:  Ideally, the repository would be under the stewardship of the Ministry of Education (MOE). To ensure the smooth running of the repository, a dedicated permanent team should be set up. The proposed organizational structure is as follows: </p>

<p>Active Users:  This group of people makes up the bulk of the contributors. They are members of the public not affiliated officially to the project. Regardless of their educational background, they are all qualified to make relevant contributions to the repository. </p>

<p>Permanent Editors: They are qualified teachers employed by the MOE. They are responsible for going through public contributions to the repository. Upon receiving public contributions, they evaluate suitability of the contributions for inclusion in the repository. Additionally, they are in charge of maintaining the repository, making suitable amendments to ensure the information stays relevant and rectify errors identified by users.   </p>

<p>Project Leader: The Project Leader is a dedicated member of the Permanent Editors. While the Permanent Editors may be regular teachers and only work part time on the repository, the Project Leader’s sole responsibility is to oversee the running of the repository. The Project Leader’s approval must be obtained for large overhauls to any section of the repository. Additionally, the Project Leader, having the fullest view of the state of the repository may call to attention any parts of the repository that need more development. </p>

<p>2. Project Needs: I encouraged qualified teachers and A level students to join in to develop this online repository so that the entire Singapore education community can benefit from these resources and thus, improve the quality of Singapore&#39;s education. Finally, it aims to replace the current blackboard system that requires a login password and username.</p>
 summary : <p>Flex application for alumns and teachers</p>
 title : The ronda3 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The rpsim Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The goal of this project is to simulate and demonstrate how routing works in a distributed fashion: each routing process, depending on the supported routing protocol, will read in configuration file, locate neighbors, disseminate routing information, calculate routing tables etc. However, we will not propagate RIB into FIB (forwarding information base) since that will require root access, and instructors may not want to give each student that privilege and potentially mess up existing configuration ... besides, that last mile is not an essential component to understand routing anyway.</p>
 title : The schizophrenia Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Schizophrenia is a mental illness defined in 1911 by Eugene Bleuler.  Its symptoms in psychiatry include: Hallucinations Delusions Paranoia Depression Suicidal Ideation </p>

<p>Treatments  </p>

<p>Acupuncture, -pressure, aromatherapy, biofeedback, biomedical devices, cognitive behavior therapy, counsel, education, electroconvulsive therapy, herbs, mental hospitalization, massage, meditation, natural supplements, pharmaeutical drugs, prayer, Qi Gong, reflexology, religion, Tai Chik, walks, yoga </p>

<p>Dr. Abram Hoffer used injections of Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide and reported a 80% recovery rate in his book &quot;Adventures in Psychiatry&quot; </p>

<p>Antipsychotic drugs are used, classified a- or typical. Well known examples include: typical: haldol atypical: olanzapine, risperidone, ziprasidone, paliperidone </p>

<p>Side effects may include: weight gain, obesity, diabetes, tardive dyskinesia, tremors, involuntary movements, bradykinesia, excess salivation, drymouth, migraine, headache, skin damage, liver damage, neuroapoptosis, incontinence, edema,   </p>

<p>They are thought to act by blocking dopamine, serotonin, histamine, and other brain receptors in chemical synapses, a gap between neuron processes (axon or dendrite) where neurochemicals cross a synaptic cleft, couple with a receptor, and cause a small excitation of electric potential. Sum together, and a nerve impulse, action potential, occurs. Antipsychotics can clog 50-80% of dopamine receptors. </p>

<p>Recovery rates on antipsychotic drugs are about 25% for 1st episodes, and moderate improvement for 50%, no recovery for 10%, including suicide. </p>

<p>NAD+ is a coenzyme found in the glycogenolysis of glucose for ATP production in the brain. Vitamins, such as niacin, niacinamide increase availability of NAD+, and have been used for schizophrenia treatment.  </p>

<p>Organisms require water, carbohydrates, fatty acids, protein, vitamins, minerals, nutrients, temperature, excretion, air, stimuli; </p>

<p>the former 7 are found in food, their quality and quantity can have a large impact on mental health. Consider biochemicals in food as construction pieces disassembled via digestion, reconstructed in bodily organs and tissues. Their composition (eg protein type) can alter brain chemistry, and neurochemical, -transmitter, -peptide proportion, affecting homeostasis, experience, mood, thought, behaviour and indirectly, belief. </p>

<p>Social relations and education have an impact on health, esp. food quality, wealth, and intellect. Chronic schizophrenia has higher rates in homeless, poor, and intellectually undervalued people.   </p>

<p>It is thought NAD injections could increase health of a recent psychotic episode, for use until body health, genetic, environment, toxin, nutrition changes and socioeconomic improvements. </p>

<p>Improved welfare, balance of wealth, social status, and better community integration may lead to improved societal health and wealth. </p>

<p>Philosophical considerations: </p>

<p>Philosophically, however, hallucinations, delusions and paranoia may be a result of misinterpretations by observers, scientists, psychiatrists, nurses, staff and others. New phenomena may be real, and not mistakes of our nervous systems. Examples: paranormal, ESP, telepathy, mindreading, religious, unexplained scientific phenomena.  </p>

<p>Brains may be evolved that its electric charge has undiscovered and undervalued practical consequences on environment and people. We may be more powerful than we realize. </p>

<p>Psychologists, mystics, laypeople can at times hallucinate with conscious choice. Using 10% of our brain suggests we have unrealized potential for higher intellect, e- E, electrostatics and others.   </p>

<p>Neuroscience research may benefit from patients, in difficulty, opportunity. Ethics and treatment compliance and cooperation issues. </p>

<p>A majority of hallucinations reported are not associated with schizophrenia.  </p>

<p>Anhedonia suggests better modes of treatment could increase life satisfaction. Experience is subjective. </p>

<p>Altered states of consciousness implicated in modes of genius or insanity may be useful for neuroscientists, self or others, improving knowledge of complex systems, mathematics, psychology, neurology, cognitive science, epigenetics. </p>

<p>Epigenetics indicates our thoughts can slowly recode and alter our genetic expression. Out thinking depression, stupidity, mania, schizophrenia, and other mental disorders    may be possible in part. </p>

<p>Dr. Abram Hoffer suggested schizophrenics have longer life spans, a resistance to cancer through increased production of adrenochrome, a hallucinogen. The Hallucinogens, Adventures in Psychiatry. </p>

<p>What is it? Why would a person report hallucinations if what we experience is all there is? How could one know it is a hallucination, delusion, paranoia? </p>

<p>Is paranoia a form of diligence? </p>

<p>Are there virtues or results of schizophrenia that can benefit mankind? </p>

<p>Why are many geniuses, relatives schizophrenic? </p>

<p>Are there strange results of nature from schizophrenia? </p>

<p>Why God, Allah, Buddha has created illness? </p>

<p>Why do healthy schizophrenics have long life spans?</p>

 title : The sociallearnlab Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>教育大发现图书、科研项目平台关于参与组织教研项目社会项目图书项目图书撰写资源各图书索引项目组织管理方式技术指引 </p>

<p>教育大发现图书、科研项目平台SocialLearnLab 缩写: SLL  
<br/>关于我们是教育大发现（SocialLearnLab），我们的英文名“SocialLearnLab”。我们的图标，选用的是甲骨文“人”字。今天是一个网络和教育技术大发展的时期，必将迎来一个教育大发现，的时代！今天我们会比过去更为自觉、更注重参与，在向更多的人介绍网络和社会化学习的同时，我们也在呼吁大家来共同参与、共同创造一个教育大发现的时代！ </p>

<p>我们的中文网站:http://sociallearnlab.org 我们的英文网站:http://sociallearnlab.org/en </p>

<p>参与SllJoinHowto ~ 加入 SLL 社区概述 SllQuickInto ~ 快速进入 SLL 团队协同 教程 SllResource ~ SLL 资源 SllDict ~ SLL 辞典 IRC 社区会议: 2008: 08.21,09.11,11.11,11.20,,, 图书讨论: GSH :09.03,10.08,,, ITC: ,,, 组织SllGroup ~ SLL团队 SllRole ~ SLL 角色 SLLS ~ SLL 社委会 会议: 2008: 11.20 实践: 仨儿之建议集 SllRules ~ SLL 规章 SllFlows~ SLL 工作流程 SllBrief ~ SLL简报: 2008: 九月; 十月; 十一月;  2009: ,,, 教研项目基于好看簿之社会化教学活动设计研究（ITC－Haokanbu） </p>

<p>图书项目像社会性软件、WEB2.0方式，应当成为每一位力求改变自己寻求发展的学习者，一种成长的方式，终身学习的方式。这是历史发展的必然。为了传播和推进这样一种让人获得新生力量，变革的学习工具，变革的学习方式，我们以教育领域人群（但不局限于）为主要对象，在尝试编写第一套图书。编写前请看： </p>

<p>图书撰写资源如何组织在线图书工程源自OBP计划 在线编写图书计划 图书维基文件命名规范 Issue 提案标签详解 Issue 提案流程概述   提示：因为空间大小限制（100m），在本项目中请谨慎上传非文本格式的文件，图片尽量使用链接 </p>

 title : The spellnow Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is a school assignment, and I am releasing the code that I am creating under a GPL license to the public. </p>

<p>News08/05/2008: I now have a working, in use copy of SpellNow at SWIFT-online.net. SWIFT is a spelling tutoring program that my school runs, which is what I had in mind when I started making SpellNow. I will be using Swift Online to aid in spelling learning, but this is along side many other activities already in place (SpellNow will just be a side note). This is using PHP, and I will be committing the source to SVN once I am happy with what I have. </p>

<p>Also, in regards to licensing. The source code of SpellNow is freely avaliable under GPL 3. There is a difference between the source code and content. I will not be releasing the content (spelling words, audio, maps, story, images etc.) under GPL, so it will need to be licensed out. Of course, this doesn&#39;t mean you can&#39;t use these items, it just means it will be different to the source code. It will be free for home use, but will be licensed out at a very reasonable rate to schools which are using it to assist in education, which is only fair. The source code is useless without the content, unless you re-write your own content into the source code, which is currently rather difficult, but will be re-done soon. </p>

<p>30/04/2008: SpellNow is back in development! I am going to use it at school now as a learning aid for a spelling program that I am a tutor at, so I will be adding more features. </p>

<p>17/11/2007: It has been a long time since I posted here. Sorry about that! As you may well have noticed, a PHP extension did not come about, as of yet, but I still have plans for it. The C++ version has been canned, and replaced by spellnowPy, a Python version. The Python version will be actively developed from now on, with no major features or changes for the web based version (planned). The PHP version will hopefully work with the spellnowPy version, to allow a database to be used. </p>

<p>The Python version will use wxPython for the GUI (Graphical User Interface), and I plan to have it as interactive as possible, with many more features to come. </p>

<p>I cannot give a date for when these are released, but I will continue to work on SpellNow into the future. </p>

<p>30/08/2007: Expect a PHP extension/add-on avaliable for download soon, and within the next month (September), a new release (0.78). </p>

<p>31/07/2007: Today my SpellNow assignment was due at school. I handed in a working copy with a few things I had finished 1am the night before. I am releasing this version as a normal version (as apposed to aplha or beta). Please download spellnow0-32.tar.gz. See the wiki page SpellNow032Release. </p>

<p>21/07/2007: Wow, it has been a little while since my last release. It has been a bit over a week since I got back from Tonga, and that went for 2 weeks. Anyway, a quick update. I am working on the same practice page as before (it is getting better), and have fixed the bug so it will now display the score at the end of the list, not the word before. I have also moved a few things around as well as touched up a few things. I am also working on a new menu page, to make it easier to select a level. I have a few other things planned before the final thing is released. I am currently in a different state, so I can&#39;t easily upload to SVN without my home computer, but I will when I get home. </p>

<p>22/06/2007: I have released the first alpha of Spell Now! It is called alpha 233, and you can download here: spellnow-alpha233.tar.gz. </p>

<p>NotesI am trying to keep this project as open source as possible, but there are a few things I cannot help. Firstly, I am forced to use mp3 for the file format, as I am using a program called Sound Manager to play the sounds, which uses (another closed format) flash to play the sounds. If I can find a way so that I can play it in OGG and without flash, I will do that. </p>

<p>Currently, I am working on the word lists, so they aren&#39;t fully up yet. The word database included could really be counted as a extra, as one that big isn&#39;t really required for my assignment, but it is needed to make it usable. </p>

<p>AboutThis is a spelling program, designed to help improve the spelling of Junior School Kids (Grade 2 to 5). This is fully customizable, and can be adapted to any learning environment. </p>

<p>Currently, as part of my Information Software and Technology assignment, I am required to make a educational JavaScript program. I am also planning to release a PHP addition to it, which isn&#39;t required, but will be able to run on a server and remember student details (previous results, name etc,). </p>

<p>LicenseImportant licensing information (additional to GPL): You are allowed to use this program free of use, but you must NOT, under any circumstances, remove any of the credits any where in this software. I reserve the right to change the license at any time, and if you are using the software, at any version, it is assumed that you will comply with the new license or stop using the software. </p>

<p>You must purchase a license if you are to use this software in a classroom, within a for profit organization (if you are registered as a non-profit organisation, you can use this software free of charge). This is due to the fact that SpellNow is back in development and more features are being added. This only applies to versions AFTER 0.32. For licensing information, please visit http://joshhendo.com/spellnow </p>

<p>If you are using this software in a classroom or learning environment, please email  to let me know that you are using it, and how many students are using it. IF you could also let me know any improvements or features that you or any students would like to see in it (or any BUGS that have been found, those are very important to know about), please let me know. I want to be able to make this the best possible. It isn&#39;t required to email me, but if you do, I will email you about new licensing information or any other important information about this (the latter won&#39;t be emailed upon request, though licensing info will be if changed). </p>

<p>Other ProjectsMany other people will know me from the project BitFox, which is a BitTorrent Firefox extension. That is a project I am doing under my own will. I will be working on it later in the year, but this project is a school assignment, so it is guaranteed to be finished early term 3 (in Australia, which would be by the end of July), while I am not getting as far with BitFox. </p>

<p>I have mentioned this because some people may think that I will start projects and not complete them, but this one I am required to complete.</p>

 title : The ufo-language Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>UFO is a general-purpose multi-paradigm functional programming language with some very high-level features. Some of the more specific features make it quite suitable for creating other programming languages and computational models (abstract/virtual machines). It includes: </p>

<p>automatic memory management a number of high-level concurrency constructs with garbage collected threads extensive pattern matching capabilities easy to use syntax (it is not a curly-brace-and-semicolon programming language) strong, dynamic typing lots of built-in data structures even more! The UFO language borrows heavily from just about every functional language in existence, most notably Scheme, Postscript, Erlang, Haskell, ML, Oz, and probably a few others. </p>

<p>The language is being developed in Modula-3 using the CM3 compiler. </p>

<p>The language is currently in the alpha stage (March 2009), so I am not releasing any source code.  Once it reaches the beta stage I will provide the source code here.  I anticipate that happening Real Soon Now (TM), which is why I have created this web page. </p>

<p>Until then, see http://ufo.wikispaces.com.</p>
 summary : <p>This project was created to develop a web-portal for Public-Private Partnership in IT education.</p>

 title : The uniwiki Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Uniwiki is a free all-in-one book for all university related people!
<br/>Students, teachers but not only: everyone can help the education system to be more student/teacher/people-friendly!</p>

<p>Add your knowledge as a student, add a teacher&#39;s knowledge and tips, and finally, hard subjects will become understandable by anyone !
<br/>Articles are written in a didactic way, so that all those books we buy will become just an extra !</p>

<p>How many times a student or a teacher, or even a normal person couldn&#39;t understand some concept or teach in a way that anyone would understand ? With Uniwiki a new education concept is born: make of University and its subjects a transparent and complete world for all the people who want and need to learn in the best way !</p>

<p>Personal projects, researches and inventions are welcome !</p>

<p>We are looking for supporters in other languages (subdomains available for free)</p>

 title : The w-profiles Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Basic Terms: </p>

<p>Let online profile be the page (or the fragment of a page) that contains some kind of user identification  and private data. Phones, names, photos, dating info, cv, hobbies,  teaching courses may be the part of such a profile. Assume that user create such a online profile by profile-template, means he chooses appropriate form (the set of input fields) somewhere and fills this with his own data. This form (creator) needs to create an html  page with microformat / eRDF  annotations. Thus user will get an page that looks like an ordinary html page, and its source code will  be marked with special notation to  find out  interested data fragment easily (using xpath).  </p>

<p>Let derived profile is the special facet of online profile, means it contains the subset of the data from the main one. The following derived profiles may usually be introduced: DATING derived profile, OFFICIAL derived profile, HOBBY derived profile, FORFRIENDs derived profile.  </p>

<p>w-profiles are both online and derived profiles which state (management) is supported by special services and technologies (see below).  </p>

<p>Basic assumption: </p>

<p>I suppose that user will have (or already had) a homepage where his identity data is located. Nowadays user  used to have a page at linkedin / facebook / moikrug services to manage and publish online profile. If it is necessary  to publish such a data online,  they need to recopy data (in most of them), or embed and card means an little HTML/AJAX fragment that will fetch the main account and show the last data.  </p>

<p>This project concentrates on this usage (creating and manage online profiles) and has the following accents </p>

<p>w-profiles needs to be decentralized system.   w-profiles needs to be inter operable. Easy to integrate in any system (including Security, Identification systems) and static page.  w-profile needs to be user centric. Easy to create, maintain, exchange.  </p>

<p>AIM: </p>

<p>Service will help to create and manage online profiles,  separate online profile to the set of facets (derived profile), and allow to create card  (as external and up-to-date view to derived profile). </p>

<p>USER STORIES Profile Creation Story  </p>

<p>user asks the service to provide online or offline creator of his profile page.  user found an profile-template (on special wiki) or derived from the known one.  user gets the html code of the profile and store it locally. User uses the special (online or offline) software  to create an number of Derived-Profile. User needs to easily perform such a derivation.    user uploads the derived profiles  somewhere to the web. User inform the w-profile  service (ping it) and provide it with the  location of this profile.  </p>

<p>  Profile Using Story  User want to embed an widget (little card) of his derived profile somewhere to the web. He asks w-profile service to give him this AJAX/HTML code.  </p>

<p> Profile Management Story  if user want to change all the embedded data (card) it needs to change only derived profile. All embedded cards will be changed automatically. </p>

<p>Look to the extended user stories  for detail.  </p>

<p>FUTURE USE The target using of this technology is to provide a basic space  for OPENID and  TRUSTID management data embedding.</p>

 title : The damaz-cms Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The dbaexplorer Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>EnglishThis management tool is designed for the Oracle RDMS. The tool was developed using Borland Delphi 7.0 programming environment which provides fast Access to the Oracle database. The code was developed after examining techniques to determine the fastest and the most effective ways of database Access to increase the overall performance of the system. As a consequence of this study, the most effective techniques and SQL statements are determined for better performance and put into action. </p>

<p>DBAExplorer allows you to access an Oracle database and perform any administrative task. Here are some of the features of DBAExplorer:  </p>

<p>Object Browser:  you can browse through the database objects like, Schema, Tables, Packages, Sequences, Views, Procedures, DB Links, Synonyms,  Functions and advanced objects etc. </p>

<p>DBA Utilities:  Allows DBAs to perform administrative tasks in a convenient way and most of the time with just clicks. It allows you to create Tablespaces, Rollback Segments, Users and redo log files. DBAConnect also allows you to manipulate all the information regarding an instance, SGA, Block, Free space and to alter wherever it is needed. </p>

<p>Developer Utilities:  Allows you to perform the developers related actions like creating tables, views, synonyms, DB Links, Procedures,  Functions, Packages and Types. It allows you to execute any SQL command through an editor window.  Also provides search facility to find any object, dependencies, relationships between tables and privileges. </p>

<p>DBA Admin: Instance Monitoring &amp; Space Management: includes active and running jobs,  SGA information (Shared pool, Library cache, UGA space used, Data Dictionary, Redo log buffer cache, Database buffer cache),  Free space information, Locks, Redo log files, Object and Data files, Rollback segment, Session information,  User information, Table Space and Data files.  You can change or alter any information by clicking on the active link for example to drop a user or to kill a session or even to change control files.  </p>

<p>If you have any questions, comments, or suggestions please contact me. alpaslankilickaya@gmail.com </p>

<p>Note:  You must install Oracle Client (9i - 10g) before trying this program. </p>

<p>TürkçeOracle veri tabanı yönetim sistemi için hazırlanmış bir Veri Tabanı Yönetim Aracıdır. Yazılan program, veri tabanına hızlı erişim sağlayan Borland Delphi 7.0 programlama dili ile geliştirilmiştir. Programın hazırlanmasında veri tabanı erişim yöntemleri incelenmiş, en hızlı ve etkin bağlanma şekilleri araştırılmıştır. Yapılan araştırmalar sonucunda en etkin performans yöntemleri ve SQL cümleleri bulunmuş ve hazırlanmıştır. </p>

<p>Eğer herhangibir öneri veya sorunuz var ise benle irtibat kurabilirsiniz. alpaslankilickaya@gmail.com</p>

 title : The google-enterprise-connector-manager Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Welcome to the Google Enterprise Connector Manager project! </p>

<p>The Google Enterprise connector framework enables the Google Search Appliance to search and serve documents stored in non-Web repositories, such as enterprise content management systems.  An enterprise content management (ECM) system provides a central repository for large numbers of documents. </p>

<p>The Connector Manager is the central part of the connector framework for the Google Search Appliance.   The Connector Manager itself manages creation, instantiation, scheduling and monitoring of connectors that supply content and provide authentication and authorization services to the Google Search Appliance. </p>

<p>Note: This system depends on Google Search Appliance 5.0 (Minimum recommended configuration is 5.0.4G22 with VM Patch #1).  Connectors developed for this framework will NOT work with previously released versions of the Google Search Appliance. </p>

<p>Update: Connector Manager release 2.4.4 is now available on the Downloads page. </p>

<p>This is a patch release that fixes several small problems discovered in the previous release. Users of previous releases are encouraged to upgrade.  For details, see the  Release Notes. </p>

<p>Featured in this release is easier Advanced Configuration.  For details, see the new Advanced Configuration wiki page.</p>
 summary : <p>About DrupalDrupal is an open source content management platform. Equipped with a powerful blend of features, Drupal can support a variety of websites, including personal blogs, corporate brochures, and large community-driven websites. It is used to power numerous high-profile websites including Sony Musicbox, PopSugar, and MTV UK. Many of our Google Summer of Code participants have gone on to full-time jobs at Drupal consulting firms around the globe. </p>

<p>Drupal is proud to be participating in the Google Highly Open Participation Contest™. </p>

<p>About the ContestBefore choosing a task, make sure that you are familiar with the Contest Official Rules and Frequently Asked Questions. You can find all of these details and more on the Google Highly Open Participation Contest page.  </p>

<p>Getting StartedIf you are looking for the student contestant list of tasks, please visit the Issues Tab. </p>

<p>If you are looking for documentation or help in completing a particular task, please visit the FurtherInformation page on the wiki for pointers to additional resources. </p>

<p>Submitting Additional TasksIf you are a member of the Drupal community who is not eligible for a task and would like to propose one, please read the HowToWriteAGoodTask page for more info.</p>

 title : The pycapole Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The newspaper business is served by a plethora of web publishing systems. They range from antiquainted junk to crappy Wintendo-based nonsense to expensive custom-written solutions. </p>

<p>Recent software advances offer a way out. Scripting languages like Python make it easy to write clean, readable code, and frameworks like Django (http://www.djangoproject.org) bring powerful staging tools to the development game. The folks who developed Django did so to support a newspaper environment (they operate the Lawrence Journal, in Lawrence, KS). The Ellington CMS (http://www.ellingtoncms.com/) is the commercial product that sprang out of Django. </p>

<p>This project will attempt to offer a decent subset of the functionality offered by Ellington as an open-source project.</p>
 summary : <p>Web based project management integrating with asp.net&#39;s membership and roles system.</p>

 summary : <p>Acegi conditional VoterThis project implements a conditional Voter for the Acegi security framework. With this Voter it is possible to specify the following kind of expressions in the Acegi configuration: </p>

<p>**/resource=ROLE_A AND ROLE_B AND (ROLE_C OR ROLE_D)With this Voter you can make a really powerful expression to handle the role based security for accessing resources. </p>

<p>This project comes complete with an example and unit tests to illustrate how it works.</p>

 title : The advancedscheduler Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project aims to be an Autosys compatible framework for control of enterprise job streams. Jobs may be scheduled based on time, as well as on the status of other jobs. This allows for fine-grained control over job streams -- especially compared to cron and other simple time-based schedulers.  </p>

<p>While the short-term goal is to be Autosys-compatible, the ultimate goal is to provide innovative facilities that Autosys does not, and to remove several of the artificial constraints placed on users by the AutoSys product.  </p>

<p>It will implement an similar user interface, when feasible, in order to avoid a high learning curve and excessive changes to existing monitoring and reporting infrastructure. </p>

<p>The blog, linked at right, is a good source of information on what work is being done, work planned for the near future, and general project direction. </p>

<p>HighlightsAccepts most existing Autosys JIL Autosys compatible interfaces make migration easier Developer- and integrator-friendly.  Easy-to-understand database schema and command-line utilities.  Completely implemented using F/OSS technology, such as PERL and Postgres, so ADS is easily maintained, low cost, and highly customizable.  Clients are kept as simple as possible, so re-implementing or porting to a new platform should be fairly straight-forward. Most logic is implemented in Postgres, so it works on any platform that supports Postgres.  Features currently implementedConditional scheduling logic No limits on job name length Reads and persists many common JIL fields to Postgres, even if they&#39;re not yet implemented.  Scheduling based on start_mins and start_times, start_days, and job conditions. insert_job, update_job, delete_job commands Many common features of sendevent, autorep, and jil utilities implemented. std_out_file, std_err_file, and std_in_file. &quot;std_in_file&quot; is an ADS extension of JIL. Ability to switch ADS databases via environment variables Agent runs configurable number of job executor threads. This allows you to throttle the number of concurrent jobs running on each machine.  Job &#39;namespaces&#39; are compatible with Autosys idea of &#39;Instance&#39;, except that it gives a few other advantages: No more scoping by prepending the system to the job name.  Large installations with multiple streams often name their jobs following a convention like GROUP-PRODUCT-real-job-name. Now you can set your namespace to GROUP-PRODUCT and simply use real-job-name as your job name.  If you&#39;re really stuck on the idea of an Autosys &quot;instance&quot;, just set your namespace to the autosys instance name for compatibility. This means you can combine multiple autosys instances on one database. Planned FeaturesWill allow distributed job management using multiple master database servers for better scalability.  Autorep output will support parser-friendly formats, like YAML and XML, in addition to the familiar autorep format.</p>
 summary : <p>This project is a module for Alfresco ECM product to enable the use of JEE container security for authentication in Alfresco&#39;s web client. </p>

<p>The goal is to be able to use the standard JEE authentication methods maintaining all the security functionality and causing only minor impact on the application&#39;s configuration files. </p>

<p>This project is sponsored by ParaRede.</p>
 title : The alfresco-container-security Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The apache-scalp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Scalp! is a log analyzer for the Apache web server that aims to look for security problems. The main idea is to look through huge log files and extract the possible attacks that have been sent through HTTP/GET (By default, Apache does not log the HTTP/POST variable). </p>

<p>How it worksScalp is basically using the regular expression from the PHP-IDS project and matches the lines from the Apache access log file.  These regexp has been chosen because of their quality and the top activity of the team maintaining that project. </p>

<p>You will then need this file https://svn.php-ids.org/svn/trunk/lib/IDS/default_filter.xml in order to run Scalp. </p>

<p>Scalp started as a simple python script which is still maintained, but I plan to focus my effort on the binary version (written in C++) for efficiency wh</p>

 summary : <p>Create a tool that generates, records, and plays back scurity test cases to enable testing for web application&#39;s security.It would create test cases that are custom for a particualr application, not a generic scanner. </p>

<p>The tool should have wizards for common security related use cases ,such as login, change password, authorid access, etc... The tool should combine these security tests to generate a custom set of security tests for an application. </p>

<p>The tool needs to be able to detect the sucess or failure of each test, not just repeat the actions required to perform the security relevant function.</p>

 title : The bsd-appliance Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Calao: a new way of working togetherCalao helps people working together by sharing information and coordinating actions through a web interface. Create tasks for your workmates and keep notified of their progress! </p>

<p>Here are typical Calao use cases: </p>

<p>An office secretary requests employees to fill in a form, for instance a timesheet for the elapsed month. She gets notified once all forms are filled-in, and simply relies on the system to automatically notify late persons. A sales manager requests a sales representative to work on a specific lead. The manager gets notified of the various associated events until the lead is closed: phone calls, documents received, etc. A project manager schedules and assigns tasks to project members and monitors their completion as users report the work done on their own tasks. </p>

<p>Calao provides the following fancy features: </p>

<p>Task notifications: Calao notifies concerned users upon task events: when a task is assigned, when it starts, when it gets completed, when it is late, etc.; Task attachments: notes or documents can be attached to tasks at any time to further share information with workmates. Worktime estimates: the system can learn from reported activity and provide worktime estimates for new tasks. Automatic scheduling: Calao can schedule tasks automatically based on priority and people availability.  Planning views: Work planned can be viewed as a Gantt chart or as a per-person worktime breakdown. Unlimited workspaces: new workspaces can be created to cater for specific workgroups, each workspace having its own user directory and storage. And probably more to come! </p>

<p>Project is currently in very first stage. It is basically a major rework from Calao original version by SIGNAL25 toward a more mature, open-source framework capable of supporting future extensions.</p>

 title : The classroombookings Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OverviewClassroombookings is a free, open-source and easy-to-use room booking system for schools built using the CodeIgniter application framework. </p>

<p>Status (May 09)Most of the back-end work is almost complete, so I will soon be able to concentrate on the actual booking side of it. In the mean time, please feel free to check out the demo of the development progress. </p>

<p>ContactGoogle Groups Directl email: craig dot rodway at gmail dot com RequirementsApache (mod_rewrite optional) PHP4/5 with GD MySQL 5 FeaturesEliminate double-bookingsIf a room is already booked by somebody or is used for a timetabled lesson, no one else can book the room for that period. Only administrators, and room owners and booking creators can cancel bookings. </p>

<p>Unlimited rooms and usersManage as many rooms and add as many users as you like. </p>

<p>Easy-to-useThe simplified user interface makes all relative information available at a glance and makes it easy to see which rooms are available to book, and when. </p>

<p>Custom timetableNot everybody has a single week timetable with fixed one-hour lessons. This is why we allow administrators to create their own timetable, with their own weekly cycle and lesson times to match the school. </p>

<p>Cross-platformNo executables, DLLs, runtimes or plugins are required. As it&#39;s web-based, a modern web browser is all that&#39;s needed for users to book rooms.</p>
 title : The cr-documentor Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>CR_Documentor </p>

<p>Writing XML documentation comments in .NET can be troublesome sometimes because you can&#39;t really see what it&#39;s going to look like - you have to compile the code, then take the extracted XML doc and feed it to a rendering engine like Sandcastle, then wait for the compiled help to come out so you can read it. </p>

<p>CR_Documentor is a plugin for DXCore that allows you to preview what the documentation will look like when it&#39;s rendered - in a tool window inside Visual Studio. </p>

<p>If you are not on the latest DXCore then check the download list to be sure you get the right version of CR_Documentor for your DXCore version. </p>

<p>ExampleYour inline XML docs... </p>

<p>/// 
<br/>/// This method returns a string.
<br/>/// 
<br/>/// Empty string is the return value.
<br/>public string Method()
<br/>{
<br/>  return &quot;&quot;;
<br/>}...get previewed in the window: </p>

<p> </p>

<p>...and here&#39;s what it looks like in the context of Visual Studio:</p>

<p>Cube°n FeaturesTask Repository Connectors  API/SPI for adding Connectors.  Local Repository Supports Create/Modify Task with Task Types(Task,Defect,Enhancement and Feature) with  Priorities and Statuses(New,Started and Completed).   Supports Querying local task with Attributes (like All My Completed Tasks ). Rich Task Editor.       Jira Repository Connector  Supports to connect Jira repository base on project wise or repository wise.Ex:  http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TST or http://jira.atlassian.com/ (this is really useful when working with large repository like http://jira.codehaus.org/ to prevent cache only relevant information locally ). Create/Modify Task offline/online and merge task with remote repository. Rich Task Editor with attributes editing, workflow actions and comments.   Create Query form remote repository filters.  Customized Jira Repositories including custom workflows. Tracking of Locally Modified tasks and revert modifications. Repository permissions based  to create, modify tasks. <p>trusted crypto primitives in &#39;C&#39; that are maintainable and easy to read. command line tools (written in &#39;C&#39;) for Unixtm-like systems to encrypt, decrypt, sign, verify, mac, hash, request, issue and query. libraries that implement security relevant services (cert storage, password vault, secure parameters &amp; policies, secure messaging, etc.) standard service daemons for a Unixtm-like environment to perform these same services. gratuitous use of XML in inappropriate places. focus on mobile applications (SRTP, Mobile Code, SIP over TLS, IAX over TLS, etc.)</p>

 title : The debina Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>目标Debian 官方网站 的中文化 </p>

<p>统计</p>

<p> 已翻译(Translated)  最新的(Up-to-date)  过时的(Outdated)  未翻译(Not translated)  91 files (2.3%)  90 files (98.9%)  1 files (1.1%)  3852 files (97.7%)  681673 bytes (5.9%)  652979 bytes (95.8%)  28694 bytes (4.2%)  10946967 bytes (94.1%)  </p>

<p>FROM: Debian web site translation statistics: Chinese (Compiled at Mon Feb 4 03:28:27 2008 +0100) </p>

<p>说明确保提交的 *.wml 和 *.po 以及 *.diff(patch) 文件均采用 BIG5 编码。 翻译之前烦请检查 CVS 中 Attic 目录下是否存在原始但已过期的翻译文件。为了避免重复劳动。 提交之前烦请获取 CVS 中对应文件的版本号(x.y)，并确保提交的 *.wml 文件中包含以下信息: #use wml::debian::translation-check translation=&quot;x.y&quot;更多说明，请参考官方文档 翻译 Debian 网页。 举例假如您是简体中文用户，使用 zh_CN.UTF8 编码，并且希望中文化 http://www.debian.org/Bugs/ 这个页面(以下简写为 w.d.o/Bugs/)，步骤如下: </p>

<p> 1$ sudo apt-get install subversion wml enca gettext
<br/> 2$ export WORKDIR=~/w.d.o; mkdir $WORKDIR; cd $WORKDIR
<br/> 3$ svn checkout http://debina.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ . --username debina-read-only
<br/> 4$ cd chinese/Bugs
<br/> 5$ cp ../../english/Bugs/index.wml ./index.utf.txt
<br/> 6$ cat index.utf.txt
<br/>    #use wml::debian::template title=&quot;Debian 缺陷跟踪系统&quot; BARETITLE=true NOCOPYRIGHT=true
<br/>    #use wml::debian::translation-check translation=&quot;1.69&quot;</p>

<p>    Debian 有一个对用户和开发者所提交的软件缺陷报告进行归档管理的缺陷跟踪系统，
<br/>    英文缩写为(BTS)。每个软件缺陷报告都被授予一个编号并且被长期跟踪，直到它被标记
<br/>    为已修复。</p>

<p>...
<br/> 7$ iconv -futf8 -tgb2312 index.utf.txt &gt; index.gb.txt
<br/> 8$ iconv -fgb2312 -tbig5 index.gb.txt &gt; index.wml
<br/> 9$ make
<br/>10$ firefox index.zh-cn.html index.zh-tw.html首先要安装必要的工具(1)，然后在设定的工作目录中(2)，下载保存源代码(3)。w.d.o/Bugs 页面的待翻译文件在相应语言目录的 Bugs 子目录。以此类推，w.d.o/News 页面的待翻译文件就应该在相应语言目录的 News 子目录中。进入待翻译文件所在的目录(4)，发现在该目录中找不到 index.wml 文件，这是由于该页面尚未有中文版，所以我们从英文目录中拷贝该文件到此准备翻译(5)。用户机器日常使用的是 zh_CN.UTF-8 编码，所以暂时命名为 index.utf.txt，最终的 index.wml 文件必须是 BIG5 编码。开始翻译 index.utf.txt 文件(6)，待文件翻译结束后，先将其从用户日常使用的 UTF8 编码转换为简体中文编码 GB2312(7)，然后再从简体中文编码 GB2312 转换成繁体中文编码 BIG5(8)，大多数情况下翻译工作到此就基本结束了。在此之后您可以执行编译命令，系统会生成 html 文件(9)，然后用浏览器打开，即可检查翻译后的页面效果。最后，您可以通过以下途径让 Debian 收录您的翻译成果，它们包括但不限于: </p>

<p>给 debian-www@lists.debian.org 写封邮件(您必须首先订阅该邮件列表)。 给 Debian 网页翻译协调人员 写封邮件。 </p>

<p>有少部分情况，除了翻译 *.wml 文件外，还需要翻译与之配套的 *.po 文件。注意看 chinese/Bugs/index.wml 文件中有如下一行: </p>

<p>#include &quot;$(ENGLISHDIR)/Bugs/pkgreport-opts.inc打开 *.inc 文件，找到 bind-gettext-domain 那一行，记住 domain= 后面的内容。例如在本例中被 Bugs/index.wml 引用的 english/Bugs/pkgreport-opts.inc 文件的 domain= 后面的内容是 bugs，剩下的工作就是对 chinese/po 目录下的 bugs.zh.po 进行翻译。假设 domain= 后面的内容是 vendors，那么剩下的工作就是对 chinese/po 目录下的 vendors.zh.po 进行翻译，以此类推。只有如此才能看到完全中文化的 w.d.o/Bugs 页面。在翻译 po 文件时一定要注意，除了保证该 po 文件的编码格式为 BIG5 以外，还请务必确认该文件 Content-Type 那一行的 charset 等于 BIG5。通过 enca 命令可以检查某个文件的编码格式。 </p>

<p>  $ enca /etc/fstab
<br/>  7bit ASCII characters建议参考 i18n-zh -- GNOME 翻译准则 </p>

<p>准确表述原文的意思 中文应该意思清晰且符合中文表达习惯 原文如果表达不清晰，中文应该意译，并且应根据上下文进行推断并填补相应的信息 情况3不能太多 对同样短语的翻译，前后必须一致 只使用中文标点，括号、数学符号除外 只使用英文括号(半角括号)，且括号与中文间不留空 英文与中文之间应该留一个英文空格 中文标点分隔的文字不再需要额外空格，如 &quot;errror: %s&quot; 的翻译应为 &quot;错误：%s&quot; 而不是 &quot;错误： %s&quot;  翻译时请留意原文的注释，即 po 文件中的 &quot;#***&quot; 行，特别需要注意注释中的 &quot;Translators:&quot; 字段 对无法找到其中文对应的条目，应该保持原文不译；对包含不容易翻译的英文的条目，可用其英文原文代替中文 </p>

<p>参考 翻译优先级 </p>

<p>最高 </p>

<p>the main directory: index.wml, contact.wml, donations.wml, social_contract.wml, support.wml the intro/ directory: about.wml, cn.wml, free.wml, why_debian.wml the releases/ directory: index.wml the releases/etch/ directory: index.wml, installmanual.wml, releasenotes.wml the distrib/ directory: index.wml, packages.wml, netinst.wml, ftplist.wml the mirror/ directory: list.wml the CD/ directory: index.wml the doc/ directory: index.wml the MailingLists/ directory: index.wml the searchtmpl/ directory: search.wml the security/ directory: index.wml 标准 Bugs/index.wml, Bugs/Reporting.wml banners/index.wml consultants/index.wml doc/ddp.wml events/index.wml international/index.wml, and create a page (or directory) for your language logos/index.wml mirror/index.wml misc/index.wml, misc/related_links.wml News/index.wml News/weekly/index.wml ports/index.wml partners/index.wml 可选 MailingLists/desc/ News/ doc/books.wml events/ security/ </p>

<p>跟踪由于网页是动态更新的，所以 这里 列出了已过时的翻译成果，有必要保持对该页面的关注。 </p>

<p>a: Debian 网页的中文化最近是由港台地区的 DD 维护的，所以采用了 BIG5 编码格式。</p>

 title : The drta Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MOD = ``Messenger on-the-drive&#39;&#39;.
<br/>Dr.ta = ``Driving Talking&#39;&#39;.</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;The man goal of MOD project is to create a brand new communication in vehicle. Dr.ta is an software implementation of it. Dr.ta is a implementation program, ased on sctp protocol and IHU (I Hear U) project, of MOD. It integrates the voice/text and supports multi-network communication.</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;We can imagine that Car PC will become standard equipment on every car in the future. There are a vehicular wireless network interface, which provides an unreliable and cheaper communication path, and a 3G network interface, which provides a reliable and more expensive communication path, on every Car PC.
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Therefore, the passengers can communicate with each other by using vehicular wireless network interface in advance. When the distance between two cars is greater than a predefined threshold, the wirelss communication will become unavailable. And Dr.ta will change the path to the reliable communication path and maintain connection automatically and seamlessly.</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Dr.ta will return the connection from a reliable path to an unreliable path, automatically, when connection of the unreliable link is available again.</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Please read more in our website http://mod.maple.tw</p>

 summary : <p>About </p>

<p>Glossword is a system written in PHP to create and publish online multilingual dictionary, glossary, or encyclopedia. </p>

<p>Contact | Glossword@Twitter | Глоссворд Россия@Twitter | Glossword@Facebook </p>

<p>Glossword - это система, написанная на PHP, для создания и публикации онлайновых мультиязычных словарей, энциклопедий, справочников. </p>

<p>Glossword 1.9 </p>

<p>Glossword 1.9 is component for CMS Joomla! to create and publish online dictionary, glossary, or encyclopedia. It features Realtime Localization Manager, UTF-8 encoding, SEF/SEO support, import / export dictionaries in XML / CSV / TSV format, integration with a native Joomla! search. </p>

<p>Glossword 1.9 это компонент CMS Joomla! для создания и публикации онлайновых мультиязычных словарей, энциклопедий, справочников. Среди возможностей: Менеджер переводов в реальном времени, кодировка UTF-8, поддержка SEF/SEO, импорт / экспорт словарей в форматах XML / CSV / TSV, интеграция с системой поиска Joomla!. </p>

<p>Glossword 1.8 </p>

<p>Notable features: installation wizard, a custom alphabetic toolbar, history of editing for terms, delayed postings, SEF support and SEO enhancements, visual themes, a multicolumn listing of terms, export/import dictionaries in XML and CSV format, built-in search and cache engines, a multifunctional feedback form with CAPTCHA, UTF-8 encoding, XHTML 1.1. </p>

<p>Примечательные особенности: мастер установки, настраиваемый алфавитный указатель, история изменения терминов, отложенная публикация, поддержка ЧПУ и SEO оптимизация, цветовые схемы, многоколоночный список терминов, импорт/экспорт словарей в форматах XML/CSV, встроенная поисковая система, многофункциональная форма обратной связи с CAPTCHA, кодировка UTF-8, XHTML 1.1. </p>
