 title : The goldilocks Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>When you set security barriers, most often your goal is to keep an intruder OUT of your stuff. Goldilocks is a system that allows you to set various levels of perceived access, giving you far more information on what the attacker intended had they been granted access. By spoofing common services, an attacker who believes they have gained access to your system, can be tracked as they issue dummy commands. Think of it as a managed honeypot for wargames or diagnostic security. </p>

<p>See project subfolders for various service implementations. Source to be posted in September 2008.</p>
 title : The google-calendar-connectors Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Google Calendar Connectors are a set of services that allow Google Calendar to interoperate with Exchange 2000, Exchange 2003 or Exchange 2007 servers through the bi-directional sharing of Calendar Free / Busy information. Each of the tools is installed in the local Exchange environment and must be maintained / configured by an Exchange Administrator. </p>

<p>January 22, 2010: Version 1.3 has just been released. </p>

<p>This open source project is a developer and partner release and is not targeted for direct  customer or end-user installation.  The Google Calendar Connectors represent a set of tools and should not be considered native functionality of Google Apps Premier &amp; Education Editions. </p>

<p>Google Calendar Connector Web Service: This connector allows users in Google Calendar to see free/busy information for users who maintain their calendars in Exchange. It is a .NET web service that takes requests sent from the browser with Google Calendar and returns free/busy obtained from a Microsoft Exchange 2003\2007 server.  Google Calendar Connector Sync Service: This connector allows users of Microsoft Exchange to see free/busy information for users who maintain their calendars in Google Calendar. It is a Windows Service that periodically queries the Google Calendar GData API to get updated free/busy information and publishes this information as free/busy information in Exchange.  Notice: The Google Calendar Connectors represent a set of tools for interoperation, and not a self-contained solution.  Bi-directional free/busy scheduling requires a Google Apps Premier Edition domain which has been enabled for calendar interoperability. </p>

<p>A special thanks to Bill Mers for his contributions to the project.</p>
 summary : <p>The groovy-guice project enables you to use Groovy script files and Groovy source files as binding targets in Guice. Ease of use and minimal amount of code for configuration were the design goals. </p>

<p>Simple examples are given inside Javadocs of this project and there is a Junit testcase in the source.  </p>

<p>You should consider using groovy-guice, if you want to use Groovy power, but you have to wrap it or want to call it from within java.  </p>

<p>currently supported features: </p>

<p>compilation of class/script files at runtime compilation of code inside a String at runtime configurable recompilation of changed class and script files  URLs as part of classpath @Inject is fully supported for resolved Groovy classes OSGi </p>

<p>changes in version 0.4.0 </p>

<p>Modules written in Groovy can now be added during module installation time. New methods were introduced for this feature. Please have a look at UserGuide for the current API usage. API from version 0.2.0 was removed. Some methods are now deprecated in GroovyGuice. Expect them to be removed within next major release. added some convenient methods to GroovyGuice. </p>

<p>changes in version 0.3.2 </p>

<p>requires now Guice 2.0 due to some changes in final Guice 2.0 release, the integration with Guice and therefore the API of groovy-guice had to be refactored. Please have a look at UserGuide for the current API usage. As a nice side effect of this refactoring, the API is now much smaller. old API of release 0.2.0 is scheduled for removal within release 0.4.0 </p>

<p>maintenance release 0.3.1 </p>

<p>switched dependency for guice to org.guiceyfruit.guice-all 2.0-beta-7 due to interface changes in guice SPI package, this release is NOT compatible with earlier versions of guice (org.guiceyfruit.guice-all 2.0-beta-6 and earlier or guice20090415 and earlier) </p>

<p>changes in version 0.3 </p>

<p>this release is a complete overhaul old API based on annotations is completely marked as deprecated and expect it to be removed after the next release introducing a fluent API class loading was also overhauled requires now Guice 2.0 (tested with 20081116 and 20090205) tested with groovy 1.5.7 and 1.6.0 supports OSGi now old API uses also new backend, so it should work also on OSGi installations, but this feature is not tested little support was added for peaberry for OSGi integration from this release on, a maven2 repository is provided for groovy-guice recompilation can now be handled transparently by groovy-guice. No need to inject a Provider, use the recompilable class as a &quot;normal&quot; class! </p>

<p>changes in version 0.2 </p>

<p>added new annotation GroovyResolve whether groovy classes should be resolved or not added new annotation GroovyCodeBase apply security permissions from .policy files to Groovy scripts an example PolicyFile is provided in Wiki</p>
 title : The groovy-guice Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The gsa-valve-security-framework Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Strategic and secure information sources are naturally becoming key repositories that customers want to make searchable. Since search is a platform and not just an application commodity, it is a pre-requisite to cope with heterogeneous security systems in order to seamlessly roll-out an Enterprise-wide secure search capability. </p>

<p>The search appliance can nicely integrate with popular single sign-on (SSO) systems, forms-based authentication systems and negotiate HTTP Basic and NTLM authentications/authorizations. However, it can’t substitute the need for a unified authentication process across all secure sources. Heterogeneous sources may require different sets of credentials which make the search experience painful for the end-user, having to authenticate multiple times when querying. </p>

<p>Additionally, the appliance may not be able in certain cases to cope with complex and non-standard authentication and/or authorization processes which may put at risk the deployment of search technology. </p>

<p>The GSA (Google Search Appliance) Valve Security Framework was designed to answer both of these issues. It exposes a global authentication capability to the search user and then loads transparently the sets of credentials that are relevant to each indexed sources. It is a framework that can easily be extended to support the specifics of new repositories in terms of authentication and authorization processes. </p>

<p>This authentication and authorization framework acts as a content proxy and can be considered as a quick, simple and low-cost alternative to a single sign-on (SSO) system. It can be integrated as well with third-party SSO solutions in those situations where the corporate SSO doesn’t secure all the searchable applications. </p>

<p>It offers two different interfaces to be integrated with the appliance: Forms Based and SAML. You can use any of them using the GSA integration features. </p>

<p>You can use Authentication/Authorization modules created by third party contributors. There is a file in the download area that includes the current ones, like the Oracle Portal module. These modules don&#39;t have anything to do with the connectors provided with the GSA Connector Manager &lt; http://code.google.com/p/google-enterprise-connector-manager/ &gt; as they have different purposes. </p>

<p>Last Version: 2.0 (June 20 2008)</p>
 summary : <p>Table of Contents</p>

 title : The iphone-pop3-outlook Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project will bring Microsoft Exchange email access to the iPhone without the use of IMAP (which many companies will not enable on their servers) or 3rd party websites. It uses a simple Python script that logs into Outlook Web Access and screen-scrapes the content.  title : The isicsaclplugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Propose a new security plugin for Symfony that handles resource level and more... </p>

<p>With sfGuardPlugin, it&#39;s easy to manage permissions for a collection of resources. But what about restricting access to a sub-collection of resources or even to a particular one ? For instance, if you want to restrict the view to all the news, a credential news_view is well enough. But if you want to restrict the same operation to the news of category 2 or directly to the news 53 ? That&#39;s the main purpose of isicsACLPlugin. </p>

<p>Another goal is to add a new customization level for end-users. With Symfony basic security system, it&#39;s the developer that tells if an action is secured or not (security.yml config file). With isicsACLPlugin, the end-user will be able to define directly if an operation on resource is: </p>

<p>public restricted to any authenticated user or fine-grained secured</p>
 summary : <p>Introduction </p>

<p>JavaSpaces Netbeans project started at the Faculty of Mathematics, Informatics and Mechanics, Warsaw University as an assignment for Multi-tier applications development (Tworzenie aplikacji wielowarstwowych) lead by Jacek Sroka. The original idea of the project also came from Jacek Sroka. The project was developed as my Master&#39;s Thesis (2007/2008) and supervised by Marcin Engel.  </p>

<p>This work is supported by the Netbeans Dream Team and Sun Microsystems as a part of Netbeans Innovators Grant process. See project&#39;s status on the official  Netbeans wiki: grant project&#39;s status. </p>

<p>Links: </p>

<p>Magdalena Dukielska LinkedIn profile Jacek Sroka Marcin Engel Netbeans Innovators Grant   Work progress for Netbeans Innovators Grant A mailing list for developers JavaSpaces Netbeans on Netbeans Plugin Portal </p>

<p>Deliverables for Netbeans releases nb6.5m1/release nb6.1: </p>

<p>Sources from 07-08-2008, Netbeans 6.5m1 NBMs from 07-08-2008, Netbeans 6.5m1 NBMs from 07-08-2008, Netbeans 6.1 A presentation showing the project in action on Netbeans 6.5m1 Javadocs from 07-08-2008, Netbeans 6.5m1/6.1 Basic Netbeans help for the project available at Help -&gt; Help contents -&gt; IDE Basics -&gt; Servers and Databases -&gt; Servers -&gt; Blitz JavaSpaces server </p>

<p>Note: releases nb6.1 and nb6.5m1 are based on exactly the same source code - the only difference between them is in classpath. For details see Installation guide. </p>

<p>Wiki: </p>

<p>User manual recorded with Wink 2.0 Installation guide Results of unit tests Netbeans Innovators Grant submission Possible extensions of the project </p>

<p>OverviewJavaSpaces Netbeans project is aimed mainly at students of Computer Science learning Linda concepts. The goal of the project is to provide a set of plugins for Netbeans IDE that turn working with JavaSpaces into a pleasure and make it easy even for Java beginners. When using JavaSpaces Netbeans one can concentrate on logic of the program instead of tinkering with the technology itself. </p>

<p>All Computer Science students of Warsaw University have to learn Linda as a part of an obligatory course (Concurrent and Distributed Programming). Thanks to JavaSpaces Netbeans project the way Linda is taught will change dramatically - instead of solving problems on the blackboard or pieces of paper students will be able to program their solutions in Java and Netbeans IDE. Besides, they will be able to test their programs with the help of a specialized debugger. </p>

<p>JavaSpaces have been around for quite a long time, yet they are not widely used - mainly because of their crude interfaces for administering tuplespace instances and complicated configuration. Despite this, as one of Linda implementations they are a very interesting and powerful technology which facilitates writing distributed and concurrent programs. Processes operating on tuplespaces created in JavaSpaces avoid many problems related to synchronization and data exchange. Thanks to dynamic code downloading, through a JavaSpace we can pass not only data but also behaviour among groups of processes, possibly operating on different machines in the network. This feature makes JavaSpaces much more expressive than plain Linda. </p>

<p>Configuring and running JavaSpaces by hand is a complicated problem - they require lots of work to set everything up. And once something doesn&#39;t work correctly, you need expert knowledge about Jini, RMI and JavaSpaces itself to fix the problem. At the same time, if we forget about tiresome configuration and untidy Jini code necessary to get hold of JavaSpace instances, JavaSpaces programs turn out to be extraordinarily simple. The example code written in the environment provided by the JavaSpaces Netbeans project is very simple. What is even more important, it can be run with no more effort that running a typical Java application with a main method. </p>

<p>Thanks to the functionality JavaSpaces Netbeans project provides, you can not only run and test famous Dining Philosophers problem, but also write a complex compute server - a distributed computing environment that is incredibly scalable and extensible in comparison to traditional interprocess communication techniques like RPC. </p>

<p>Useful tipsBlitz  Blitz Project - many interesting articles about Blitz and Jini Blitz mailing list Blitz Javadocs Inca-X  Inca-X JINI Jini Planet FAQ JCM JDPA JDPA Main page JDPA on Sun JDPA Guide Netbeans debugger Spring support for JavaSpaces Spring module for JavaSpaces News13-01-2010 Revised solutions of 5 philosophers, readers/writers and producer/consumer problems with recorded scenarios demonstrating various synchronization issues are available at JavaSpacesTestAnn.zip 12-01-2010 Prepare for better replay mechanism! Recording selected entries in BRC files is already designed. Implementation will follow 03-01-2010 Coming soon: downloads for Netbeans 6.8 10-10-2009 Soon available: a paper about JSN project describing how it can be used to improve distributed programming classes 07-08-2008 Basic Netbeans help added and available at Help -&gt; Help contents -&gt; IDE Basics -&gt; Servers and Databases -&gt; Servers -&gt; Blitz JavaSpaces server 03-08-2008 The project is published on Plugin Portal 29-07-2008 Nbms for release nb6.5m1 are available at Downloads 19-07-2008 Javadocs for nb6.5m1 release are available at Downloads 14-07-2008 Project works on NB 6.5m1, All unit tests pass on NB 6.5m1 18-05-2008 User manual created by Wink 2.0 (English) 14-04-2008 Netbeans Innovators Grant results! 09-04-2008 Solutions of 5 philosophers and readers/writers problems are available at JavaSpacesTestAnn.zip 13-03-2008 Installation 13-03-2008 JavaSpaces without an IDE (Polish) 09-03-2008 User manual created by Wink 2.0 (Polish) 28-10-2007 Plan of my Master&#39;s Thesis (Polish) 07-10-2007 New Tree Table entries browser introduced 08-09-2007 Run on sever option available! 09-08-2007 Codebase problem solved! 08-08-2007 Codebase information available on wiki 01-08-2007 Nmb&#39;s for the nb5.5.1 release are available at Downloads 01-08-2007 Source code for the whole project available in repository ProgressNetbeans Innovators Grant project timeline Netbeans 6.5m1 compatibility schedule</p>
 title : The javaspaces-netbeans Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This suite is a set of JIRA workflow conditions and validators. Also it has &#39;Issue Tab Panel&#39;, which shows information about the execution of each transition. </p>

<p>Author of original code base was Gustavo Martin. </p>

<p>Description/FeaturesCustom FieldsLocation Text: custom field for specifying address in free form text. Location will be shown as inline Google Map. 
<br/>Location Select: custom field for selecting address from predefined list. Location will be shown as inline Google Map. 
<br/>Workflow ConditionsUser Is In Any Groups: which allows to only execute a transition, if the user belongs to one of the selected groups. By means of this condition, it will not be necessary to edit the xml of workflow to allow that the user belongs to a group or another one. 
<br/>Value Field: it allows to execute the transition on the basis of the value of a field. 
<br/>Workflow ValidatorsFields Required: it allows to select a set of fields, to do required them during the execution of a transition. 
<br/>Date Compare: allowing to choose single type fields it dates, to compare the date of a field against the one of another one. 
<br/>Window Dates: it establishes that the date of a field, must be between two dates. Which are determined by the value of another field and a window of time, in days. 
<br/>Post functionsCopy Value From Other Field: this function copies the value of one field to another. 
<br/>Update Issue Custom Field: it updates an issue custom field to a given value. 
<br/>Clear Field Value: this function used for cleaning field value. 
<br/>Issue Tab PanelTransitions Summary Tab Panel: It shows the total duration of each executed transition, whichever times was executed, who and when was the last time that executed it.</p>

 summary : <p>The project has been moved to http://code.google.com/p/knl-php-user-management/  </p>

<p>The KNL Authenticator class provides a simple method for creating a multiple user authentication system using PHP and PDO. The class has been developed to make SQL injections impossible and great focus has been put on making the class very easy to use. The system uses sessions that saves the session ID in a cookie. </p>

<p>The following databases are supported with PDO at the moment of writing: dBase, DB++, Frontbase, filePro, Firebird/Interbase, Informix, IBM DB2, Ingres II, MaxDB, mSQL, MS SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle OCI8, Ovrimos SQL, Paradox, PostgreSQL, SQLite, Sybase. </p>

<p>Includes: </p>

<p>KNL Software licens - do with it what you like, almost identical to BSD licens, but you don&#39;t even need to keep the copyright notice. Fully commented code. A very extensive documentation (see the Wiki) with clear installation and usage instructions plus a section on security issues related to the development of this class. Requirements: </p>

<p>PHP 5.1. All feedback are welcome, use the email on the right pane.</p>
 title : The knl-authenticator Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>02/05/2010: We are looking for maintainers.If you are interested please email the project owners.  </p>

<p>A library for the eve-online api.What is libeveapi?libeveapi is a library designed to simplify working with data from the Eve-Online API. The library handles requesting data from the api along with caching and parsing the result. </p>

<p>CachingEvery response from the Eve-Online API includes a &quot;cacheUntil&quot; directive. After the first request for some data the library will transparently cache the response until the &quot;cacheUntil&quot; time is reached. The library manages the cache transparently. All you have to do is load the cache file when your application starts up and save it before your application shuts down. </p>

<p>Securitylibeveapi does not save any authentication information (apiKey, userID). All responses are cached using the SHA1 hash of the request url. For added security you have complete control over how the cache is saved. If you are working with sensitive data from the API then you are free to encrypt the cache in any form you choose. For more information see Security. </p>

<p>Using the LibraryFor detailed explanations and examples see the documentation. </p>

<p>using libeveapi;</p>

<p>// Load the XML Responses from a local webserver during development
<br/>#if DEBUG
<br/>Constants.ApiPrefix = &quot;http://localhost/eveapi&quot;;
<br/>#endif</p>

<p>// Load the ResponseCache when your application starts up.
<br/>if (File.Exists(&quot;ResponseCache.xml&quot;))
<br/>{
<br/>    ResponseCache.LoadFromFile(&quot;ResponseCache.xml&quot;);
<br/>}
<br/>// Application startup and other stuff...</p>

<p>// Some time later - we need a list of all the characters on an account
<br/>// Method is GetAccountCharacters(userId, apiKey);
<br/>CharacterList characterList = EveApi.GetAccountCharacters(1234, &quot;apiKey&quot;);
<br/>foreach (CharacterListItem character in characterList.CharacterListItems)
<br/>{
<br/>    string characterName = character.Name;
<br/>    int characterId = character.CharacterId;
<br/>    int corporationId = character.CorporationId;
<br/>    string corporationName = character.CorporationName;
<br/>}
<br/>// Application does whatever it does...</p>

<p>// Save the ResponseCache before exiting your application.
<br/>ResponseCache.SaveToFile(&quot;ResponseCache.xml&quot;);</p>

<p>API Call  Supported  Api Call  Supported   Account Balances  Yes  Market Orders  Yes   Alliance List  Yes  Map: Jumps  Yes   Asset List  Yes   Map: Kills  Yes   Character List  Yes  Map: Sovereignty  Yes   Character Sheet  Yes   Member Tracking  Yes   Conquerable Station/Outpost List  Yes  Character Name / ID Lookup  Yes   Corporation Sheet  Yes   ID to Character Portrait  Yes   Error List  Yes  RefTypes List  Yes   Industry Jobs  Yes   Skill in Training  Yes    Journal Entries  Yes  Skill Tree  Yes   Kill Log  Yes  Starbase (POS) Details  Yes   Market / Wallet Transactions  Yes  Starbase (POS) List  Yes   Server Status  Yes (SVN)  Map: Occupancy  Yes (SVN)</p>
 title : The libeveapi Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The litsearch Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Extension of the existing Litsearch project!, </p>
 title : The livelocations Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Live Locations (LL) is an Android service for finding your contacts.   </p>

<p>Live Locations has two features, linked with each other. </p>

<p>The First feature is that LL ties into your phone via your GTalk contacts and the phones GPS service.  When a contact sync request is made by your phone to google, LL will also update your location to the Live Locations Service, hosted on Google Appengine. </p>

<p>At the same time, LL&#39;s second feature will make a request to the service to request all your contacts (you have permission to recieve) last know locations.  If they have LL installed, then your contacts screen will be updated with this. </p>

<p>From here, you can click on the location (similar to what you can do with their address) and a map will appear with this location shown.  This means you can see where your friend is and find directions to them.  Great for meeting up in unfamiliar locations. </p>

<p>The idea is not to replace the existing contacts manager, but to improve it by adding this location-based feature, so it can become a popular service by being unobtrusive. </p>

<p>In future versions you will also be able to make your position public via a web interface, and there are plans to look at adding additional services (Fireeagle, Brightkite, Twitter, etc). </p>

<p>The service runs on a Google Appengine backend.</p>
 title : The lusas Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is a collection of command line security auditing scripts for Linux/Unix.  Originally by Sean Boran in 2000, with a few improvements over the years. </p>

<p>Auditing the security of an existing system can be time-consuming, and often requires on-site visits. There are several commercial tools and a few free ones that help, but they can be complicated and require local compilation or configuration. </p>

<p>So a tool was developed with the following aims: </p>

<p>Simple to use: the auditor could even give the tool to the sysadmin, ask him to run it at night and send the results back to the auditor (perhaps by encrypted email). For situations where a &quot;quick audit&quot; of the system is required. Easy to verify: it is not as thorough as other tools, but it is small and easy to understand. Does not require a compiler or other tools. Support several Linux and Unix derivatives </p>

<p>This script automates the gathering of the information only. Of course, the difficult part is the interpretation of results and deciding what countermeasures to take. </p>

<p>Please visit http://code.google.com/p/lusas for the current documentation. The previous doc is on http://boran.com/audit </p>

<p>DOWNLOAD: The sources are available via SVN on Google code. USAGE: </p>

<p>./lusas-basic.sh -h 
<br/>For the other audit scripts, refer to http://boran.com/audit </p>

<p>Update dec&#39;08: Pablo is working on a new release replacing audit1.sh with lusas-basic.sh. Checkout his design in the wiki and provide feedback via the issue queue.</p>

 summary : <p>Regola conventional toolkit </p>

 summary : <p>This idea of mine is to lock a computer remotely via a GSM service etc using a biometric device by its user so that he can protect the computer at the top level security. As hackers cant directly access the servers to steal data because of the hardware and software firewalls, their primary choice of attack would be on terminals. This project will pay attention to the corporate level mainntainance and also by an individual if deserved. There would be a GSM service that communicate with the computer remotely ie., wherever the user is, through a proper biometric device. With the key press, he will be able to stop the power supply flow into the motherboard from the SMPS so as to prevent the system from getting on. Similarly, he will send another signal to start the computer working normally and the lock gets released. For this to work, we need a device to communicate with the biometric gadget in the user hand and, control the computer. This device must be able to sit in the cabinet itself and the power for it is the CMOS battery that is existing in the computer itself.</p>

 title : The security-nadav-gil Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Design a home and industry based security systems using VHDL.. Could be used for sensoring temperature changes,motion detector,water-level sensor,fire sensor,back and front door detection etc.... </p>

<p>VHDL has been at the heart of electronic design productivity since initial ratification by the IEEE in 1987.For almost 15 years the electronic design automation industry has expanded the use of VHDL from initial concept of design documentation to design implementation and functional verification. It can be said that VHDL fueled modern synthesis technology and enabled the development of ASIC semiconductor companies. </p>

<p>The use of vhdl has evolved and its importance increased as semiconductor devices dimensions have shrunk. Not more than 10 years ago it was common to mix designs described with schematics in favor of the hardware description language only. </p>

<p>The fact that VHDL is adaptable is a tribute to its architecture. The industry has seen the use of VHDL’s package structure to allow designers, electronic design automation companies and the semiconductor industry to experiment with new language concepts to ensure good tool design and data interoperability. When the associated data types found in the IEEE 1164 standard were ratified, it meant that design data interoperability was possible. </p>

<p>The design community continues to see benefits as the electronic design automation community continues to find new algorithms to work from VHDL design descriptions and related standards to again push designer productivity. And, as a new generation of designers of programmable logic devices move to the use of hardware description languages as the basis of their design methodology, there will be substantial growth in the number of VHDL users. </p>

<p>The VHSIC Hardware Description Language is an industry standard language used to describe hardware from the abstract to the concrete level.VHDL resulted from the work done in the ‘70s and early ‘80s by the U.S Department of Defence.Its roots are in the ADA language, as will be seen by the overall structure of VHDL as well as other VHDL statements .VHDL usage risen rapidly since its inception and is used by literally tens of thousands of enginners around the globe to create sophisticated electronic products.VHDL is a powerful language with numerous language constructs that are capable of describing very complex behavior. </p>

<p>In 1986,VHDL was proposed as an IEEE standard, It went through a number of revisions and changes until it was adopted as the IEEE 1076 standard in December 1987.The IEEE 1076-1987 standard VHDL is the VHDL used in this book.All the examples have been described in IEEE 1076 VHDL,and compiled and simulated with the VHDL simulation environment from Model Technology Inc.The synthesis examples were synthesized with the Exemplar Logic Inc. synthesis tools.  </p>

<p>The Ada language is the result of the most extensive and most expensive language design effort ever undertaken. Up until 1974 half of the applications at The Department of Defense were embedded systems. An embedded system is one where the computer hardware is embedded in the device it controls. More than 450 programming languages were used to implement different DoD projects, and none of them were standardized. Because of this, software was rarely reused. For these reasons, the Army, Navy, and Air Force proposed to develop a high-level language for embedded systems. </p>

<p>By 1977, a complete language design specification for Ada was created. In April 1977, four proposing contractors were chosen to produce Phase I of the language design. In February 1977, Phase I of the language design was complete. Following this, was a two month evaluation period where 400 volunteers in 80 teams chose two out of the four as being the best language designs. These two companies were then given the go ahead to produce Phase II of the project. At the end of Phase II, another two month evaluation period took place. In May of 1979 the Cii Honeywell/Bull (the only foreign contractor) language design was chosen as the winner. Phase III of the project began after the winner was selected. After a winner was selected, the language design was published by the ACM. In November 1979, over 500 language reports were received from 15 different countries. Most of the reports suggested minor changes in the design, none real drastic. Based on these suggestions, a revised language design was published in February of 1980. After some minor changes to this document over the next few years, the final official version of the language was settled upon. The Ada language was then frozen for the next five years </p>

<p>Ada is a comb-structured, statically typed imperative computer programming language designed by a team led by Jean Ichbiah of CII Honeywell Bull under contract to the United States Department of Defense during 1977–1983. Ada addresses some of the same tasks as C or C++, but Ada is strongly-typed (even for integer-range), and compilers are validated for reliability in mission-critical applications, such as avionics software. Ada was named after Ada Lovelace, who is often credited with being the first computer programmer. </p>

<p>Source</p>
 title : The security-systems-using-vhdl Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Student project for creating a tool that checks on security vulnerabilities in program code</p>
 title : The securityaudit Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The secutiry-package Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Package contains implementation for most security algorithms including :Caesar Cipher Play Fair Cipher Hill Cipher Columnar Transposition Cipher Monoalphabetic Chipher Polyalphabetic Cipher RC4 DES AES RSA  (Including the different modes of operations for block ciphers)</p>
 summary : <p>Simple Software ManagerSSM v8.0 is now available. See What Is New in SSM 8.0. </p>

<p>SSM is a package management system of particular interest to: </p>

<p>users who build software but want a way to manage what they have built in their home directories--without root access, administrators who build software for multiple platforms but do not want to tie themselves to a single native package manager (e.g., RPM), developers who may want to make multiple versions of their software to users but without the often burdensome task of package management, software library maintainers who want to be able to maintain collections of software, each tailored to a specific user or group. </p>

<p>Among other things, SSM supports: </p>

<p>multiple platforms - most UNIX and Linux operating systems capable of running Python 2.3 and greater, multiple package versions - multiple versions of a package may be made available to users, where each user can tailor which packages he wants immediate access to, multiple collections of packages - one or more (related in some way) packages may be installed together and selectable/accessible on demand, multiple administrators - each collection (called an SSM domain) is maintained/administrated by a single user without the need for special privileges. </p>

<p>Comments/questions/problems: ssmcmc (at) gmail (dot) com </p>

<p> </p>

<p>This software was developed at, and made available courtesy of, the Supercomputing, Storage, and Systems branch of Environment Canada.</p>

 title : The softenido Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Softenido Softenido is a project that brings together all my personal software. Collaborators and partners are welcome. </p>

<p>The list of programs or subprojects is the following: </p>

<p>- findrepe is a command-line tool designed for an eficient search of repeated files. Basically the method consists in an initial comparison of file sizes, followed by an MD5 and SHA1 signature comparison (both must be satified to avoid MD5 or SHA1 collisions). There are some options to filter and an option to ask for deletion of repeated files. </p>

<p>- safepw is a commandline password database utility (an alternative to pwsafe). </p>

<p>- picbulk is a commandline tool to upload images to picasaweb or send by email. </p>

<p>- echoserver is an TCP/IP echo server.</p>

 title : The synapse-security Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A basic overview of what Synapse will be like. </p>

<p>Synapse will be a platform and online code-vulnerability scanner that pro-actively educates software developers that write software for the Internet by inspecting their software, and notify them of code flaws. Synapse will be able to inspect all software packages released on the Internet that is freely available and under any GNU type-off license on a special dedicated webserver. Synapse will spider the free software portals and retrieves all software for inspection. Synapse will investigate the code and upon finding a flaw it will enter the vulnerability into a database ready for triage by either manually labor through a syndicate feed, or further processing which involve real-time automated software testing. Synapse will be able to notify the software developer automatically with a report generated on the results. Synapse then offers the software developer with different choices. One will be that the developer will get general advise on how to fix the issues, the other will be to get in contact with a skilled programmer or company that can advise the programmer or solve the problems for a fee.</p>
 title : The thai-l10n Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>พบปัญหา แจ้งคำแปลผิดแจ้งปัญหาได้ที่ http://code.google.com/p/thai-l10n/issues/list เข้าไปแล้วเลือกที่ &quot;New Issue&quot; เพื่อรายงานปัญหา ดูวิธีแจ้งปัญหาโดยละเอียดที่ http://www.blognone.com/node/9086  ทดสอบไฟร์ฟ็อกซ์ภาษาไทย รุ่นล่าสุด จาก &quot;Tinderbox&quot; ใน Mozilla.org </p>

<p>แนะนำให้สร้าง profile ใหม่เพื่อทดสอบ วิธีการตามบทความนี้ ดาวน์โหลดรุ่นล่าสุดจากหน้านี้ http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/firefox/tinderbox-builds/latest-mozilla1.9.0-l10n/ มาทดลองใช้งานได้เลย รุ่น 3.0.4pre.th : Windows installer (.exe), Windows (.zip), Mac OS X, Linux วิธีติดตั้งบน Windows ด้วยตัว installer (.exe) ให้ดับเบิลคลิกแล้วกด next ไปเรื่อย ๆ เหมือนติดตั้งโปรแกรมปกติ วิธีติดตั้งบน Windows ตัวแฟ้ม .zip ให้แตกแฟ้มออกมา แล้วรันแฟ้ม firefox.exe ได้เลย วิธีติดตั้งบน Linux ให้แตกแฟ้ม .tar.bz2 ออกมา แล้วรันไบนารีของ firefox ได้เลย (สั่ง ./firefox -ProfileManager) วิธีติดตั้งบน Mac OS X ให้ดับเบิลคลิกที่แฟ้ม dmg แล้วลาก Minefield ไปใส่ใน Application Folder เหมือนลงโปรแกรมปกติ </p>

<p>สำหรับผู้ต้องการทดสอบ ชุดภาษาไทยสำหรับไฟร์ฟ็อกซ์ Firefox Thai language pack </p>

<p>แนะนำให้ทดสอบตัว ไฟร์ฟ็อกซ์รุ่นภาษาไทย (localized build) มากกว่า เนื่องจากตัวนี้เก่าแล้ว language pack นี้ ต้องใช้กับ Firefox 3.0pre (nightly build) เท่านั้น ดาวน์โหลด language pack รุ่นที่ใหม่ที่สุด (Alpha-3) จากหน้า Downloads การติดตั้ง language pack เหมือนการติดตั้ง extension ธรรมดาทั่วไป (คลิก/เปิดใน Firefox) การสลับภาษา ทำได้สองวิธี ท่ามาตรฐาน ใช้ Locale Switcher add-on แล้วเลือกเมนูเปลี่ยนภาษา ท่ายาก เรียก Firefox จากคอมมานด์ไลน์ &quot;firefox -UILocale th&quot; </p>

<p>เมลกลุ่มhttp://groups.google.com/group/thai-l10n (สมัครก่อนถึงจะส่งได้ - สมัครได้เลย) คำแนะนำในการแปลดูคำแนะนำทั่วไปและลิงก์ต่าง ๆ ที่ Thai L10n   </p>

<p>คำศัพท์และการใช้ภาษาแหล่งข้อมูลอ้างอิง (Thai L10n) OSS Corpus ค้นหาคำที่แปลแล้วในโปรแกรมอื่น ๆ OSS Glossary ค้นหาศัพท์ในคลังศัพท์กลาง พจนานุกรมราชบัณฑิตยสถาน ศัพท์บัญญัติราชบัณฑิตยสถาน ศัพท์บัญญัติในสาขาต่าง ๆ พจนานุกรม Longdo ศัพท์ทั่วไป หลายภาษา เครื่องมือเครื่องมือเพื่อช่วยงานแปล (Thai L10n) แนะนำเครื่องมือแก้ไขและช่วยงานแปล Translate Toolkit เครื่องมือแปลงไฟล์ต่าง ๆ วิธีการ build Localized Firefox และ LangpackLocalizedBuildHowto LangpackBuildHowto ลิงก์tracker bug ของ Thai Firefox Localization ที่ bugzilla.mozilla.org Firefox 3 release tracker ที่ bugzilla.mozilla.org</p>

 title : The vicsys Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Three main objective(s) for program: </p>

<p>1.)  Allow users to store xml url references to their google calendar(s).  Once the URL&#39;s have been validated, users will be able to listen to their appointment(s) via the telephone.   </p>

<p>2.)  Create VXML code, to allow users to listen to weather forecast for any zip code they chose. </p>

<p>3.)  Allow users to hear current sports schedule via phone  (Hopeful, last item to complete) </p>

<p>Python, CGI, MySql ,  VXML, XML </p>

<p>Summary: </p>

<p>Once completed, the user will be able to add multiple calendars into the VICS system, via the web.  The user will have at least 2 options (possibly 3). (Hopefully) Last, find out which sports team is playing today.</p>

 title : The winsys Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>WinSys is a Python package which wraps aspects of the Windows API to make them more Pythonic and usable by Windows administrators directly from the interpreter or as part of a wider set of applications. It targets recent versions of Python and reasonably recent versions of Windows although it’s not yet up speed on Vista &amp; x64. </p>

<p>It is unashamedly platform-specific: no hint of a concession towards more Unix-like operating systems. You can read about the design philosophy and decisions in About WinSys. If you want to see some examples, have a look in the Cookbook. Or visit the Contents for an overview. </p>

<p>The code is Copyright Tim Golden 2009 and is licensed under the GPL compatible MIT License:  http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php</p>
 summary : <p>A Quiz engine written in perl. Users are given a random selection of questions taken from a list of questions stored in a database.</p>

<p>Users can then review their answers, and try again using another random set of questions.</p>

<p>Questions can be multiple choice, checkbox,  text or number based. The text allows for regular expression checking of the answer and the number allows for numerical ranges.</p>

<p>The quiz is administered through a web front end, and can be incorporated into an existing web site design using html templates.</p>

<p>An off-line feature (which can be disabled), allows the users to print off a list of questions which can be completed off-line or shared with friends.</p>
 title : The wquiz Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The wssg Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>WSSG is developed by wssg team @ ICL/ITRI, it is a high-performance software solution for Web Services Security Control &amp; Management, it consists of: </p>

<p>ICL VTD-XML Parser, which is originally from VTD-XML parser Wirtely API Support, which prevents parsing the whole document for every single write operation XPE(XPath Processing Engine)  Schema Validation &amp; Grammer Pool WS-Security Profile Implementation based on ICL VTD-XML Parser  Lighttpd Reverse Proxy plugin Security Policy Wizard &amp; Management Console  </p>

<p>The performance of WSSG is excellent as a software solution without any hardware acceleration, the following is our benchmarking on our machine: </p>

<p>XML Parsing Performance XPath intepreter WS-Security processing ... </p>

<p>Sponsored by Information &amp; Communications Research Laboratories</p>
 title : The xerobits Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>&quot;In the old days we just had 0&#39;s,
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;we had to pound them flat to get 1&#39;s...&quot;
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;-- Rodney Thayer, ÜberHaxxor</p>

<p>The mobile phone industry is expected to ship something on the order of 935 million phones in 2006, half of which will be so-called &quot;Smart Phones.&quot; This number is expected to double in  five years. Some of these phones will run Windows Mobile; some will run Symbian. But even if only 1% run some variety of Linux (a la MonteVista) or L4 (a la Qualcomm) that&#39;s still something like 20 million linux devices shipping in 2011. That&#39;s quite a few Unix based devices running around a wireless network.</p>

<p>Handset manufacturers, network operators and some corporate IT departments have fallen down on their responsibility to develop secure products in the past. But Basil II / Solvency II in Europe and Sarbanes-Oxley in the United States have raised awareness of IT security as a cross-cutting concern across an increasingly global business community.</p>

<p>The industry is looking for tools and techniques to limit the financial risk of exposure of corporate secrets or loss of assurance over the firm&#39;s financial control processes. In other words, corporations on both sides of the Atlantic are being asked by regulatory regimes to prove that their IT resources are resistant to assault from malicious attackers.</p>

<p>After being taken on a confusing ride on the &quot;PKI express&quot; in the late 1990&#39;s, IT consumers are interested in security again. But this time around they&#39;re looking at &quot;global&quot; technology solutions that create a &quot;secure end-to-end experience.&quot; In the previous tech-cycle, corporate IT departments gained extensive experience with VPNs, Firewalls, PKIs, SSL, SSH, and basic key management. But the &quot;Dot Com&quot; era ended just as mobile device and web application security solutions were maturing.</p>

<p>Now that we find ourselves in something that looks like a recovery, it&#39;s time to start focusing on the harder problems of securing mobile applications.</p>

<p>Traditional Unix-like operating systems use the concept of the &quot;user&quot; as the basic subject for security policy decisions. An application&#39;s ability to access resources such as files and devices is based on the User ID it is running as. This was great for multi-user servers with tens, hundreds or thousands of concurrent users whose files must be protected from accidental (or malicious) access.</p>

<p>While user-mediated security enforcement for mobile applications is necessary, it is not sufficient to properly represent security policy for mobile devices; devices that traditionally have a single primary user.</p>

<p>The XeroBits project is an attempt to develop a toolkit for mobile device security. It is released under a BSD license with the hope that the more &quot;corporate friendly&quot; terms will encourage it&#39;s adoption by handset manufacturers, network operators and enterprise customers.</p>

<p>&quot;Yes,&quot; you ask, &quot;but what it it?&quot;</p>

<p>XeroBits includes primitives that may be used to establish the origin of bits of code. The kernel may then use this information in an access-control decision, mediating access to a file descriptor, network socket, device or even a CDSA-style  key repository.</p>

<p>XeroBits contains tools and libraries for:</p>

<p>* Digitally Signing Executables and shared object libraries
<br/>* Establishing an &quot;appropriate&quot; level of trust when shared object libraries from different protection domains are dynamically loaded into the same executable image.
<br/>* Generating and authenticating opaque tokens (think SASL here) that testify as to the inclusion of an executable in a given protection domain. This provides non-kernel processes with the ability to make access control decisions based on a subject&#39;s protection domain.
<br/>* Generating and authenticating opaque tokens based on stack-based attestation (a la NGSCB/Palladium.) This gives kernel and non-kernel processes the ability to make access control decisions based on the call-graph that led to a kernel trap or IPC call.)
<br/>* Remotely managing device security policy
<br/>* Protection domain specific and application specific secure out-of-process storage of shared secrets, secret keys and private keys.
<br/>* &quot;Out of process&quot; encryption, signing, decryption and verification using references to managed keys.
<br/>* Digital Certificate life-cycle management. This relieves application programmers of the requirement to maintain certificate meta-data.</p>
 summary : <p>This project is part of a directed study project at Kennesaw State University under Dr. Alan Shaw. The purpose of the project is to make education more interesting and to make students more interested in Computer Science. One of the goals of this project is to create a virtual world where students can create their own robots with A.I. and fight other robots in tournaments. Even though one of the main goals of the project is to create a game-like environment, another goal is to create an engine out of this for others to use. </p>

<p>My plans for the engine include: Using C++ to write the server and the client Using the networking library enet (http://enet.bespin.org/) Using OpenGL with SDL underneath it for the graphics and input/output. (http://www.opengl.org/) (http://www.libsdl.org/) Eventually include Python or some other scripting language like lua for the objects that are in-game. (http://www.python.org/) (http://www.lua.org/) Possibly implement some sort of protocol that will make communications between the clients and the server more efficient. At some point down the road, figure out how to include artificial intelligence.</p>

<p>We have made a series of tutorials to show our clients how to use our products. This tutorials include things like: Slave and Master handling, Interactive code, Networking, and Hardware interfacing. In each section you will find some examples that will show you how to achieve different tasks. Check our tutorials </p>

 title : The aispt Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>AKOMA NTOSO (&quot;Architecture for Knowledge-Oriented Management of African Normative Texts using Open Standards and Ontologies&quot;) is a standard that defines a “machine readable” set of simple technology-neutral representations (XML) of parliamentary, legislative and judiciary documents in order to enable easy and effective search, retrieval and exchange of such documents. </p>

<p>The AKOMA NTOSO XML schema for parliamentary, legislative and judiciary documents will not just “publish” documents online, as most institutions are currently doing, but will allow these documents to be “accessible” with in its structure and components as well as their main semantic components.</p>

 title : The ambienttrust Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Ambient trust is an experiment in ubiquitous/ambient computing that will be researched at Indiana University. It involves creating a physical interface for elderly/older people who do not have a vivid mental model of the recent social networking paradigm to be able to use social networking tools (NetTrust) to empower themselves to make wise decisions while browsing the internet. </p>

<p>All code here is experimental! For stable versions please visit Ambient Trust&#39;s Branch on the NetTrust page at http://nettrust.googlecode.com/</p>
 title : The amms Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The android-tabletop Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>NewsAfter completing prototype for ADC, I took some time to review architecture, study similar projects, etc. As a result, I changed a lot of things. In fact, only most basic code and architecture remained, everything else has changed. So, It will take some time before project will be back in a &quot;playable&quot; state. I&#39;ll update source, code, description etc. then. </p>

<p>ConceptThis is a graphical interface for playing tabletop and tabletop-alike games. It is a lot like XChess or XBoard. But it is not limited to only chess. It is a set of tools, that allow to easily teach it to work with virtually any  game that can be played on a table with boards, pieces, cards, etc. </p>

<p>Architecture basicsThe core of this application consist of two parts - game model and it&#39;s visual presentation. </p>

<p>GameModel is designed in a way, that will allow easily adjust it to different kinds of games and different kind of play styles (one player, several remote players, ai, game server, etc). </p>

<p>VisualEngine is designed to present current game state engine on a screen of Android phone and to interact with it. It represent game as a set of interactive game accessories - pieces, boards, card decks, dices. Simple XmlFormat is used to make creating new game environments easy. </p>

<p>DemonstrationTabletop.apk is a demo application, that demonstrates some of engine capabilities. You can choose chess of draughts game boards (see menu). Moves you do are stored to a file in real time, so you can exit application at any time and when you relaunch it you will have same position as when exited. </p>

<p>To move a piece, click on it, and then where you want to place it. You can take new pieces from palettes  atthe bottom of the screen and frop there unneeded pieces to remove them from game. </p>

<p>It also can be used for solving chess puzzless, like 8 Queens. </p>

<p>    </p>

<p>Further developmentBesides some usability and performance tweaks, following features are currently in work and are planned to be finished in immediate future: </p>

<p>Interface for choosing file to store games, copying games, etc. Networking and multiplayer - it&#39;s a shame that it&#39;s not present already, but I spend too much time polishing other components. With that it will be finally a complete application, in addition to just a framework. It will be a P2P oriented model - no need for trusted server, just direct data interchange. Support for games with a chance and hidden information. Card decks, dices, that sort of thing. That will require implementation of fair play enforcing algorithms - Mental Poker, etc. Trans-application interface - it will allow controlling Tabletop fully from other applications. It can be used for making AI&#39;s, writing specialised network interfaces, etc. LicensingDemo and engine are licensed under GPL v3 license. Code is licensed under New BSD license as well. </p>

<p>Knight piece in logo, chess pieces  </p>

<p>Created by Elmar Bartel, Tim Mann  </p>

<p>Draughts pieces </p>

<p>Created by Arvindn and modified by Klin. </p>

<p>http://savannah.gnu.org/projects/xboard/  </p>

<p>&quot;Tux&quot; card set </p>

<p>Copyright (C) 1998 Oliver Xymoron oxymoron@waste.org </p>

<p>http://www.waste.org/~oxymoron/cards/</p>

 title : The buddypress-wpmu Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>WordPress MU(Multiuser) is the multi-user version of WordPress, the popular blog/cms tool. BuddyPress takes this one step further by making a social network of it, providing messaging and other tools with the blog already in place, making each person&#39;s blog a member page.  </p>

<p>For an example of it in action, check out http://chickspeak.com. It&#39;s built using some of the same core code and integrates with bbpress. </p>

<p>From Andy Peatling, creator of BuddyPress </p>

<p>I&#39;m having trouble finding any time to work on BuddyPress so I&#39;ve decided to hand over what I have to the community for help. 
<br/>There are three Wordpress MU plugins here, each should be dropped into the &quot;mu-plugins&quot; folder. The &quot;core&quot; plugin should also be used, and is required for all the other plugins to work. </p>

<p>Please note: These plugins are not ready to be used for anything other than further development! You should not use them on your public website. I&#39;m only making them available so that other developers can continue working with them. </p>

<p>Any questions relating to the code, or how it works can be directed to: dev at buddypress dot com</p>
 summary : <p>c10k.net is the community site for game server programming geeks who want to compete with other friends for his/her own server/network library (aka networking core)&#39;s performance, stability and scalability. </p>

<p>The basic goals of c10k.net are: </p>

<p>developing generic stress clients for testing &quot;networking core&quot; under open source license. the clients should supports execution on distributed systems. developing various &amp; flexible test cases/suites. scripting will be good choice. supports multiple protocols, various encodings and versioning. generating rich testing reports and give a score for measurement. each participants can download our client and test his/her own core. client will upload its score to c10k.net. ranking every testing results and prepare a forum for discussing about how to get the higher score.</p>

 title : The dadadu Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Renamed to OpenZone and moved to http://code.google.com/p/openzone/  </p>

<p>Simple 3D engine that uses OpenGL for graphics, OpenAL or SDL for sound and SDL for other comunication with OS (threads, input, initialization). </p>

<p>It is meant to support huge levels (at most 20x20 km). Terrain is specified as heightmap, buildings and character use Quake3 BSP and Quake2 MD2 formats respectively. As it is strictly layered it should ease integration of networking code and split for client-server model (maybe suitable for MMORPG?) which is planned in near future. </p>

<p>The engine is meant to be cross-platform, running at least on GNU/Linux, FreeBSD and Windows. However, the development occurs on GNU/Linux, so the development version may not compile on other platforms.</p>

 summary : <p>AboutDominate 3D is loosely based on the classic Dominate game released by Shadoware in 1993. </p>

<p>The major differences now are that it includes support for upto 24 players per cube and up to 6 cubes per session, advanced AI, and eventually great graphics.  In addition, the playing field is composed of a 3D cube instead of a flat plane for play. </p>

<p>For testersBeta testing and bug reports are much appreciated.  If you wish to contribute more, then download the most recent development revision and perform some QA testing.  I prefer the output of drmingw for crash reports, but anything besides the default MS crash reports should be sufficient. </p>

<p>For developersIf you plan to contribute source code to the development of this game, you will need the OpenGL Framework libraries (glfw) and the OpenGL Extension Wrangler library (glew). </p>

 title : The easy-networking-library Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The easysharefs Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>EasyshareFS lets you share files with everyone else on the local network without configuration, without logging into a remote computer, and without a server.  </p>

<p>Every participating computer gets one EasyshareFS volume. This volume shows every file in every EasyshareFS volume on the local network. Essentially, all Easyshare FS volumes form one big &#39;file cloud&#39; which every user is shown. And every user can access all files in the file cloud as if they were local files. </p>

<p>I know what you&#39;re thinking: &#39;Mac OS X has AppleShare (AFP) already. Why shouldn&#39;t I use that and be done with it?&#39; To get the answer to that question and many more, please visit our FrequentlyAskedQuestions. </p>

<p>At least, that is the goal of this project. EasyshareFS is still in the early stages of development, and nothing has been released yet.  </p>

<p>If you&#39;re looking for a ready-to-use application, you&#39;ll have to wait for a bit. Sorry. But be sure to check back once in a while. Noting to see here. Move along citizen :-)  </p>

<p>To see more details on how it will work please visit HowItWorks. </p>

<p>The list of planned features is in TheFeatures</p>

 title : The eelhandhelds Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Project DescriptionThis project seeks to implement encrypted streaming audio and video in conjunction with Penn State&#39;s Extreme Events Lab (EEL), part of the College of Information Sciences and Technology&#39;s Center for Network-Centric Cognition and Information Fusion (NC2IF) </p>

<p>Hardware InformationUltimately, the target hardware for the project is the Nokia n8x0 handheld (the n800 and the n810). These devices run a customized version of Debian Linux, using the Maemo application framework. They include built-in wifi connectivity and an integrated camera. Eventually the devices will connect to the EEL&#39;s ad-hoc mesh wireless network, and use OpenVPN to connect back to the IST network. </p>

<p>Software DevelopmentInitially, development will be done for standard x86 systems, and the task of porting the application to the Maemo framework will be done when the code is in a more usable state. Code is written in C, and we use GTK+ and Glade for UI development, and Gstreamer to implement video/audio streams.</p>

 title : The enetpp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project aims to rewrite the eNet networking library in C++, from scratch, utilising the ideas of eNet rather than refactoring the existing code.   </p>

<p>The goals of the project are to use test driven development to complete a feature-complete eNet sister project in C++, focussing on object oriented programming methods. </p>

<p>The eNet library is a stable, efficient and effective cross-platform networking library.  Re-writing this networking library will provide a working base to compare this project&#39;s progress, and provide a deeper understanding of the requirements of a reliable UDP networking library.</p>
 title : The esprit Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>What is Esprit?Esprit is a php based social networking site, which uses Apache shindig framework for OpenSocial compliance. Esprit has all the essential features like messaging, friend list, send mail, albums , application gallery etc, yet is very simple and straight forward to understand and use. We feel this is one of the more easier reference implementations of the Shindig framework. </p>

<p>Esprit is currently version 0.9 beta. </p>

<p>How can I use Esprit?The steps to build the code are mentioned at following location: http://code.google.com/p/esprit/wiki/GettingStarted </p>

<p>What is Esprit’s short term roadmap?Verify on unix/linux and Macintosh platforms. Turnkey deployment A brand new look &amp; feel. Easily customizable look and feel. Compliance with all of OpenSocial’s REST based interfaces as OpenSocial API matures. Working on additional features like Caja integration, Oauth Service provider. Technical Brief:The architecture document is available at : http://code.google.com/p/esprit/wiki/Architecture </p>

<p>Related Projects:Java version of Esprit (Zing) : http://code.google.com/p/zing/  About us:We are Impetus Labs or iLabs as we call it. iLabs is a R&amp;D consulting division of software product R&amp;D company called as Impetus technologies. (http://www.impetus.com). iLabs focuses on innovations with next generation technologies. iLabs creates practice areas and new products around them. iLabs is currently working on next generation technologies like OpenSocial, High Performance and Parallel computing. iLabs is an active contributor to the Shindig project. iLabs is also actively involved in various Open Source technologies.</p>

<p>The current version of Gatsb is hosted at gatsb.com and is maintained by Andre de Cavaignac (http://www.decav.com) </p>

<p>More InformationAfter publishing Gatsb and receiving a few users, but not having time to contribute towards it, I have decided to release it as open source so other users can contribute or take pieces and build something new. </p>

<p>This project demonstrates .NET 3.0, Workflow Foundation and ASP.NET Ajax.  It is a great demonstration of connecting Wofkflow Foundation to a text message interface and keeping a &quot;text message session&quot; open. </p>

<p>In addition, it demonstrates how to create a database of geocoordinates, how to do some geotagging, and also demonstates the use of the Microsoft Virtual Earth Maps (I tried to use Google maps but the developer API wasn&#39;t working right on localhost!) </p>

<p>Although I&#39;d love to say the code is beautiful, it was written in spare time and there are certainly some hacks in there to just get it working and up.  Forgive me if you get confused :-) </p>

 title : The gmod-plugins Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Aims to provide various Lua based plugins for Garrys Mod 10 to expand usability, namly in networking and scripting efficiency.</p>

<p>12/27/2006
<br/>Welcome to gmod-plugins.  Currently we are still in the planning stages but hopefully we&#39;ll have some more detailed information about our scripts available.  Until we have a proper site, this area will serve as a news hub.</p>

<p>There are two main projects in the development stage right now, GMTalk and GMEdit, a GMod based Google Talk client and ingame script editor respectivly.</p>

<p>GMTalk is currently on hold due to the lack of socket support in GMod 10 and a lack of SSL support for the Lua Socket library.  The only way to currently log in and send a message is to auth using the X-GOOGLE-TOKEN.</p>

<p>GMEdit is also on hold as there isn&#39;t great support for advanced GUIs in GMod 10.  It shouldn&#39;t be that hard to work around though.</p>

<p>Projects will be graded for completeness based on the following system:
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Phase 1: Planning
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Phase 2: Development
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Phase 3: Beta
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Phase 4: Release</p>

<p>12/28/2006
<br/>Not actually a GMod plugin, but could easily be ported to it, 0byte is a chat server backend I have been working on for another project.  The foundation is almost fully functional, requiring minor tweaks and some more functionality past just sending messages.  With minimal work, it could be converted to a privatized, &#39;members only&#39; chat server for GMod 10.</p>

<p>0byte: Phase 2
<br/>GMTalk: Phase 1
<br/>GMEdit: Phase 1</p>
 title : The gnizr-undergrads Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>snewzr </p>

<p>Social News Reader </p>

<p>Project Description </p>

<p>Initial general requirements: </p>

<p>Create a new public front page for the gnizr system Generate an RSS feed that pulls all new public posts from the system The front page will display the results of this public RSS feed Generate an RSS feed that pulls all new public and private posts from the system Users will log in and be able to interact with the front page which now includes the public and private RSS feed -Bookmarks can be set to be private or public (extendable to higher resolution)  -Public items are posted to the public (no login) front page --Private items show up on the  front page once the user logs in -Comments are posted to the original bookmark -When users edit, tag or geotag items, a new bookmark is created in the user&#39;s profile -A link is created in the original bookmark back to the new bookmark as a linkback item and the new bookmark has a link back to the original </p>

<p>The RSS feed is only updated when a new UNIQUE bookmark is added to the system -if the new bookmark already exists in the database, then it is not added to the RSS feed </p>

<p>Bonus goals: </p>

<p>RSS feeds generated from individual users AJAX auto-updating front page</p>

 title : The greenvex Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>GreenVexOpen Source proxy written in Python. Simplifies interacting with Battle.net protocols. Allows the creation of bots and tools for Battle.net by monitoring, sending, and receiving packets.  </p>

<p>Python is an interpreted language, therefore the source code can be executed without re-compilation (on-the-fly changes). </p>

<p>Currently supports: Diablo II. </p>

<p>Features a plugin system, and many functions to make bot development easier. Creating, testing, and running plugins is quick and easy. </p>

<p>Features a protocol system to extend handing of Battle.net protocols for the server and client. </p>

<p>Redesigned Python version of RedVex. It acts as a portal between your computer and Battle.net servers. It accepts and sends your client packets to Battle.net, then accepts and sends Battle.net&#39;s packets to your client. </p>

<p>At the moment primarily designed for Unix based systems. Versions for Windows have been compiled, which merely wrap the Python run-time interpreter into an executable. </p>

<p>Created by Eric Muyser. </p>

<p>Changelog08.11.02: Disabled library compression (causing issues). </p>

<p>08.11.02: Added a quick GUI, and fixed up the source for Windows. </p>

<p>Todo- Possibly rewrite the protocol handler structure. </p>

<p>- Fix the event listener. </p>

<p>- Take consideration for disconnections in the multiplexer. </p>

<p>- Write client plugins login/cdkey/etc and a corresponding GUI. More packet handling. </p>

<p>- Add all the GUI features. Plugin list, live Python interpreter, start/stop, realms/ports, run multiple plugin setups (multiple bots essentially) - set realm/ip address/cdkey/etc, mac address changer. </p>

<p>- Convert game packet decrypt functions into Python. </p>

<p>- Convert map parser into Python. </p>

<p>GreenVex TeamLead Developer: Eric Muyser </p>

<p>Lead Programmer: Open </p>

<p>Lead Designer: Open </p>

<p>Developer: Open </p>

<p>Programmer: Open </p>

<p>Designer: Open</p>

 title : The gserver Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Simple to use library. </p>

<p>Primarily designed for multiplayer games but can be used for anything else. </p>

<p>Features: </p>

<p>-multi threaded but the nio package will also be support for  mono threaded networking. -UDP/TCP -working with serialized objects, or simple strings is ok. The better way is to use EcoMessage which provides a way to send only what&#39;s needed. -working with groups: enables you to retrieve easyly any object and to &quot;talk&quot; to the right group. -working with contexts. A context can be a Game object. -working with MessageProcessor: this where you implement what do you do with received packets. -No need to create Threads. You don&#39;t have to worry about synchronisation. -uses Javolution.</p>

 title : The imagexgui Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is a tool for easier use of Microsoft&#39;s ImageX CLI disk imaging tool.  It allows for creation and application of images, .ini file usage, networking tools, and access to a disk partitioner (experimental). </p>

 title : The imaginecup2k7t3 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Omni is a language learning system that uses social networking concepts to encourage student collaboration. Omni allows users to meet and communicate with each other in the language they are learning. Integrated into Omni are a set of features designed to help language learners of varying skill levels share information. When students encounter difficulties they can work past them by cooperating with other users. By allowing open access to Omni, other social networks and communication services will be able to use the power of the network to allow their users to communicate across language barriers. One of the greatest obstacles for language students is moving from the classroom to native speaking; Omni seeks to overcome these difficulties using social networking.</p>
 title : The imgd4000 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Rise of the Turkey I Found Gerber presents  </p>

<p> Yi Wang, Tim Poliquin </p>

<p> Special thanks to: </p>

<p>JavaMonkeyEngine for awesome graphics support JavaGameNetworking for awesome networking support FengGUI for awesome GUI support </p>

<p>WebstartClient Webstart </p>

<p>Server Autorun </p>

<p>It is advised to run the server in command line to view all the logging information and any exceptions may occur due to network protocol issues. </p>

<p>Post MortemPost-Mortem </p>

<p>DescriptionRise of the Turkey is a 3rd Person 3D platformer in the spirit of family friendly adventures. Players control Bernie, a young Turkey wishing to complete his rite of passage into adult hood by navigating the heavens and find the great Phoenix Gate. Navigating the heavens is no easy task for Bernie and the players, as the path is not complete and is blocked by many obstacles. Bernie must create his own paths, using the Cloud Gun to form bridges and absorb “light” clouds to break obstacles. Absorbing clouds also replenishes Bernie’s limited water supply (the resource that allows him to create clouds), allowing him to progress through levels. In addition, the player will be able to compete against other players via a network connection in a timed trial to the finish line. </p>

<p>FeaturesCloud generation to modify terrrain. Checkpoint save. Multiplayer. Intense graphics. Background and triggered sound effects. ControlsMovement control </p>

<p>w key - Move forward a key - Rotate left s key - Move backward d key - Rotate right q key - Strafe left e key - Strafe right Space key - Jump Camera control </p>

<p>Hold down middle mouse button and drag mouse to rotate camera around the character. Scroll the mouse wheel to control zoom in and out. Cloud control </p>

<p>Move the mouse up or down to change the height for cloud generation Hold down left mouse button to change charge amount. Release left mouse button to generate cloud. Hold down right mouse button to start absorbing. Release right mouse button to absorb a cloud. Goal </p>

<p>Each player is in a race to the Golden Cloud at the end of the level. Players may get there however they choose, though some paths may be faster than others. </p>

<p>Technical Focus1. Intense graphics through multi-render pass rendering: </p>

<p>Dynamic lighting Full screen blooming Per-vertex fog Water effect Dynamic texture blending 2. Force driven physics: Additive forces (movement, friction, gravity) Velocity computation 3. Networking: Message passing Multi-threaded message handling 4. Extendability architecture: Highly object-oriented architecture design for maximum extendability </p>

<p>Screen Shots</p>

 title : The innerspace Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Welcome to InnerSpaceInnerSpace is a MUD-like system for building virtual worlds. The goal was to take the LambdaMOO approach to creating online worlds, and update it in hopes of attracting new players to an old idea. </p>

<p>Like many MOO-clones before it, InnerSpace uses Python as its internal scripting language. This provides a powerful environment for game authors, while a flexible object model allows for creation of complex in-game objects. </p>

<p>Since the primary client is a XHTML web interface, authors can customize the client appearance a great deal using standards-based XHTML and CSS -- even JavaScript or Macromedia Flash can be embedded. </p>

<p>Feature SetAJAX-Enabled Client </p>

<p>The default client provides a standards-compliant web interface based 
<br/>on the Nevow Athena AJAX framework. </p>

<p>Client API </p>

<p>A Twisted Perspective Broker interface is provided for developers 
<br/>who with to build a custom heavy client. </p>

<p>Powerful Natural-Language Parser </p>

<p>The built-in interpreter parses a large number of different imperative 
<br/>statements, making user-world interaction a more immersive experience. </p>

<p>Internal Scripting </p>

<p>A Pure-Python scripting layer integrates tightly with the framework code, 
<br/>allowing a high degree of customization. 
<br/>   Robust Networking InnerSpace relies on the Twisted Python and Nevow frameworks to implement 
<br/>client-server communication. This robust asychronous networking library 
<br/>allows client connections to scale easily to hundreds of connections. </p>

<p>Graphical Object Editors </p>

<p>Programmers and authors alike will find the built-in authoring tools 
<br/>expedite world creation and verb programming. </p>

<p>Syntax-Highlighting Verb Editor </p>

<p>Verbs are created in-game, through an embedded editor. Support for 
<br/>external editors coming soon. </p>

<p>Keep in mind that InnerSpace in its current form is not targeted to one particular game genre or type. Owing to its roots in LambdaMOO, the goal here is to provide a basic environment that takes care of the common features of these kinds of systems. If you&#39;re looking for something with a richer set of primitives for immersive text-oriented gaming, you should have a look at Divmod&#39;s Imaginary. </p>

<p>Try it Out!I&#39;ve installed a test server on bubblehouse, but it&#39;s going to be awhile until it can be opened to the public. However, I&#39;m very interested in finding beta testers to put this thing through its paces. If you&#39;re interested in mucking around with the beta server, you should sign up for the InnerSpace mailing list. Once subscribed, you can submit a request for an account there; eventually I&#39;ll have a form or some other mechanism to allow users to create their own accounts. </p>

<p>Things Around HereInstalling InnerSpace Getting Started Creating Content Writing Verbs Default ACL Permissions Inheritance in InnerSpace Extending InnerSpace InnerSpace History Sign up for the InnerSpace mailing list Freshmeat Project Page SourceForge Project Page Ancient InnerSpace Blog at bubblehouse Twisted Imaginary Incidentally, Innerspace was a somewhat preposterous movie from the 80s featuring Martin Short. This is, thankfully, a coincidence.</p>

 title : The jetbase Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>JetBase aims to provide a performance oriented light-weight base for the network component of applications. It handles the actual output and input to/from sockets, makes sure protocol implementations supplied by your application are instantiated via factories you provide, and invokes the protocol when there is new data.  </p>

<p>JetBase is young, but functional. It uses the New I/O classes of Java to perform non-blocking socket handling, using a minimal number of threads.</p>
 title : The jmingle Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>JMingle is a social networking endeavor that works by scanning phones over Bluetooth. The goal of the project is to create a social networking platform in which &#39;links&#39; between people are created when they are in range for their Bluetooth-enabled phones (or, eventually, other devices) can discover each other. </p>

<p>Future goals for JMingle are to create a more &quot;competitive&quot; style where those with the most &quot;bump-ins&quot; are ranked on a centralized site. This would require a web site where accounts are attached to the unique Bluetooth addresses of each device.</p>

 title : The libtion Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Library for a Topological Infrastructure for Open Networking (libtion) provides services for creating network topologies optimized for specific tasks and provides both data transport services and a system of network self-realization to optimize data distribution and collection.  It will include a high level API for working with the infrastructure and may, at some point, also ship with a GUI to aid in constructing optimized topologies.</p>
 title : The lidgren-network Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Lidgren.Network is a networking library for .net framework which uses a single udp socket to delivers a simple API for connecting a client to a server, reading and sending messages. The following delivery methods is implemented: </p>

<p>Unreliable unordered. Messages may or may not arrive and the order is undetermined. Reliable unordered. Messages will arrive (sooner or later), but the order is undetermined. Unreliable ordered. Messages may or may not arrive and the order is fixed, ie. old messages will not arrive after new messages. Reliable ordered. Message will arrive (sooner or later) in the same order they were sent. All delivery methods rejects duplicate messages and UnreliableOrdered and ReliableOrdered can be sent in different channels. Other features includes: </p>

<p>Message coalescing/c</p>

 title : The mosoni Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MUK is a basic IA32 kernel written from scratch, mostly done for educationnal purpose. It features networking and multitasking, but doesnot provide support for a userland (yet). A beginning of virtual memory is implemented but has been disabled for testing purposes. Once the current code + virtual memory work well, userland will be added and networking will be removed from kernel to user land. Due to time constraints, the code is not good and there is no real design in the kernel architecture. Please note it hasnot been tested on real hardware(Qemu only), plus it compiles with an old version of gcc. All this is to be improved.</p>
