 title : The myisern-1-silver Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MyISERN: A social networking application to facilitate research collaboration. </p>

<p>This is the code repository of the silver group.</p>
 summary : <p>This is the project home page for the MyISERN Web application.   </p>

<p>The objective of this project is to create a social-networking web application for the International Software Engineering Research Network (ISERN). With this social networking site, a member may add, edit, and display members of the ISERN community. It also allows the same functionalities for its members&#39; organizations.  Most importantly, it facilitates collaboration among ISERN members by allowing a user to create collaborations with other members of the network.  Member information is kept confidential from the public as login is required. </p>

<p>Team Onyx has chosen the Apache Derby Database to store information provided by ISERN members.  A new ISERN member can be added to the database with the edd function.  A member may also add a new Organization, as well as create a Collaboration between another ISERN member.  The edit function allows a user to edit information for a researcher, an organization, or a collaboration.  The user is able to view information for members, organizations, and collaborations of the network.  The application must also able to create an XML representation of the information stored in the database. </p>

<p>MyISERN is able to authenticate a login/logout process as well as add, edit, and  display the Researchers, Organizations, Collaborations of the ISERN network.  Implementation is nearly complete for the use of the Derby Database to store the saved information.  We are using Java to implement the web application and the Stripes web application framework to work with the web application.  For a guide to installing the system on your machine, please visit the link provided below.  If you are a developer interested in hacking the system, please refer to the developers guide found below.     </p>

<p>Important Links </p>

<p>ISERN homepage - The ISERN webpage InstallationGuide - Installation Guide for End-User. DevelopersGuide - Start-up guide for a Developer ReleaseNotes - New Features, Known Issues for the latest release. JavaDoc - Java Documentation in the SVN repository. NOTE Visiting the javadoc link using Firefox will only show a text file.  Please use Internet Explorer to view the javadoc pages. </p>

<p>Additionally, if you are a member of this project and would like to discuss issues regarding this project, please visit our Discussion Page. </p>

<p>Lastly, if you have found a bug or any unexpected errors, please contact one of developers listed below and describe what the problem is and if possible, steps to take to reproduce the error. </p>

<p>Hong Nguyen - savagecorp46ATgmailDOTcom John Hauge - HanClanSoloATgmailDOTcom Marcius Bagawan - denverjockstrapATgmailDOTcom  Sonwright M. Gomez - sonnyg95ATgmailDOTcom Current look of the ISERN website(Beta Version):</p>
 title : The myisern-onyx Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The n-utils Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>There&#39;s a lot of stuff here.  Lately I&#39;ve been writing a lot of code to manipulate collections, iterables, arrays, etc. </p>

<p>There is a collection of stream decorators that simplify the use of buffered I/O and other stream related tasks. For example, a DelimitedInputStream wraps another stream, but considers itself closed once a certain token appears. </p>

<p>There is a set of networking classes that simplify listening on a TCP/UDP port and transmitting UDP packets. </p>

<p>There are also utility classes for manipulating bits and bytes. The BitReader and BitWriter classes allow 1 bit at a time I/O. Bytes is a collection of byte/byte stream manipulation functions. Hex2Bytes converts a hexadecimal string into a byte array. </p>

<p>There are currently no external dependencies unless you want to run the tests, in which case you&#39;ll need JUnit. </p>

<p>MavenWe have a Maven repository. Add this to your pom&#39;s repositories element: </p>

<p>		
<br/>			n-utils
<br/>			http://www.noahsloan.com/snapshot
<br/>		and this to dependencies: </p>

<p>		
<br/>			com.noahsloan
<br/>			n-utils
<br/>			1.0-SNAPSHOT
<br/>		Snapshots&#39;Whenever I change something&#39; snapshots are available here.</p>
 title : The neptune-network-emulator Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Neptune Network EmulatorThe aim of this project is the development of a flexible, multi-user, virtualization-enabled network emulator, using a cluster of general purpose (x86) machines: network nodes are virtual machines running on top of cluster physical machines. All nodes are GNU/Linux ones, and link emulation is implemented by netem.  </p>

<p>The emulator interface is web-based and uses the AJAX pattern. An example of net topology definition through the Neptune&#39;s Web Interface is here:  </p>

<p>More examples are in ScreenShots. </p>

<p>Actual features: </p>

<p>Users management Experimemts life cycle management (definition, allocation, destruction) Hypervisors and Virtual machines management Two ways to define topologies: xml file or visual editor Automatic topology validation and completion processes </p>

<p>What I need to use Neptune?Neptune is a cluster-based emulator, but you don&#39;t need a cluster to use it, because it&#39;s flexible!! All you need is a PC with the Xen Hypervisor,libvirt and an application server like tomcat installed and ready to use. If you have a cluster, instead, you can use the whole cluster or a part of it, simply installing on a node the above configuration and on the other nodes the Xen Hypervisor and libvirt. </p>

<p>  This is an intellectual property by Università di Napoli “Federico II” and respective authors. You are free to use this work as long as you cite the original authors:
<br/> prof. ing. Roberto Canonico
<br/> ing. Pasquale Di Gennaro
<br/> ing. Roberto Bifulco
<br/> ing. Luigi Arpino</p>

<p>http://www.gaffer.org/networking-for-game-programmers</p>

 title : The networksuite Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IntroductionNoX is and idea that came to me when I was initially showing Ubuntu to a new user. The conversation went something like this:  Me&gt; &quot;and this is the mail client .. &quot;  User&gt; &quot;hot damn that&#39;s ugly&quot;  </p>

<p>and it dawned on me that, well, it is.. and functionality wise it&#39;s just not keeping up with it. then again to be fair neither are MS or Mozilla products. So i decided to write my own.  </p>

<p>NoX is designed to fit into the MVC pattern, to be modular in development, and  integrated in use. Why can&#39;t I click on the contact name and be taken to that contact in my contacts tab. why can&#39;t i see my contact&#39;s facebook, twitter, friendfeed etc. statuses right there in the application. why can&#39;t i be notified when one of my contacts has updated her blog. for god sakes why isn&#39;t rss implemented properly! </p>

<p>then there is the look of it. Current mail clients seem hell bent on being dreary. </p>

<p>ImplementationClearly I can&#39;t implement this all by myself. Luckily most of the libraries are already written and the API&#39;s for social networking are simple and established.  </p>

<p>links to URLS to be added </p>

<p>Function  Library   RSS  Rome   E-Mail  Java Mail , Gmail API  Instant Messaging  SMACK XMPP  Contact Management  Various Social Networking API&#39;s   Calendaring  Problem   Content  looking for a decent OSS HTML Renderer  Components  customized implementation and Glazed Lists </p>

<p>StatusDeveloping Framework for modules. </p>

<p>Release Cyclex.01   ten weeks 
<br/>x.02   ten weeks 
<br/>x.03   twelve weeks 
<br/>x+1.0  20 weeks 
<br/>which gives us a release cylce of 1 year. </p>

<p>i&#39;m hoping to speed up the release cycle a bit initially but that will be down to community vote.</p>

 title : The openvirgle Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>What started as an April Fool joke by Google for 2008 is now a real and genuine effort to create ideas for ways in which humankind can live sustainably in space using free and open source technology. This project is a place for all space enthusiasts to cooperate on simulations of space habitats and a related knowledgebase and tools for the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) using Jython and other JVM languages. Rather than argue whether L5 or Mars or the asteroids or the Moon or the rings of Saturn should be humankind&#39;s first space settlement, we could be asking what is common between those efforts so that that groundwork can be shared. </p>

<p>The proposed first design/simulation is a utility space pod. The &quot;shirtsleeve&quot; utility space pod is probably common to all space efforts. See: http://code.google.com/p/openvirgle/wiki/SpacePod</p>
 title : The opponet Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Opponet is an open source effort to create components and tools for support of opportunistic wireless networking in the OMNeT++ discrete event simulator. We provide a NodeFactory component which uses traces to dynamically instantiate mobile nodes during a simulation run. Two distinct models are supported: Mobility and contact trace based. Mobility traces consist of create, destroy and waypoint commands. Contact traces consist of create, destroy, contact establish and contact break events. OMNeT++ simple modules are embedded in the mobile nodes. These are TraceMobility and ContactNotifier which handle mobility and contact events locally for each mobile node during its lifetime. Both TraceMobility and ContactNotifier inherit from the BasicMobility base class of the Mobility Framework (MF) and can thus be used in existing simulations which utilize the MF. </p>

<p>The project is described in  </p>

<p>Helgason, O. R. &amp; Jónsson, K. V., Opportunistic Networking in OMNeT++. First International Conference on Simulation Tools and Techniques for Communications, Networks and Systems (SIMUTOOLS 2008), OMNeT++ Workshop, 2008. 
<br/>The paper is available on the downloads page. </p>

<p>UsageThe most convenient way to start experimenting with the trace driven approach to mobility and contact support is to build and run the Opposim simulator. This is a very simple simulator which demonstrates our node factory and associated component. </p>

<p>We also provide a number of tools for generation of traces and conversion of existing traces into our format in the MobiTrace toolbox. </p>

<p>Opponet is an academic project and based solely on our interest and past research projects. The code is released under a GPL license and is free for all to use within its terms. We encourage you all to try the code and are interested in receiving feedback, either by email or though the issue tracking system (requires a google account). We are also very interested in recruiting some collaborators for the project. </p>

<p>The newest releases of the code are available from downloads or via anonymous subversion access: </p>

<p>svn checkout http://opponet.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ opponet-read-only</p>
 title : The osspaces Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>AstroSPACES is the first ever free, open source social networking solution. With it, you can easily create your own MySpace-like website with very little work on your part. It utilizes the Smarty Template Engine, so web designers can easily customize the default look of the system. Users can also edit the look of their spaces. Being written in PHP, it is also highly customizable.</p>

 title : The petants Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Pet Ants is a social networking tool for Eclipse.  As an Eclipse view it allows you to create your own ant&#39;s nest and add pet ants to the nest.  You can attach messages to your ants which will roam to your buddies&#39; views using various protocols such as XMPP.  You can also import your buddy lists from Livejournal and Twitter and those ants will will change colour when your buddy posts an update.  Another type of ant keeps track of your RSS feeds and changes colour when the feed is updated. </p>

<p>There is much more going to be added and Pet Ants will also expose some extension points so that additional functionality can be added later or by other developers. </p>

<p>Use the Eclipse Update Site to install this plugin (as a feature). http://eclipse.brindy.org.uk/ </p>

<p>Version 1.0.5 now available.</p>

 title : The pinproject Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The pyela Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>PyelaTools and application programming interfaces (APIs) for the open-source &amp; free MMORPG, Eternal Lands. </p>

<p>Pyela is an implementation of the Eternal Lands network protocol in Python. The aim of this project is to provide an object oriented API and framework for communicating over the Eternal Lands protocol and to allow rapid and simple development of tools and other features that would communicate with an EL server (such as bots). </p>

<p>Apart from the APIs, there are also tools in the works. The first of which is a GTK Python chat application. It&#39;s currently in the early development stage but is already functional and usable. You can download that here. </p>

<p>RequirementsYou will need the following software packages/libraries installed on your computer before using any of the Pyela framework: </p>

<p>Python 2.5 or later PyGTK/GTK 2.0 GTK is only needed for the GUI based applications. </p>

<p>Featured DownloadsPyela-Net, 0.4.1 Alpha - the first release of the networking API for connecting to an Eternal Lands server. </p>

<p>Pyela-GUI, 0.4 Alpha - a Python Eternal Lands chat GUI </p>

<p>DocumentationLearn how to use pyela-net, the first pyela module, to connect to an Eternal Lands server in Python: UsingPyelaNet. </p>

<p>Understand the possibilities of Pyela as a bot framework with PyelaBotFramework. </p>

<p>AboutPyela was designed and written by atc as a pet-project to practice python and learn network programming.</p>

 title : The qwired-suite Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Qwired Client is a multi-platform client for the Wired protocol. It is written in C++ and using the Qt4 framework, providing a very good multi-platform experience for the user. </p>

<p>It allows you to connect to Wired servers and participate in chats, private messaging and file transfers from a single application. All data transmitted between users is encrypted using OpenSSL on all supported platforms. Primary development targets are Linux, Windows and Mac OS X. The project is licensed under the GPL, so more platforms may be targeted in the future. </p>

<p>Qwired Server is also under development and soon will offer a multi-platform server aimed to be stable and scalable. </p>

<p>Please use our Google Group for discussions related to Qwired.NewsYou can find the most recent news on our Blag. </p>

<p>Snapshot DownloadsRecent Snapshots for Mac OS X, Linux and Windows can be downloaded directly from the nightly build server at http://qwired.neo.de/nightlies/ Stable releases will be available from the Downloads section here. </p>

<p>Qwired Server is a multi-platform server daemon for the Wired protocol. Just like Qwired Client it is also written in C++ and using the Qt4 framework. Qwired Server is currently under heavy development and in very early testing stages. </p>

<p>Qwired Development ServerIf you wish to participate  in Qwired development, please visit us at our Wired server at wired://hl.neo.de/ </p>

<p>DonationsSince many people asked, here is the link to the donation page. Donations help us to pay for neccessary servers/bandwidth and coffeine.</p>

 title : The raknet-wrapper Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Rawflickr is a library designed to allow Delphi programs to access the Flickr API as if it were a set of local function. It does so by providing a set of classes, one for each group of Flickr API methods (auth, blogs, photos, ...) and making the methods inside each class mimic almost exactly the corresponding API method, though using comfortable ObjectPascal types rather than raw strings.</p>

 summary : <p>RoX 3D is a 3-Dimensional open source game engine entirely written in x86 Assembler with OpenGL libraries. The objective of this engine is to be one of the fastest rendering engines out there and power high demand applications and games. We also plan to implement networking code, some basic physics, an advanced particle engine and a small map/game editor. </p>

 title : The rssdler Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>RSSDlerA utility to automatically download enclosures and other objects linked to from various types of RSS feeds. Works well on podcasts, videocasts, and torrents. </p>

<p>Features include:filtering using regular expressions and/or file size global, feed, and filter based download locations can run in the background (at least on GNU/Linux) like a daemon various logging and verbosity levels  support for sites protected with cookies (LWP/MSIE/Mozilla/Safari/Firefox3) global and feed scan times respects &#39;ttl&#39; tag in feeds that have them call custom functions after a download or after a scan of the feed (episode advancement!) generates an RSS feed of what it has downloaded.  Because it is written in Python, it is highly cross-platform compatible. It tries to be memory efficient, with reports of it functioning on consumer routers. Minimal external dependencies help keep that a reality. It became popular when people started using it in conjunction with rTorrent for torrent broadcatching. </p>

<p>News2009.10.01  Version 0.4.2 released  See ChangeLog for details. 2008.04.29: Version 0.4.0 released. See ChangeLog and release message for details. 2008.01.13: Version 0.3.4 released. See ChangeLog for details 2008.01.11: Version 0.3.3 released. See ChangeLog for details 2008.01.01: Version 0.3.2 released. See ChangeLog for details DependenciesPython 2.4 or later (required) feedparser (required) mechanize (suggested)] SupportStill have questions after reading the wiki. Message the group and see if you cannot get help  there. </p>

<p>DevelopmentYou can also find the development version for testing or using new features or trying out new bugfixes. This may or may not run and may or may not be stable. There are times when it contains bugfixes for the latest version, and times when it is undergoing feature development and may be subject to crashes. The changelog will note the changes in the development version, but those changes may be buggy and/or incomplete. Feel free to test this version and email me the bug reports you have. </p>

<p>And by popular request:a CommentedConfig file As well as sample postDownloadFunctions, the most recent of which will be in your installation tarball An init script can be found in the installation tar ball If you are here from the rtorrent website, note that you&#39;ll want to set downloadDir (see HelpMessage) to the same directory as rtorrent&#39;s watch directory. Of course, you can download different rss feeds to different directories with the directory option for each thread.  </p>

<p>PLEASE READ THE ChangeLog BETWEEN UPGRADES. Settings may change that require some (minor) user intervention. These will be detailed between releases (as well as more esoteric things).</p>

 title : The ruby-autoblog-library Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>In this era of widget proliferation, user&#39;s are coming more and more to expect to be able to easily insert a widget into their blog or social networking page. </p>

<p>This library provides a single API for automatically publishing content to major blog platforms and social networking sites. We call this &quot;auto-blogging&quot;. </p>

<p>The intent is for your application to be able to offer users a simple mechanism for adding some content to their personal site. The general flow is: </p>

<p>-Gather user input: 
<br/>Page identifier 
<br/>account credentials 
<br/>-Post content via the library directly to the indicated system. 
<br/>-Inform user of the result.</p>

 summary : <p>SpacedockA 2D physics based top down shooter written in C++ using Chipmunk physics, OpenGL, and GLUT.</p>
 summary : <p>WelcomeWelcome to the Spring Social Project!   </p>

<p>This project provides a Spring MVC Framework based API for developing social networking applications on  platforms such as Facebook.  The goal of the project is to make developing scalable and testable social networking applications easier.  Currently, only Facebook is supported.  However, we plan to add support for Open Social as that platform matures. </p>

<p>There is currently a lot of confusion and complexity surrounding Facebook&#39;s APIs and the request model imposed on Facebook applications.  This project aims to simplify Java based Facebook application development and deployment by providing a consistent, reusable and well documented set of Spring MVC components. </p>

<p>StatusPlease note this project is still in its early development stages and therefore, has not yet released a stable API.</p>

 title : The tetrazune Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>TetraZuneThis remake of the classic block puzzler is being developed as a tutorial tool for others wishing to make games for the Zune on the brand new XNA 3.0 CTP.  In addition, non-programmers will be able to easily upload and play the game themselves. </p>

<p>Latest News:For Christmas I just got a new Zune 8 to replace my lost Zune 30!  I will soon be continuing this project to its very-near completion. Sorry for the long delay. </p>

<p>TetraZune is nearing completion, with the title screen now complete.  Scoring is really the last thing to add (including score totalling, high score listings, and name entering).  I have not decided yet if I will allow the wireless transfer of high scores, we will have to see how long the other stuff takes. </p>

<p>Alpha release 0.1 is available on the Downloads page (or the &quot;Featured Downloads&quot; pane to the right &gt;&gt;&gt;).  Only the main game logic is working, and the program quits as soon as you lose, without totalling your full score.  Still it is the first stable release that lets you play a full game of Tetris!  Whoo hoo! </p>

<p>Projected Features:Full working tetra block game with bonuses, cool animations, and &#39;1337&#39; sound effects. Basic media functionality. High scores and other notable achievements. Clean, professional presentation, animated effects, and overall quality. Possible utilization of wireless multiplayer, most likely only to share high scores. Overall demonstration of key components needed to making games on the XNA platform. Donations?You really love tetris? Want to see me devote more time to Zune games?  You&#39;ve just hit the lottery?  Donate!  Any amount is appreciated.  Leave a message with your gift if you&#39;re feeling really saucy ;) </p>

<p>Easy donations with Paypal.  Every dollar helps! </p>

 title : The tryst Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>UOFAP is in essence a utility for use with the Ultima Online client. It is not a cheat program or a tool for connecting to third party servers, you may be interested in Razor if this is what you are looking for. </p>

<p>UOFAP does however work with third party UO servers, and is how we do the majority of our testing. </p>

<p>This solution covers a set of libraries and designs to be used for plug-ins for the actual UOFAP program or for people to use in their own projects. </p>

<p>UOFAP will be supplied with certain plug-ins such as a mapping tool and a chat tool, to hopefully replace the now unsupported UO Automap. Plug ins are modular, and can communicate with each other, allowing plug-ins that add extra functionality to other plug-ins (such as the mapping tool). </p>

<p>Users will get the most from the Quick Start Guide and developers will get the most from the Solution Overview. </p>

<p>None of this is &quot;UO Pro&quot; or in any way supported or authorized by Electronic Arts. Use of these tools is at your own risk.</p>

 title : The wnetscan Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Improved Linux Wireless Networking Administration </p>

<p>Until recently hooking a Linux computer up to a Wi-Fi wireless network was all but impossible. This was due to the limited software available. wnetscan is a big step in the right directiom. </p>

<p>wnetscan will find any wireless adaptor installed and use it to find all wireless access points in range. It will then use the information from this scan to set up the wireless adaptor and its network configuration file to connect to one of these networks. </p>

<p>Normally wnetscan will attempt to connect the network it finds with the strongest signal since this is generally the closest and the one most likely to be the one desired.</p>
 title : The wozzhot Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Wozzhot: A popular social networking Search engine</p>
 summary : <p>OverviewThis is a Java API for communication with XBee/XBee-Pro series 1 (802.15.4) and series 2 (ZNet 2.5 and ZB/ZigBee Pro) OEM RF Modules, in API mode.  The objective of this project is to provide a flexible and simple to use API to interact with XBee radios.  In terms of flexibility, the goal is to not constrain you to a particular implementation (e.g. GUI, Web App), but instead let you decide how to use it.  This software has been tested on Windows, Mac, and Linux and can run on any other platform that supports Java 5 or greater and RXTX. </p>

<p>News5/10/09 Version 0.5.5 is available and includes many updates.   See ReleaseNotes for details. 3/29/09 I have released XBee Arduino.  This is a port of XBee API to the Arduino platform, allowing you to send/receive packets on Arduino. 1/29/09 I have released XBee XMPP.  This project is built on XBee-API and uses XMPP for remote communication with an XBee network.  This allows you to share an XBee with multiple applications, that can exist on different machines. 1/25/09  Version 0.5.1 of the XBee API is now available.  This release contains two bugfixes.  See ReleaseNotes for details. 1/17/09 Version 0.5 8/3/08 Version 0.4 6/10/08 Version 0.3.1 4/29/08 Version 0.3 4/5/08 Initial Release DocumentationDeveloper&#39;s Guide Javadocs Wiki Docs  </p>

<p>ExamplesHere are a few examples that demostrate some common functionality: </p>

<p>Turn on an I/O port on a remote Series 2 (ZNet/ZB Pro) XBee: </p>

<p>XBee xbee = new XBee();
<br/>xbee.open(&quot;COM5&quot;, 9600);</p>

<p>// this is the Serial High (SH) + Serial Low (SL) of the remote XBee			
<br/>XBeeAddress64 addr64 = new XBeeAddress64(0xa, 0xb, 0xc, 0xd, 0xe, 0xf, 0, 1);</p>

<p>// Turn on DIO0 (Pin 20).  5 is Digital Output High
<br/>ZNetRemoteAtRequest request = new ZNetRemoteAtRequest(addr64, &quot;D0&quot;, new int[] {5});</p>

<p>xbee.sendAsynchronous(request);</p>

<p>ZNetRemoteAtResponse response = (ZNetRemoteAtResponse) xbee.getResponse();</p>

<p>if (response.isOk()) {
<br/>    System.out.println(&quot;Successfully turned on DIO0&quot;);
<br/>} else {
<br/>    System.out.println(&quot;Attempt to turn on DIO0 failed.  Status: &quot; + response.getStatus());
<br/>}</p>

<p>// shutdown the serial port and associated threads
<br/>xbee.close();
<br/>Receive I/O samples from a remote Series 1 (802.15.4) XBee: </p>

<p>XBee xbee = new XBee();		
<br/>xbee.open(&quot;COM15&quot;, 9600);
<br/>			
<br/>while (true) {
<br/>    RxResponseIoSample ioSample = (RxResponseIoSample) xbee.getResponse();</p>

<p>    System.out.println(&quot;We received a sample from &quot; + ioSample.getSourceAddress());	
<br/>			
<br/>    if (ioSample.containsAnalog()) {
<br/>        System.out.println(&quot;10-bit temp reading (pin 19) is &quot; + ioSample.getSamples()[0].getAnalog1();
<br/>    }
<br/>}There are many more detailed examples included in the code for both ZigBee and 802.15.4.  Here are just a few: </p>

<p>This example contains a few sample configurations to get your ZigBee coordinator and end devices configured quickly, without needing X-CTU (windows only) ZNetApiAtTest.java </p>

<p>Example of sending packets from a ZigBee coordinator to an end device ZNetSenderTest.java </p>

<p>This example receives the packets sent in the previous example ZNetReceiverTest.java </p>

<p>Feature SupportThe majority of the XBee specification has been implemented for both 802.15.4 (Series 1) and ZNet 2.5/ZB Pro (Series 2).  See FeatureSupport for a full listing of supported API types. </p>

<p>AboutI received my first pair of XBee Pro radios in Nov &#39;07, after learning about them on the Arduino website.  I quickly learned that to take advantage of the real power in XBee radios (e.g. I/O Samples, ACK/Delivery Status, Remote AT etc.), you need to configure the radio in API mode.  I searched for open source XBee software with support for API mode, but couldn&#39;t find anything, so I decided to write my own.  I started coding on 12/15/2007 and after about 300 commits and several months later I released the software here, on Google Code. </p>

<p>SupportPlease report any bugs on the Issue Tracker  For questions regarding this software, not covered in the documentation, use the Forum   </p>

<p>Questions/FeedbackQuestions about this project should be posted to  http://groups.google.com/group/xbee-api?pli=1  Be sure to provide as much detail as possible. </p>

<p>For other stuff, I can be contacted at andrew.rapp [at] gmail.</p>

 title : The ajaxformsplugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>DOMAssistantAJAXFormsAJAXForms is a plugin to DOMAssistant, and offers the possibility to submit forms dynamically through AJAX without posting the entire page. </p>

<p>Usage:Use DOMAssistant in your web page. Then include the DOMAssistantAJAXForms plugin. There are two ways of adding AJAX form functionality to a form: </p>

<p>Approach 1:Add the class &quot;ajax-form&quot; to any form you would like to be submitted via AJAX. For example: </p>

<p>. </p>

<p>Approach 2:Use a JavaScript call to apply the functionality to the form, and optionally, setting beforeSubmissionHandler, responseHandler and request headers. For example: </p>

<p>$(&quot;#form-id&quot;).setAJAXForm(function () {
<br/>	// Function to run before submission
<br/>}, function (response) {
<br/>	// Function to run to handle the response
<br/>}, {
<br/>	// Setting headers, as an object
<br/>	&quot;X-Requested-With&quot; : &quot;XMLHttpRequest&quot;
<br/>});When the posting is complete:You can, in three different ways, specify what function should be called once the posting is complete. </p>

<p>Alternative 1:    // Applies to the form with an id of &quot;form-id&quot; in the web page
<br/>    $(&quot;#form-id&quot;).setResponseHandler(functionToCall);Alternative 2:    // Applies to all AJAXForms in the web page
<br/>    DOMAssistant.AJAXForms.setResponseHandler(functionToCall);Alternative 3:        The called function:Using any of these approaches, in functionToCall, the first parameter will be the response from the request. The context will the form that it was called on, i.e. &quot;this&quot; in that function will be the form element which was posted. </p>

<p>Before the posting:If you want, for instance, to validate the form before it&#39;s sent, you can specify a function to run, and then continue posting if that function returns true, or stop the posting if it returns false. </p>

<p>You can, in three different ways, specify what function should be called before the posting occurs. </p>

<p>Alternative 1:    // Applies to the form with an id of &quot;form-id&quot; in the web page
<br/>    $(&quot;#form-id&quot;).setBeforeSubmissionHandler(functionToCall);Alternative 2:    // Applies to all AJAXForms in the web page
<br/>    DOMAssistant.AJAXForms.setBeforeSubmissionHandler(functionToCall);Alternative 3:        The called functionUsing any of these approaches, the context will the form that it was called on, i.e. &quot;this&quot; in that function will be the form element which was posted.</p>
 summary : <p>This project consists of a number of Eclipse plug-ins which allows the exploring of a Photoshop Elements catalog. </p>

<p>Here&#39;s an early screenshot ...  </p>

<p>See the wiki for more details.</p>

 title : The clearbox-wordpress-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This plugin includes the ClearBox JS 2.0 by Krupa György into WordPress. Used to overlay images on the current page. Package contains Hungarian, English and Polish translations. Plugin based on Lightbox 2 Wordpress Plugin by Peppe Argento. </p>

If you want to add automatically the clearbox effect, open clearbox-js.php, find: //function clearbox_create($content) {
<br/>//return preg_replace(&#39;/&#39;, $content);
<br/>//}
<br/>//add_filter(&#39;the_content&#39;, &#39;clearbox_create&#39;, 2);and replace with: 
<br/>function clearbox_create($content) {
<br/>return preg_replace(&#39;/&#39;, $content);
<br/>}
<br/>add_filter(&#39;the_content&#39;, &#39;clearbox_create&#39;, 2);Avai</p>
 summary : <p>Clips Eclipse (3.2 and above) plug-inUpdate Sitehttp://clipseclipseplugin.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ClipsUpdateSite/ </p>

<p>DescriptionThis plug-in supports cut/copy/paste and management of multiple snippets of text. </p>

<p>Commands Copy text selected in text editor as a clip Alt+Shift+X Alt+Shift+C Cut text selected in text editor as a clip Alt+Shift+X Alt+Shift+X Copy Clipboard text content as a clip Alt+Shift+X Alt+Shift+B Paste clip in active text editor Alt+Shift+X Alt+Shift+V. The pasted text is left selected. If this command is invoked again within ~1 sec the successive clips are pasted. Paste clip from a popup Rotate Clips Up Alt+Shift+X Alt+Shift+9 Rotate Clips Down Alt+Shift+X Alt+Shift+0 Clips Popup  </p>

<p>Clips View Supports filtering of clips using wildcards  </p>

<p>Clips View Actions Paste If there is no selection the first clip is pasted. If this action is invoked again within ~1 sec the successive clips are pasted. If there is (multiple) selection, the selected clip(s) are pasted. Rotate Clips Up Rotate Clips Down Move Clip Up Move Clip Down Edit clip Remove selected clips Remove All clips Clips preferences page Automatically create clips after Cut or Copy commands Number of clips to store</p>

 title : The cmd-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Command prompt plugin for Eclipse., </p>
 summary : <p>Right click on any symbol in the editor to search Google Code Search or a custom service. Search results show up in a tree within the IDE, grouped by language, project and file Double-click a result to download it and open it in IntelliJ. Install it now!</p>

<p>  Open the Settings window in IntelliJ 6.     Open the Plugins settings.     Select the Available tab to list available plugins.     Right click on Code Search and select Download and Install. The plugin will be available next time IntelliJ is started.  </p>

<p>Using the Code Search Plugin</p>

<p>  Right click any term in the editor and select Code Search to search for it. The shortcut for this is CTRL+SHIFT+G.     A preflight dialog allows you to tweak your search. All fields are  regular expressions.     Each search opens a results panel. Double-click a result to open it.     If you have a copy of a result in your project, that result will be green. Double-click the result to open your local file. To open the remote file, right click on it.     Combine search results with the Intersect and Union buttons.</p>

 title : The comment-highlighter Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>I have stopped the development of this plugin until further notice. This plugin hasn&#39;t been tested with Wordpress 2.7 so I am not sure how it behaves with that release. </p>

<p>Comment Highlighter is a Wordpress plugin which can be used to add different style classes to comments. There are already plugins/hacks/alterations that adds a style to all comments written by the blog owner, adds a different style to every other comment, etc. This plugin takes it a bit further. </p>

<p>Depending on which rules you set up, then Comment Highlighter can add style to comments based on the email of the author (of the comment), the name or the URL. These styles can furhter more be locked to a specific post ID. </p>

<p>Some samples of what I use this plugin for: </p>

<p> Add a special CSS style to all comments written by myself 
<br/> Add a special CSS style to all comments written by my co-author (read: my wife  ) 
<br/> Add a special CSS style to all comments by a specific person on a specific post 
<br/> Add a special CSS style to all pingbacks 
<br/>There might be other Wordpress plugins that does the same as this one, but I wasn&#39;t able to find any. At least not a single plugin that did everything. </p>

<p> Please take general questions, comments, enhancement requests, etc. to the FAQ or list of issues and I will try to deal with them as soon as possible.</p>

 title : The creole-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The cruisecontrol-eclipse-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Rate this plugin at EclipsePluginCentral </p>

<p>Project GoalsThe goal of this project is to provide a view to cruise control projects within the eclipse workbench. </p>

<p>the Cruise Control Eclipse Plugin integrates monitoring of Cruise Control projects into the Eclipse Workbench.  The plugin provides two views:  </p>

<p>Cruise Control JMX View: It provides information about the build process using the RMI connector.  Cruise Control Rss Feed View: It provides information about the build process using the HTTP Adapter.  </p>

<p>PrerequisitesJDK 5 and higher  Eclipse 3.2 and higher  Cruise Control Installation with RMI connector Download and InstallationDownload either the Cruise Control Eclipse Plugin and copy it to the plugin directory of your eclipse installation or access the update site </p>

<p>Note: Using the Cruise Control JMX View requires to start Cruise Control using the -rmiPort switch.  </p>

<p>Description  The Cruise Control Eclipse Plugin provides two ways of access to cruise control information.  </p>

<p>Using the JMX API with the RMI connector (Cruise Control Jmx View) Using RSS Feeds with the http protocol (Cruise Control Feed View) </p>

<p>The first way is the more powerful since it provides advanced features like forcing a build, pausing or resuming a project. It also gets updates by using the JMX notification mechansim.  </p>

<p>Cruise Control Jmx ViewThis view connects to a cruise control host by using the RMI connector and gathers project information using the JMX API. After setting up projects in the preferences dialog, the view connects to these projects and displays each of the projects with its name as a root in a table tree view. The properties of a project are displayed as child items.  Double clicking a project or one of its properties opens the cruise control web page for the project.  The projects get notified whenever its states have changed.  A status of a project is also displayed as icon before the project name. This view is the recommended one.  </p>

<p>The Cruise Control JMX View only works properly if you start Cruise Control with -rmiPort switch </p>

<p>Note: If the cruise control was down, you have to press refresh to reconnect the plugin to the cruise control connector again. You will notice it when the state doesn&#39;t refresh itself.  </p>

<p>Cruise Control Feed ViewThis view gathers project information by using the RSS feeds provided by cruise control for a project. The feeds for each project are setup using the preferences dialog. For each project the state of the last build is displayed as an icon left from the project name string. As child items the feed entry items are displayed which are actually the recent history of build runs. Double clicking on the feed URL displays the crusie control web page for the project.  This view is useful if you cannot run the crusie control with the -rmiPort switch. </p>

<p>Rate this plugin at EclipsePluginCentral</p>

 title : The eidle Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>prevents your PC from code burn-in. ;-) </p>

<p>Eidle provides a screensaver framework based on the Eclipse Rich Client Framework.  </p>

<p>It can be run stand-alone or be deployed into EclipseRCP-based apps like the EclipseIDE or Notes8 (see screenshots). </p>

<p>Currently, Eidle comes with the following functionality: </p>

<p>picture show (since release 0.1) sliding image tiles (since release 0.1) flashlight over image (since release 0.1) browser (since release 0.1) auto-minesweeper (since release 0.2) </p>

<p>The framework manages the activation of these screens. </p>

<p>You can easily extend the Eidle framework to present your own screens. </p>

<p>The latest version (see download section) provides an installer for Eidle that registers it as a stand-alone windows screensaver (java1.4 or better required). more... </p>

<p>Feedback is highly appreciated. </p>

 title : The farcry-jcfarcryflvplayer Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>DescriptionThe jcFarcryFlvPlayer plugin for FarCry gives you a flash-based video player for your website. </p>

<p>The plugin takes advantage of the JW FLV Media Player (a flash-based audio/video player) to offer your website/web-application users playback of your video and audio content (FLV, MP3, H264, SWF, JPG, PNG and GIF). </p>

<p>Currently there are two rules included in this plugin (both for FLV playback), however it can be used for other format playback (either by extending the rules for more configurable options, or create a new rule (using the existing one as a base example)). </p>

 title : The flex-mojos Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Attention:New project site http://flexmojos.sonatype.org/ </p>

<p>What is flex-mojos?A collection of maven plugins to allow maven to compile, optimize, test and ... Flex SWF, Flex SWC, Air SWF and Air SWC. </p>

<p>The main goal is to provide a full support to all mxmlc/compc options. </p>

<p>Those two projects are great, but I believe I can be a good alternative. I made this choice of create a new project when I tried to compile the Adobe Open Source SDK and figure out that will not be possible with none of these. </p>

<p>Major features: </p>

<p>SWF, SWC, AIR and Flex versions; RSL and caching framework support; Modules support; full cover to MXMLC and COMPC options; flex 3; use FLEX-OEM-COMPILER, means it faster, uses less memory, no need of references to local drive; flex unit support; asdoc support; no set</p>

<p>Example$(document).ready(
<br/>	function(){
<br/>		var chart = $(&quot;#chartArea&quot;).chart();
<br/>		
<br/>		chart.title(&#39;My test chart\nsub title&#39;);
<br/>		
<br/>		chart.width(300).height(200);
<br/>		
<br/>		chart.data(0).x(10,20,30,40,50).y([5,30,20,70,90]).color(&#39;0000ff&#39;);
<br/>		
<br/>		chart.xaxis(0).range(0, 50);
<br/>		
<br/>		chart.yaxis(0).range(0, 110);
<br/>		
<br/>		chart.data(0).label(&#39;Series 1&#39;);
<br/>		
<br/>		chart.data(0).markerType(MarkerType.Circle).markerSize(8).markerColor(&#39;00ff00&#39;);
<br/>		
<br/>		chart.type(ChartType.Line);
<br/>		
<br/>		chart.render();
<br/>	}

 title : The gdata-java-client-eclipse-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Notice:  This project is no longer supported.I recommend using Jeffrey Friedl’s new Lightroom 2.0 Geoencoding plugin.Available here: http://regex.info/blog/lightroom-goodies/gpsThis project installs menu items into the Adobe Lightroom interface that allows photos to be tagged with geographic information through the Lightroom interface.   </p>

<p>Locations are read from the standard GPX file format and exif information is stored in the image files using Phil Harvey&#39;s exiftool. </p>

<p>Make Comments and Suggestions Here </p>

<p>Current Version:Download: Version 0.1.0 </p>

<p>Features:Sync photo to GPS using picture of GPS display Interpolate location between track points Add geotags to original images or save to new location Installation:Copy the entire geotag.lrdevplugin directory to the following location: </p>

<p>(Vista)  C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Adobe\Lightroom\Modules   (XP)  C:\Documents and Settings\username\Application Data\Adobe\Lightroom\Modules   (Mac)  /Library/Application Support/Adobe/Lightroom/Modules  </p>

<p>For Windows users, the exiftool executeable is included with the plugin. </p>

<p>For Mac users, you must also install the Mac exiftool package -&gt; http://www.sno.phy.queensu.ca/~phil/exiftool/ </p>

<p>InstructionsWarning! Make sure you GPX logs have time data recorded, or this plugin won&#39;t work.  Several users have reported that some GPS models and software do not save time data with GPX files by default. </p>

<p>Two new items are added to the File menu: </p>

<p>Geotag Photos Select the photos you want to tag in the main Lightroom interface then choose this menu item.  A dialog is presented that allows you to choose the GPX file for location information and the destination settings. 
<br/>    Sync Photo to GPS This item allows you to match the timestamp of your GPS unit with the timestamp recorded by your camera.  First select a picture of you GPS showing the time in the main Lightroom interface.</p>

 title : The janalyzercode-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>janalyzercode es un plugin para eclipse, que va a permitir analizar estaticamente el codigo de algun proyecto escrito en java, para encontrar errores. </p>

<p>El proyecto es desarrollado por el grupo Akatsuki del curso de Tecnologia de Objetos de la Universidad Nacional de San Agustin de Arequipa - Perú.</p>
 summary : <p>NOTE: The project is fozen due to motivation issues. If you are interested in it (not supporting by any means, but simply using), please, let me know by submitting a bug or any way you like. Thank you for visiting this page </p>

<p>Ever worked with Emfatic? Well, it&#39;s nice but very old. For example, it does not support generics. And the editor is not so good.  But there&#39;s a JDT Java editor which is very powerful, and Emfatic syntax is so much alike Java... Well, I&#39;m working on this project to make Java be a syntax for Ecore. </p>

<p>There&#39;s a set of annotations inside and a simple Eclipse plug-in which just adds a builder that can convert your &quot;special Java&quot; to Ecore. Checkout our wiki for more details: </p>

<p>Overview Update Site URL: http://java2ecore.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/org.abreslav.java2ecore.updatesite/site.xml Eclipse integration Syntax description JavaDoc for Java2Ecore annotations and library classes </p>

<p>Have a look at our blog. </p>

<p>And, please, rate Java2Ecore at EPIC. You comments will help make Java2Ecore better. </p>

<p>Current version (0.3 beta) featuresEClasses, EDataTypes, EEnums EAttributes, EReferences, EOperations Generics Nested packages Imports of exiting Ecore models  From registered packages From GenModels with generated Java code Brief documentation provided directly in the editor (through JavaDoc) See New and noteworthy</p>

 title : The jqmultiselects Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IntroductionjqMultiSelects is a plugin for jQuery which enables the addition of common behaviour to </p>

<p> elements allowing multiple options to be selected. </p>

<p>FeaturesjqMultiSelects enables you to deal purely with the presentation of your </p>

<p> elements, and then use the plugin to attach common behaviours to them. Current features include: Set up double-click transferring of options from one select to another Enable transferring of multiple options via an external element, e.g. , , , etc. Automatic submission of  elements with parent form submission Callbacks to hook into the process Size is 4.4KB or 0.6KB packed </p>

<p>ExampleTo implement, start by creating your </p>

<p> elements: </p>

<p>   Item 1
<br/>   Item 2</p>

<p>move right
<br/>move left</p>

<p>   Item 3
<br/>   Item 4
<br/>Then, to add the Multi-Selects behaviour to these listboxes, simply perform the following (usually in the $(document).ready() event): </p>

<p>$(document).ready(function() {
<br/>   $(&quot;#select_left&quot;).multiSelect(&quot;#select_right&quot;, {trigger: &quot;#options_right&quot;});
<br/>   $(&quot;#select_right&quot;).multiSelect(&quot;#select_left&quot;, {trigger: &quot;#options_left&quot;});
<br/>})ChangelogVersion 0.2  </p>

<p> elements can be automatically selected upon parent form submission  plugin options now passed as an array  all element identifiers now taken as jQuery selectors instead  added beforeMove and afterMove callback functions Version 0.1  initial release </p>

<p>Future DevelopmentCurrently planned additions (roughly in priority order) include: </p>

<p>enable a graceful degradation - e.g. convert a group of checkboxes into 2 multiple selects Add ability to manually order items within a list Investigate  sorting plugins and check integration with transfers is easy </p>

<p>DiscussionI am not often on the jQuery mailing list these days, but I get notified of any activity on this project so if you have any requests, suggestions, bug reports, modifications then please post them in the &#39;issues&#39; section here.</p>
 title : The jquery-aop Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>jQuery plugin to add features of aspect-oriented programming (AOP) to jQuery. </p>

<p>Introduction
<br/>============
<br/>jQuery AOP is a very small plugin that adds AOP features to javascript. It allows to add advices (Before, After, After Throw, After Finally, Around and Introduction) to any global or instance object. </p>

<p>Features
<br/>========
<br/> - Allows to add Before, After, After Throw, After Finally, Around and Introduction advices. 
<br/> - Allows to define point-cuts using regex to match multiple methods. 
<br/> - Works with global function and object methods. 
<br/> - Advices can be removed after being applied. 
<br/> - Just 1091 bytes! (Packed and Gzipped) 
<br/> - Integrated into jQuery.</p>
 summary : <p>NoticejQuery Lightbox has moved to github.com  </p>

<p>I haven&#39;t decided how gracefully make the switch, but i&#39;m going to be doing all future development on github, rather than google code.  Update your bookmarks :)</p>
 title : The jquery-lightbox Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The jqueryselectcombo Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A &#39;Select Combo&#39; is setting the values of a select element based on the user&#39;s choice of the source select element.  As a jQuery plugin, it will create &#39;unobtrusive&#39; javascript to bind a change event to the source select element and retrieve JSON results from your server, placing the results in the target select element.  This has been tested with jQuery 1.2.6. on FF 2 &amp; 3, IE7, Safari.  I hope this works with other browsers, but if it doesn&#39;t please let me know. (There is an error in IE 6.  I&#39;m currently unsure of what to do with the non helpful MS error of: &quot;Could not set the selected property.  Unspecified error&quot;) </p>

<p>This plugin requires jQuery - a most awesome javascript library for AJAX, AHAH, and all that! </p>

<p>See the Demo of the selectCombo plugin </p>

<p>Rob D from down under has posted a demo using a large set of data </p>

<p>9/9/2008 - Bypassed select first object for IE - no more IE 6 error </p>

<p>8/29/2008 - 1.2.5 Release - Fixed bug that only called change for children if the hidetarget had been set. </p>

<p>6/24/2008 - 1.2.4 Release - Fixed functionality when selectCombo is used for multiple select objects.  Will now execute the change event for each of the successive targets on change of the parent. </p>

<p>3/1/2007 - 1.2.3 Release - Changed when the hidetarget was called so that targets aren&#39;t hidden onchange unless there are no values returned for targets </p>

<p>12/15/2007 - 1.2.2 Release - Fixed issue with target not hiding when there are no options in target </p>

<p>8/30/2007 - 1.2.1 Release - removed console.log line that may cause problems in IE </p>

<p>8/22/2007 - 1.2 Release added option to set target options when the page loads (you may have a default value selected in the primary select that you want to &quot;preload&quot; options in your target) </p>

<p>Clearing options of target before calling getJSON (if primary not same as target) so that if no results are returned target reflects no results of selected primary (if you want there to be something loaded as a place holder for the target, have your server return something like: [{oV: &#39;&#39;, oT: &#39;-No Option-&#39;}] </p>

<p>Changed check on hidetarget.  Instead of checking that the primary select has no selected value, will now check that the target has no value.  If hidetarget == true, target will hide onload when no value in target and will hide if no options available on change </p>

<p>5/25/2007 - 1.1 Release added option for indicator display during ajax call, added check that if target ID is the same as the original source, it will override hidetarget setting and not hide target</p>
 title : The jsdoctk-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Introductionjsdoctk-plugin aims simply to create a Mojo around JsDoc Toolkit so that you can run it from within maven. Inside the plugins&#39; jar is a packaged version of JsDoc Toolkit which gets temporarily unpacked into your target directory and is then used to run JsDoc Toolkit on your webapp directory. As a result you can now, easily and without a hassle, create documentation for your javascripts within a maven project... </p>

<p>ProgressA new version based on the JsDoc Toolkit 2.0.1 is finally released. It&#39;s been on ice for quite a while since I had problems during testing months ago and was on the road and busy with work in the weeks since then. Now that I&#39;m back home and needed the plugin to work, I polished it, packaged it and released it for you guys and girls out there to enjoy. </p>

<p>For those not familiar with the changes in 2.x of JsDoc Toolkit I would give you an advance warning, the templates have changed significantly and this may, or may not be to your liking. I have no control over this!!! For this reasons alone I will keep the 1.x versions available for download, but support may grow even weaker than it has been so far ;). </p>

<p>DownloadsFor people new with this plugin I recommend downloading the .zip distribution as I have added a usefull README as well as the &#39;JavaDoc&#39; for the jar with more detailed information. If you&#39;re sure of what you&#39;re doing and just looking for the latest version go ahead and download the .jar, it saves only a little in size though :). </p>

<p>Alternatively, even though this keeps me from being able to track the popularity of this project, you can now specify a repository in your pom.xml like so: </p>

<p>    
<br/>        
<br/>            jsdoctk1
<br/>            http://jsdoctk-plugin.googlecode.com/svn/repo
<br/>        
<br/>    
<br/>    
<br/>        
<br/>            jsdoctk2
<br/>            http://jsdoctk-plugin.googlecode.com/svn/repo
<br/>        
<br/>    ConfigurationInstallation Instructions as well as detailed Configuration Instructions are also available online in case you can&#39;t be bothered downloading the .zip and reading the README contained within, one small warning, I am more likely to keep the README updated rather than the online version, though this mostly means you&#39;ll have to be carefull to use the correct version-numbers in the commands outlined in the instructions...</p>

 title : The json-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This plugin provides simple access to Confluence sites via the JSON format, so you could easy mashup your confluence content anywhere. now only test confluence 2.6 compatibility. </p>

<p>Featurespanel level json format http://HOST/confluence/plugins/json/dashboard.action http://HOST/confluence/plugins/json/space.action?key=SPACEKEY http://HOST/confluence/plugins/json/page.action?pageId=PAGEID http://HOST/confluence/plugins/json/pagechildren.action?pageId=PAGEID http://HOST/confluence/plugins/json/pageinfo.action?pageId=PAGEID http://HOST/confluence/plugins/json/attachments.action?pageId=PAGEID http://HOST/confluence/plugins/json/panel.action?pageId=PAGEID http://HOST/confluence/plugins/json/profile.action?username=USERNAME Usage Examplethis example show use jquery call the panel json array and mashup to divs. </p>

<p>mashup.html </p>

<p>        $(function() {
<br/>            $.getJSON(&quot;http://HOST/confluence/plugins/json/panel.action?pageId=PAGEID&quot;, function(data) {
<br/>                $(&#39;#a).empty();
<br/>                $(&#39;#a&#39;).append(data[0].content);
<br/>                $(&quot;#b&quot;).empty();
<br/>                $(&quot;#b&quot;).append(data[1].content);
<br/>            });
<br/>        });</p>

<p>How to buildsvn co http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/maven-plugins/com.atlassian.maven.plugins/atlassian-pdk/tags/2.1.1/ atlassian-pdk
<br/>cd atlassian-pdk
<br/>mvn install</p>

<p>svn co http://json-plugin.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ json-plugin
<br/>cd json-plugin
<br/>mvn packageyou will get the jar in target directory.</p>

 title : The lilypond-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Lilypond Plugin for DokuwikiIntroductionThis is a plugin to do music typesetting with Lilypond via Dokuwiki. Lilypond is a music typesetter similar to latex (in quality and complexity). Dokuwiki is a very simple to use yet powerful wiki engine. </p>

<p>Lilypond plugin allows to write lilypond code to a wiki page, and let the wiki generate the pdf etc for you. </p>

<p>This enables you to: </p>

<p>share your music with others work on your music with others revision control </p>

<p>The idea is to eventually start a wiki where sheetmusic can be exchanged and developed collaboratively. </p>

<p>Requirementsa working dokuwiki installation lilypond pdfinfo from xpdf-utils (or poppler-utils) svn to get the plugin in the first place Installationcd to dokuwiki/lib/plugins svn checkout http://lilypond-plugin.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ lilypond UsageSimply put something like this (any correct lilypond file) on a wiki page </p>

<p>\relative c&#39; { c4 d e f }
<br/>The page will be saved as reduced png for thumbnails and .pdf and .ly for download. The generated files will be rendered as links. </p>

<p>The filename is (for now) the same as the name of the wikipage (one page for one score). </p>

<p>ConfigurationNone for now. </p>

<p>Technical DetailsThe files are generated with: </p>

<p>/usr/bin/lilypond --png --pdf -dresolution=20 -ddelete-intermediate-files=#t -o .../dokuwiki/data/media/output - </p>

<p>The results show up under: </p>

<p>.../dokuwiki/data/media</p>
 title : The livepress Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Live+Press </p>

<p>Description: </p>

<p>Livepress is a plugin for wordpress which allows the user to automatically crosspost journal entries to a LiveJournal account.   </p>

<p>This fork of the plugin is licensed under GPLv3.  All contributions and suggestions are welcome. </p>

<p>Please report bugs under &quot;Issues&quot; section.  </p>

<p>Current version features list:  </p>

<p>(Tested with Wordpress 2.5.1 and 2.6) cross posting full posts or exerpts with lj_cuts tags cross posting of User Pics, Moods, Music, and Tags choose LJ security level and custom friends lists enable / disable comments on livejournal side include a link back to the original wordpress post (new) cross posts Tags instead of Categories (new) post delete also deletes livejournal post (new) automatic crosspost email and cell phone text and multimedia posts  </p>

<p>Upcoming Version 2.1 features list: (available 9/2008) </p>

<p>plugin reset button bulk deletes (new with wp 2.6) also bulk deletes LJ posts Livepress Extras style changed to match wordpress 2.6 admin theme.  Livepress Admin page style change to match wordpress 2.6 admin theme. (bug fix: Id 1) Overhaul to how Livepress saves login information.  </p>

<p>  Future features wish list: </p>

<p>scheduled post for future publishing will crosspost at the future scheduled time, instead of immediately. ability to choose between syncing tags or categories. ability to disable comments by default, instead of post by post basis. ability to post a link to an entry on Facebook. expand Livepress to sync with other popular sites that use the LiveJournal engine such as InsaneJournal, DeadJournal. expand to sync with MySpace. </p>

<p>Livepress History Lesson: </p>

<p>Livepress was originally written by Jason Goldsmith (Aka: &quot;unteins&quot;) back in 2005.  He maintained the plugin up until 2006.  His last updated version of the plugin, I believe, was 1.99.   </p>

<p>When the plugin ceased to work with newer releases of Wordpress in 2006, it was kept working by &quot;CreepiGurl&quot;.  The last known version of the plugin was 1.99.9, made available in 2006.  Later, information on how to hack the plugin to get it working with WP version 2.2, sometime in 2007, could be found on her site. </p>

<p>Fast forward to 2008: As a fan of the original plugin, I have kept a personal copy updated with changes I wanted and needed.  So with this new project, I hope to keep the plugin alive.   (Because I really don&#39;t like the alternatives!) </p>

<p>Livepress History Lesson Links: </p>

<p>Untein&#39;s LJ site Untein&#39;s Home Site CreepiGurl&#39;s Blog Digsite&#39;s Live+Press 2.0 revival</p>
 title : The ljxp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Livejournal Crossposter (LJXP for short) is a WordPress 2.x plugin, which automatically copies new posts to a specified Livejournal (or Deadjournal or any other LJ-based hosts). Editing and deleting crossposted entries causes the same changes to be made on the Livejournal. </p>

<p>Stay tuned in with our new web-site: http://www.lj-xp.comCOMPATIBILITY: &gt;= Wordpress 2.5.1 (Including Wordpress 2.7!), PHP &gt; 4.3 </p>

<p>INSTALLATION: </p>

<p>Download the latest version from the link on the right Extract the archive into the wp-content/plugins/ folder. A new folder, ljxp, should appear Go to Plugins in the Wordpress Admin Centre and activate Livejournal Crossposter Edit settings under Options entitled &#39;Livejournal&#39; where appropriate</p>

 title : The mercurialidea Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mercurial Plugin for IdeaStatusThe plugin provides a subset of the functionality that you need for working with Mercurial in Idea. </p>

<p>What WorksCurrently the plugin has the following functionality: </p>

<p>Add Delete Commit Revert History Tag Pull Merge- with an external tool Push Move Rename Functionality to come: </p>

<p>Copy Clone Integrated merging Implementation InformationThe plugin is implemented by creating an external process executing the hg executable, and then screen scraping the result. </p>

<p>You can use the hg command line tool in conjunction with Idea. If things look like they are out of sync, then the Refresh File Status function on the Version Control menu will refresh the file status of all files. </p>

<p>Currently merge will call out to an external merge program. I use kdiff3 at this stage. Integrated merging for the plugin is coming... </p>

<p>To InstallFirstly, you must have Mercurial installed. The plugin is tested with Mercurial version 0.9.5 on Windows Vista, built with JDK 1.5.0. You can install the plugin from the Plugin Manager in Idea. </p>

<p>The plugin is developed on IntelliJ IDEA 7.0.3 #7718(It should work as far back as 7065). It will not work on IntelliJ IDEA 6. </p>

<p>Source CodeIn the interested of eating our own dog food, the source code has been moved to a Mercurial repository at FreeHg. To provide a patch, clone this repository, post your issue in the issues database here and include the URL to your repository. Let me know when your changes are ready and I will pull your changes from there and review them. If you do not have a repository that you can expose on the internet, then you can use FreeHg to create one.</p>
 summary : <p>Mippin brings together the broadest range of web content on your mobile phone. </p>

<p>Mippin makes it easy to find your favorites, discover what others are reading and share whatever interests you, wherever you are. </p>

<p>This site has been designed so you, as a developer or blog publisher can get a more from Mippin, through APIs or additional tools which can allow further integration directly into your existing blog. </p>

<p>Making Content look good on Cell PhonesContent which can be easily rendered on any cell phone has been traditionally very difficult. Users have got very frustrated waiting for web pages to load on their phones and then for them to display in a very unfriendly way. Even the iPhone can take more than 60 seconds to load a normal sized web page. Some carriers have introduced transcoder to help render the content in a more suitable format for phones. However, this approach is flawed because the variety of formats on the web make this task often impossible to do well. Mippin took the approach of using RSS feeds from sites as the raw content for rendering on the phone. Mippin then goes much further to ensure the rendering of the content is perfect for every single device. For example photos are scaled to perfectly fill the horizontal dimension of the screen, videos are converted on the fly to the 3gp format commonly used on phones and games are delivered according the phones capabilities. </p>

<p>Mippin has as a product has been active since Oct 2007 and growth in user take-up and available content has been strong. </p>

<p>Mippin is a free service to the consumer and its revenue model is via advertising in its own content. Adverts are not shown in the publishers content without their permission and if they are the publishers can get up to 100% of the advertising revenue. </p>

<p>Mippin APIs allow other sites to access Mippin content and display perfectly on a mobile device </p>

<p>The following links will take you to important further information: </p>

<p>MobilizingaBlog Description of simple to detailed approach to make your mobilized blog and your web blog integrated together. How to configure your apache web server to split mobile and desktop traffic</p>

 summary : <p>MySQL2i is a relatively simple compatibility layer between legacy code in PHP 4 which uses the old ext/mysql extension to the new MySQLi extension in PHP 5. Just include this file at the top of your scripts when you only have MySQLi installed and your ext/mysql code should work just fine.</p>

 title : The nephtalidomassistantplugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Nephtali DOMAssistant plugin allows you to progressively enhance links and forms through use of the DOMAssistant Javascript library with just a few lines of code. </p>

<p>Nephtali&#39;s pages lend to progressive enhancement, as the html fragment for any dynamic region of a page can be retrieved through a RESTful API. </p>

<p>DOMAssistant provides an elegant interface to Javascript capabilities with fast processing. </p>

<p>The code below shows an example of code that wires up the Hijax functionality of the search form: </p>

<p>	$(&quot;#search&quot;).setNephtaliForm({	
<br/>		pipe : &quot;yahooSearchResults&quot;,
<br/>		portGroup : &quot;yahooSearch&quot;,
<br/>		invalidHandler : function(errors){
<br/>			$(&quot;#yahooSearchQ&quot;).setStyle(&quot;background-color&quot;, &quot;#ffcccc&quot;);
<br/>		},
<br/>		responseHandler : function(htmlfrag){
<br/>			$(&quot;#canvas&quot;).replaceContent(htmlfrag);	
<br/>		},
<br/>		onLoading : function(){
<br/>			$(&quot;#canvas&quot;).replaceContent(&quot;</p>
 title : The nest-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This plugin provides excerpt like functions, but renders in origion page and deals with internal link, so support toc macro and correct internal link. </p>

<p>Featuresmulti nest-export in one page render in original(nest-export) page, not in usage(nest) page correct innerlink, support toc macro Usage ExampleSpacce: A/Page: a </p>

<p>{nest-export:name=toc|hidden=true} 
<br/>  {toc:minLevel=2|maxLevel=2}
<br/>{nest-export} </p>

<p>h2.title1
<br/>{nest-export:name=content1}
<br/>content......
<br/>{nest-export}
<br/>h2.title2Spacce: A/Page: b </p>

<p>{nest:pageTitle=a|name=content1|nopanel=true}{nest}</p>

<p>{nest:pageTitle=a|name=toc|nopanel=true}{nest}How to buildsvn co http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/maven-plugins/com.atlassian.maven.plugins/atlassian-pdk/tags/2.1.1/ atlassian-pdk

 title : The pidgin-identica-status Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The pidgin-twitterstatus Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Use your Twitter account as your Pidgin status message.New to 0.4.0Support for updating multiple savedstatuses (For away on idle etc.) Status format changes would be picked up even if there are no updates. Twitter status now writes to a saved status, rather than the main one. Add more debugging information to help debugging any issues Fix print undefined purple status message Fix when no XML data is returned. Use in_reply_to_user_id XML node instead of string parsing, to detect replies. &#39;Advanced option&#39; to set a regular expression, which is tested against the tweet, and discarded if matching (I, for example, set it to #twitter, so that twitter specific tweets are ignored) If the first status is not suitable, go for the second, and so on... If the user changes status after we set it, don&#39;t trash the changes, unless we have a more recent update from Twitter. Only downloads diffs from Twitter from previous update using since_id: Saves bandwidth, and friendlier to Twitter servers. Stricter username checking, just reschedule timer and return instead of die&#39;ing for invalid usernames, so that we can pickup any username changes from preferences. Use an integer for timeout preference, and remove all the string parsing &#39;Advanced option&#39; to set the API root url, instead of http://twitter.com. http://identi.ca/api should work as well, though I haven&#39;t tested that much. (identi.ca support for free, thus!) Minor code cleanups: Use variables where sane instead of hardcoding, version http user agent, use strict and warnings on Perl, fix scopes of various variables. Existing FeaturesUpdate your status as frequently or infrequently as you wish. @ messages can be ignored.</p>
 title : The pidgintex Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Notice 2009-04-12Version 1.1.1 is up. Last version caused all chat sessions to crash, it is now fixed. </p>

<p>Version 1.1.0 is up. It fixes some memory leaks, fixes the nicks in the logs. And there is a new version for windows. For complete list of changes, see the CHANGELOG </p>

<p>Update from any earlier version is highly recommended. </p>

<p>For windows users, there is a newer simplier installation. Remove the old mimetex.bat file, it is no longer in use. Simply put mimetex.exe in C:\Windows\ and the plugin in the plugin folder. Make sure the old plugin dll is removed. </p>

<p>Also make sure to check out the wiki pages for help on mimeTeX and mathTeX installation. </p>

<p>WantedNothing right now. Maybe compiling a 64bit version of the plugin. See issues. </p>

<p>Screenshots</p>

<p> Sending messages on a dark grey GTK-theme.Config menu  </p>

<p>What is itpidginTeX is a fast plugin for the instant messaging client Pidgin and uses mimeTeX or mathTeX to render LaTeX expressions in messages and chat.  It is intended for math but mathTeX is fully compatible with LaTeX and any package can be used and mimeTeX also supports many other features. See Why use pidginTeX below. </p>

<p>RequirementsEither mimeTeX or mathTeX is needed. See links for more information. If you still can&#39;t decide, see the FAQ. </p>

<p>mimeTeXis a small (&lt; 1MB) program with no other dependencies. </p>

<p>mathTeXdepends on latex and dvipng for rendering. </p>

<p>How to useThe syntax is simple, write $$latex expression$$ anywhere in a message and an image will appear in the message log. </p>

<p>Example&quot;Hey John, how do I solve this? $$a x^2 + b x + c = 0$$ ?&quot;
<br/>&quot;Well Bill, you can use this $$x_{1,2} = \frac{-b \pm\sqrt{b^2-4 a c}}{2 a}$$Why use pidginTeX?It is built upon pidgin-LaTeX but with many improvements such as </p>

<p>Much faster render time (less than a second) Transparent images Does not require latex and ImageMagick when using mimeTeX, suitable for system where the user doesn&#39;t want to install alot of software. Many options, such as font size, color, styles The ability to send the rendered images. Usefull when the  reciever doesn&#39;t have  </p>

<p>InstallationWhen compiling from source in Linux </p>

<p>Obtain the pidgin-dev package Check out the a copy from the repository or download the source tarball. $ make install   ( for user ) or $ make install PREFIX=/usr ( all users, change /usr if needed ) Start Pidgin </p>

<p>When downloading the library, place the file in Pidgins plugin directory and restart Pidgin. See further mimeTeXmathTeXHowto on how to compile the required libraries.</p>

 title : The pluto-server-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Eclipse Pluto Server Plug-inTo make developing portlets with Eclipse a little bit easier when using the Pluto bundled with Tomcat, I developed a little server plug-in that will automatically rewrite the web.xml as needed when publishing a portlet web application to the Pluto server on deployment from within Eclipse. This provides a nice lightweight rapid development environment without needing to maintain an additional pluto specific web.xml file. </p>

<p>Tested with Eclipse 3.3 (Europa) and requires WTP 2.0.3+. </p>

<p>NewsJun 22, 2008 - Open sourced on Google Code, released minor version 0.2.5 to reference the new update site Jun 01, 2008 - Added a sample eclipse project, roughly equivalent to the hello world portlet in the screencast demo. Oct 21, 2007 - Added a screencast demo. Sept 13, 2007 - Rel</p>
 summary : <p>The Poll Plugins lets you create simple polls within your wiki pages., </p>
 title : The poll-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>About構成管理SaaSであるPROMA-Cサービスを活用するためのEclipseプラグインです。Java開発を効率化し、プロジェクトを成功に導きます。 </p>

<p>PROMA-Cを利用していなくても、Java開発で利用できる機能を提供しているため、通常の開発に用いることができます。 </p>

<p> </p>

<p>FeatureMaven2のpom.xmlの生成 DownloadEclipseの更新サイトでダウンロード可能です。 </p>

<p>http://proma-c-plugin.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/proma-c-updates/ </p>

<p>手順は以下の通りです。 </p>

<p>Eclipseのメニューで、「Help」→「Software Updates」→「Find and Install...」を選択します。 「Search for new features to install」を選択し、「Next &gt;」ボタンを押下します。 「New Remote Site...」ボタンを押下し、上記の更新サイトを登録します。 ウィザードに従って、インストールを行います。 ※Eclipse3.3、3.4で動作を確認しています。 </p>

 title : The putty-launchy-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Adds completion of saved PuTTY sessions to Launchy. </p>

<p>08/05/08 - PuTTY Plugin v2.2 released! </p>

<p>UPDATES
<br/>The latest version of this software can always be found at:
<br/>http://putty-launchy-plugin.googlecode.com/</p>

<p>USAGE
<br/>Version 2.0+ of PuTTY Plugin for Launchy will work only with v2.0+ of Launchy.</p>

<p>If PuTTY.exe is not in your system PATH, you will need to set the path to PuTTY 
<br/>in the options dialog.  To access the options, right click on the Launchy window 
<br/>and click &quot;Options&quot;.  Next go to the &quot;Plugins&quot; tab and select &quot;PuTTY&quot;.  You can 
<br/>customize and enable/disable many features of this plugin here.</p>

<p>To begin completion, type &quot;ssh&quot; or &quot;putty&quot; followed by tab or space. The plugin 
<br/>will list all of your PuTTY sessions.  After you select a session in Launchy, it 
<br/>will be launched in PuTTY.</p>

<p>If you want to use this plugin in portable mode you will first need PuTTY Tray 
<br/>or portaPuTTY in order to save sessions to a filesystem.  Next set the &quot;Path to 
<br/>PuTTY&quot; in the plugin options dialog to the RELATIVE path from the Launchy 
<br/>directory to the PuTTY executable.  Finally, enable loading sessions from the 
<br/>filesystem in the plugin options dialog.</p>

<p>CHANGELOG
<br/>v2.2
<br/>    New icon in PNG format for compatibility with Launchy 2.1
<br/>    PuTTY configuration dialog now starts when no session is specified</p>

<p>v2.1
<br/>    Added option to run PuTTY maximized
<br/>    Added loading sessions from filesystem
<br/>    Added error message when putty.exe can&#39;t be found</p>

<p>v2.0
<br/>    Now supports Launchy v2.0 (complete rewrite)
<br/>    Added configurable options for just about everything
<br/>    Trigger words can be changed (defaults to &quot;ssh&quot; and &quot;putty&quot;)
<br/>    Sessions can be added directly to index, with no trigger word required</p>

<p>v1.3
<br/>    Parameters not matching a session name will now be treated as a host name
<br/>    Session names containing quote marks now work</p>

<p>v1.2:
<br/>    Removed dependency on VC++ Runtime and .NET CLR
<br/>    Unsupported plugin for x64 systems</p>

<p>v1.1:
<br/>    Added options dialog to set PATH to PuTTY.
<br/>    Added icon.
<br/>v1.0:
<br/>    Initial Release</p>

<p>KNOWN BUGS
<br/>See http://code.google.com/p/putty-launchy-plugin/issues/list</p>

<p>CREDITS
<br/>Author:
<br/>    Matt Cowell
<br/>Portions of this code are part of the Launchy project:
<br/>    http://www.launchy.net
<br/>Portions of this code originated from the PuTTY project:
<br/>    http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/
<br/>The icon is used from the PuTTY Portable project:
<br/>	http://portableapps.com/apps/internet/putty_portable</p>
 title : The python-nosexml Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The main plugin generates a series of SAX-like events that can be custom formatted into an XML document. </p>

<p>The default formatter provides a simple XML document listing each test and its status, any associated traceback information and captured output. </p>

<p>Installation$ easy_install nosexmlI may or may not have gotten everything with cheese shop setup correctly. Feel free to add an issue if something is wonky. </p>

<p>Added Command Line Options</p>

<p>--xml  Enable the plugin. Defaults to disabled   --xml-formatter=XML_FORMATTER  Provide the plugin with the class name that should format the output. Defaults to nosexml.PrettyPrintFormatter   --xml-no-stderr  Disable capturing of stderr. Useful for catching exceptions that get captured but abort the application.</p>
 title : The reorder Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The assymetry in the way ,  (comma)  is used to separate the items in parameter and arguments lists always causes problem when one wants to reorder that list in Java editor.  Is that why Java allows trailing commas in array initializer? ;) may be. </p>

<p>The Reorder plug-in adds the following actions to the Java editor tool bar. </p>

<p>Swap backward (Ctrl+,) Swap forward (Ctrl+.) Basically the actions reorder the: </p>

<p>arguments of a class instance creation invocation arguments of a method invocation parameters of a method declaration members of array initializer and automatically adjust the &#39;,&#39; separator. </p>

<p>For example with caret at | in: </p>

<p> void method(int iii, String |sss, boolean bbb){}  </p>

<p>pressing Ctrl+. (i.e. Control+period) or clicking on Swap forward tool bar button yields: </p>

<p> void method(int iii, boolean bbb, String |sss){}  </p>

<p>or pressing CTRL+, (i.e. Control+comma) or clicking on Swap backward tool bar button with the original source yields: </p>

<p> void method(String |sss, int iii, boolean bbb){}</p>
