 summary : <p>SKOSEd is a plugin for Protege 4 that allows you to create and edit thesauri (or similar artefacts) represented in the Simple Knowledge Organisation System (SKOS).  </p>

<p>SKOS is now a W3C recommendation and users familiar with SKOS will notice that SKOSEd still treats labels as OWL data properties. Luckily, you can create labels as annotations using the standard Protege 4 interface. The developers of Protege 4 are trying to keep Protege 4 and the underlying OWL API inline with the latest OWL 2 specification, which has recently undergone some changes. Work on SKOSEd has been temporarily halted while Protege 4.1 and the underlying OWL API are updated. One of the main advantages these changes will bring is that SKOSEd will allow the creation of sub-annotation properties. The porting of the SKOSEd plugin to Protege 4.1 will take place in September/October 2009. Please e-mail directly if you any queries about this. Simon </p>

<p>Version  Release notes   SKOSEd-1.0-alpha(build04)  Fixed namespace URI bug   SKOSEd-1.0-alpha(build02)  - Updated to use new 20081001 SKOS namespace and semantics  
<br/>- New SKOS preferences (See Protege Preferences menu) Allows you to set the order and language of label rendering  
<br/>- Automatic notification and update of new SKOSEd versions 
<br/>-  All views are now sorted 
<br/>- Additional asserted and inferred views in the Views menu ( NOTE Some of the views have been re-factored, if you have used a previous version of SKOSEd and you get the error message &quot;Can&#39;t load plugin&quot;, select the &quot;Reset selected Tab to the default state&quot; option in the &#39;Tabs&#39; menu   SKOSEd-1.0-alpha(build01)  First Alpha release of SKOSEd. This version uses the old 2004 namespaces  </p>

<p> </p>

<p>This work is supported by the EU Sealife project and CO-ODE.</p>

 title : The spreadshop Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Spreadshop Wordpress PluginThis plugin it&#39;s tested on WordPress 2.3.1Nowadays I&#39;m writing the goPHP5 version 2.0 that will use a slim SOAP client instead of the huge XML parser. </p>

<p>Ok guys I&#39;m sorry. This project is abandoned. If someone wants to join, is welcome. </p>

<p>Spreadshirt is a online gadget service, with it you can easily sell online your personal t-shirts and gadgets with a cool and fast Macromedia Flash creator interface. Items quality seem excelent but prices aren&#39;t so cheap. </p>

<p>This plugin is already quite stable. I have to praise all active users who posted bugs in the forum and helped with developement. </p>

<p>InstallationFirst of all you should register an account at Spreadshirt.net if you&#39;re European, or Spreadshirt.com if you&#39;re American. So you&#39;ll avoid transatlantic shipping Customize your shop settings, and add some cool products to your shop (don&#39;t forget to write down your SHOP ID) Download Spreadshirt plugin for WordPress Extract the spreadshop directory into your FTP wp-content/plugins directory Go to administration panel and visit the plugin page, then activate the Spreadshop plugin Go to Manage » Spreadshop and fill the options as you want. You&#39;ll need the SHOP ID you wrote down before. Once you&#39;ll submit the option page, the plugin will fetch your items data from Spreadshirt website. So remember to submit that form every time you&#39;ll add new products UsageTo get entire the shop embed into your blog, you must push it in a normal page.  Create that page, and give it a pretty title, then fill the content with this string only: </p>

<p>Now save the page and your Spreadshop will just appear online like a sharme. </p>

<p>If you want to embed a single product into a post, or a page, you should use the following code syntax into your posts: </p>

<p>The number must be an existent article id, you can find that number in the URL of details page. </p>

<p>The column separator is optional and size string too, it&#39;s used to force a specific image size: </p>

<p>If you want to show a random product from your shop, you must edit the theme. Probably you&#39;ll want it into the sidebar, so edit sidebar.php and put in this code: </p>

<p>You can manage the size of the random thumbnail. Simply add into parenthesis one of this words between two single or double quotes: small, medium, big, huge.  </p>

<p>Size reference stands in the administration page. You can find it in a drop down list, with pixel dimensions. </p>

<p>UpgradingGo to administration and visit plugins page, then disable Spreadshop plugin Delete from FTP wp-content/plugins/spreadshop directory Follow installation instructions, your options are not lost. You&#39;ll get them back once you re-activate the new version into plugin page. Changelog0.1 An idea was born. 0.2 Admin interface, xml parsing, and page integration. 0.3 Some debugging 1.0 Added support for shops registered in USA (spreadshirt.com) 1.1 DO&#39;H I can&#39;t remember sorry... maybe debugging 1.2 Multi language gettext support. 1.3 Added currency support ($ for US and € for EU), and Italian translation 1.4 Added random article for sidebar 1.5 Added German translation 1.6 Added French translation 1.7 SpreadArticle functionality added 1.8 XML fetching bug solved TranslationsIf you&#39;re good with PoEdit you&#39;ll find the .pot template into the file archive distribution.  </p>

<p>Please contact me and send me your translation. I&#39;ll be pleased to embed it on next releases. </p>

<p>If you&#39;re not yet good, learn how to localize WordPress plugins.</p>
 summary : <p>This plugin can move windows and resize them. It can be used with configurable key presses to squeeze windows but is intended to use the client written for it.</p>
 title : The squeeze-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Hackers Diet plugin for Sport Tracks. Provides functionality to: a) Graph your moving average weight b) Import your daily weight (and other statistics) from www.physicsdiet.com </p>

<p>InstallationSimply download the latest version of the plugin and double-click on the .st2plugin file. This should automatically install the plugin. </p>

<p>UseDisplaying weight graphIf you already have some weight related info stored in your logbook, then you can easily graph this by going to &quot;Select View-&gt;Hackers Diet&quot;. This will then graph your weight and its associated moving average. </p>

<p>Importing weight data from www.physicsdiet.comIf you have been using www.physicsdiet.com to monitor your progress on the physics diet, then this plugin allows you to easily import that data into ST2. To begin with, you will need to fill in the relevant details in the plugin&#39;s settings (Settings -&gt; Plugins -&gt; HD Settings). Once this is done, simply go to &quot;Select View -&gt; Hackers Diet&quot; and then click on &quot;Import from Physics Diet&quot;.  </p>

<p>In order to view the imported data, you will need to restart ST2.</p>
 title : The st2hackersdietplugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Version 1.1.1 released(support eclipse 3.4 now )release note: T4EclipseVersion1_1_1 </p>

<p>Version 1.1 releasedT4EclipseVersion1_1 </p>

<p>introductiont4eclipse is developed when I learn and use swt/eclipse. I develop this tool to make life easier for me as an eclipse plug-in developer. And I believe that this tool will also help you in some way. </p>

<p>Currently, t4eclipse provides the following functions: </p>

<p>list all wizards, preference pages, views,editors,perspectives in current eclipse workbench. provide method to find the java class for the above eclispe components. provide method to  view all swt controls in a view/editor. and you can analysis the above swt contorl by check its field value or invoke a method with no paras. list the java class for each opened  Dialog in eclipse.  list all path id for eclipse main menu, so that you can easily add a menuitem in a special place. </p>

<p>Installationt4eclipse can be used in any eclispe3.2 to eclipse3.4 version on windows and linux platform. (other platform may also works but I can not promise) </p>

<p>update update site at: http://t4eclipse.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/updatesite/eclipse Download the latest eclipse plug-in jar file for t4eclipse and put it to your eclipse plugins directory.    </p>

<p>Note:If you still can not see the t4eclipse menu after you installed it in eclipse. Try to start eclipse with &quot;-clean&quot; parameter.
<br/>Open t4eclipse view by click main menu &quot;t4eclipse--&gt;open/update t4eclise view&quot; or the related toolbar item. (if you open t4eclipse view using standard eclipse way, this menu also need to be clicked in order to fill the data in the view tables.)
<br/>Please look through the flash demo if you encountered an issue in using t4eclipse.
<br/>Since eclipse 3.3 , you can use Shift+Alt+F1 to open the related implementation information, this short has some function of t4eclispe
<br/>:)=== </p>

<p>Demothis flash demo shows everything you need to know how to use t4eclipse.(for version 1.1) </p>

<p>Demo Htmlyou can also download the flash file from the top right corner on this page and play it locally   </p>

<p>Report Errorreport your found bugs and required enhancement at here </p>

<p>Snap Shot </p>

<p>LinksT4Eclipse at www.eclipseplugincentral.com </p>

<p>an article about T4Eclipse at DZone. </p>

<p>Special Thankszeroturnaround&#39;s product JavaRebel offers free license for   open source developers.  </p>

<p>&quot;JavaRebel&quot; is an amazing tool and it saves lot of time on debugging eclipse plug-ins. </p>

 title : The tiles2-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub

 summary : <p>In Rails, caching is one of those things that is made pretty easy, but can also be difficult when you want to do complex tasks with the caching -- such as expiring it. There are two ways with expire_fragment within the logic of your controllers or using an Observers. </p>

<p>This plugin allows caching to be expired on predefined time limit. The idea is that the caching takes cared of the expiration instead of writing conditions in the controller. I understand that it goes against the idea of why the caching mechanism does not have them now. </p>

<p>To the plugin. Its an extension of cache method that has logic for the time limit. The method to use within views is called cache_timeout. The first argument of the method is the regular Hash/String of the cache key and the second argument is the timeout value (being a Time class value). </p>

<p>Example usage: </p>

<p># This is last 5 minutes of posts from our forums:   </p>

<p>&lt;%cache_timeout(&#39;forum_listing&#39;,5.minutes.from_now) do %&gt;   
<br/>   
<br/>&lt;% for post in @posts %&gt;   
<br/>&lt;%=post.title%&gt; - by &lt;%=post.author.username%&gt; at &lt;%=post.created_at&gt;Unknown end tag for </p>

<p>   
<br/>&lt;%end%&gt;   
<br/>   
<br/>&lt;%end%&gt; </p>

<p>To enforce the timeout cache value within the controller don&#39;t use the read_fragment method -- unless really needed. The method that is provided to check that the timeout value has is expired is is_cache_expired?. The method takes the argument of the cache key. </p>

<p>Example Usage within controller: </p>

<p>def list </p>

<p>if is_cache_expired?(&#39;forum_listing&#39;) 
<br/>@posts = Post.find(:all) 
<br/>end 
<br/>end</p>
 title : The timedcachedfragment Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The tinymce-plugin-advimagescale Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>When developing a custom CMS with TinyMCE for a company project, I found that scaling/resizing an image in the TinyMCE editor allows stretching/skewing an image in a way that distorts image aspect ratio.  Finding this to be an odd &#39;default&#39; behavior, I developed this plugin.  </p>

<p>The default behavior of tinymce-plugin-advimagescale solves the problem by: </p>

<p>Maintaining aspect ratio on image scaling by watching for image resize events and preserving the &quot;most changed&quot; dimension and adjusting the other to maintain aspect ratio Working around browser bugs in the UI that make resizing problematic. </p>

<p>Optional features include: </p>

<p>Enforce a minimum/maximum image dimensions Append width and height dimensions to the  src path to allow a dynamic server-side script to perform automatic resampling on the image (i.e. via imagemagick or GD2) (for example, a URL such as http://www.mydomain.com/picture.php?id=123 would be changed to http://www.mydomain.com/picture.php?id=123&amp;w=200&amp;h=400 to indicate an image scaled to 200x400) Callbacks for image events including loading, loaded and resize events - this allows you to build your own custom handling for image events in the editor and access image properties. </p>

<p>Soruce is available for check-out via SVN.  There are no zipped downloads for this plugin - simply check-out the source via SVN or download via the code browser. See the Usage page for full instructions. </p>

<p>Tested only IE7, IE8 and Firefox 3 on Windows Vista &amp; Windows 7.  Google Chrome/Webkit (and therefore Safari as well) do not presently support image scaling in designMode, so this plugin does not apply).  Patches are welcome. </p>

<p>If you find a bug, please submit it using the issue tracker tab (above). </p>

<p>REQUIRES TINYMCE VERSION 3 OR BETTER</p>

 summary : <p>A rails plugin that marks up user input and inserts auto-typography </p>

<p>script/plugin install http://usertext.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/usertext -x </p>

<p>(this way, changes to the plugin will automatically be applied to your project when you do an svn update.</p>

 title : The wordpress-geo-mashup Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This plugin lets you save location information with posts, pages, and other WordPress objects.  These objects can then be presented on interactive Google maps in many ways. </p>

<p>There are often two versions of the plugin available, stable and BETA. The BETA version includes all the stable version features, and also new features that need further testing. </p>

<p>FeaturesGeo Mashup, like WordPress, has a simple interface for basic features, templates for control of output, and APIs for endless customization options.  Some popular features are: </p>

<p>Once you have a Google Maps API key, you&#39;re ready to put maps just about anywhere in your blog. Global maps can present your posts in many ways They can show just one category, for example Context-sensitive template maps show the markers of currently displayed posts Clicking on a post marker shows a customizable summary of the post or page in an info window Location can be saved for posts, pages, users, and comments Location can also be embedded in post content for mobile blogging Support for both standard WordPress shortcodes and template tags to add maps to your site. Reverse geocoding to fill in address information for locations GeoRSS automatically added to feeds Attach KML files to posts and pages Connect category markers with a colored line Many more enhancements implemented and underway. </p>

<p>TranslationsGerman by Thomas Morvay added in version 1.3.2 Italian by Stefan Des added in version 1.2.9 Belorussian by FatCow added in version 1.2.8 French added in version 1.1 Please contact the author if you&#39;d like to add or update a translation. </p>

<p>Mashup IngredientsGeo Mashup combines WordPress, Google Maps, and GeoNames to create a GeoCMS that puts you in control of all your content, including geographic data. </p>

<p>The FutureI would like to make WordPress a first-class GeoCMS, and also make working with maps in your blog as easy as working with images. </p>

<p>Geo Mashup endures because it supplies me with customization work. If you are a developer interested in this kind of work, contact me. More of us can make Geo Mashup better, which will in turn supply us with more work. </p>

<p>Donations have also encouraged me keep developing - thanks to those who have donated.</p>
 summary : <p>Descriptionwp-ajax-newsletter is a Wordpress plugin that allows users to subscribe and receive a newsletter containing the blog latest posts. </p>

<p>FeaturesCurrently, it supports sending a newsletter:  </p>

<p>Automatically after a specified amount of posts are published On a monthly or weekly basis Manually from the back-office </p>

<p>Users subscribe to the newsletter in the front-office, using an Ajax component, and are not required to be registered. Subscriptions must be validated either by an administrator, in the back-office, or by using a link provided in the confirmation email. Additionally, users can also unsubscribe using a quick link. </p>

<p>In the back-office, the newsletter can be customized with a header, footer, subject, and with a template for displaying posts (with real-time preview). The list of subscribers is also available with some basic functionality: activate and delete. </p>

<p>RequirementsWordpress 2.0x or 2.1 MySQL version 4.1 or greater Javascript enabled</p>

 title : The wp2pownce Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The wpng-calendar Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OverviewThe Wordpress Google calendar plugin allows for the integration of a Google calendar into a Wordpress blog.  </p>

<p>We are currently at release 0.8.5. You can download it at the right ===&gt;. </p>

<p>For release notes, please see the change log. </p>

<p>InstallationThis section describes how to install the plugin and get it working. </p>

<p>Request Google GDATA API key (see link below) Upload the contents of the ZIP file to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory Activate the plugin through the Plugins menu Configure your GDATA API key in the plugin options panel Configure a Google calendar in the plugin options panel Configure the option to render the description field as Wiki markup Create a page and add the &#39;show-wpng-calendar&#39; custom field with the number of weeks you want to be displayed Add the widget to your sidebar and configure the title and number of events to display The plugin-in requires a valid Google GDATA API key. Only one calendar can be associated with the plug-in (want more?, request an enhancement). </p>

<p>NOTE: The API key must correspond to your domain URL. Read this snippet from the Google API site for more information: </p>

<p>A key is associated with a website. If you want to use the JavaScript client library on another site, you should obtain another key for that site. More specifically, a key is associated with the URL that you enter on the signup page; the key applies to all URLs under the domain or directory that you specify. </p>

<p>NOTE: It is also important to note that you must use the full version of the Google calendar. By default, the address to the calendar will point to the basic format. Change basic to full in the URL in order to have the plugin work correctly. </p>

<p>Displaying The CalendarCalendar data can be displayed in three ways: </p>

<p>As a widget in the sidebarThe simplest way to incorporate the calendar is to use the WPNG Calendar widget. The widget is installed as a part of the plugin-in, so you already have it. Use this widget like any other widget, drag-n-drop it into the sidebar where you want the calendar to appear.  </p>

<p>Once the widget is there, you can customize the Title shown in the sidebar and the number of events that are displayed. Access these values in the widget&#39;s options panel. </p>

<p>As a pageCalendar data can also be embedded within a Page. The page will initially list data starting with the current date. The amount of data shown in the page will depend on the value you enter in the custom fields&#39; value box. At the bottom of the page, links  will be displayed to allow the user to navigate to the next interval of data. To embed a calendar into a page, follow these steps: </p>

<p>Create a page, give it any title you desire Add the following as a custom field: show-wpng-calendar In the value field enter the number of weeks of data you wish to display at one time Uncheck &quot;Allow Comments&quot; in the Discussion settings for the page Displaying an eventWhether clicked from the side bar or from a page, each event can be displayed within its own modal DIV. The event view will show all details that are available from the Google calendar for that particular calendar entry. As an option, you can choose to render the description field of an event using wiki markup. The markup syntax is similar to most common wiki markup languages. For more information, see the Wiki formatting page. </p>

<p>FormattingWe made every attempt to make the calendar integrate with themes as much as possible. If you do have a need to edit the style of event lists or the ThickBox dialog, you can use the following: </p>

<p>wpng-calendar/css/style.css wpng-calendar/css/thickbox.css You can update the size of the modal, but alter this line in the functions.js: </p>

<p>/* add the div to my modified ThickBox function */
<br/>tb_show_inner(&quot;&quot;,entryDiv.innerHTML,&quot;height=500&amp;width=500&quot;);ScreenshotsCalendar In A Page &amp; As A Widget </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Displaying An Event </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Plugin Configuration </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Widget Configuration </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Special ThanksThis is our first plug-in and required a lot of Google time. A few articles and sites really helped to get this going. We would like to point out those brave individuals who blazed the Wordpress plug-in trail long before us: </p>

<p>Creating A Plug-InRonald Huereca - http://www.devlounge.net/extras/how-to-write-a-wordpress-plugin </p>

<p>Creating A WidgetMason Wolf - http://hiremasonwolf.com/plugin-to-widget/36 </p>

<p>Date Maniuplation MagicThe Coolite Crew - http://www.datejs.com </p>

<p>Wiki Rendering With JavaScriptStefan Goessner - http://goessner.net/articles/wiky/ </p>

<p>ThickboxCody Lindley - http://jquery.com/demo/thickbox/</p>

 title : The xmi-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A maven plugin to generate an UML dependency model (in XMI) from the dependencies of a maven project. </p>

<p>InstallationFor now you have to check out the code in order to use the plugin. You&#39;ll obviously also require a working maven installation. </p>

<p>checkout the code from subversion svn checkout http://xmi-plugin.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ xmi-plugin 
<br/>install the xmi-plugin in your local maven repository In the checkout directory, run mvn install 
<br/>use the plugin on your maven project Run mvn xmi:xmi in a directory where there is a maven pom.xml file. The resulting xmi model will be generated in the target directory of your project, with the name ${artifactid}-${version}.xmi 
<br/>open the xmi model in your favourite xmi tool (e.g. Magic Draw)</p>
 summary : <p>A configuration to assist editing xml2rfc-format documents using XMLMind XML Editor. </p>

<p>See Installation for how to install.  Super-brief installation instructions: drag the .xxe_addon file from the right column of this page to your addon preferences and use the xxe addon manager. </p>

<p>Make sure you download and install XMLMind XML Editor first.  This configuration works with both Personal and Professional editions.  Some features (e.g., format using XSLT) only work with Professional edition. </p>

<p>This is a WYSIKN (What You See Is Kinda Neat) addon for the very configurable XMLMind XML Editor (“xxe”). The personal version of xxe is free and very capable. It&#39;s also written in java, so one addon works on many platforms (I&#39;ve tested it on MacOS, Windows 2000 and FreeBSD). </p>

<p>The addon is capable of graphical editing of sections, anchors, lists, cross-references, etc. and allows word processor-like behavior of &quot;enter&quot; to create a new paragraph or list item. It can use a locally-installed xml2rfc to format the document for preview or conversion, or use xxe&#39;s built-in XSL transform or submit the document to the xml.resource.org web form. It provides easy hooks to validate the references to other IETF documents in your document to make sure they&#39;re up to date.</p>

 summary : <p>Contributors: iroybot

<br/>Stable Version: -DescriptionIntegrates XStandard Editor into WordPress. XStandard is a standards-compliant, flexible and highly customizable WYSIWYG-solution. It ensures, the that your markup validates against XHTML 1.0 Strict and XHTML 1.1 specifications. Configure your WYSIWYGs on the XStandard Options Page (if you enable this feature, users can customize their WYSIWYG settings in their Profile Page or on a per post basis. By Erik Pöhler. </p>

For example by providing something useful like a microformats plugin-addon, or a more-button. However, the downside is that only people with this tool installed are able to fully make use of applying new xstandard privileges to single users, user groups and roles. If I would code a solution for this on my own it would be an hilarious amount of work... high priority: There are many risky scenarios where the inserted content is not what it should be. (verify the encoding. twice. important task.) disabling wpautop makes sense in many ways (performance, making sure valid xhtml doesn&#39;t get messed up with all those regex guessing), but what happens with published posts? We need a test here. A flag/meta field or something that tells WordPress if a post has been published with XStandard (thus it IS XHTML and doesn&#39;t need that filters that tinkerMCE obviously needs so much) normal priority:Beautify the folder structure.  title : The bsdz-perl Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A home for various Perl projects. </p>

<p>Tie::iCalTie::iCal makes working with RFC 2445 iCalendar files as easy as dealing with hashes in Perl. </p>

<p>It can greatly simplify merging, parsing and manipulating several iCalendar files all at once. </p>

<p>Simple structure - Intuitive mapping between iCalendar components, names, parameters and properties and Perl data structure.  Complete Support - Near complete RFC 2445 support by concentrating mostly on the iCalendar file format.  Pure Perl - Available on all platforms where a Perl port exists.  Win32::GUI::XMLBuilderWin32::GUI::XMLBuilder or WGX is a way to build simple Win32 GUI interfaces in Perl while keeping the visual design separate from the inner workings of the code. </p>

<p>WGX makes it easy to add a Win32 user interface to whatever script or module you’re writing. </p>

<p>XML Based GUI Creation - Keeping your GUI structure in XML format is easier to grasp than needing to maintain a linear list of commands to construct each element. Dynamic Auto-resizing - Writing simple Win32::GUI applications can be annoying having to manually write widget and child resizing routines, WGX deals with this automatically but keeping track of your widgets and fitting them to their parents. One can still override the defaults if required. Embeded Perl Events - Win32::GUI NEM events allow you to specify a widget and attach a callback or event routine at the same time. Extended Widget Set - WGX provides some additional widgets that augment Win32::GUI such as WGXSplitter, WGXPanel and WGXMenu. Read an Introduction that was published in The Perl Journal.</p>

 title : The chinese-perl-book Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>GoalsThe goals of the Cloud Perl project are </p>

<p>to bring together the community of people who use Perl for Cloud Computing to think of and implement better ways to use Perl for Cloud Computing to provide support for people who want to use Perl for Cloud Computing </p>

<p>Get InvolvedAnyone who is interested in following the discussion should sign up on the mailing lists. Please sign up on the Cloud Perl mailing list, regarding anything having to do with Cloud Computing in Perl. Please also sign up for any of the mailing lists devoted to specific Cloud Computing technologies. the Perl-AppEngine mailing list supports the Perl-AppEngine project to get Perl supported as a language on Google App Engine. Start discussing your ideas of how to move this project forward. Ideas can be floated on the mailing list. However, to make meaningful progress on an idea, it should be documented on the wiki. Discussion on the mailing list will be centered around updating those documented ideas. When ideas mature, they should definitely be documented on the wiki on this project site. Project Status2008-06-20 - This project is just starting up. Help us get the word out. Overview&quot;Cloud Computing&quot; has arisen as a powerful new computing paradigm (1). Many people are doing things in Perl that relate to this, and this project offers a place for people to discuss the topic and share knowledge. </p>

<p>If you are actively working in Cloud Computing with Perl (on any reasonable cloud computing platform, such as EC2, CloudDB, Hypertable, etc.) or are interested in it, please sign up for the cloud-perl mailing list. </p>

<p>(1) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloud_computing - Definition of Cloud Computing (2) http://code.google.com/appengine/docs/whatisgoogleappengine.html - Google AppEngine (3) http://www.amazon.com/gp/browse.html?node=201590011 - Amazon EC3 service (4) http://cloudcomputing.qrimp.com/portal.aspx - Cloud Portal</p>
 title : The cloud-perl Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Please see the main Continuity website at http://continuity.tlt42.org/</p>

<p>At its core the web uses the stateless HTTP protocol. In a CGI setting, this effectively means that your program is re-started during each instance of user input, losing all current variable values and other program state information. Most applications combat this by keeping track of the current application state in GET, POST, and session variables, effectively implementing an ad-hoc State Machine.</p>

<p>Continuity uses a programming concept called continuations to make HTTP seem like a statefull protocol instead of stateless protocol. This technique is increasingly called creating a Continuation Server. Continuity is a suite of libraries (not a framework) for building a highly structured web-based interface for your application, without using ad-hoc state management. Continuity is Free Software, distributed under the same terms as Perl itself.</p>
 title : The continuity-perl Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The google-checkout-perl-sample-code Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IntroductionThis project is about using Perl to interact with the Google Checkout payment system.  It provides a set of Perl modules which allows you to checkout, send commands,  wait and process notifications. </p>

<p>DetailsThe code is written entirely in Perl which means no compiler is required for installation. The interface is in OO and the objective is to hide all the complexcity of the checkout flow from the users. There are ~43 modules in the whole code base but you will only need to use just a few. Please refer to the &#39;examples&#39; directory for examples to post a cart, send command as well as process notifications. The structure of the code base tree is base on the following: </p>

<p>lib/
<br/>  Google/
<br/>    Checkout/
<br/>      Command/</p>
 title : The itunes-perl Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Allows control of iTunes for Windows via a command line.  It provides all basic media controls such as play, pause, stop, next/previous track, and volume adjustment.  In addition, you can search for tracks in any given playlist and perform operations on them, or retrieve information regarding them.  title : The perl-filter-eof Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This module utilises Perl&#39;s source filters to provide you with a mechanism to run some code after a file using your module has been processed. This is especially useful for post-compiletime cleanups. </p>

<p>As an example: </p>

<p>  package MyPackage;
<br/>  use warnings;
<br/>  use strict;</p>

<p>  use Filter::EOF;</p>

<p>  sub import {
<br/>      my ($class, @args) = @_;
<br/>      my $caller = scalar caller;</p>

<p>      # set the COMPILE_TIME package var to a false value
<br/>      # when the file was compiled
<br/>      Filter::EOF-&gt;on_eof_call(sub {
<br/>          no strict &#39;refs&#39;;
<br/>          ${ $caller . &#39;::COMPILE_TIME&#39; } = 0;
<br/>      });</p>

<p>      # set the COMPILE_TIME package var to a true value when
<br/>      # we start compiling it.
<br/>      {   no strict &#39;refs&#39;;
<br/>          ${ $caller . &#39;::COMPILE_TIME&#39; } = 1;
<br/>      }
<br/>  }</p>

<p>  1;
<br/>  ...</p>

<p>  package MyUsingPackage;
<br/>  use warnings;
<br/>  use strict;</p>

<p>  our $COMPILE_TIME;
<br/>  use MyPackage;</p>

<p>  # prints &#39;yes&#39;
<br/>  BEGIN { print +( $COMPILE_TIME ? &#39;yes&#39; : &#39;no&#39; ), &quot;\n&quot; }</p>

<p>  # prints &#39;no&#39;
<br/>  print +( $COMPILE_TIME ? &#39;yes&#39; : &#39;no&#39; ), &quot;\n&quot;;</p>

<p>  1;</p>

<p>Copyright (c) 2002-2006 Cunningham &amp; Cunningham, Inc. </p>

<p>Footnotes: </p>

<p>(1) &quot;Don&#39;t be seduced by generalized html/xml parsers. This one has unique features. Make it work. Consider replacing it only after you&#39;ve used this one a while.&quot; </p>

<p>http://fit.c2.com/wiki.cgi?TipsForCoreImplementors</p>

 title : The perl-mobile-wurfl Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mobile::Wurfl is a perl module that provides an interface to mobile device information represented in wurfl (http://wurfl.sourceforge.net/). The Mobile::Wurfl module works by saving this device information in a database (preferably mysql).</p>

<p>It offers an interface to create the relevant database tables from a SQL file containing &quot;CREATE TABLE&quot; statements (a sample is provided with the distribution). It also provides a method for updating the data in the database from the wurfl.xml file hosted at http://www.nusho.it/wurfl/dl.php?t=d&amp;f=wurfl.xml.</p>

<p>It provides methods to query the database for lists of capabilities, and groups of capabilities. It also provides a method for generating a &quot;canonical&quot; user agent string (see &quot;canonical_ua&quot;).</p>

<p>Finally, it provides a method for looking up values for particular capability / user agent combinations. By default, this makes use of the hierarchical &quot;fallback&quot; structure of wurfl to lookup capabilities fallback devices if these capabilities are not defined for the requested device.</p>
 summary : <p>Most MySQL drivers (and database drivers in general) are synchronous, i.e. the execution of a script is blocked until having connected to the database or having obtained the result of a query. This is often unacceptable for highload services, since one probably wants the script do something useful while MySQL server is executing a long query. So perl-mysql-async is developed to make asynchronous requests to the server: a script submits a query, specifies a callback for the result and continues executing in the libevent loop; when the result of the query is completely read from the server, the specified callback is called with the result as a parameter.  </p>

<p>New versions of MySQL 4.1 protocol and newer versions are supported.</p>
 title : The perl-mysql-async Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The perl-net-bittorrent Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project is an attempt to port the popular BitTorrent system to Perl., </p>
 title : The perl-net-epp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IntroductionEPP is the Extensible Provisioning Protocol. EPP (defined in RFC 4930) is an application layer client-server protocol for the provisioning and management of objects stored in a shared central repository. Specified in XML, the protocol defines generic object management operations and an extensible framework that maps protocol operations to objects. As of writing, its only well-developed application is the provisioning of Internet domain names, hosts, and related contact details. </p>

<p>This project offers a number of Perl modules which implement various EPP-related functions: </p>

<p>a low level protocol implementation (Net::EPP::Protocol) a low-level client (Net::EPP::Client) a high-level client (Net::EPP::Simple) an EPP frame builder (Net::EPP::Frame) an EPP proxy server (Net::EPP::Proxy) a utility library to export EPP responde codes (Net::EPP::ResponseCodes) These modules were originally created and maintained by CentralNic for use by their own registrars, but since their original release have become widely used by registrars and registries of all kinds. </p>

<p>CentralNic has chosen to create this project to allow interested third parties to contribute to the development of these libraries, and to guarantee their long-term stability and maintenance. </p>

<p>PreppiPreppi is a graphical EPP client written in Perl. It uses the modules listed above as well as the GTK and GNOME bindings for Perl. For more information about Preppi, click here. </p>

<p>DownloadsThe Net::EPP modules are distributed via CPAN in a single package to allow for easy installation. To install the package, simply use the cpan command: </p>

<p># cpan -i Net::EPPDocumentationThe CPAN search site automatically generates documentation for these modules from the inline POD documentation - click on the module names above to view the documentation for each module. </p>

<p>ContributingIf you would like to contribute to the maintenance and development of these modules, please get in touch.</p>

 title : The perl-path-class Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Path::Class is a module for manipulation of file and directory specifications (strings describing their locations, like &#39;/home/ken/foo.txt&#39; or &#39;C:\Windows\Foo.txt&#39;) in a cross-platform manner.  It supports pretty much every platform Perl runs on, including Unix, Windows, Mac, VMS, Epoc, Cygwin, OS/2, and NetWare. </p>

<p>The well-known module File::Spec also provides this service, but it&#39;s sort of awkward to use well, so people sometimes avoid it, or use it in a way that won&#39;t actually work properly on platforms significantly different than the ones they&#39;ve tested their code on.</p>

 title : The perl-text-widont Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Collins English Dictionary defines a &#39;widow&#39; in typesetting as: </p>

<p>A short line at the end of a paragraph, especially one that occurs as the top line of a page or column. 
<br/>For example, in the text... </p>

<p>    How much wood could a woodchuck
<br/>    chuck if a woodchuck could chuck
<br/>    wood?...the word &#39;wood&#39; at the end is considered a widow. Using Text::Widont, that sentence would instead appear as... </p>

<p>    How much wood could a woodchuck
<br/>    chuck if a woodchuck could
<br/>    chuck wood?</p>

 title : The perlsitemapgenerator Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Perl Sitemap Generator is a Perl script that creates a Sitemap for your site using the Sitemap Protocol. This script can create Sitemaps from URL lists, web server directories, access logs, or from other sitemaps. </p>

<p>This tool is a translation of Google Sitemap Generator from python to perl. </p>

<p>In order to use this script: </p>

<p>You must be able to connect to and run scripts on your web server. Your web server must have Perl 5.8.0 or later installed. You must know the directory path to your site. If your web server hosts one site, this may be a path such as var/www/html. If you have a virtual server that hosts multiple sites, this may be a path such as home/virtual/site1/fst/var/www/html. You must be able to upload files to your web server (for instance, using FTP). If you will be generating a list of URLs based on access logs, you must know the encoding used for those logs and the complete path to them. </p>

<p>If you aren&#39;t sure about any of this, you can check with your web hosting company. </p>

<p>Now you’re ready to get started. Here’s an overview of what you’ll need to do. </p>

<p> Download the Sitemap Generator program files. Extract the files to a local directory.  Create a configuration file for your site using the provided example_config.xml file as a template. Modify this file as needed for your site and save it.  Upload the necessary files to your web server.  Run sitemap_gen.pl.  Add the generated Sitemap to your Google webmaster tools account.  Set up a recurring script. (optional) If you are unable to use the Sitemap Generator, you can add a Sitemap to your Google webmaster tools account in another format, such as a simple text file. You can also find links to third-party programs that support Google Sitemaps here.</p>

 title : The calvis Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Calendar Visualization (CalVis) is designed to provide an easy and customizable user interface (UI) to present data from Google Calendar account. CalVis draws data directly from your Google Calendar account via the Google Calendar Data API. It makes use of the Google Data JavaScript client library underneath to communciate with Google Calendar, and is designed to maximize flexibility in customization.  </p>

<p>CalVis is designed to spare developers from having to re-create the rich calendar UI experience. The developers can use it as customizable template container to overlay Google Calendar data. Developers can use CalVis to render calendar data and to achieve a deep level of customized integration with their sites. As you will learn, an interface that is built on top of CalVis is completely customizable through JavaScript, HTML and CSS. Developers would be able to quickly and easily deploy a customized calendar interface with a set of essential calendar control components to render calendar data.  </p>

<p>Read this article to learn how to use CalVis. Screen captures of demo: </p>

<p> </p>

<p> </p>

<p> added 10/14/08  A well-written japanese tutorial article on CalVis can be found here -  </p>

 title : The google-calendar-widget Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Google Calendar Dashboard WidgetKeep an eye on today&#39;s events on your desktop. With this dashboard widget, you don&#39;t need to logon to Google Calendar in a dedicated browser window. Clicking on an event takes you directly to the event in Google Calendar, ready for you to edit. </p>

<p>Screenshots  </p>

<p>Instructions for InstallationMac OS X 10.4 Tiger is required. If you&#39;re using Safari, click the download link. When the widget download is complete, show Dashboard, click the Plus sign to display the Widget Bar and click the widget&#39;s icon in the Widget Bar to open it. If you&#39;re using a browser other than Safari, click the download link. When the widget download is complete, unarchive it and place it in /Library/Widgets/ in your home folder. show Dashboard, click the Plus sign to display the Widget  Bar and click the widget&#39;s icon in the Widget Bar to open it. </p>

<p>Comments, Suggestions, FeedbackYour comments, suggestions, and bug reports are appreciated! Please send comments to me via email, and post issues to the issue tracking database. You can locate the current version number of the widget as specified at LocateVersionNumber. </p>

<p>LicenseThe source code of this widget is licensed as GPL; you are free to modify and redistribute the widget, provided complete attribution and version history is kept intact. </p>

 title : The googlecalendarsync Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Overviewgooglecalendarsync is a tool written in python to bidirectional synchronize a local iCal (.ics) file with Google Calendar </p>

<p>Requirementspython-vobject - for local iCal file management python-gdata - for remote Google Calendar management python-httplib2 - for remote iCal retrieval InstallDownload the latest release here, Extract the source tarball googlecalendarsync-x.y.tar.gz, Run python setup.py build to make, Run sudo python setup.py install to install. How to use googlecalendarsyncCreate a configuration file ($HOME/.googlecalsync/config) using the following template: </p>

<p>[google]
<br/>username = 
<br/>password = </p>

<p>[local]
<br/>ical_file = 
<br/>workdir = ${HOME}/.googlecalsync/work/Then run: </p>

<p>  googlecalsync.py [--dry-run]Recommended usageAdd an entry in crontab (as non-privileged user) like the following to synchronize a local calendar with Google Calendar every 30mins: </p>

<p>0,30 * * * * /usr/bin/googlecalsync.py &gt;/dev/null 2&gt;&amp;1</p>

I developed this application mainly for my girlfriend and myself, so it only contains features that we hope to see in a desktop calendar. It is a simple calendar which works just like a paper calendar, allowing you to schedule events on it. Unlike many other desktop calendars, it does not offer any integration with emails or contacts. </p>

It normally stays in the background, and you can use hotkey or tray icon to bring it to the front. It also hides itself when you click away. RequirementsIt requires Microsoft .Net Framework 3.5.  title : The anyprogress Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project aims to create a progress indicator that can be displayed to users for processes which you don&#39;t control.  </p>

<p>Currently, the tool implements a file and directory monitor that will display a Swing-JProgressBar and optionally a progress log. The progress indicated is configured by a properties file, which maps file names to current progress. </p>

<p>The vision is to create a generic and extensible toolset to include arbitrary resource monitors (files, URIs, memory, etc.), different progress indicators (Swing, console, Ajax/HMTL etc.) and reporting options.</p>

 title : The arpc Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>What is “arpc”?“arpc” is an acronym for AJAX Remote Procedure Calls AJAX: Asynchronous Javascript and XML XML: Extensible Markup Language It is a tool that creates Javascript client stubs and PHP server stubs from an “.arpc” file for RPC’s (Remote Procedure Calls). The “.arpc” file contains all the data types (data structures) and remote procedure prototypes that you want for your web-app. Once you have created the “.arpc” file, you “compile” it with “arpcgen” (program/script) to create the required stubs (client/Javascript, server/PHP). The XML-RPC standard is used for communications between the client and server. This is why I called the tool “arpc”, the “X” from “AJAX” represents the “XML” in “XML-RPC”. Note: RPC calls from the client (Javascript) are asynchronous (the code that calls the stub is not blocked after the request is sent), this is a feature AJAX provides, this is an advantageous for longer requests. Why “arpc”?I wanted to use AJAX to access remote procedures on a server but I could not find any tools on the web that did what I wanted. So I decided to create my own tool, sure I could have hand-coded the client/server stubs, but this would not be reusable in future web-apps that I might create in the future.  Basically, I want to use AJAX in my “12.0 Student” web-app.  Most of the existing tools on the weren’t designed to exchange “data structures”, they basically just returned the string from the server and assigned in to a document element, so the server controlled the dynamic HTML on the page directly. With “arpc” the server and client code are completely isolated. So the person who is developing the client-side of the web-app, just needs to know what remote procedures the server provides and what they do. Similarly, the person who is developing the server-side of the web-app just need to know what functions they need to provide and what the functions should do.  Since the XML-RPC protocol is used for communications, the server and client stubs do not need to be used together. You can use the client  stub with an existing XML-RPC web service, as long as you know the procedure name and required parameters. Similarly, the server stub can be used to service existing XML-RPC clients. Why XML-RPC as the communications protocol? SOAP is the protocol used by most web-services nowadays, but the standard is much larger than XML-RPC (which is about six pages). It can do almost everything you need for simple RPC’s.  Existing standard, I don’t have to “re-invent the wheel”.  Simple protocol to implement, and I am the only person working on the tool at the moment! How does it work?Step 1: Design required remote procedures and create stubs. Step 2: Create remaining server/client application. Step 3: Use web-app.</p>

 title : The bitxml-dot-org Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>While efforts have been made in order to identify a &#39;killer protocol&#39; in the M2M arena, it seems that no one has hit the target yet.</p>

<p>For this reason, we felt that the best way to approach the problem was to define an extendible protocol - targeting at first the core functionalities commonly required by M2M applications - and lying on a very general architectural model: this is in fact the BiTXml protocol design approach.</p>

<p>Our main guidelines have been readability and easy extendibility of the protocol specifications, including the support for different I/O ports, network protocols, and core functionalities.</p>

<p>The result - in line with an evolutionary project - wants to be of help to anyone is facing a generic M2M project and needs a reference framework to express commands and control processes in an easy yet powerful manner.</p>

<p>The authors, Milan (Italy), Jun 2005.</p>

 title : The bugzilla-cn Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>欢迎访问Bugzilla简体中文本地化开源项目网站欢迎加入这个项目或给Bugzilla汉化项目提出你的意见或建议，如： 遗漏汉化或没有汉化的地方。 汉化不恰当的地方。 汉化有错误的地方。 汉化后造成某些功能有问题的地方。 目前，bugzilla 3.13 的简体中文本地化已有90%以上页面完成，欢迎大家加入此项目！ 请升级bugzilla至3.1.3,mozilla已经解决了双字节语言数据库输出乱码的问题. </p>

<p>已汉化目录: \global \bug \list \search \account \setup \email \request \whine \attachment \flag \reports </p>

<p>未汉化目录: \pages </p>

<p>未完全汉化文件： \bug\create\create-guided.html.tmpl \bug\create\confirm-create-dupe.html.tmpl \global\code-error.html.tmpl \global\user-error.html.tmpl \search\search-help.html.tmpl \attachment\diff-header.html.tmpl \admin\confirm-action.html.tmpl \admin\sanitycheck\messages.html.tmpl \admin\flag-type\edit.html.tmpl \admin\flag-type\list.html.tmpl</p>
 title : The capstonec Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Group C Senior Capstone Project Page- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - </p>

 title : The checkdigits Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Check digits (or characters) are a &#39;checksum&#39; on a number or word to help prevent manual typing errors. </p>

<p>This was originally based from Cryptography for Internet and Database Applications, pp 221-229. </p>

<p>This projects provides examples and source in both java and javacript. </p>

<p>Check digits (or characters) are a &#39;checksum&#39; on a number or word to help prevent manual typing errors.   They are not used for long or binary data sets.  They are not hashes, nor cryptographic.  They do not do error correction.  They are for catching CheckDigitsAndManualErrors. </p>

<p>The following schemes are currently implemented: </p>

<p>Dihedral Luhn, Mod 10 ISO 7064, Mod 11,2 ISO 7064, Mod 11,10 ISO 7064, Mod 97,10 More information on each is in CheckDigitSystems. </p>

<p>All versions have some type of &#39;object&#39; with the following methods: </p>

<p>encode	   Adds check digit to given string   verify	   Verifies data is correct using check digits   computeCheck  Returns the check digit (as integer) for given data   getCheck	   Extracts the check characters   getData	   Extracts the data with out the check character  </p>

<p>encode may throw an exception if &#39;bad&#39; data (e.g. non-numeric) is passed to it, while verify only returns true or false. The idea here is that encode normally gets it&#39;s data from &#39;trusted&#39; internal sources (a database key for instance), so it should be pretty usual, in fact, exceptional that bad data is being passed in. verify doesn&#39;t throw exceptions since this data is coming from an &#39;untrusted&#39; source such user input and who knows what they&#39;ll type in. Bad input is &#39;non-exceptional&#39; and is expected. </p>

<p>Note: unless explicitly specified, the code does not check the input length or trim off white space since that is application specific. </p>

<p>The verify method could have been universally implemented as encode(getData(str)) == getCheck(str), however in most caes custom code was implemented. This was done so that: </p>

<p>Reduce number of function calls (speed) Reduce number of objects/string generate (speed and memory) Allow the verify method to be &#39;yanked out&#39; of the source file with out dependencies on other methods Improve clarity of the algorithms. Frequently the computation of the check digits is tricky, while the verification is very clear. JavaAll check schemes implement the CheckDigit interface. </p>

<p>Extensive Junit tests exist in the com.modp.checkdigits.test package. </p>

<p>Javadoc code is in the java/doc directory. </p>

<p>JavaScriptThe javascript versions follow the java code fairly closely. However, the javascript objects do not formally use an interface or use inheritance. They are effectively static classes. </p>

<p>Extensive unit tests exist in the javascript/test directory. Just open the html files in your browser to run the tests. </p>

<p>NOTE: The core of the unit test is based from jsunit, but the test runner is custom. Need to split out the new runner and document it.</p>
 title : The circle-sharp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Circle# is a port of CircleMUD written using the Microsoft .NET Framework and the C# language. </p>

<p>CircleMUD is a multi-user dungeon game system (MUD) written by Jeremy Elson, originally at Johns Hopkins University&#39;s Department of Computer Science (I graduated in May of 1996). CircleMUD is a derivative of DikuMUD Gamma 0.0, which was written in 1990 at DIKU, the Department of Computer Science at the University of Copenhagen, by Katja Nyboe, Tom Madsen, Hans Henrik Staerfeldt, Michael Seifert, and Sebastian Hammer.</p>

 title : The crapto1 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This code provides library functions which aide in the verification of crypto1 weaknesses.  </p>

<p>The necessary information was extracted from the papers: </p>

<p>http://www.sos.cs.ru.nl/applications/rfid/2008-esorics.pdf  Finalized. (recover keys with a valid reader) http://www.cs.ru.nl/~flaviog/publications/Pickpocketing.Mifare.pdf Support for the fourth attack mentioned. (escalating from 1 key to any without a valid reader). http://eprint.iacr.org/2009/137  Support for the &#39;common prefix&#39; attack. Retrieves a key without a valid reader. Requires more communication than the previous attack and accurate timing.</p>
 title : The cripton Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>&quot;Group communications&quot; has become increasingly important in many network applications. With this arises the challenge of efficient group management algorithms. This includes providing confidentiality, authenticity, integrity and scalability. Though the technical issues of securing unicast communications has been well understood, the technical issues of securing group communications are not. An important part of secure group communications is scalability, which can be costly when large dynamic groups are involved. Previous attempts to solve this problem, have had communication cost proportional to the number of clients. In this project, we model the system using &quot;key graphs&quot;. This model induces a hierarchy in the group of clients leading to subgroups(group within groups) and so on. There exists at least a  two level hierarchy ,groups of workstations  forming one level of hierarchy and individual workstations forming the other. Operations like a client joining or leaving a group( or a subgroup) now reduce to set of operations on the key graph like finding the descendants of a node in the graph, finding the set of leaves in a tree, finding the minimal covering set. These algorithms enable us to achieve a communication cost proportional to logarithm of the number of clients. It also helps us to achieve scalability i.e.., perform efficiently when a large number of clients are involved.</p>
 title : The cryptobyn Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is an encryptation paradigm based in random filters that make grow the complexity of the encrypted text in a exponential way. </p>

<p>Introduction
<br/>Nowadays cryptographic messages are really important for communications through the web. In cryptography, encryption is the process of transforming information (referred to as plaintext) using an algorithm (called cipher) to make it unreadable to anyone except those possessing special knowledge, usually referred to as a key. The result of the process is encrypted information (in cryptography, referred to as ciphertext). In many contexts, the word encryption also implicitly refers to the reverse process, decryption, to make the encrypted information readable again (i.e. to make it unencrypted).</p>

 title : The csharpmudserver Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MUD.NetMUD.Net started as a test project to learn the new .Net 3.5 asynchronous sockets pattern. When testing that initial code, I used MUSHClient and it made me a tad nostalgic for ye olde MUDs. So, I figured, why not, there&#39;s a lot of other patterns and techniques I don&#39;t have in my repertoire. Why not work on them here? </p>

<p>It&#39;s been a fun ride, a ride that continues today. This site will host public releases of the MUD.Net source. All releases on this site are subject to the MIT License restrictions, which is to say not much. Use it as you like.  </p>

<p>Note about licensing and &quot;Insurrection&quot;As the above statement implies, I am NOT using this respository for development. I have my own, private, repo that I&#39;m using for that, and the only thing that will be available here are milestone snapshots, major and minor releases, and if there&#39;s enough interest perhaps weekly snapshots. I&#39;m basically doing that so I can keep the actively developed codebase in a perpetually branched state as far as this license is concerned. If I decide to go ahead and use it for profit or sell it to someone who will, that remains my decision. For the purposes of keeping these two codebases separate, I&#39;m calling the private branch &quot;Insurrection,&quot; after the MUD that will be hosted by that name, both as a production MUD and as a feature showcase. Link forthcoming when I manage to get said game up and running.</p>
 title : The csquickusb Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Generally, CSQuickUSB is a library that exposes access to USB hardware manufactured by Bitwise Systems (http://www.bitwisesys.com). Essentially allowing full featured interop with a USB 2.0 port and hardware of an external device, all from an easy to use C#/managed landscape. </p>

<p>DownloadTo download the latest release, go to the Downloads Page. For nightly builds see the SVN repository. </p>

<p>BackgroundBitwise Systems manufactures a USB module called QuickUSB which provides all the features of a full USB 2.0 system, but is very easy to integrate with existing hardware. However, at the time, the API to access the device is poorly designed and sparsely documented. In short, I wish I had went with the Cypress solutions instead. </p>

<p>Out of the box it comes with an unmanaged wrapper library called quickusb.dll, which wraps all the necessary Windows API calls to successfully preform USB 2.0 communication with the hardware. With that in mind, all CSQuickUSB is, is a wrapper of quickusb.dll, that is much easier to use and performs all the necessary win32 marshaling for full managed environment access to the hardware on the other side of the USB cable. </p>

<p>For examples on how to use the CsQuickUSB library see the UsageExamples wiki page</p>
 title : The dd4mmkb Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A device driver for a Multimedia Keyboard in Linux </p>

<p>A device driver or a software driver is a specific type of computer software, typically developed to allow interaction with hardware devices. This usually constitutes an interface for communicating with the device, through the specific computer bus or communications subsystem that the hardware is connected to, providing commands to and/or receiving data from the device, and on the other end, the requisite interfaces to the operating system and software applications. </p>

<p>A Multimedia Keyboard provides enhanced functionalities like launching an application e.g. web browser, volume control, browser navigation, etc. at the press of a special key. 
<br/>The project aims at providing the functionalities not yet defined in Linux for a multimedia keyboard.</p>
 title : The dircproxy Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>dircproxy is an IRC proxy server (&quot;bouncer&quot;) designed for people who use IRC from lots of different workstations or clients, but wish to remain connected and see what they missed while they were away. You connect to IRC through dircproxy, and it keeps you connected to the server, even after you detach your client from it. While you&#39;re detached, it logs channel and private messages as well as important events, and when you reattach it&#39;ll let you know what you missed. </p>

<p>Join us on IRC:
<br/> irc.freenode.net
<br/> #dircproxy</p>

 title : The diversion Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Statusplanning </p>

<p>Diversion is a game system for playing multi-player tabletop games. The games available will be a variety of board games, table top games, card games, plus support for role playing games. The difference between Diversion and other programs that play games over a network connection is instead of requiring a centralized server for hosting games, Diversion will use many servers in the same way p2p file sharing programs use multiple servers to host a given file. </p>

 title : The e-bibliophile Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>e-Bibliophile is the first iteration of a grammar and surrounding tools to make use of that grammar, targeting written media including but not limited to: Literature, Fiction, Essays, Articles, and Plays.  As such it is meant to focus on syntactical markup of those sorts of works, and not be a solution for all written works.  With a goal of only targeting the bulk of written materials (excluding things such as text books, mathematical formulae, technical documents, contractual agreements etc.) we have been able to come up with a concise grammar that is easy to read, and apply, with a minimum of arbitrary methods to properly mark up a single document. </p>

<p>The advantage?  By not being a solution for all things, we are able to provide an incredibly effective and dynamic solution to things that fall within the range of our target.  We are able to realize the sort of flexibility and separation of contextual/syntactical markup and style markup shown at projects like CSS Zen Garden, and has been talked about at the W3 consortium for over a decade now. </p>

<p>e-Bibliophile as a piece of software centers around a &quot;what you see is what you mean&quot; (wysiwym) document markup gui, an IDE like text based editor for manual editing of the document and the associated CSS type documents, and an IDE like editor to &quot;tweak&quot; the processing engine&#39;s output.  It also features interfaces to convert images into text, the facilities to then check the accuracy of the document, and tools to refer back to the original document throughout the markup process.  For documents that are originally composed inside e-Bibliophile there are also many algorithms that will assist in checking for consistency of spelling non-standard non-dictionary words, as well as checking to assess the difficulty for readers to understand the document. </p>

<p>News1-26-2009 Finally finished the first draft of the markup language.  Work has started on prototyping the system we will be using to keep all of the parts of the application synchronized. </p>

<p>12-28-2008 Xmas is over, new years is just around the corner, and energy towards e-Bibliophile is ramping up.  Our main developer is going to have more time to start working on making this project a reality starting in less than 2 weeks.  We have also had a few &quot;nibbles&quot; from other developers who are interested in making our dream a reality.  Documenting the last few parts of the grammar is proving to be more difficult that expected, but getting this right up front is more important than getting words on a sheet. </p>

<p>12-12-2008 The grammar is almost completely outlined. The only major hurdles left are Images, Cites, and Notes.  We have decided that will will set up an event driven parser, that will allow LARGE amounts of flexibility for any document compliant to this grammar, so that as we work on the GUI, members of the e-book community can use the markup to format books. </p>

<p>11-17-2008 We have spent significant time working on the grammar and scope of the markup language.  Coding may start as soon as January 2009.  If all goes well we should have a functional program by Q3 of 2009.  </p>

<p>10-28-2008 Real life, wedding planning, work, twins and plenty of other things have slowed down initial development of the project, but it is far from dead. </p>

<p>4-10-2008 We are currently refining the set of tags/data model that we are going to employ in the application.  Code modeling and GUI design to follow shortly there after.</p>
 summary : <p>This project has given the authorization from one of the main original authors to be published in an open source repository. So, here we go. </p>

<p>---------------Original description--------------Taken from pear http://pear.php.net/package/File_DICOM </p>

<p>File_DICOM allows reading and modifying of DICOM files. </p>

<p>DICOM stands for Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine, and is a standard for creating, storing and transferring digital images (X-rays, tomography) and related information used in medicine. </p>

<p>This package in particular does not support the exchange/transfer of DICOM data, nor any network related functionality. </p>

<p>More information on the DICOM standard can be found at: http://medical.nema.org/ </p>

<p>Please be aware that any use of the information produced by this package for diagnosing purposes is strongly discouraged by the author. </p>

<p>See http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html for more information.</p>

 title : The gvms Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>简述   </p>

<p>我们所做的是一个基于Mapobjects的开源的GPS车俩监控系统。系统分为四个部分，GPS网关模拟系统、车辆轨迹记录系统、地图配置系统和车辆监控系统。 
<br/>1、GPS车辆监控系统 </p>

<p>主要用来对车辆进行实时位置跟踪，在电子地图上显示其所在位置。但其长远目的是为以后可以在该系统平台上构建复杂的业务系统而构建一个基础平台，因此在保证系统有较高的使用效率和友好的交互性能之外，还具有很好的可扩充性。 
<br/>2、地图配置系统： 主要用来配置地图数据，创建地图的工程文件。 
<br/>3、GPS网关模拟系统： 模拟车辆位置信息发送，为车辆监控系统和轨迹记录系统提供实时的数据源，他们之间通过UDP网络协议来进行通信。 
<br/>4、轨迹记录系统 实时保存车辆数据到数据库中，以便在车辆监控系统需要对特定车辆进行轨迹回放时为其提供车辆历史轨迹数据。 </p>

<p>特点 1、使用优化的数据缓存技术保证了系统的实时性和高效率 2、使用了基于时间差值的轨迹回放算法，能根据历史轨迹数据精确模拟车辆行驶速度 3、采用两种监控模式（web模式和桌面模式），保证数据源同步，为用户提供选择空间 </p>

<p>ps:本项目采用visual studio .net 2005 和 ESRI mapobjects 2.4平台开发。    </p>

<p>由于时间问题，还没能提供系统的部署文档，如有兴趣写文档者，可与我联系。 
<br/>MSN:massifor@hotmail.com,请注明&quot;gvms document&quot;</p>
 summary : <p>This project provides an convenient abstraction over flash.net.Socket. With this module, you can use arbitrary network services hosted on the server. </p>

<p>As a backend, it uses a small flash movie that does the actual data transfer. </p>

<p>One of the limitations imposed by the single-threaded nature of ActionScript3 is the fact that you only get non-blocking sockets, which can prove harder to use. </p>

<p>As an example, we provide a simple POP3 protocol implementation. </p>

<p>mail: pinocet@gmail.com</p>
 title : The gwt-socket Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The hackystat-sensor-tfs Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IntroductionTeam Foundation Server(TFS) is a Microsoft application framework used to manage teams working on group projects. It includes source control, build, reporting and ticking services. The Visual Studio Team Foundation Server Hackystat Sensor is a web service application that combines the Eventing Service provided by TFS along with the TFS API to intercept, extract and record development information sent through Team Foundation Server in near real-time. This information is then processed and sent to a Hackystat database for further analysis by other tools in the Hackystat Framework. </p>

<p>By creating a Hackystat sensor which will collect development process data for the VS Team Foundation Server, developers and team leaders would be able to utilize all the information gained throughout a project to their advantage. Instead of simply viewing the number of bugs fixed over time, they could use this information to identify common patterns that precede each bug. Developers could then use this information to better mold there individual design process. They could also use the information gained on previously similar projects to map out better development timelines for future ones. </p>

<p>For users</p>

<p>Why  Why make this sensor   Demo  Demo of the sensor in action   Overview  A brief overview of the sensor and its capabilities.   Tutorial  How to setup and subscribe to events.   FAQ  Frequently asked questions.  </p>

<p>For installers and developers</p>

<p>Installation Guide  How to install the sensor from a binary distribution.   Developer Guide  How to build the sensor from source.  </p>

<p>Documentation</p>

<p>Setting File  How to configure the settings file.   Design Decisions  Why did I do this instead of that.   Event Types  Explanations about the various types of TFS events   Source  Source code documentation</p>

 title : The ict4dlab Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project is a repository for tools for creating new projects on ICT (Information and Communication Technologies) for Development. </p>

<p>It was originally started to support MIT D-Lab ICT4D course this Spring 2008. </p>

<p>Please contact Luis Sarmenta for more information.</p>
 summary : <p>The field of Distributed Computing has existed for many years, but has seen a recent surge in development as the prevalance of consumer electronics has increased. Distributed Computing is based on the principle that connected devices can achieve more. Many homes are now enabled with high speed wireless networking and devices, although these are simply members of a disjointed collection of gadgets. The ideas of intelligent spaces or Smart Environments try to remedy this disjointed nature using concepts from Distributed Computing. In this project we hope to implement a simple prototype demonstrating the advantages of such a system.</p>

 title : The instant-messenger Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The intranet-chat Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IntraNet-ChatIntraNet Chat is an open source Intranet messenger style service that runs on java and uses the multicast system to send messages across an Internet.  </p>

<p>The main program runs a group chat so that all users can communicate with each other through a graphical user interface.  </p>

<p>The program also includes a private chat function that enable two individual users can communicate with each other.  </p>

<p>Program facilities include audio warnings, a system tray icon to enable the program to be minimized and a settings function that enables settings from the last session to be recalled. </p>

<p>Give it a try this may be a suitable messaging service for your local network! </p>

<p>If anyone has an idea for a feature that can be added to the program feel free to email it to me and it may get added ! </p>

<p>NewsNew Version of the program is available for download now  </p>

<p>mac version will be uploaded later as there is a few more tests to be run before it can be released  </p>

<p>Source code is now present in the source tab and can be downloaded via svn transfer </p>

<p>Version 1.2.5 has be released with extra usability and previous issues fixed </p>

<p>There is currently an issue with the program running in mac os&#39;s we are trying to ascertain what is causing these faults and produce a fix so that the program can run on mac. Any information about the problems would be gladly accepted and will help to a solution.</p>

 title : The jjil Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>JJIL is a Java image processing library. It includes an image processing architecture and over 60 routines for various image processing tasks. </p>

<p>JJIL is particularly targeted towards mobile applications. It includes interfaces so images can be converted to and from native formats for J2ME, Android, and J2SE. </p>

<p>JJIL includes some sample applications for face detection and EAN-13 (including UPC) barcode reading. The barcode reader requires high resolution images (currently beyond a typical cameraphone, but perhaps not Android) but the face detection code works well with any cameraphone. It can isolate any reasonable frontal view of a face in a few seconds. </p>

<p>Update, 10-16-2008: I added many classes to JJIL and made the naming more consistent. This is a major update which will break existing</p>

 title : The jstm4gwt Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>jstm4gwt - Java Shared Transacted Memory for GWTjstm4gwt helps with the developement of distributed GWT-Ajax applications. This library handles the data manipulation and synchronization with the server. </p>

<p>jstm4gwt automatically sends modified data to the server. </p>

<p>jstm4gwt automatically broadcasts changes to other clients. </p>

<p>jstm4gwt saves the user from implementing RPC services for each remote data operation. </p>

<p>jstm4gwt detects conflicts with changes made by other clients on the same data. </p>

<p>jstm4gwt allows data modifications to be done within transactions, and cleanly rollbacked if the transaction aborts. </p>

<p>jstm4gwt is simpler to use than SOA design since you don&#39;t have to define services but you just have to work on your functional data and implement listeners on client (refreshing UI ) and on the server (persistence, mailing, ...). </p>

<p>jstm4gwt can be very efficient, e.g. for gwt multi users games. </p>

<p>jstm4gwt allows you to setup a powerfull distributed gwt application in few minutes. </p>

<p>Chat demo video </p>

<p>GWM demo video </p>

<p>(Special thanks to Dominik Steiner for those videos)  </p>

<p>To get started, download one of our samples. E.g. the Images demo. It contains a Jetty server with the demo code. Just unzip it and launch the server using start.cmd, then launch two browsers by clicking twice the Browse.url shortcut. </p>

<p>Have a look at the web site for the parent project JSTM, and to the JSTM blog.</p>
 title : The kim4apple Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Instroduction </p>

<p>This project is just a part of Windows Workflow Foundation Kim4Apple implementation. </p>

<p>Windows Workflow Foundation (WF) has been introduced as part of Microsoft .Net 3.0 framework (formerly called WinFX). It is a namespace and a set of tools designed for building workflow enabled applications on .Net. 
<br/>Microsoft WF is a very sophisticated workflow engine that supports persistence (hydratation, dehydratation), tracking, visual design, compiling, communications, timer and rules services and it is highly extensible from new activities to new hosts. Windows Workflow Foundation also provides an extensible model and designer to build custom activities which encapsulate workflow functionality for end-users. WWF it is heavily object oriented designed and a bit overbloatted.  
<br/>Microsoft also allows to define workflows uing XOML and provides a complier for it.</p>

 title : The lcm Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>LCM is a library for message passing and data marshalling targeted at real-time systems where high-bandwidth and low latency are critical. It provides a publish/subscribe message passing model and an XDR-style message specification language with bindings for applications in C, Java, and Python. It was originally designed and used by the MIT DARPA Urban Challenge Team as its message passing system. </p>

<p>LCM is designed for tightly-coupled systems connected via a dedicated local-area network. It is not intended for message passing over the Internet. LCM has been developed for soft real-time systems: its default messaging model permits dropping messages in order to minimize the latency of new messages. </p>

<p>FeaturesLow-latency inter-process communication Efficient broadcast mechanism using UDP Multicast Provides type-safe message marshaling that automatically detects most types of errors (such as version mismatches between different modules) User-friendly logging and playback  Essentially unlimited packet size No centralized &quot;database&quot; or &quot;hub&quot; -- peers communicate directly No daemons Supports C/C++, Java, Python, and MATLAB RequirementsPOSIX.1-2001 system (GNU/Linux, OS X, Cygwin, Solaris, etc.) or Windows XP/Vista/7 GLib &gt;= 2.0 Java &gt;= 1.5 is strongly recommended, as several important utilities distributed with LCM are written in Java. 
<br/>DocumentationTechnical Report (PDF) -- This document describes the design principles of LCM, and is the best place to start for a comprehensive understanding. More Documentation -- Tutorials, API Reference, Troubleshooting, etc. NewsMar 15, 2010Release 0.4.1: </p>

<p>This is primarily a bugfix and maintenance release. </p>

<p>C: fix leaking file descriptors fix OS/X compile bug for lcm-example (missing #include ) simplify project include path requirements in Windows update error checking, messages for single host use (Linux) Java: expose encode/decode methods for advanced users lcm-gen: (C) add --c-no-pubsub command line option to lcm-gen to generate C language    bindings without a dependency on liblcm (useful if only the marshalling aspect of LCM is desired). (Java) don&#39;t complain about default pkg if one is specified on cmd line. lcm-spy: remember last message on each channel so that object panels open up immediately. put frames in front when double clicked. Other: remove manpage-specific GFDL copyright notices. Jan 6, 2010Release 0.4.0: </p>

<p>This release includes experimental support for Microsoft Visual C++. Thanks go to Randy Sybel for providing this port.  Although it&#39;s undergone some testing, it should be considered highly experimental, and is not well documented or packaged at all.  Bug reports and patches are greatly appreciated. </p>

<p>This release also incorporates a number of minor bugfixes for the Java port.  See the changelog for details. </p>
