 summary : <p>This project has been cancelled, nobody is working on it right now!2009-10-06: DO NOT USE PHOTOFLIPPlease don&#39;t try to use PhotoFlip if you&#39;re not a developer, it&#39;s not in a usable state! Softpedia has started distributing our ALPHA-QUALITY archive without prior notification, this was neither expected nor asked from us. We doubt anyone has managed to run it anyway since the required libraries are not available anymore. </p>

<p>PhotoFlip is a photo managing software featuring a smooth 3d interface enabling you to browse seemlessly through your photos, as if they were right in your hands. You can tag your photos, organize them into separate collections, customize photo frames and add background music while browsing a collection. </p>

<p>News2007-11-14: Development updateWe are working on a whole new codebase for PhotoFlip 0.3, our next experimental version. We chose to get rid of Gtk/Glib as a whole, loosing some really useful API functions but gaining in size, portability, and in the long run this will certainly prove to be a better option. </p>

<p>So what is going on right now? The new code uses SDL as its base input/output library. I&#39;m working on a (great) OpenGL-cairo GUI interface which meets our specific needs for a fullscreen application with multiple tool-windows in it, a dock, etc. </p>

<p>2007-10-24: First version releasedWe just released the first PhotoFlip development version. This is ALPHA-QUALITY software and may DAMAGE YOUR DATA (although it didn&#39;t while we tested it, of course). There are already quite a lot of functions working, but many are still work in progress. We encourage you to test PhotoFlip 0.1.0 and give us feedback. </p>

<p>You can find Linux, Windows and source packages on the Featured Downloads list on your right.  </p>

<p>In order to run PhotoFlip, you will need the gtkmm 2.12 (2.10 should work too) runtime package (it should include libglademm too) and the gtkglextmm 1.2 package. Under Linux, these packages should be in your distribution&#39;s package manager. Here are links for win32 runtime packages: </p>

 summary : <p>Phrasis is a is a stripped down text editor. We want to remove any feature that might hinder the productivity of a professional (or serious amateur) writer and add any feature that would increase the efficiency (of must our users). Therefore, we&#39;ve created an interface with only the bare essentials, no menus, no formating features and no nonsense. </p>

<p>Please comment and help improve the product. Phrasis only edits text files, so other formats must be converted to text or they show up as gobbledygook. We support Unicode, so non-English and multilingual documents are acceptable. </p>

<p>Our first public release should occur in January 2007. In the mean time, feel free to download the development version from svn and compile it yourself. </p>

<p>A public wiki is now available. </p>

<p>NEWS:Grammar checking now works!! </p>

 title : The proptcp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>PropTCP is a TCP/IP stack for the Parallax Propeller P8X32A microcontroller. </p>

<p>Updated! New Beta Posted! Sockets Layer Beta / Development Snapshots: http://harrisonpham.com/embedded/PropTCP/beta/  </p>

<p>NewsApr 20, 2009 - The latest PropTCP beta has been released.  It can be downloaded at http://harrisonpham.com/embedded/PropTCP/beta/. </p>

<p>Mar 21, 2008 - Yes we are still working on the code base.  We are testing the stack on numerous network configurations to ensure it works.  You can still download betas at the beta site listed above. </p>

<p>Dec 14, 2007 - Beta revisions are now available at: http://harrisonpham.com/embedded/PropTCP/beta/.  All stable releases will still be posted to this site in the Downloads section.  Remember, betas will change often and may not always work 100%.  Do not use Beta code in production environments. </p>

<p>Nov 27, 2007 - The new sockets layer API and code base are being finalized.  We are very close to a release candidate.  We are hoping to have a release ready within the next week. </p>

<p>Nov 12, 2007 - The enc28j60 driver bug fix has been uploaded to the download section.  It is recommended that all users update to this new driver since it fixes a critical hang bug associated with packet collisions.  A new version of the http server example has been posted (no functionality changes other than vga debug information and updated drivers). </p>

<p>Nov 4, 2007 - A bug with the enc28j60 driver was recently found where excessive collisions or late collisions would cause the driver to lock up.  The bug is not documented anywhere (not even in the enc28j60 datasheets / erratas).  A fix should be released soon that is based on Microchip&#39;s driver which contains some slightly hacky code to fix the undocumented issue. </p>

<p>Supported HardwareThere is no single supported configuration.  The current code supports an ENC28J60 chip from Microchip connected to a Propeller Chip.  Click here for in-depth hardware setup information.</p>

 title : The pyramidsolitaire Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Cards are distributed in a pattern like this. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>The bottom row of cards is face up, and the rows above that are all face down. As soon as a card does not have cards laying on top of it, it may be flipped over and shown to the player.  The cards in the lowest row will sit on top of the cards in the row above them so as to not make the cards accessible until they are uncovered.  The player will then be able to deal the rest of the 24 cards one by one to the discard pile. </p>

<p>The goal of the game is to get every card off of the pyramid and into the discard pile. </p>

<p>For more information about our version of pyramid solitaire, please see our game design document.</p>

 title : The pytestsgenerator Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>PyTestsGenerator is an automated Test Case Generator for creating python unittests. It is a tool that is used to create pyunit test cases for any given python module. It requires only the name of the module to generate its testcases, except in the case of customization.The use of the GUI is optional as the test cases could be generated with the CLI itself. </p>

<p>The Project aims at making the life of the python developers and unit testers easy.The generation of the test cases have been simplified to its very basic extent. the performance of the tool is high as it could generate thousands of cases in seconds. </p>

<p>Functional UpdatesThe functional update is that the mode of generation is extended to user levels of customizations and operating from file levels to generate cases is also made possible </p>

<p>The generators next focus would be on the web category which will handle the web based testcases and api&#39;s for handling the web frameworks and testing their components. </p>

<p>Planned UpdatesThe next version of the test generator will have a feature of comparing the generated values with the csv or a text based file. The customization past of the application will be extended further to provide more functionality.</p>

 title : The rallyetime Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>RallyeTime SystemThis website is the repository for my work on my TSD road rally system. All the current code and past versions of the system are available for download. </p>

<p>A Rally is a time-speed-distance event you run in your car with a team of two people on public roads. You have to travel an unknown path by following a set of directions and arrive at the checkpoint at exactly the right time based off the speed limit of the roads you were travelling. </p>

<p>I&#39;m currently developing a new system, but you can view the version of this system I developed and used to  win the 2008 Fall TAMSCC rally season. </p>

<p>You can read about the existing system here. </p>

<p>Current PlansCurrently I&#39;m designing a new system that will be used for both tour and course SCCA style rallies. I plan on developing a proving its useful over the 2009 WDCR SCCA Rally season. The goal is to develop a system that is cheaper, easier to use, and better than traditional &#39;A&#39; box rally computers. The software program will be free for anyone to use and I plan on developing and offering for sale the needed hardware portion. </p>

<p>I will posting to the project blog about my progress as I develop the prototype system. </p>

<p>Current Rally Vehicle</p>

 title : The read2me Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Home Page </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Suite of cross-platform text-to-speech tools, with which a computer reads text aloud. The tools have a series of text-to-speech interfaces, including a stand alone interface and a converter to save the speech to an MP3. Other possible added tools include a Mozilla Firefox plug-in and a dockable version.  </p>

<p>Students at Learning Disabilities Services will be the first users. Everyone, however, can take advantage of the tools, for example, to create MP3 of a text and listen to it on the road. The reading software is a critical tool to help students with reading weaknesses. Having the computer read text aloud to students helps them circumvent their difficulty of processing printed text. </p>

 title : The secondpylon Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The seedparser Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>SAX based Extended Event Driven XML Parser for C++ </p>

<p>Introduction </p>

<p>Building DOM tree is the simplest way to parse an XML document and extract details. It is widely used in a variety of applications spanning business domains - simple desktop applications, enterprise applications and large scale web applications. In a large scale application or in B2B scenario the XML document tends to quiet huge in the order 100s of GBs, in which case building a DOM tree would simply not be possible because of memory limitations. There is absolutely no point in building a DOM tree if it cannot fit into physical main memory. The alternative is to use SAX parsers. SAX parser are too basic and are not a natural fit for the problem. </p>

<p>History </p>

<p>I was present with the problem of parsing an XML file of size 2GB (back in 2002 when the world was still using 32-bit systems) with a certain processing time requirement. I looked at the options I had and decided to write a threaded variant of SAX parser that would be easy enough to use like DOM trees but be memory efficient and agile as SAX parser. I called it the SEED parser (the project was a success, by the way). Recently I ran into a team which was struggling to address this problem, and was pleasantly surprised. I thought I should re-write my idea and open source the code. Hence this project. </p>

<p>Solution </p>

<p>The approach is rather simple. SAX is event driven but the events are low level tags, values and end tags notification. I extended the event notification on a subscription basis for XML paths. There are two kinds of subscriptions you can make, SAX subscriptions and DOM subscriptions. SAX subscription can support sub-subscriptions, and receives notifications that SAX parsers support. DOM subscription receives DOM tree for that path. There are two types of notifications - synchronous and asynchronous. Asynchronous is thread based. Mix matching all the provisions you can build parsing logic to parse huge XML files and maintain synchronization in the logic parser. </p>

<p>Example </p>

<p>If you have a 2 GB file like </p>

<p>     ... Unknown end tag for </p>

<p>Unknown end tag for </p>

<p>if you want to process order you would register SAX subscriber for /root called SAX-Root, register synchronous DOM-SUBSCRIBER orders/meta-data under SAX-Root and register asynchronous DOM-SUBSCRIBER for orders/order under SAX-Root. </p>

<p>Author </p>

<p>Karthikeyan Radhakrishnan (karthikeyan.radhakrishnan@gmail.com)</p>

 title : The soaprj Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>HybFS </p>

<p>We are starting HybFS as a semester project for the Advanced Operating Systems course (Politehnica University of Bucharest). The main idea of this project is to have an overlay file system on Linux that can provide multiple organizational views of the same original hierarchy of files, without altering the interface for the existing applications. It is different from a true semantic file system because it still allows the orginial hierarhical view of files, therefore the name of &quot;hybrid file system&quot; - HybFS :) . </p>

<p>More details about this project are described on HybFS wiki.</p>

 title : The space-herder Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>TBA, </p>
 summary : <p>Notice: Due to the high degree of overlap, this project has been abandoned in favor of Enchant </p>

<p>SpellCore is a an open-architecture spelling/orthography-changing engine for minority languages.   </p>

<p>In a typical language development project, workers use four or more applications to produce vernacular materials (i.e. reading primers, dictionaries, books).  Because these are non-commercially interesting languages, ready-made spell-checkers are not available.  Some applications have their own way to spell check anyhow, but the resulting list of good and bad words is not generally reusable in the other applications.  So the first thing  SpellCore offers is a database of spelling information which is usable by multiple applications. </p>

<p>Recognizing the needs of languages where &#39;correct-spelling&#39; is an elusive target, SpellCore goes way beyond &#39;correct/incorrect&#39; lists to include plug-ins that measure suspiciousness. That is, if a word is not known to be right or wrong, does it seem likely to be wrong? Two measures that have proven useful are: </p>

<p>Structure (e.g. syllable structure, composed of morphemes found in a dictionary and conforming to known morphological grammar rules). Similarity (e.g. one key away from a known-good word see edit distance) Equivalent Transliterations (Eaton &amp; Penny) </p>

<p>Architectural OverviewA core library/api, named SpellCore (previously codenamed Panang), sits in-between the client pieces and particular plugins. Note: many possible plug-ins are shown here, but we don&#39;t need to build all these pieces to have a great system. The point is to have natural places to add in approaches that we know folks are currently using out there, in various kinds of languages. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Related ProjectsSee SpellCenter. </p>

<p>Who&#39;s doing this?This project is being launched by a Palaso (PAyap LAnguage SOftware).  Palaso is a small group of field-based developers working for SIL International, some working in the Linguistic Institute of Thailand&#39;s Payap University.  We welcome others to join in. </p>

<p>StatusJuly 2007.  Christopher Wilks and Eric Albright added support for HunSpell and ASpell engines, so our major-language support is strong.  Next up is minority language support. </p>

<p>October 2007. We found out about Enchant so have moved our efforts to contributing toward Enchant. </p>

<p>Please post to the mailing list with your ideas/questions.</p>

 title : The springbox-design-theme-test Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is a test-run for an iGoogle theme from Springbox Design</p>
 summary : <p>This project aims to provide a simple Builder pattern and Factory pattern based approach to generating DML (Data Manipulation Language) SQL for all the popular RDBMS systems. Included builders are SelectBuilder, InsertBuilder, UpdateBuilder, DeleteBuilder. It is much lighter weight than any of the ORM tools available, and is 100% Java, no other special configuration language or query language to learn. This code has been in production use since its first incarnation around 2001. Also included is a Facade patterned Database object that wraps a Datasource object. This provides an execution framework for the results of the Builder objects which includes simplified transaction and batch management as well as the ability to transparently handle sql exceptions in a default manner. The Database object also provides a simple object oriented approach via wrappers around the database metadata.  </p>

<p>There are no DDL (Data Definition Language) builders. This library is aimed at creating runtime dynamic sql easy. The DDL for the different databases is so varied that trying to abstract it out to a single generation framework would be counter productive. There are no plans to address DDL any time in the future.  </p>

<p>This is a very active project, come back often as I work on either the code/javadoc or wiki documentation on a daily basis. Or you can subscribe to notifications using freshmeat.net.</p>

 title : The tartar Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Welcome to Burmese conversation agent - an intelligent computer entity to communicate with Burmese, the people live in Myanmar, in their own native language. In Burmese Tar Tar Oo Lay means the lovely one who like to talk, hance this project aptly name TarTar. </p>

<p>TarTar is a a set of AIML contents providing basic functionality to communicate between Hunan and Computer. AIML, or Artificial Intelligence Markup Language, is an XML dialect for creating natural language software agents. The AIML was developed by Richard Wallace. It formed the basis for what was initially a highly extended Eliza called A.L.I.C.E. (Artificial Linguistic Internet Computer Entity), which won the annual Loebner Prize Contest for Most Human Computer three times, and was also the Chatterbox Challenge Champion in 2004. The AIML specification can be found here. </p>

<p>TarTar, a set of AIML contents for Burmese language, can be applied to any AIML intreprators supporting 1.0.1 unicode AIML, (see TarTarBrain for detail) providing basic functionality to communicate between Human and Computer in Burmese langauge. </p>

<p>TarTar can be easily extensible just by adding domain knowledge AIML contents, since AIML is an XML-compliant language that&#39;s easy to learn and create one from scratch within minutes.  </p>

<p>UsageDownload on of your favorate AIML intreprater from AliceBot.Org and get it ready. Set TarTar AIML content to the intreprater. This is no more than copying to the appriorate folder in most intrepraters. Modify few personalization, such as bot name and bot master. ApplicationThe application of chat bot is growing rapidly in customer serving on the web sites. </p>

<p>We are also looking at MM-EN translation service, dictionary lookup service and some casual information service like Burmese calender and fortune telling in Burmese ways. </p>

<p>DemoDarDar  MembersKyaw Tun (HDN) - Project Manager: overall responsibility, making critical decision and Burmese conversation brain designing Khin Temoe (HDN) - AI Content Designer: Core Burmese Conversation AIML Ye Myat Thu (Alpha Info-Tech Co., Ltd) - Burmese Knowledgebase Aung Kyaw Htet (MMGeeks) - Artificial Intelligence Licencing InformationCopyleft© 2008 Hnandar. </p>

 title : The tigus Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Welcome to Tigus ProjectTigus Project aims implementing a complete test generation and evaluation system. This involves applications (components) for question management, test generation, test evaluation and results publishing. </p>

<p>In the initial iteration, this involved writing several components in various languages to manage test data in various forms. This meant having separate tools for processing questions, generating the tests and correcting the tests, without any common framework. In the last years, while using the solution in production (for hundreds of tests), several flows in the generation-execution-checking process were identified. </p>

<p>Based on the knowledge gathered in this period, a rewrite of the system was decided in order to consolidate the use of the available components. The system architecture was redesigned to allow components to be brought in our taken out as desired. Multiple architecture layers working with common interfaces allow exchanging components and morphing the system depending on requirements. </p>

<p>NewsTigus Project participates at ROSEdu Summer of Code 2008. Make sure to check the projects available there.</p>

 title : The tlc-spacegame Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>http://sjsayers.com/?p=38 This post is a large bulk of the core idea of this game. </p>

<p>We discuss a lot on the ##teenlinux channel on the freenode network. However I encourage you to use our new mailing list.</p>
 summary : <p>Our goal is to create an object oriented simulator using Gillespie&#39;s stochastic algorithm to model the behavior of genetic regulatory networks. </p>

<p>There are three major design challenges that we hope to meet with our code: </p>

<p>Extensibility </p>

<p>The dynamics of gene regulation are complex and not fully understood. Therefore we want to make it easy to alter the behavior of genes in our simulation without disrupting other parts of the code. This goal suggests using OOP. </p>

<p>Scalability </p>

<p>We hope to eventually scale our simulations to large numbers of genes and regulators. For this to be feasible, our program must be efficient in regards to both computer time and set up time. Simulating a network of large numbers of genes will obviously require that our algorithms are efficient. It will also require an straightforward way to set all the required parameters. </p>

<p>Simplicity </p>

<p>Related to the last point, we want our code to have a simple enough user interface that a non-programmer with a little instruction can design and run simulations. While we don&#39;t necessarily want to provide a GUI, we will use input files to set simulation parameters so that a user doesn&#39;t need to alter the source code and recompile in order to change the simulation. </p>

<p>--- </p>

<p>Institute for Biocomplexity and Informatics </p>

<p>University of Calgary </p>

<p>http://www.ibi.ucalgary.ca/ibi/index.html</p>

 title : The tracman Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mailman does a great job of dealing with the gnarly task of running a mailing list. However, its web interface leaves something to be desired.  </p>

<p>Trac, on the other hand, is really slick for TTW project management, but where is threaded discussion? </p>

<p>This project aims to implement a Trac plugin that gives you robust threaded discussion (via web and email), with Mailman under the hood. </p>

<p>P.S. It may seem goofy to host here instead of on Trac somewhere. Personally, I&#39;m using Trac for non-software projects, and this is just so easy. </p>

<p>P.P.S. License is GPL because of Mailman, sorry. :^(</p>

 title : The typewriter Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>One Laptop Per Child (OLPC) Typewriter </p>

<p>In January 2005 the MIT Media Lab launched a new research initiative to develop a $100 laptop – a technology that could revolutionize how we educate the world’s children.  The One Laptop Per Child initiative presents a unique opportunity for educators to distribute learning content to millions of children in the developing world.  For more on OLPC visit http://www.laptop.org  </p>

<p>Learning problems </p>

<p>Higher order computer use e.g. creative writing or programming,  is slow / limited until sufficient typing skill is developed Sufficient familiarity in learning to type takes significant time investment and practice Existing typing curriculum are boring, repetitive and time consuming  </p>

<p>The project idea is to develop a typing and writing learning application for the target users of the “Children’s Machine” ($100 laptop). The One Laptop Per Child (OLPC) Typewriter application delivers an interactive keyboard typing and language curriculum.  To increase the speed, efficiency, and effectiveness of typed documents, messages and communication on the laptop, it emphasizes simultaneous motor-tactual and language skill development, utilizing a customizable, collaborative and adaptive rhythm video game to maximize fun and engagement.  The Typewriter application can also be delivered to all Internet users with the capability to use custom curriculum.  Our initial language curriculla will be focused on English and Mandarin Chinese</p>
 title : The tysos Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Tysos is a 64-bit operating system written in C Sharp. The kernel is compiled ahead-of-time by tysila, the TYSos Intermediate Language Assembler into native machine code (currently position-independent x86_64 code packaged in an ELF-64 object file). Tysila itself will then also be compiled ahead-of-time by itself and the resultant object files linked together to produce an operating system that can just-in-time compile any other required modules or applications.</p>

<p>The resultant binary will be loaded by TLoad, a stage 2 bootloader in turn loaded by GRUB.</p>

<p>The base design of the operating system is a pre-emptive multitasking microkernel with all processes within the same (64-bit) address space. Memory-safety and protection against malicious code will be provided by Tysila.</p>

 title : The umlp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>UMLP </p>

<p>A tool for testing location based services. Features are: </p>

<p>- UMLPUserInterface for setting location, targetlocation and / or routes &quot;on the fly&quot;. - UMLPService,  background service computing the current location depending on the given parameters (from UI) - UniversalMockLocationProvider - an Implementation of the LocationProdverImpl which calls the UMLPService for retrieving current location. - Example application (bounty hunt) for testing the UMLP </p>

<p>With UMLP developers can change the provided location of the phone within the emulator while testing their application.</p>

 summary : <p>Memba Velodoc Outlook Add-in lets you send large files directly from Outlook using a variety of file transfer server platforms including Velodoc Enterprise Edition, Velodoc XP Edition, FTP servers, UNC file shares, Microsoft Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) servers and Amazon S3. </p>

<p>More specifically, Memba Velodoc Outlook Add-in is constituted of: </p>

<p>VSTO projects for Outlook 2003 and Outlook 2007 add-ins; A package editor winforms application to select and view files which are part of the same transfer and define options like compression and encryption; A transfer controller winforms application for monitoring, pausing, resuming and cancelling transfers; A Vista preview handler for previewing packages in Vista explorer and Outlook 2007; Plug-ins for Velodoc Enterprise Edition, Velodoc XP Edition, FTP servers, UNC file shares, BITS servers and Amazon S3;  Test projects; A setup project; Documentation.  Click here to watch the video (Silverlight) - Also on YouTube (Flash) </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Click here to watch the video (Silverlight) - Also on YouTube (Flash) </p>

<p>More informationYou can try Velodoc at http://www.velodoc.net. You can get Velodoc at http://www.velodoc.com. For more information go to http://www.velodoc.com/help and http://www.memba.com. </p>

<p>PrerequisitesTo install this project, you need: </p>

<p>Windows XP or Windows Vista, Office 2003 or Office 2007, .NET framework 3.5. To run this project, you need access to a file transfer server. Currently the Memba Velodoc Outlook Add-in has plug-ins for: Velodoc Enterprise Edition and http://www.velodoc.net, Velodoc XP Edition, FTP Servers, UNC File Shares, Microsoft BITS Servers, Amazon S3. To modify this project, you need Visual Studio 2008 including Visual Studio Tools for Office 2008. Our development and test platforms always have the latest service packs and windows updates applied. </p>

 title : The velodocxp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Memba Velodoc XP Edition is the open source core of the Velodoc platform for publishing, sharing, sending and transferring large files. It is constituted of ASP.NET Ajax server controls, modules and handlers for uploading and downloading large files. </p>

<p>More specifically, Memba Velodoc XP Edition is constituted of: </p>

<p>An ASP.NET Http module to stream the upload of large files (compatible with IIS7 integrated pipeline mode); An ASP.NET Http handler to provide resumable downloads of large files; ASP.NET server controls to develop user interfaces with file upload functionalities, including a multi-upload control, a listview control and a progress bar control; A web application which is an FTP replacement for exchanging large files with email contacts and which also serves as a sample implementation of the components listed above; A WCF streaming web service used by Memba Velodoc Outlook Add-In; A windows service to periodically purge old files; A test project; A deployment project; A setup project; Documentation. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>More informationYou can try Velodoc at http://www.velodoc.net. You can get Velodoc at http://www.velodoc.com. For more information go to http://www.velodoc.com/help and http://www.memba.com. </p>

 title : The versabox Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Versabox is a collaborative software project that follows in the footsteps of the original NitixVirtualServer (NVS) package for Nitix.  It provides an up-to-date Linux installation for your Nitix system that makes it easy to install applications and produce new pre-installed &#39;images&#39; that you can redistribute to others so they don&#39;t have to install applications by hand.  Combining Nitix and Versabox, you can easily build full-featured, simple, reliable &#39;server appliances&#39; running the application(s) of your choice. </p>

 summary : <p>The Webkinz Garden Tools is a set of tools in C# 3.0 that allows you to collect data about Webkinz gardens or plan a Webkinz garden.  The application targets the .NET Framework 2.0 and uses Windows Forms. </p>

<p>The data collection tool allows you to model an in-game garden and record information about harvests.  This data will be used to produce information about the average yield for plants and will be used as the basis for the planning tool. </p>

<p>The planning tool allows you to model an in-game garden and provides important data such as average income per week.  This is useful for maximizing profit vs. aesthetic value.</p>

 title : The wow-get Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>wow-get is a tool that interacts with wow-index servers to install and update world of warcraft addons.</p>
 summary : <p>wrsd is a World of Warcraft realm monitoring daemon that serves individual realm status information. It is loosely based on the WWW::WoW::RealmStatus perl module. </p>

<p>Application Overviewwrsd is very simple. It consists of an Erlang application that supervises two children. </p>

<p>wrsd_realmserver -- This gen_server process maintains the status of given realms using gb_trees (general balanced trees). wrsd_yaws -- This module manages an embedded yaws server to provide a public XML interface. The wrsd_realm module is used to fetch and process realm data provided by http://www.worldofwarcraft.com/realmstatus/status.xml. </p>

<p>Quick StartBefore you compile the modules you&#39;ll have to make yaws configuration change to set the public interface to the correct hostname and port. In the wrsd_yaws.erl module change the &#39;port&#39; and &#39;servername&#39; of the SC1 variable in wrsd_yaws:set_conf/0. There are two SC variables set, one for localhost testing and another for your (potential) production host. </p>

<p>The application also assumes that the yaws ebin is in the code path. If you havn&#39;t set yaws in your $HOME/.erlang file do it with this: </p>

<p>echo &quot;code:add_path(\&quot;/usr/local/lib/yaws/ebin\&quot;).&quot; &gt;&gt; ~/.erlangNow start an Erlang node, compile all of the modules and start the applications and its dependancies. </p>

<p>erl +A 1 +Ktrue -boot start_sasl +W w -sname wrsdapp -yaws embedded true -setcookie wrsdcookie
<br/>Erlang (BEAM) emulator version 5.5.5 [source] [64-bit] [async-threads:1] [kernel-poll:true]
<br/>....</p>

<p>wrsdapp@yournode)1&gt; make:all([load]), [application:start(X) || X Thanks to sasl you&#39;ll probably see a lot of output. Most of it can be ignored. As long as you don&#39;t see errors or application start failures you should be good to go. As per the update_loop start phase a process will spawn that will attempt to update the realm data every 10 minutes. </p>

<p>You can test the application by using the public www interface. Go to http://host:port/realm/Medivh.</p>

WIS is a search engine which search web pages on internet.</p>

 title : The frameworks Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Frameworks provides a collective of common functions, classes, service packages like fpdf, tranfser that are required or can be used by modules like article, cbb, planet, wordpress, mediawiki and more </p>

<p>user guide: </p>

<p>1 check the files xoops_version.php under /Frameworks/ and subfolder to make sure it is newer than your current ones </p>

<p>2 upload /Frameworks/ to your XOOPS root path: XOOPS/Frameworks/art XOOPS/Frameworks/captcha XOOPS/Frameworks/fpdf XOOPS/Frameworks/PEAR XOOPS/Frameworks/textsanitizer XOOPS/Frameworks/transfer XOOPS/Frameworks/xoops22 </p>

<p>3 check file names: for filename case sensitive system, make sure you have the file names literally correct, i.e., &quot;Frameworks&quot; is not identical to &quot;frameworks&quot; </p>

<p>4 configure preferences where applicable 4.1 ./fpdf/language/: make your local langauge file based on english.php, you could check schinese.php as example, or inline comments in english.php 4.2 ./textsanitizer/config.php: check inline comments 4.3 ./transfer/: 4.3.1 ./transfer/language/: make your local langauge file based on english.php 4.3.2 ./transfer/modules/: for developers only, add transfer handler for your module, or store the file as: XOOPS/modules/mymodule/include/plugin.transfer.php 4.3.3 ./transfer/plugin/: add items available for the transfer 4.3.4 ./transfer/plugin/myplugin/config: configurations for a plugin 4.3.5 ./transfer/plugin/myplugin/language/: make your local langauge file based on english.php 4.3.6 ./transfer/bar.transfer.php: set &quot;$limit&quot; for number of plugins that will be displayed on a front page; 4.4 ./xoops22/language/: make your local langauge files based on /english/ 4.5 ./captcha/: 4.5.1 ./captcha/language/: make your local langauge file based on english.php 4.5.2 ./captcha/config.php: set configs </p>

<p>5 Requirements for XOOPS 2.2 users: Copy /Frameworks/xoops22/language/english/local.php /Frameworks/xoops22/language/english/local.class.php To XOOPS/language/english/ And for other languages, after creating local language files as in step 4.4,, for instance &quot;french&quot; Copy /Frameworks/xoops22/language/french/local.php To XOOPS/language/french/</p>
 title : The houdah-webobjects-frameworks Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The frameworks make up a new major open source project to extend Apple&#39;s WebObjects application server. Granted the Houdah Frameworks can&#39;t compete in size with Project WONDER. Yet I am proud of what I achieved and believe I provide a viable alternative. </p>

<p>Most importantly though, you don&#39;t have to view Houdah Frameworks as competition to existing architecture like D2W or WONDER. You may view the Houdah Frameworks as a repository of utilities and useful code snippet which work with all WebObjects applications. Actually some of the code has been available for download on my personal web site for quite some time now. The custom qualifiers (InSubqueryQualifier, InSubSetQualifier, ...) have proven to be popular. You are bound to find many like code nuggets in the low level frameworks: HoudahFoundation, HoudahEOControl, HoudahEOAccess or HoudahAppServer. </p>

<p>Of course, there is much more to the Houdah Frameworks. Like the rule based validation system which will, of course, work with just about any WebObjects application. Or the rule engine, ... . </p>

<p>The real strength of the Houdah Frameworks is the web component architecture which builds up to a rule based CRUD framework. HoudahAgileComponents are meant as a modern alternative to D2W. The framework produces perfectly clean HTML which is to be &quot;skinned&quot; at the application level by CSS sheets.  HoudahAgileComponents is very flexible and allows for easy customization and extension through both rules and code. </p>

<p>The architecture builds upon HoudahViewComponents which provides the view layer. This layer provides large grain view components build from fine grained cells. The view layer could work with any control or persistence layer. The HoudahControlComponents implements a control layer focused on creating CRUD applications using EOF. The control components could be used as is: one would have to subclass an abstract controller for each &quot;page&quot; of the application. </p>

<p>HoudahAgileComponents extends the control components by concrete subclasses which call into a rule system. This makes Houdah Frameworks a powerhouse for both rapid prototyping as well as production applications. That said,  Houdah Frameworks are intended for use on in-house CRUD systems. If you were to create a public web site, you would need to work on optimization. </p>

<p>All throughout Houdah Frameworks MVC principles are taken to the extreme. Of course the EOControl layer does not depend on the EOAccess layer, the view layer does not depend on EOF and the control layer joins them. </p>

<p>BTW, I am pretty proud of the rule engine. It is based upon the same ideas as Apple&#39;s engine and retains file format compatibility.  It has the distinct advantage of depending only on the Foundation and EOControl layers. It may thus be used in code that&#39;s unrelated to the WebObjects presentation layer. I also believe that the caching algorithm is much superior to Apple&#39;s. </p>

<p>The bad news: What&#39;s missing is a sample application. I am still (slowly) working on that. Documentation can always use improvement. That&#39;s what the Google Code wiki is for. I plan to publish how-tos and documentation as time permits. I also hope for others to chime in on the wiki.</p>
 title : The lyricus Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Lyricus is a minimalist lyric reader/editor for Mac OS X &quot;Leopard&quot; and later. I started developing in part out of boredom, but also in part because I was missing something small to read lyrics in.  Before Lyricus, I used Firefox, but with the lyrics in one tab, you have to switch back and forth a lot. I could have used a new, sized down window, but I wanted to practice Cocoa as well! </p>

<p>Update: Version 0.85 is out (November 30 2009). This is a minor release, with one major anti-feature: Lyricwiki support has been removed, due to legal trouble on their side. :-( The only other change from 0.83 is the added ability to customize the text and background colors. </p>

<p>See LyricusFeatures for a list of features. </p>

<p>Two old, but mostly relevant pictures (please note that the toolbar can be hidden): The main lyric window (0.70),  The preferences window (0.76) </p>

<p>The download is up for grabs (10.5+, Universal Binary). Please, please, please report all and any bugs and/or feature requests, either using the issue tracker on this site, or via email (serenity@exscape.org). I&#39;m the only dev, and I&#39;m also the QA team. ;) If you don&#39;t tell me about a problem, I may well never find it nor fix it! </p>

<p>BTW, note that it is, and will stay, Leopard and later only. Apple weren&#39;t lying when they said that there were many things for the programmers in Leopard. </p>

<p>SVN note: I&#39;ve previously relied on Xcode&#39;s snapshots feature to take backups in between svn commits, to make sure that the trunk always works. Well, not anymore, because that feature is bugged bigtime. The trunk may contain all kinds of stuff now, including features that will never make in into a release. Get the latest tag if you want to look at working source.</p>

 summary : <p>Given a subset of the assembler instruction set, write a program and generate the Control Flow Graph for that program. Write a genetic algorithm that using the previously generated graph, finds a set of values for registries EAX, EBX, ECX and EDX that will assure the total coverage of the graph, in other words, performing the structural testing of the written program.</p>
 title : The testing-doctest Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ImportantTesting_DocTest is now an offcial PEAR package and has moved to the PEAR packages repository, please report bugs to the PEAR bug tracker. </p>

<p>IntroductionTesting_DocTest allows the developer to write unit tests directly in the </p>

<p> blocs of your PHP functions, classes and class methods. </p>

<p>It comes with a default runner that will parse all your </p>

<p> blocs and will run the extracted tests, running tests is as simple as: </p>

<p>$ phpdt /path/to/your/codeThere are several advantages in using Testing_DocTest: </p>

<p>it makes unit tests writing funnier, easier and quicker (there&#39;s no infrastructure to setup, you just install the package, write your code examples tests and you&#39;re done !); it ensures that docstrings are up-to-date by verifying that all examples work as documented; it enforces writing of tutorial documentation, liberally illustrated with input-output examples. </p>

<p>InstallationJust run: </p>

<p>$ pear install -f Testing_DocTestAnd to uninstall: </p>

<p>$ pear uninstall Testing_DocTestDocumentationUser documentation API documentation ExamplesA simple example A more advanced example</p>

 title : The azinix Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Azinix is software for monitoring and controlling networks.  </p>

<p>It receives packets on the host&#39;s Ethernet interfaces, and applies user-specified rules to these packets.  </p>

<p>Each rule consists of a condition and an action. The condition may refer to the packet&#39;s header and payload, as well as network state.  </p>

<p>Azinix implements a number of diverse actions related to access control, logging, statistics gathering, queuing, forwarding, encryption, and compression.  </p>

<p>The key advantages of Azinix include  </p>

<p>Performance: Azinix supports Gigabit speeds on cheap commodity hardware  </p>

<p>Scalability: Azinix suffers no performance degradation as the number of rules and the size of the network increases  </p>

<p>Flexibility: Azinix can implement arbitrary user-defined actions, in the form of scripts or dynamically linked compiled code  </p>

<p>Ease-of-use: The Azinix user interface is based on Tcl, which simplifies interfacing, scripting, and prototyping.</p>

 title : The brui Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Brui: Bean Reflection User Interface1. OverviewStatus: Brainstorming </p>

<p>1.1. ObjectivesThe framework support the generation of (client side) user interfaces for Java. The framework should work for all objects that follow the Java Bean Specification (so-called Pojos – plain old Java objects). In particular, the framework should be able to build forms &quot;on the fly&quot; that can be used to visualize and edit sets of objects and individual objects. The framework should be customizable, as Cascading Style Sheets were to HTML, BRUI will be to Java Swing/SWT components. 1.2. AcknoledgementsThis idea was taken from the second part of an Object Oriented Software Engineering Course (159.707/407) at Massey University. Motivations for making this project was it seemed that the material could be extended beyond the scope of the assignment. Also, it just sounded really cool, and there isn&#39;t anything out there that does this already. The original idea was borrowed from Jens Deitrich. </p>

<p>2. ParticipationIf you want to be a part, just drop your name into the wiki somewhere. I&#39;ll see you and maybe we can talk. </p>

<p>2.1. RequirementsJ2EE (or JDKv6 with Swing classes, however you get at those javax.swing files) A Maven setup</p>
 summary : <p>ABOUT CLIENT-OBJECTS FRAMEWORKClient-Objects aims to become a collection of stable and well-organized Java libraries that help simplify the development Java client applications that extensively use JavaBeans technology. Namely, it provides means to dynamically (runtime) convert POJO classes into JavaBeans allowing the developers to use their POJO objects with binding frameworks, such as JGoodies, without the need to create JavaBeans manually. </p>

<p>If the information below looks too confusing, please try the tutorial here: http://code.google.com/p/client-objects/wiki/Tutorial </p>

<p>Assumptions About The Client-SideOne of the problems in developing Swing applications (and GUI applications in general) is binding your data object model to each other and to the GUI elements. There are excellent binding frameworks, like JGoodies Binding, and in the future Spring RCP Binding and JSR-295: Beans Binding, that are very helpful in solving this problem. These frameworks operate within JavaBeans standard - a framework that among other things describes how one could &quot;listen&quot; to the changes that occur in the objects that comply with the standard. The use of JavaBeans on the client-side makes sense and client-objects framework is not trying to change that. </p>

<p>Assumptions About The Server-SideThere are established practices in server-side coding. One of the biggest ones is the use of light-weight data objects, often called POJOs (Plain Old Java Objects), along with persistence frameworks, such as Hibernate and EJB3, for data access and transfer. These practices are justified and are in wide use. Again, client-objects framework is not trying to change that either. </p>

<p>So Why Do We Need Client-Objects?Simply put, client-objects framework tries to make the above two approaches compatible. Why are they not compatible? Server-side objects - POJOs - are not JavaBeans and they cannot be used with a binding framework directly. You have to create JavaBeans objects first. Usually JavaBeans will repeat the properties of the POJOs and add property change support. If you manually write your JavaBeans you will have to update the code every time POJO interfaces change. It could also become a quite complex task when POJOs encapsulate other POJOs and contain indexed properties, e.g. arrays and collections. This is where the incompatibility is clearly seen. Client-Objects framework takes the responsibility of dynamically creating JavaBeans from the POJO instances. This is the major component of the framework. </p>

<p>The second major component of the framework will be a service wrapping library. Usually a service also originates on the server-side and &quot;talks&quot; in the POJO language (i.e. parameter types and return types contain POJOs and standard Java types). The library will allow the developer to &quot;wrap&quot; the services dynamically so that the POJO parameters and POJO return types become JavaBeans. </p>

<p>Our PrioritiesPerformance. We are focusing on the GUI applications, which must be responsive and have small memory footprint. Stability. There is nothing worse for the user than a crashing GUI app. There is nothing more annoying for the developer than a GUI app that crashes because of a 3rd party library. Size. Keep the framework size (the size of the jar files) as small as possible without sacrificing the above. Small dependencies. Keep 3rd party dependencies to the minimum. Currently we depend only on asm and cglib libraries and hope we will not have to introduce any more dependencies. Nobody likes GUI apps that need tens of megabytes of disk space. Modularity. Client-Objects framework will address several aspects of client-side programming. Separate different aspects and package them in different jar files. Clearly document the dependencies between the jars.</p>
 title : The client-objects Open Source Project on Open Hub

Look great, because our skinnable components look fantastic. Build what you want, because our suite is designed specifically for PHP, Classic ASP, and Coldfusion MX. </p>

<p>Benefits </p>

<p>9 cross-browser, enterprise-grade Ajax components Dreamweaver Extensions to drag and drop Nitobi Ajax components into Adobe Dreamweaver Cross platform support including Java, ASP.NET, PHP, Classic ASP, and Coldfusion MX An advanced Ajax datagrid featuring livescrolling, in-place editing, and rich editor widgets Richly designed Ajax tree, tab, and fisheye components for web navigation Includes Nitobi Ajax Toolkit used in all components, which can also be used in your web applications Subscription based, per developer, royalty-free licensing. Quarterly release schedule. Drag and drop Complete UI components into any site or application with Nitobi Dreamweaver extensions </p>

<p>Want to contribute? Get in touch with us (support@nitobi.com) about becoming an official Complete UI contributor!</p>

 title : The crud4j Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IntroductionCrud4j is a java tool that generates user interfaces for editing beans.  Crud4j supports ejb3 as a persistence strategy and a portal environment for the view. Creating a user interface that provides crud operations for your beans is as simple as adding the necessary metadata through annotations. The metadata can be provided either using crud specific annotations or seamlessly through the annotations of the selected persistence strategy, i.e. crud4j reads the ejb3 annotations to generate the metadata necessary to create a crud GUI. </p>

<p>DocumentationCrud4jDocumentation</p>

 title : The disorder Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>DisOrder is a software jukebox designed for multi-user environments. It allows users to pick music tracks for play from a shared collection. When nobody has picked anything, it can play randomly picked tracks instead. </p>

<p>There are two main user interfaces: a web interface and a GTK+ client called Disobedience. The latter is somewhat more sophisticated but only runs on UNIX-like systems; however most features are supported by both interfaces. </p>

<p>Tracks can be selected either by navigating through the directory hierarchy or by fast word search. It&#39;s also possible to apply tags to tracks and search by tag. Once a track is playing it&#39;s possible to cancel it if someone doesn&#39;t like it, or to pause it. </p>

<p>Sound can be played via either the ALSA or OSS (/dev/audio) interfaces; via the Mac&#39;s native sound API; or broadcast/multicast over a LAN. </p>

<p>Natively, DisOrder supports MP3, OGG, WAV and FLAC files. It&#39;s possible to add players for other file formats. </p>

<p>DisOrder&#39;s home page, which has more about it, including downnloads of source code and precompiled .deb files, is: http://www.greenend.org.uk/rjk/disorder/</p>
 summary : <p>ProblemOur project will address the following problem: given an academic paper or any general textual query, find a researcher who would be best suited to talk to you about it (based on their previous research). For example, given a paper as a pdf file, we would like to know who in the UW Computer Science department would be best suited to review the paper. Or given a phrase &#39;probabilistic motion planning&#39;, who are the people to talk to in the top Computer Science departments in the US? </p>

<p>SolutionIn order to answer this question we will build a statistical profile for a list of researchers based on their published papers, and do a cosine similarity between the query and the profiles to find the best match. Our program will roughly consist of the following modules: </p>

<p>Obtain the data and do some basic processing </p>

<p>Given a web URL address of a person&#39;s web page, download all the publications of that person (in pdf format)  Convert the pdf file to a text file  Clean up the text: Appropriate text cleaning like tokenization, removing stop words, and maybe stemming can be done.  Repeat the above procedure for a list of web addresses of multiple researchers&#39; web pages (perhaps given in a file).  Build a bag-of-word statistical profile for each researcher  Given a string, pdf file or a text file as a query, transform it into appropriate format, calculate cosine similarity of the document to each of the profiles, and output a sorted list of best matches.  Consider other applications on the statistical profiles, such as clustering people doing similar work.</p>
 title : The expertfinder Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Finite State Machine / State Chart Framework for building User Interfaces in Adobe Flex </p>

<p>RoadmapSCMXML (faceless) tags for quick scripting SCMXML-V (ui based) tags for semi-visual editing SCXML engine SCXML -&gt; Flex Bridge What is SCMXML?  </p>

<p>SCMXML is a stripped down version of SCXML based on MXML that allows you to insert HFSMs into your Flex code using regular MXML, bindings and events. </p>

<p>SCMXML-V... </p>

 title : The flexmachine Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The flexwires Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Components for building wire-based data-driven user interfaces in Flex. Yahoo! Pipes demonstrates a similar UI paradigm.</p>
 summary : <p>Flex on BSPThe Flex on BSP (FLOB) project represent a library of SAP BSP Extension Elements that generate Adobe Flex instead of the standard BSP Extension output of HTML and JavaScript. </p>

<p>They are designed to make it easy for existing BSP developers to render Adobe Flex User Interfaces without having any knowledge of ActionScript or MXML and to allow BSP developers to work entirely within the ABAP Workbench. </p>

<p>An empty, compiled SWF file is loaded into the Flash Player within the Browser. UI elements are then added to the framework via JavaScript and the Adobe Flex/AJAX bridge (FABridge). This allows for a simple interface relying only on JavaScript to manipulate the User Interface. To make the process even easier, these BSP Extensions encapsulate the JavaScript and map concepts to BSP friendly constructs. BSP Server Side Eventing and Data Binding are both supported even with the Flex User Interface Elements. </p>

<p>Also for all Input Enabled Flex UI elements, an HTML Document Form Field is also generated hidden to the user. On Server Side events, these form fields are populated with the current values in the Flex UI Elements; causing a post back to the server that looks exactly like an HTML Form. This makes the transition from HTML/JavaScript based UIs to Flex ones almost completely invisible to the developer. </p>

<p>Also included is an application (zbspext_flex) that is designed to showcase the abilities of the Adobe Flex Extensions of BSP and to provide code samples of many of the commonly used UI patterns.</p>
 title : The flob Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The fluidity-project Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The fluidity project is two things: a set of Javascript libraries to make creating complex AJAX apps easier, and a Java based web framework designed to make it very easy to fetch and send data to complex AJAX sites.  </p>

<p>About the framework first: The web framework&#39;s goal is to make it very easy to create rich web applications built on top of a solid business tier.  Allowing the framework to work with existing business tiers and data sources is paramount. </p>

<p>The main design concerns for the web framework are: </p>

<p>Keep the framework simple straightforward and light.  It feels like you have to fight most frameworks to get things done.  It shouldn&#39;t have to be that way. No &quot;Magic&quot;.  No code generation, inversion of control, runtime &quot;enhancing&quot; of classes, aspects, XML based bindings of classes to interfaces, hacked-up classloaders, or any of that other all-too-common-in-Java-web-frameworks stuff.  If you want to introduce any of those patterns into your app, that&#39;s all fine and good, but your web framework shouldn&#39;t force your hand. Very little configuration.  I don&#39;t know about all of you, but I&#39;d much rather subclass an object and override a method than hunt through pages of documentation and obscure online forums trying to figure out why my XML based configuration items I just activated don&#39;t work.   Right now, all the required configuration is in the web.xml file. Simplified exception handling by using runtime exceptions.  Exceptions are exceptional, they should be for when something goes irreparably wrong. </p>

<p>The javascript libraries include: $N node builder : A prototype.js based node builder that uses DocumentFragment and has a preferable syntax to the built in prototype.js &quot;new Element()&quot; builder. </p>

<p>BasePager : A prototype.js based client side pager control that is easy to wire up to AJAX/JSON requests. </p>

<p>BasePagerTable : Extends BasePager to add support for doing tasks common to data table displays (sorting, etc). </p>

<p>The project is still in its early stages, and is not yet well documented, but I&#39;m working on it, and there is a lot in there to dig into, if you&#39;re the curious type.  All code is released under an Apache 2.0 license, so share freely. </p>

<p>Right now all the projects in this SVN repository are Eclipse projects.</p>
 title : The google-thingbrowser Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Thing Browser is a framework for loosely coupled components -- eventually, distributed objects -- that can be intuitively and securely composed by end-users. The project covers: </p>

<p>An argument for object-oriented user interfaces to software components (and the corresponding end-user information model); A way for components to be accessible using the familiar Web browser user interface; and A plan to interoperate with &quot;plain&quot; HTTP resources, including HTML, both programmatically and in the user interface. Between them, these concepts have precedents in Squeak and other Smalltalks; Self; OpenDoc; Cyberdog; the OS/2  Workplace Shell; and Internet Explorer extensions using COM components. It is also similar to a project called FavaBeans developed by Ihab Awad and the NakedObjects platform. </p>

<p>To the extent that casual composition of components from the Internet is hampered mainly by security concerns, and composition by direct manipulation (e.g., drag and drop) maps very well to capability security, the Thing Browser project is largely about security. The Open Source Google Caja project intends to bring capability security to JavaScript, and we would like to start thinking about suitable UI models. </p>

<p>The Thing Browser work, taken to its logical conclusion, would either adopt or invent a highly improved component model for the Internet. Since we hope to have buy-in from multiple vendors on such a model, it makes sense to do our work in the open. </p>

<p>Eventually, the Thing Browser project will rely on Google Gears and Google Caja.</p>
 title : The gtkaml Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>gtkaml is an XML parser that extends the Vala.Parser (literally) and transforms all your tags into a valid Gtk+ UI class described in the Vala language. 
<br/>        
<br/>Features:</p>

<p>* compact XML syntax for describing Gtk widgets</p>

<p>* code &#39;islands&#39; (written in Vala) for signal handling and other methods/signals/properties/ in your widget class (so you don&#39;t modify the generated code ever)</p>

<p>* doesn&#39;t depend on an external library at run-time much more readable than the usual UI boilerplate (e.g. you don&#39;t need to worry about temporary variable names, or ever write hundreds of lines of code/markup)</p>

 title : The gwt-fusion Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Writing web apps today is a tedious and error-prone process. Developers can spend 90% of their time working around browser quirks. In addition, building, reusing, and maintaining large JavaScript code bases and AJAX components can be difficult and fragile. Google Web Toolkit (GWT) eases this burden by allowing developers to quickly build and maintain complex yet highly performant JavaScript front-end applications in the Java programming language.  </p>

<p>Learn MoreLearn about how Google Web Toolkit works, the features it offers, and how you can develop performance web apps faster with it. </p>

 title : The israfil-markup Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Markup is a system inspired by NeXTSTEP, XMLTalk, Smalltalk, and other systems that use an Object-Oriented, MVC, no-generated-code approach to user interfaces.  Markup consumes a markup file which defines the user interface and associations to application controllers, and then assembles the GUI components and links them up accordingly. </p>

<p>The result is that there is no generated code to maintain or override.  To build an application one need only create application controllers that implement your business logic, spec out your UI in xml, and off you go. </p>

<p>The core assembly runtime, and any dependencies are completely open-source and free for any use in accordance with the new BSD license.  An application built as a MarkupApplication need only include the dependencies (and Markup is built with Maven for ease of managing this sort of thing), and then ship the app.  A courtesy note that you&#39;re using Markup would be nice, but beyond the terms of BSD license is not strictly necessary.  Letting Israfil Consulting know that you&#39;re using it would also be nice.</p>

 summary : <p>Liquidity is a cross-platform, high-level library for creating modern animated user interfaces, based on Clutter and Cairo.  title : The menudesigner Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Designing menu driven user interfaces is a demanding task. The menu driven user interface exposes application&#39;s appearance to the public. That&#39;s why it should be precise and stylish.  </p>

<p>The main purpose of Menu Designer project is to ease the development efforts when designing menu driven user interfaces. An easy to use tools and techniques may transform developers into designers. The Menu Designer is ideal for embedded devices such as IP phones since it supports IP phone specific input controls and display features. It&#39;s the best choice for LCD matrix displays. </p>

<p>A project core consists of an object oriented framework. The framework consists of component classes and user action handlers. Application developer may use these classes or create its own.  </p>

<p>Some basic framework features: - consists of components - menus are compositions (composite design pattern) - ready to use components/compositions: pages, links, edit fields, lists, text fields, check boxes, timers, ... - page history - basic decorators - rendering interface (observer design pattern) </p>

<p>The framework is available in C++ or C#. It&#39;s highly portable and runs on a variety of platform&#39;s and OS&#39;s (linux, vxworks, windows). A special edition is available for low memory embedded platforms. </p>

<p>The final project goal is to develop simple and easy to use IDE (something like very simplified version VS .net). </p>

 title : The minui Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Simple in use, lightweight api for developing graphical user interfaces on MIDP 2.0 capable devices.</p>
 summary : <p>AbstractThis paper proposes an intuitive 3D user interface based on hand gestures, implemented with light sensitive cameras and reflective markers. User of the system can create and modify file, picture and video with hands. Tasks that are more complex can be done by using a programmable user interface. </p>

<p>IntroductionWith the advance in computer hardware and human-computer interface (HCI) field, user interface used in computer has changed a lot in the recent years. From punched card to keyboard, from text to graphic, from command to menu, computer users can complete their tasks more easily and naturally. However, most user interfaces we used nowadays still require the use of some unnatural device like keyboard. Extensive practice may be needed in order to interact with the computer fluently and effectively. For the elderly and young children, the unnatural interaction with computer and the metaphor feedback environment from it makes them afraid to begin learning. </p>

<p>Nevertheless, when we look at the home entertainment market, we will find an interesting increase in the coverage of age. More elderly and young children play electrical games, as touch screen, voice recognition and motion detection system is used by game consoles in home. These natural interaction methods proofed to be a huge succeed. It no doubt gives us the trend of future HCI development. </p>

<p>This proposal suggests an intuitive 3D user interface based on hand gestures. An inexpensive and easy-to-use motion capture system with light sensitive cameras and reflective markers will be implemented, for the purpose of recognizing hand gestures. The user will interact with the computer in a virtual environment with actions he would do as if in real life.</p>

 title : The myfaces-orchestra-goodies Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Apache MyFaces Orchestra aims to provide a simple way to combine a web-framework with a persistence layer. Typically, an Apache MyFaces Orchestra stack might combine JavaServer Faces, Spring and a JPA implementation like Toplink, Hibernate, etc. The underlying idea is to provide long persistence sessions to the web-developer - this is done by associating these sessions with a conversational context. </p>

<p>The Google space will be used to host non ASF compatible code, e.g. which depend on LGPL stuff. </p>

 title : The tupletester Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OverviewThe simplest bugs in a program are generally triggered by a single input parameter. The next simplest category of bugs consists of those dependent on interactions between pairs of parameters, which can be caught with all-pairs testing. Bugs involving interactions between three or more parameters are progressively less common, whilst at the same time being progressively more expensive to find by exhaustive testing, which has as its limit the exhaustive testing of all possible inputs.  </p>

<p>FeaturesThis tool is platform independent way of generating something close to the minimum number of testcases required to test features of a specified tuple size, (all-pairs, or all triples for example) .   </p>

<p>More information on the technique is available at http://www.pairwise.org</p>
 title : The usixml-model-management Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Software user interfaces have become more and more complex nowadays because of the industry competitiveness, which is impacted by the new expectations of users, who expect to save time, enjoy a comfortable interaction and a clear understanding. </p>

<p>The HCI (Human Computer Interaction) discipline became even more concerned about the increase of the user interaction complexity and has been working on models to formally represent all aspects involved on the user experience. Some models are already mature and make part of this project: Task Model (TM), Abstract User Interface (AUI), Concrete User Interface (CUI) and Domain Model (DM). </p>

<p>A XML-compliant markup language was created to describe those models in an easier way to persist, share and transform. This language is called USIXML (USer Interface eXtensible Markup Language). More information are available in the USIXML website: http://www.usixml.org. </p>

<p>The USIXML Model Management project is focused on managing the USIXML code produced in your organization, integrating the currently available tools, sharing the code with the team and providing additional services like transformation, generation and traceability.</p>

Built from the ground up to empower the developer to create widgets and interaction models that are distinctive and easy to use. uxPython comes with many standard widgets like textboxes,labels, gradient headers and grids. </p>

 title : The votebox Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IntroductionVoteBox is an electronic voting system designed by computer security researchers at Rice University. It is not an Internet-based voting platform; rather, it is software that is intended to be used on computer terminals in a supervised polling place.  VoteBox runs on standard Macs, Windows, and Linux computers. </p>

<p>The design of VoteBox is described in detail in several research papers, particularly our paper and presentation from USENIX Security 2008. </p>

<p>The project home page is votebox.cs.rice.edu, where you can find contact information and a general project description. The source code for VoteBox is hosted here at votebox.googlecode.com, along with instructions for setting up an election and additional wiki documentation. </p>

<p>Your task is to write a length unit calculator.  summary : <p>An actionscript SVG renderer. Lets you manipulate and render SVGs in actionscript 3.0, Flash 10, and Flex 3.0+ at runtime. LGPL license. </p>

<p>The initial version was created by Charles Dietrich and based on Rob Lanphier&#39;s svg2swf, with the the path parser and normalizer a port of the Batik microsyntax parsers.  </p>

<p>The current version was developed and is maintained by Lucas Lorentz. This version support more SVGs, but there are still lots of features to add. If it doesn&#39;t work with some SVG, please post to Issues. </p>

<p>UPDATE 03/10/2010 </p>

<p>I redesigned the library into &quot;display objects&quot;. Some advantages: </p>

<p>They represents the SVG structure and have properties like SVG elements; When you change some property, the object is rendered again. With deferred rendering; They can be cloned into a new object; Better events; They are easier to add new features </p>

<p>I intend to add new features only to the new &quot;display objects&quot;. So, the SVGRenderer and SVGParser classes will be deprecated. </p>

<p>If you have suggestions, questions, or just liked it. Send me an e-mail: lucaslorentzlara(at)hotmail.com </p>

<p>If this library is usefull to you, please make a donation. :)</p>
 title : The as3svgrendererlib Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ASCanvas is an implementation of the HTML 5 Canvas element for the Flash environment, written in ActionScript. Older implementations are available supporting Flash 9, however our new code base targets the Flash 10 player and Adobe&#39;s asc.jar ActionScript compiler. </p>

<p>This project is now available as a CC 0 / Public Domain resource. It is also available under less liberal licensing; though CC0 allows many provisions for areas in which public domain copyright is not appropropriate. </p>

<p>html:</p>

<p>JavaScript and/or ActionScript
<br/>var canvas = document.createElement(&#39;canvas&#39;);
<br/>document.body.appendChild(canvas);
<br/>var ctx = canvas.getContext(&#39;2d&#39;);
<br/>// Draw shapes
<br/>ctx.beginPath();
<br/>ctx.arc(75,75,50,0,Math.PI*2,true); // Outer circle
<br/>ctx.moveTo(110,75);
<br/>ctx.arc(75,75,35,0,Math.PI,false); // Mouth
<br/>ctx.moveTo(65,65);
<br/>ctx.arc(60,65,5,0,Math.PI*2,true); // Left eye
<br/>ctx.moveTo(95,65);
<br/>ctx.arc(90,65,5,0,Math.PI*2,true); // Right eye
<br/>ctx.stroke();</p>

 summary : <p>WhatcppGlue is a pre-alpha C++ library for openFrameworks. The library enables easy communication with Arduino boards and DMX USB PRO devices. It also includes Tweener / Caller functionality for animations and some useful math tools.  </p>

<p>DetailscppGlue requires the POCO C++, PennerEasing and Serial libraries which all are included with the distribution. cppGlue is in theory cross platform but has only been compiled and tested in Xcode on Intel Macs.  </p>

<p>The Arduino class can be used to monitor sensors (such as buttons, rotary encoders and motion detectors) and control actuators (such as servos and LEDs) and other electronics (such as RFID readers) from C++ applications without any Arduino programming (using the StandardFirmata library).  </p>

 summary : <p>The Distributed Family Tree is an open network of genealogical data and metadata.  In a nutshell, the big idea is that we can combine all available genealogical information on the Internet into a single distributed network. </p>

<p>Genesis, the current focus of this effort, is a software research assistant based on the Eclipse RCP. It provides basic data storage and retrieval, user interface, and software agent coordination facilities. It can be extended with plugins to access new data sources, analyze and correlate genealogical facts, provide new views on the data, and much, much more.  </p>

 title : The dgbgui Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Current statusThe project is under development and not yet ready for public use. </p>

<p>OverviewThe DGB is a distributed graph database, which enables the storing and querying of heterogeneous data in the form of a semantic network. The primary purpose of the DGB is to enable large-scale integration and analysis of biological data. The DGB project was initiated in 2004 and is a primary research and development project at the Central Node of the National Bioinformatics Network in South Africa. </p>

<p>DGB|gui is a graphical front-end for the dgb. It is written in Java and uses the Piccolo library for the 2D scene graph. This shows the results of the search &quot;All mouse genes described by sexual reproduction and tumorigenesis&quot;: </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Project website(s)The DGB project (Overview of the entire project): http://dgb.nbn.ac.za/index.php/Main_Page </p>

<p>DGB|gui user site (using the interface, tutorials etc.): http://dgb.nbn.ac.za/index.php/DGBgui </p>

<p>InstallationYou can download the latest release (v0.8) from the &quot;Downloads&quot; section. You should be able to just double-click on it in Windows or Mac OS X if you have Java installed.  </p>

<p>If you wish to compile the source yourself, please refer to the Installation page. </p>

<p>http://dgb.nbn.ac.za/index.php/DGBguiGettingStarted </p>

<p>ContactIf you have any questions, comments etc., please email me at</p>
 title : The digirobo01 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Background </p>

<p>&quot;Digi-Robo 01&quot; is a simple robot toy from a Japanese company Gakken. Robot movements are controlled by a simple program disc. This disc is actually a circle divided in 180 small sections. The color of two adjacent (inner and outer) sections (black and white) correspond to robot movement direction. If you read russian you can also read about it in my blog. Or just see the movie. </p>

<p>Inner and outer sections are both white correspond to robot movement straight ahead. Inner section is white and outer section is black turns robot left. Inner section is black and outer section is white turns robot right. Inner and outer sections are both black stops the robot. This software can be used to create and print program discs easily. </p>

<p>Steps 1-2-3 for easy robot programming. </p>

<p>Step 1. Setup your screen for easy programming.Circles on screen represent control points of robot movement. Each circle has a number written in it, this number is the number of steps (circle sections) that robot took to get to this point. First circle with no number in it is a start point. You can use the mouse to drag the start point to appropriate position on screen. If you select any other circle and drag it across the screen it will result in rotation of robot movement direction angle from the start point. Adjust your robot position and angle in a way to be able to fit the path you desire to design on your screen. </p>

<p>Step 2. Design robot path.Initially robot path as a straight line ahead is projected. Each circle is shown with dotted gray outline, this is because this is not the final robot path yet, only something that will happen if you choose to move robot into given direction from this point. We can call these circles as projected robot path. Also initially first circle of this projected path is marked as “selected”. You can see this because this circle has somewhat thicker outline. As you move the mouse along the projected path more circles get selected. First make sure the first circle (marked as 0.5) is selected. Right click on it. You will see a popup showing you the options to change robot direction from here. You can choose to move robot right, left, straight or stop. The last image you will see is how the program disc will look once you print it. If you choose next direction like this all circles before selected will become final circles of your robot path. You can change that later by unselecting them. Next part of the path will be projected in next direction you choose. If you select left or right the robot will make 360 turn, remaining steps permitting. Tangent ines will show however what direction will be taken if you will chose to stop turn during some stage of it and choose another direction after it. </p>

<p>Step 3. Print program disc.Use file menu to print program disc and check the resulting path with your real robot. You can also save and load program disc files easily. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>DownloadVersion 0.0.1Initial public release version.  </p>

<p>Binary JAR (requires Java 6) Example files (TXT) Source code (Java) Latest snapshotBuild from SVN. </p>

<p>Binary JAR (requires Java 6)</p>

 title : The eyepatch Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Eyepatch is a rapid prototyping tool designed to simplify the process of developing computer vision applications. Eyepatch allows novice programmers to extract useful data from live video and stream that data to other rapid prototyping tools, such as Adobe Flash, d.tools, Processing, and Microsoft Visual Basic. Eyepatch has two basic modes: </p>

<p>A training mode, where users can train different types of classifiers to recognize the object, region, or parameter that they are interested in. A composition mode, where the classifiers are composed in various ways and users specify where the output of the classifiers should go. Eyepatch allows designers to create, test, and refine their own customized classifiers, without writing any specialized code. Its diversity of classification strategies makes it adaptable to a wide variety of applications, and the fluidity of its classifier training interface illustrates how interactive machine learning can allow designers to tailor a recognition algorithm to their application without any specialized knowledge of computer vision. </p>

<p>Download the latest Eyepatch installer from http://eyepatch.stanford.edu/.</p>
