 title : The fallenge Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FallenGEFallenGE (Game Engine) is a complete solution for witting games in c#. The engine makes use of various free libraries, such as Tao, and combines them together into a nice neat package to make writing a game as easy as possible. </p>

<p>FeaturesA simple interface for creating games. Rendering engine written in OpenGL. Sprite management. Audio playback via OpenAL. File management via PhysFS. Supports all image formats supported by DevIL. Mouse/Keyboard Input support. Basic Shader support. Physics support via Physics2D (Work in Progress). A logical game creation process which lets you create various screens which your game may change between. ExampleA working ghost shell application written using the engine can be found below: </p>

<p>MyGame.cs </p>

<p>namespace FallenGE_Game1.Game
<br/>{
<br/>    class MyGame : GameManager
<br/>    {
<br/>        public override void Startup()
<br/>        {
<br/>            // Create the engine.
<br/>            CreateEngine();</p>

<p>            // Create the game context.
<br/>            CreateGame(&quot;Test Application&quot;, &quot;data/&quot;, 640, 480, 32, false);</p>

<p>            // Setup some reneder properties.
<br/>            engine.RenderManager.SetMaskColor(255, 0, 255);
<br/>            engine.RenderManager.SetDrawAlpha(1.0f);
<br/>            engine.RenderManager.SetOffset(-0.5f, -0.5f);</p>

<p>            // Add our screen.
<br/>            AddScreen(&quot;Start&quot;, new MyScreen(engine));
<br/>        }</p>

<p>        public override void Shutdown()
<br/>        {
<br/>            // Destroy the engine.
<br/>            DestroyEngine();
<br/>        }</p>

<p>        public override void Render()
<br/>        {
<br/>            // Render the current screen.
<br/>            currentScreen.Render(); 
<br/>        }</p>

<p>        public override void Update(float delta)
<br/>        {
<br/>            // Update the current screen.
<br/>            currentScreen.Update(delta);</p>

<p>            // If the screen has set next screen, change to that screen.
<br/>            if (currentScreen.NextScreen != &quot;&quot;)
<br/>                ChangeScreen(currentScreen.NextScreen);
<br/>        }
<br/>    }
<br/>}MyScreen.cs </p>

<p>namespace FallenGE_Game1.Game.Screens
<br/>{
<br/>    class MyScreen : Screen
<br/>    {
<br/>        public MyScreen(Engine engine) : base(engine)
<br/>        {</p>

<p>        }</p>

<p>        public override void Load()
<br/>        {
<br/>            // Load some cool media.
<br/>        }</p>

<p>        public override void Unload()
<br/>        {
<br/>            // Unload the media.
<br/>        }</p>

<p>        public override void TransIn()
<br/>        {
<br/>            // Smooth transition into the screen.
<br/>        }</p>

<p>        public override void TransOut()
<br/>        {
<br/>            // Smooth transition out of the screen.
<br/>        }</p>

<p>        public override void Render()
<br/>        {
<br/>            // Clear the screen.
<br/>            engine.RenderManager.Cls();</p>

<p>            // Render cool stuff.</p>

<p>            // Flip the screen buffers.
<br/>            engine.RenderManager.Flip();
<br/>        }</p>

<p>        public override void Update(float delta)
<br/>        {
<br/>            // Update the screen.
<br/>        }
<br/>    }
<br/>}Screenshots </p>

<p>Thanks toThe authors of the TaoFramework. The author of Physics2D. The authors of BlitMax, A language which influenced the design of the engine. The authors of SlimDX.</p>

 summary : <p>IntroductionIf you don&#39;t know Actionscript (or don&#39;t like it) but you would like to play flash video on your site, you&#39;ll probably find Flivpee useful. All the player widgets use JavaScript and you will style them with CSS. The goal for Flivpee is rapid deployment for developers without Flash / Actionscript knowledge. I believe there to be a performance benefit as well, though I have no benchmarks to prove it. </p>

<p>Your users will need Flash 9. </p>

<p>People Using FlivpeeIf you&#39;d like to be added to this list, email me or say so in the discussion group. </p>

<p> Me. </p>

<p>News2008-08-12Version 0.8 has been released. I&#39;ve had this ready for a while but I thought it was my duty to provide an example of the new features. I&#39;ll have an example soon, but in the mean time you&#39;ll just have to trust me. New features: </p>

<p>Audio playback (mp3). RTMP playback for audio and video. I tested the RTMP playback with a service I subscribed to for the purpose, but I haven&#39;t yet tested it in a real world scenario. If you&#39;re going to use this and it doesn&#39;t work for you I would love to help. Contact me in the Google Group or e-mail me. </p>

<p>2008-02-09Version 0.7 has been released. This is a complete rewrite over the previous versions. If you installed the old version, you should consider upgrading. </p>

<p>2008-02-07I&#39;m preparing a new release, so you&#39;ll see aspects of this site change in the coming days as I update the different sections incrementally. If you&#39;re thinking of using Flivpee, please wait a little bit. This is necessary because the new release is a complete rewrite. </p>

<p>2007-09-08I&#39;m re-writing the player. I&#39;m going to take it off haXe because the Flex SDK is open and I think it&#39;d be easier to debug the JavaScript if I just hand-coded it all.</p>

 title : The fourinaline Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Four In A Line is a multiplayer Connect Four game. It can be played on a network, or against an AI game player. </p>

<p>The AI game player uses the algorithm developed by Keith Pomakis but then rewritten in Java. </p>

<p>The network layer uses RMI without using the callback pattern, which ensures that the game will be compliant with firewalls. </p>

<p>Connect Four is a trademark of Hasbro. I designated an implementation of the game and an AI player of it, but not the game itself. </p>

<p>In case you want to reuse some parts of the project in a proprietary product, please contact me for licensing issues at address |julien_aubin_lm| #AT# /yahoo/ DOT fr . </p>

<p>Update information : the new version, 1.3.6, now supports to be installed in a location which does not contain spaces. It requires a JVM 1.6+ and brings a huge speed improvement when using the AI player, two new AI strength levels and a better UI. </p>

<p>System requirements </p>

<p>- Linux/Unix </p>

<p>- Windows </p>

<p>- MacOS </p>

<p>- Java 1.6 or higher, downloadable from http://java.sun.com </p>

<p>Launching the game - Extract the ZIP archive in a directory of your choice. </p>

<p>- Windows users : double click the fourinaline.jar file. </p>

<p>- Linux/Unix and MacOS users : depending on the environment you have, double click the fourinaline.jar file or launch the following command : java -jar fourinaline.jar </p>

<p>Note to Linux users </p>

<p>The game won&#39;t work with the GNU Classpath JVM. Please ensure that you have installed properly the official Sun JVM, or even the OpenJDK JVM. Note that under the OpenJDK JVM fonts may look ugly, especially if the Metal look and feel is used under your environment. </p>

<p>Then you must run the update-alternatives tool to ensure that the following commands point to the official Sun JVM commands : </p>

<p>java </p>

<p>rmiregistry </p>

<p>If you want to compile the game, you must also ensure that the following commands point to the official Sun JVM commands : </p>

<p>javac </p>

<p>rmic</p>

 title : The headless-graph-viz Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>So I am a Software Engineer that has taken an interest in the Eclipse community and their corresponding RCP framework. For our customers, RCP + SWT has provided a far better user experience than designing our same application around Java AWT/Swing. We&#39;re starting to provide an application that features network visualization. The problem I face is that all the Java graph/network visualization software we came across is written to use Swing/Java2D. As people who have developed with SWT may have experienced, sometimes bridging/integrating AWT components into SWT is not always an easy process. The more obvious issue is that you now have 2 different UI threads to manage, and the application can be more prone to deadlocks if you are not careful. A more problematic issue my team ran across is that the SWT_AWT bridge may not work perfectly on different Operating System and Windowing System combinations, Problem with SWT-popup-menu and Linux. Therefore, my team would like a visualization package that can use SWT natively. But, if we are to implement a successful visualization package, then we don&#39;t want to shoot ourselves in the foot if others what to use this software and wish to make Swing based applications. Therefore, my goal for this project is to make a visualization package that is abstracted enough so that developers can choose the GUI head to render; SWT, Swing, or perhaps other technologies such as AJAX or Adobe Flex. But, before I jump too far ahead, my first goal is to implement a basic visualization that can be rendered with SWT. Then, add the components that will allow rendering with Java2D/Swing. </p>

<p>I will also add that this project will start as a &quot;personal itch&quot; I need to scratch. Even if  my company doesn&#39;t choose to use my design, this project will start with the development of features that my team desires the most. Note that I am not attempting to refactor my favorite Java2D graph visualization software. If that were the only reason, then I would settle for the SWT_AWT bridge. I desire features such as spatial data structures to optimize the rendering performance, powerful &amp; flexible visual annotations, nested graphs, animation, etc. But, I have yet to find a good open source solution that incorporates all of the features I want.</p>
 title : The hiranipra Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Create a small world, create some life, and watch it go., </p>
 title : The holly-gtk-widgets Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Holly Gtk Widgets - A free library of .NET/GTK# widgetsFor the use of HollyLibrary.dll you will need:mono           &gt;= 1.9 gtk-sharp, gtk-dotnet,gdk-sharp, pango-sharp &gt;= 2.10 mono.cairo     &gt;= 2.0 System.Drawing &gt;= 2.0 Download the latest build from here:HollyLibrary.dll </p>

<p>Download the demo app from here:demo.tar </p>

<p>Featured widgets (with screen shots):</p>

<p>Widget  Short description   HFontPicker  A office like font picker widget   HDateEdit    A date-time picker supporting custom formatting options  HSimpleList  A simple list widget, inspired by the Winforms Listbox control ( has the nice Items collection, the OwnerDrawn property and the OnMeasureItem, OnDrawItem events ).  HSimpleComboBox  A simple combobox widget, inspired by the Winforms Combobox control  HRegExEntry  A simple entry with regular expressions validation. Has a small icon that changes if the content is valid or invalid.   HColorPicker  A simple color picker drop-down ( office like )  HToolTip  A nice ballon tooltip window   HIpEntry  A widget that alows the user to enter an IPv4 address   HTreeView  A simple to use TreeView widget, similar to the winforms one   HComboTree  A easy to use combobox with a treeview ( HTreeView ) inside   HComboFolder  A combobox widget with a folder tree popup   HColorPickerWidget - HColorPickerDialog   A adobe photoshop like color picker widget / dialog.   HLabel  A label widget with text position and icon position properties   HImageCheckBox  A checkbox widget with custom icons and text position properties  </p>

<p>Some utility classes: </p>

<p>CairoUtil  GraphUtil  GrabUtil  WinUtil  </p>

<p>In the futureCurrent TODO list is here. </p>

<p>AttentionFor win32 users: Library is not tested on win32 systems, but theoretically it should work. </p>

 title : The jot-lib Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>jot-lib is a collection of C++ libraries developed at Brown University, Princeton University, and the University of Michigan from the mid-1990&#39;s to 2007, and used in support of research in 3D graphics. Various projects were published as papers, including &quot;Dynamic 2D Patterns for Shading 3D Scenes&quot; (SIGGRAPH 2007), &quot;Line drawings via abstracted shading&quot; (SIGGRAPH 2007), &quot;Free-form Sketch&quot; (SBIM 2007), &quot;Coherent Stylized Silhouettes&quot; (SIGGRAPH 2003), and &quot;WYSIWYG NPR&quot; (SIGGRAPH 2002). </p>

<p>As of late 2007 there are no active jot developers. We are releasing the source code is the hope that parts of it will be useful to 3D graphics developers. Recent focus in jot has been on GLSL shaders (which are easy to port to other systems) and sketch-based 3D modeling. </p>

<p>This project was supported in part by the NSF (CCF-0447883).</p>
 title : The kachassa Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A FICS client using Qt library, </p>
 summary : <p>KanjiTori (the name has changed from Kanji Ateoni) is a 3D learning game, mainly designed for learning Kanji, but also useful for learning other things (even Morse code). The next release 0.4 will be able to handle vocabulary too.  The game is written in Java and uses the jMonkeyEngine. Currently, only Windows is supported. It is in an early stage. </p>

<p>You are in a maze (3D, first person view). You see some &#39;bots&#39; moving randomly through the maze, and every bot has a kanji (or letter, or flag etc) attached. In the lower left corner of your screen you can see a definition (or a question, a reading etc), and your task is to catch the related bot while avoiding the others. If you got the right one, it disappears, and you get the next definition. </p>

<p>One goal is to make the game as flexible and configurable as possible. It is easy to add new lessons and maps, and you can learn different kinds of content (unicode letters, vocabulary, graphics etc). </p>

<p>If you&#39;re curious to see what happens in this project, check the news page from time to time: http://code.google.com/p/kanjiateoni/wiki/News </p>

<p>Special thanks to Detlef Pierre Pfeifer, who gave the permission to use the flags from his website in KanjiTori. </p>

<p>Have fun! </p>

<p>Daniel </p>

<p>Mail: danielgronau@gmail.com </p>

 title : The krayserkraw Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Abstract </p>

<p>Integration of collision and graphics layers at sub-entity level </p>

<p>Motivation </p>

<p>One of the most astonishing features shown in Crysis is the tight integration of the collision and graphics layers. This can be seen in the way plants bend when the character passes through them, or the sensation of a completely interactive world where everything can be touched, bent, broken, shot or utterly destroyed. There is a sense that any level of world subdivision (tree, branch, leaf) that is convenient for collision/physics modeling can be mapped into a convenient graphics structure realistically showing the results of that simulation. The implementation of how collision is mapped into renderable graphics in most current game technology makes it almost impossible to think of achieving such close interdependence between both layers, due to both performance and most importantly, the wrong design in the interface of both systems: the collision layer is a black box accessible only as one-piece entities, no matter how many geometries it contains; and typical scene graphs lack both the capability to dynamically tweak the inner hierarchical structure of a pre-defined graphical construct, except internally (purely graphic animation). This is why ragdoll-character integration is so difficult to achieve, and why something that looks as simple and obvious as colliding particles looks as such an advanced feature. </p>

<p>This project tries to prove wrong the idea that graphics and collision layers are only capable of interaction at the entity (global transform) level. I will develop a basic framework for both collision/physics simulation and graphics that allows both a physics-controlled structure arbitrarily map itself correctly into its graphics representation. This interaction can be applied at several levels: </p>

<p>· Map rigid-body physics to a rigid, hierarchical graphic transform </p>

<p>· Map hierarchical, joint-based collision structures to deformable, skinned meshes </p>

<p>· Map arbitrary damage or destruction effects into its graphic visualization: bending, bumping, crushing, breaking or plain blowing the object to smithereens. </p>

<p>· Map arbitrary deformation of a solid mesh into a graphic mesh at vertex level (eg. cloth animation) </p>

<p>· Map arbitrary fluid deformation and dynamics into a graphic fluid volume </p>

<p>With this project I plan to devise an alternate representation for hierarchical graphics, and a flexible interface for modifying the internals of such a structure, as well as the internals of defining a collision layer.</p>

 title : The osengine Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>2D Scrolling Game EngineLe projet Old School Engine a pour but d&#39;offrir une solution pratique permettant d&#39;éditer ses propres jeux de plateforme 2D (très typés Super Mario World ©). </p>

<p>Grâce à un éditeur et à un moteur aussi généraliste que ce style de jeu le demande, vous pourrez intégrer vos propres graphismes, sons et vos règles de gestions (script lua). </p>

<p>Pourquoi avoir créé un moteur et un éditeur plutôt qu&#39;un jeu : </p>

<p>Dans la création d&#39;un jeu, la conception d&#39;un éditeur complet est primordiale. Cet éditeur doit permettre le plus de modifications post-compilatoires possibles, et surtout permettre à des non-développeurs de gérer les aspects &quot;non-critiques&quot; du jeu (comportement des ennemis, map). Dans la réalité tous les jeux commerciaux ont leur propre éditeur,  publiés ou non. Le fait de publier l&#39;éditeur donne l&#39;opportunité au joueur de modifier le contenu et grâce à internet, de faire partager son mod. Ce qui permet de prolonger la durée de vie du jeu (exemple spectaculaire de Counter Strike, mod d&#39;Half-Life). </p>

<p>Au terme de la programmation du moteur (voire en parallèle), un jeu sera développé grâce à l&#39;éditeur pour présenter ses performances. 
<br/>Documentation techniquePartie analytiqueCahier des charges Choix techniques Conception UML Partie conceptuelleConception générale Conception détaillée LiensDocumentation Doxygen du code source </p>

<p>Repository browser </p>

<p>RoadmapMoteur du jeuSystème (terminé) Gestion du clavier (terminée) Gestion du temps (terminée) Gestion des entités (en cours) Classe EntityManager (en cours) Classe Entity (en cours) Classe Player (pas commencée) Classe Enemy (pas commencée) Classe Dynamic (échelle, trampoline, etc...) (pas commencée) Classe Bonus (pas commencée) Gestion de la map (pas commencée) Classe Tile (pas commencée) Création d&#39;un format de map (pas commencée) Gestion des collisions (pas commencée) Gestion des évènement (en cours) Emis par les entitées (pas commencés) Par le clavier (pas commencés) Gestion des états du jeu (pas commencée) Menu (pas commencé) Jeu (pas commencé) Pause (pas commencé) Moteur graphiqueClasse GfxEngine (en cours) Mise en place d&#39;un contexte graphique OpenGL (terminé) Ajouter la possibilité de configurer le contexte graphique (en cours) Dessiner un Sprite (terminé) Dessiner un Tile (pas commencé) Gestion des sprites (en cours) Classe Sprite (en cours) Classe SpriteManager (en cours) Classe SpriteDefinition (en cours) Classe Animation (en cours) Classe AnimationManager (en cours) Gestion du scrolling (pas commencée) Classe camera (pas commencée) Création d&#39;une interface utilisateur simple (pas commencée) Pour le jeu (pas commencée) Pour le menu (pas commencée) Composants (label, button, image) (pas commencés) Moteur sonore(pas commencée) </p>

<p>Moteur physiqueRéflexion sur son hypothétique implémentation</p>

 title : The perftestharness Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Every coder knows that certain techniques are supposed to be faster than others. But no one has hard numbers.The Performance Test Harness is a framework for automated performance comparisons, along with a suite of code fragments implementing common techniques. Some are compute-only tests, for instance measuring the speed difference of traversing an array randomly or linearly. Others are graphics-oriented tests, for instance measuring the change in fill rate due to different AA schemes. </p>

<p>By giving programmers hard data to guide their intuition, we hope to remove the &quot;voodoo&quot; from fast code and give visibility into this murky aspect of programming. </p>

<p>Useful Pages </p>

<p>ToDo lists some tasks that need to be done. PerformanceTests discusses performance tests and how to create them. GraphicsTests discusses graphics performance tests for measuring performance of D3D9 operations.</p>

 summary : <p>January 12, 2008 at Plazes HQ in Berlin, GermanyPlazeCamp -- aka &quot;Plazes Developer Day&quot; -- was an opportunity for third-party developers to join the Plazes development team at Plazes HQ in Berlin for a day of learning, mashing-up, hacking, developing, questioning, and generally exploring the capabilities of the Plazes API.  </p>

<p>PlazeCamp was not a formal conference, but rather an open day for interested developers, designers, and people generally interested in Plazes and presence to come together in the same place to &quot;hack together.&quot;   </p>

<p>Now that the PlazeCamp physical event is over (see a wrap up of what happened here), this Google Code project can live on as a repository for information, code, and tips for using the Plazes API. </p>

<p>Project AccessIf you&#39;re doing third-party development using the Plazes API, and would like to become a &quot;Project Owner&quot; here, simply send an email to plazes.advocate@gmail.com with your Google Account information (and a brief summary of what your developing). </p>

 title : The pygpu Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Haven&#39;t you ever dreamt of writing code in a very high level language and have that code execute at speeds rivaling that of lower-level languages? PyGPU is a compiler that lets you write image processing programs in Python that execute on the graphics processing unit (GPU) present in modern graphics cards. This enables image processing algorithms to take advantage of the performance of the GPU. In some applications, performance increases approach an order of magnitude, compared to CPUs.</p>

 title : The robocute Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The sidelight Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Sidelight ProjectA lot of graphics websites are platform agnostic, teaching a lot of useful principles, but requiring the learner to figure out the platform specific details on their own. In an attempt to fill in the gaps, Sidelight is dedicated to making graphics programming simpler and more enjoyable for Mac developers. </p>

<p>TutorialsOpenGL Tutorials – An indispensable book for learning OpenGL is the OpenGL Programming Guide by Shreiner, Woo, Neider, and Davis. It is effective as both a learning guide and an API references, though there are other resources for the latter. Sidelight provides as series of tutorials based on the topics covered in this book. Mac OS X Tutorials - These tutorials go into depth on solving a specific problem in Mac OS X development. FrameworksFrameworks on Mac OS X are collections of executable code (in the form of dynamic libraries) and related header files and resources. System frameworks such as Cocoa.framework and OpenGL.framwork are located in /Library/Frameworks/ or /System/Library/Frameworks. Third party frameworks are typically included in the application bundle (e.g. in MyApplication.app/Contents/Frameworks). Hence, the frameworks are installed and uninstalled with the application bundle, without polluting the system frameworks directories. </p>

<p>Here are the Sidelight frameworks, and links to their respective pages: </p>

<p>Geometry Framework – A framework for reusable geometric primitives.  Physics Framework - Unimplemented (coming soon!)</p>

 summary : <p>SpritelySpritely is an editor that allows you to easily create sprites for Gameboy Advance (GBA) and Nintendo DS (NDS) programming projects. It is designed specifically for programmers who are just starting out in GBA/NDS game development. </p>

<p>Spritely is best described as a simple paint program that allows you to create a set of foreground/background sprites and screen maps. It also includes an &quot;Export...&quot; option that creates a complete GBA/NDS project - source code, makefile and all. </p>

<p>In conjunction with devkitPro and an emulator like VisualBoyAdvance, you can easily create your own GBA/NDS games and get started in the wonderful world of homebrew. </p>

<p>A set of basic tutorials is also available. </p>

<p>For suggestions/bug-reports, go to the Issues tab and edit an existing entry or add a new one. Send other comments to ɯoɔ˙ןıɐɯƃ@ɔɐʞʎɹɐƃ - please include &quot;spritely&quot; in the subject line. </p>

<p>Announcements and updates are posted on the Computer Science &amp; Engineering for K-12 blog.</p>

 summary : <p>Waht is this?StripExperiment is viewer  software, allow you to see the realtime rendering 3d model data. </p>

<p>This software have other feature, it is to build triangle strip data for 3d model data. User can compaer compare fps(frame per second) of vertex array with tirangle strip. </p>

<p>This software allow user to read two file formats are obj and 3ds. </p>

<p>This software is written in C++ with gtk and OpenGL. </p>

<p>Future tasksLoading material infomation in 3ds file Loading uv coord in 3ds file Imporving implement to build triangle strip How to run?If you feel like using it, please download source codes. And type make command in the source directory. </p>

<p>After, you type  </p>

<p> ./StripExperiment How to load file ?Firstly, I guess that you want to load file.  Please click file menu, then you will be enable to select three file format. There are 3ds , obj and original format. </p>

<p>How to create strip ?There is command making strip in create menu. If you click, This application show you a dialog to accept option. </p>

<p>Now, Option is one. It is to select ways deciding start triangle. </p>

 title : The tangame Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>TangameDescription:A puzzle game based on the popular Tangram puzzle, in which a silhouette is show and must be recreated using smaller shapes. </p>

<p>Manipulation of the pieces is done with the mouse with realistic physics. </p>

<p>Eventually custom puzzles, textures and possibly shapes will most likely be added. </p>

<p>In VERY early development, source may be difficult to compile. </p>

<p>Depends on Chipmunk Physics and Gosu. </p>

<p>Changelog:r7: Added window walls to prevent pieces leaving the screen. Fixed locking bug that made shapes disappear. r6: Lock shapes with right mouse button (still buggy). r5: Flip the parallelogram with F1. r4: Hold Ctrl when dragging to move shapes from the centre (no rotation). hold Shift to rotate without moving. r2: Tangram shapes appear on screen and are movable via the mouse. BugsSee Issues.</p>
 title : The terrabrowser Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>SummaryTerrabrowser is an internet browser for satellite photos and topographical maps which are obtained from the Microsoft Terra Server web site. The map data is provided by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and therefore only covers the United States at this time (although expansion to other map servers may occur in the future). Although a GPS receiver is not required to enjoy Terrabrowser, using one opens up more extensive features such as bookmark transfer, tracklog and route display, and live tracking. Includes extensive bookmarking support, tracklog/route rendering, image cache, address search, region download, and many other features! </p>

<p>Terrabrowser features built in support for serial based Garmin GPS receivers, and also supports Magellan receivers when combined with the freeware program MacGPS Babel). Download waypoints from your GPS to display on the maps, edit them, upload new waypoints to your receiver. </p>

<p>Terrabrowser aims to be compatible with the rest of the GPS world, so it uses the XML based GPX file standard which allows easy exchange (file, copy/paste) with other GPS programs for Macintosh, Linux, Windows, etc. which support this format. The NMEA standard protocol is also supported which allows for a &quot;live tracking&quot; mode to display the user&#39;s realtime position on a satellite map (cached or not). </p>

<p>BuildingRefer to the building instructions in the Wiki.</p>
 title : The thelab-project Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Pending for now!, </p>
 summary : <p>Google Finance includes a very nice, flexible chart of stock values and volume, allowing the user to quickly look at different date ranges and retrieve specific values.  Inspired by this, I coded a very similar graph/chart for a project.  I then decided to create an AS3 class for the chart so that I and others could quickly add it to any project with just a few lines of code for configuration.  The initial class was just over 200 lines, but with additional features the class has ballooned to over 850 lines of code. </p>

<p>For an online example, check out http://indiemaps.com/blog/2007/11/timeseriesgraph-now-with-flags/      This was one of my first AS3 projects, so there is likely room for optimization and recoding.  And of course, there&#39;s plenty of room for additional features and public methods. The time_series_graph is not a component, but rather one (1) .FLA file with some movie clips and two (2) .AS files with the charting and flagging code. </p>

<p>By Zachary Forest Johnson (http://indiemaps.com/blog) </p>

<p>Download the latest version, and run examples/charting.fla for an example of the class.</p>

 title : The twisty Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Filing BugsThe version of this game distributed on Market (0.7) is a year old, and we have a complete rewrite coming up soon.  Please only file bugs against the new version (2.0), of which extremely-alpha versions are available in the &#39;Downloads&#39; tab.  Bugs filed against the Market version of this app are fairly useless to us. </p>

<p>What is this Android App?This application allows Android users to play Infocom classics just as &#39;Zork&#39;, as well hundreds of newer text adventures written in the last ten years or so.  The package comes bundled with a few built-in games, but also allows you to load games from your sdcard. </p>

<p>Specifically, it implements a &#39;z-machine&#39;: a virtual machine designed in 1979 by Infocom for playing text adventures, which has been re-implemented on nearly every computer and PDA since then.  To learn more about the platform and all the games available, start by reading the wikipedia entry on Interactive Fiction. </p>

<p>Can I Help Write the App?To get involved with development, join the twisty-dev googlegroup and introduce yourself!  We&#39;re currently in the process of doing a massive rewrite of the game:  we&#39;re moving from a java-based interpreter (fairly slow) to a set of C-based interpreters running native ARM code (fairly fast, and compatible with a wider range of games.) </p>

<p>How Do I Get It?Download (the OLD version) directly to your Android device now (or get it from Android Market): </p>

<p> </p>

<p>The new extremely buggy 2.0 rewrite (not yet finished!) is available from the &#39;Downloads&#39; tab.</p>
 title : The uioe Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>we have moved to sourceforge!please visit http://uioe.sourceforge.netUnofficial IOE is a project that documents information about all the projects being developed at Institute of Engineering IOE, Pulchowk Campus (Nepal) as requirement for Engineering (Electronics/Computer) courses offered by IOE. </p>

<p>The Electronics &amp; Computer department officials do not maintain any digital archive of the projects that can be accessed online. They just store the project files (source codes and other project documents) in a computer that is used to demonstrate the project to the teachers. The result is that all the work done by previous batch of students is not accessible to students when they plan their projects (except 4th year MAJOR project whose printed copies are available in the library). </p>

<p>The aim of uioe@googlecode is to document all the projects being developed at IOE. All the documents (project proposal,mid-term report, final report, source code documents, etc) and the source code of the projects (if the team want to release it in public domain) will be made available through this website.</p>
 title : The vayala Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Vayala is a multipurpose chat client for developers. It offers a platform and an easy to use Eclipse plugin. Based on multicast technology, each client is automatically connected to one network of chat client without a central server or much configuration or installation effort. You add the Eclipse view, and you are connected to your collegues. In addition to basic chat functionality, you can also exchange files, graphics and much more. </p>

<p>NOTE: Currently in development. Not yet published any stable release. Nevertheless we are publishing some preview versions from time to time. </p>

<p>Use this remote site URL to install Vayala preview release into your Eclipse 3.2.x (valid for all OS platforms): Last &quot;stable&quot; version: http://vayala.googlecode.com/svn/tags/v0.1.4/vayala Development version: http://vayala.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/vayala </p>

<p>Please follow the installation instructions in the Wiki http://code.google.com/p/vayala/wiki/Installation </p>

<p>In addition we provide some standalone clients. You can download them in the download section here. It is just a ZIP file, extract it to a local folder and start the executable inside. No installer available so far. </p>

<p>FeaturesZero administration chat client No server required Multicast file transmission Easy drag n drop of images, urls, etc. Integration into Eclipse Visualization via browser Easily change your skin/theme (html/css) ScreenshotsLinuxThis screenshot show Vayala plugin running inside Eclipse on Ubuntu 7.04. You can see the bubble information in the tray. It will display new messages also if your view in Eclipse is not visible at the moment. </p>

 title : The vex-edit Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Constructs an abstract syntax tree from simple delphi-like expressions. The abstract syntax is displayed visually and can be edited. Concrete textual syntax is re-created from an edited abstract syntax tree.</p>

<p>Expressions are extremely simplistic, and can contain simple mathematical operators, integer literals, variable identifiers, parentheses, and an assignment operator.</p>

<p>The visual editor uses Java Swing components.</p>

 title : The wow-tcg-collector Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The aim of this project is to create a tool that will offline manage the collection of cards for each player and build decks. Cards from World Of Warcraft - the Collective Card Game</p>
 summary : <p>__  __    __  _     __ _                          __  __  __    
<br/>        \ \/ / /\ \ \/_\   / _\ |__   __ _ _ __ _ __   /\ \ \/__\/ _\   
<br/>         \  / /  \/ //_\\  \ \| &#39;_ \ / _` | &#39;__| &#39;_ \ /  \/ /_\  \ \    
<br/>         /  \/ /\  /  _  \ _\ \ | | | (_| | |  | |_) / /\  //__  _\ \   
<br/>        /_/\_\_\ \/\_/ \_/ \__/_| |_|\__,_|_|  | .__/\_\ \/\__/  \__/   
<br/>                                               |_|                      
<br/>              the first NES emulator for the Xbox 360 and XNA</p>

<p>The project page for this project is at:
<br/>	http://code.google.com/p/xnasharpnes/</p>

<p>The latest release can be downloaded from:
<br/>	http://code.google.com/p/xnasharpnes/downloads/list</p>

<p>You can get the latest source from our subversion repository at: 
<br/>	http://code.google.com/p/xnasharpnes/source</p>

<p>The development mailing list for the project is at:
<br/>	http://groups.google.com/group/xnasharpnes</p>

<p>You&#39;ll need to put your roms in the SharpNES360\bin\Xbox 360\Debug directory
<br/>and then run the emulator to deploy them to the xbox.</p>

<p>When the emulator runs it first pops up the prompt for storage devices, this
<br/>is so that it knows where to load and save your savegames.</p>

<p>It runs at 60% or 70% of normal speed while being debugged, but runs at full
<br/>speed when not running with a debugger on the 360.</p>

<p>This requires a creators club account which runs $99 a year or $49 for four
<br/>months.  You&#39;ll also need the free Visual C# Studio Express and the XNA bits.</p>

<p>To run on windows you&#39;ll need the Microsoft XNA Framework Redistributable 1.0:
<br/>http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=2E136A1F-F187-478C-9DA5-AAEB0904782B&amp;displaylang=en
<br/>and may also need the DirectX End-User Runtime Web Installer:
<br/>http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=2DA43D38-DB71-4C1B-BC6A-9B6652CD92A3&amp;displaylang=en</p>

<p>Controls:
<br/>	A = A
<br/>	B = X or B
<br/>	Start = Start
<br/>	Select = Back
<br/>	Up, Down, Left, Right = D-Pad or Left Thumbstick</p>

<p>	* With the first controller:
<br/>		Return to Rom Menu = RB (Right Shoulder Button) + Back
<br/>		Exit Emu from Rom Menu = Back</p>

<p>Supported Mappers:
<br/>	Mappers 1 (mostly), 2, 3, 4 (mostly), 7 (partial), 9 (mostly), 10, 
<br/>	  11 (partial), 22 (partial), 34, 64 (partial), 66</p>

<p>What&#39;s Still Missing:
<br/>	Sound (Might I suggest humming along or retro game music from the 360)
<br/>	Full Mapper Support
<br/>	NES State Saving and Loading</p>

<p>A Note About Sound:
<br/>	Josh Dersch, author of DotNES (another NES emu written in C#,
<br/>	http://yahozna.dhs.org/projects/NES/index.html) has given us permission
<br/>	to use his sound rendering classes when he releases the source code.</p>

<p>	Unfortunatly, they won&#39;t do us any good.  The Audio API&#39;s in XNA do not
<br/>	allow for writing to sound buffers.  THIS MEANS THAT NO EMU OR MEDIA
<br/>	PLAYER CAN HAVE SOUND SUPPORT ON XNA IN ITS CURRENT STATE.  I&#39;ve talked
<br/>	with MS about this and they said it is not intentionally blocked but is
<br/>	just a side effect of using the XACT system.  It&#39;s something that they
<br/>	didn&#39;t get to, which is understandable considering how fast they built
<br/>	XNA for us.  Please feel free to complain loudly to xna@microsoft.com.</p>

<p>Change Log:
<br/>	Release 3 (3-8-2007)
<br/>		Rom Loading Menu - Contributed by Thomas Aylesworth		
<br/>			Font classes from XNA Extras by Gary Kacmarcik at
<br/>			http://blogs.msdn.com/garykac/articles/749188.aspx
<br/>		
<br/>		Several bug fixes by Kerry McCullough</p>

<p>		New logo designed by Matt Turnbull</p>

<p>		Windows executables are now included in the release.  No need
<br/>		to compile it yourself to run on windows.</p>

<p>		New mailing list setup for dev talk at 
<br/>		http://groups.google.com/group/xnasharpnes</p>

<p>	Release 2 (1-28-2007)
<br/>		Second controller fixed (Yea for Luigi fans!)
<br/>		Made thumbstick work as an alternate control
<br/>		Battery saves are stored to disk
<br/>			(Be sure to exit the emu or it won&#39;t save)
<br/>		Crude rom navigation
<br/>		Emu remembers which rom was last loaded and will load it up
<br/>		Minor performance improvements
<br/>		Emu runs at full speed when not being debugged</p>

<p>	Release 1 (1-26-2007)
<br/>		Initial Release</p>

<p>Contributors:
<br/>	Bryan Livingston - Lone Coder - Developer &amp; Project Manager
<br/>	Thomas Aylesworth - SwampThingTom - Developer
<br/>	Kerry McCullough - SubOneND - Developer
<br/>	Matt Turnbull - BigBaconAndEggs - Logo Designer
<br/>	Jonathan Turner - Original Sharp NES author
<br/>		http://jturner.tapetrade.net/sharpnes/index.html
<br/>Shoutouts: </p>

<br/>http://FlatRedBall.com, Shawn Hargreaves (Allegro rocked!), The crew 
<br/>at http://NinjaBee.com and Greg Squire of http://UtahIndieGames.org </p>

 title : The aescla Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>AESCLA stands for Another Embeddable SCripting LAnguage. The goal is to provide an object-oriented embeddable language. The syntax will be based on C++ syntax, but don&#39;t expect to take a C++ application and expect it to be interpreted by an AESCLA interpreter. It will be using the Parrot VM interpreter.</p>
 title : The aliquid Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The aoofwm Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Aoof-Wm is a portable framework designed specifically for the development of multiplatform Window Management Systems.</p>

<p>Written in C++, the Advanced Object Oriented Framework for Window Managers is the interface between the Window Manager and the Operating System. Thus, it allows the Window Manager to use a functionality whatever the system is or provides.</p>

<p>Aoof-Wm is an abstraction framework developed to support the Toy&#39;d Window Manager, but it is also a generic framework which may be used for other purposes or by other Window Managers.</p>

<p>Aoof-Wm and Toy&#39;d are Student Projects developed at the {EPITECH.} - EuroPean Institute of TECHnology.</p>

<p>http://www.toyd.org/
<br/>http://www.epitech.net/</p>
 title : The aop-ood Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is the example code used in my various presentations on improving application design by using dependency injection, aspect-oriented programming and object-oriented design. </p>

<p>It contains multiple versions of the same sample application - a really simple &quot;banking&quot; application - that is incrementally transformed from tangled mess of procedural code to a nice object-oriented POJO design that leverages aspects and dependency injection. </p>

<p>There are three sets of maven projects.  </p>

<p>The first group contains the example code for my rich domain model presentation. This code illustrates compares and contrasts a procedural design with one that uses a rich domain model. There are two projects: </p>

<p>procedural-banking - the procedural version domain-model-banking - the domain model version Both projects uses Spring and Hibernate. There are a couple of different versions of this presentation. The Spring One version from June 2007 is available as both slides and a video. The Spring Experience version from December 2007 has the slides and an audio recording. </p>

<p>The second set of maven projects contain the code for my presentation on simplifying code with dependency injection, aspect-oriented programming (Spring AOP) and Hibernate. There are the following projects: </p>

<p>v0-non-pojo-banking - uses programmatic transaction management/security/etc and singletons and statics for inter-component references  v1-non-pojo-banking-with-di - uses dependency injection for inter-component references v2-non-pojo-banking-with-di-aop - uses Spring AOP to handle transactions/security/etc v3-non-pojo-banking-with-di-aop-spring-txn - uses Spring&#39;s builtin transaction management aspect v4-non-pojo-banking-with-di-aop-spring-txn-jdbc - uses JDBC v5-non-pojo-banking-with-di-aop-spring-txn-hibernate - use Hibernates </p>

<p>These projects progressively illustrate how using dependency injection, AOP and Hibernate simplify the code. You can find the slides for February 2008 version of the presentation here. An earlier version of this presentation was also given at the Colorado Software Summit 2007. </p>

<p>Finally, there is also the spring-mvc-jpa-banking project. This version uses Spring 2.5 @MVC and JPA.</p>

 title : The baynoon Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Baynoon is an object database server that understands and efficiently implements relationships (one to one, one to many and many to many) between entities using a simple query language. </p>

<p>Baynoon is written in object-oriented C++. Baynoon is also intended to be portable. Currently, it abstracts an object oriented threading API over pthread. </p>

<p>Baynoon is in an early stage of development, currently, the underlying engine is being written. Here&#39;s a brief list of the current engine features: </p>

<p>Constant row length tables, with variable-length columns being externally stored (one file per column). Row-level locking against writes. Writers block readers only in the row they are writing to. Integrated table partitioning. Table locking is performed per-partition in order to reduce thread synchronization overhead. Variable-length columns are only limited by the amount of data that can be carried in memory. In the future, support for VarCol streaming maybe added. Constant row length implies implicit &#39;id&#39; indexing, i.e an index does not need to be created for a quick look-up for a row with a certain id. Every Baynoon object implicitly has an &#39;id&#39; member variable. In addition, Baynoon&#39;s query language parser has neared the testing stage, Lemon was used for a parser generator, Flex was used for a tokenizer generator. </p>

<p>Everybody is welcome to join with ideas, suggestions or code submition (though you should read this first: BaynoonCodingConvention).</p>
 summary : <p>Our codebase has been moved to GithubSource code: http://github.com/xdev/blackbird Documentation: http://github.com/xdev/blackbird/wikis Blackbird is a fully customizable data management system built with the understanding that no two websites are the same, nor are their management needs. Instead of dictating a pre-defined schema for content storage, retrieval and manipulation (as most CMSs on the market do), Blackbird separates content, style and structure to adapt to any number of formats, front-facing interface(s), and any information/data architecture - be it an XHTML-based website, Flash site, XML/RSS, mobile content, custom API, or any needed technology. </p>

<p>ApproachBlackbird was developed out of the need for a flexible toolbox with room for more tools when necessary. At it&#39;s core, Blackbird includes the tools to handle most common tasks (handling ascii and binary assets, users and permissions, content relationships and data-mapping), and when a special tool is required for a particular custom function, it can be easily added (image manipulation, nonlinear folksonomies, etc.). The idea is that no single tool is meant to perform every task: sometimes you just need a screwdriver or hammer, other times you need a paint brush and full pigment oils. </p>

<p>FeaturesAttribute based categorization of content Flexible database schema to work with any information architecture Support for a combination of taxonomy and folksonomy systems Customizable standards-based XHTML/CSS user interface Ajax-enabled editing to enhance user experience and optimize workflow Object-oriented plug-in architecture for simple custom functionality Data mapping for cross-content relationships Advanced user permission system Comprehensive history log ExtensibilityWhile the core system&#39;s solid foundation is built to handle the common tasks of content storage and retrieval, Blackbird&#39;s object-oriented plugin architecture allows the core to seamlessly expand to handle any number of specific requirements. </p>

<p>Custom extensions built in the past include customizable reports, image manipulation, metadata filtering systems, custom user content management privileges, email campaign management, site navigation systems, media galleries, and many more. </p>

<p>LicensingBlackbird is open-source software freely available under the GNU General Public License v2. By default, any custom (client-specific) plugins are applied with the same license; however, arrangements can be made to provide full copyright protection for specific custom plugins to the client if necessary (additional fees may apply). </p>

<p>Our hope is that innovation would be a benefit to all, but respect that some investments are meant to benefit only the few. </p>

<p>System RequirementsPHP 5+ MySQL 4+ Apache 2 Other configurations are possible, if necessary, but might require some modifications to the core code.</p>

 title : The Brainix Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Brainix is a microkernel-based, Unix-like operating system.  It includes support for virtual memory, preemptive multitasking, asynchronous message passing, and the ext2 file system.  It was written from scratch and runs on IA-32 (x86) computers. </p>

<p>Brainix was inspired by (but shares no code with) Minix. </p>

<p>Brainix boots, initializes its sub-systems, then passes messages.  It isn&#39;t mature enough to support a shell, but its developers are active.</p>
 title : The brainz Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>BrainzBrainz is a simple, no-frills, object-oriented PHP5 API for working with the MusicBrainz REST API. Future releases may include support for AudioScrobbler/Last.fm APIs and MusicDNS. </p>

<p>Developer DescriptionBrainz is a simple, no-frills, object-oriented PHP5 API for working with the MusicBrainz REST API. Brainz is fully object-oriented, has complete API documentation, and is developed by a commercial entity that uses frequently uses the API. This means that that there will be long-term continued maintenance. The API is fully documented, and support is provided primarily by users, for users. Read and contribute to the documentation wiki. Learn to love code comments, print_r()&#39;s, and var_dump()&#39;s. ;) </p>

<p>There will probably never be any official releases -- only stable SVN trunk builds. </p>

<p>Available Developer ResourcesBrainz was developed for the WarpShare project, then made available as an open source project. I&#39;m always open to patches, feature requests, and the like, but know that I&#39;m currently the only person working on this project. Because of that, the majority of my development efforts will only go to bugfixes and enhancements that will be valuable to me in building WarpShare. If you want to see a new feature integrated, or a particular bug fixed, make it as easy for me as possible. Generating a patch and sending it to me is always the preferred method as it&#39;s the easiest for me. </p>

<p>Welcome to the project! :) </p>

<p>RequirementsThis package utilizes specific PHP extensions and other open-source packages: SimpleXML (for handling XML responses) PEAR HTTP_Request, which in turn requires: PEAR (base package) PEAR Net_URL PEAR Net_Socket, which in turn requires: Various PHP stream_socket_ functions. Tarzan is Brainz&#39; sister project, and at the moment, Brainz is still utilizing Tarzan&#39;s Autoload functionality and HTTP Response class. Eventually, these two classes will be completely separate, but that&#39;s not a priority at the moment.</p>

 title : The crylib Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>As a programmer, I personally hate editing stylesheets. Experimentation would be so much more fun if styles could be applied to GWT widgets using an object-oriented API. Goals of this API will be: 
<br/>- to allow programmatic control of styling of CSS widgets and a GWT application; for experimentation, tweaking, etc. 
<br/>- optional final step to instead export these programtically assigned styles as a generated stylesheet. 
<br/>- make it easier to work with styles using an API: one important reason: the style descriptions are different between JavaScript and in a stylesheet; e.g. font-weight vs. fontWeight. This is an annoying PITA. One API - define styles programatically/OO and with the ability to export as a stylesheet page as needed when deploying.

 title : The ctp-210-p2 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The cvphplib Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>AboutThis library started in the Summer of 2008 and is still in an early stage. </p>

<p>This library has two aims. Firstly, it bundles small and simple re-usable functions that I use regularly, such as functions to work on 2-dimensional arrays. Secondly, it features new solutions to more complex but common problems, that other libraries or frameworks did not solve in a way I was looking for. </p>

<p>Part of this library may depend on the Zend Framework. </p>

<p>This library uses simpletest for unit testing. </p>

<p>ComponentsOpen for trialThe following components are open for trial. </p>

<p>CV_OutputFilter (beta)forces the developer to escape output data, effectively preventing Cross Site Scripting caused by laziness. For more info read the examples, the unit tests and the Google Groups Thread </p>

<p>CV_Collection (alpha)A powerful collection class, based on SPL::ArrayObject. It is superior from simply using arrays for managing collections. Among other features, CV_Collection offers methods for sorting and filtering, similar to PHPLinq. </p>

<p>CV_Collection has a few significant advantages over PHPLinq. </p>

<p>A shorter, more readable interface. Names easier to learn for PHP developers. While PHPLinq reminds of SQL, CV_Collection widely re-uses the familar names of the standard php Array-functions. Security assistance. Both CV_Collection and PHPLinq use expressions provided as strings, for queries. This opens the serious danger of code injection. To assist in avoiding security vulnerabilities, CV_Collection provides support for binding variables, similar to what PDO allows for SQL-Queries. This way embedding potentially dangerous strings directly into the expression string can be avoided. CV_Collection can be used for collections of any kind of data. It however offers special convenience functions for collections of objects and database records. These include extracting a &quot;column&quot; from a database result set and using the database IDs as array keys. </p>

<p>CV_Collection offers a fluent interface aka. support for method chaining.  </p>

<p>CV_Filter_Input (stable)extends Zend_Filter_Input to allow proper handling of arrays, also submitted as a patch http://framework.zend.com/issues/browse/ZF-4354 </p>

<p>IncompleteThe following components exist in a very incomplete state in the code base. </p>

<p>CV_ORM (pre-alpha)an Object-relational mapping approach, that aims to solve some problems all competitors share. The recognized competitors are ezpdo, ezComponents, doctrine, propel, PEAR DB_DataObject. Some goals of this implementation: </p>

<p>easy out-of-the box functionality: include and run, no configuration needed (except for database login). Have ORM in place within 10 seconds. (Especially no huge XML configuration as in Propel) completely customizable model implementations (using code generation based on replaceable code templates), in order to allow conformity to any existing architecture be adaptable to the developers taste of style and architecture for models, in other words: use getters or public attributes or ArrayAccess or get set or whatever you like. It&#39;s up to you, you can adapt the implementation completely to what you like in a simple way. use your own custom class extension strategy, no forced base class as in doctrine and propel, no proxing object as in ezpdo direct access to objects related over several hops, not just one (one-to-many) or two (many-to-many) but through arbitrary relationship paths maximum re-use of data already in the database schema: your change your schema -&gt; your models change right away. retrieval and merging of the schemas from several sources: database, an array configuration format, your custom schema source. This allows to transparently add data not available in one source. Your database does not provide foreign key information? Or you want to change the name of the class member retrieving related objects? Just complement the missing data by additional configuration. This also allows to  tolerate database changes, no migration problems as in the other ORM frameworks DataMapper, not ActiveRecord, in other words separation of model and database logic </p>

<p>CV_Form (pre-alpha)aims to implement form handling in a way that is php-developer-friendly as well as web-designer-friendly. </p>

<p>PlannedPrototypes for the following components exist, but are not yet in shape to be put into the code base. </p>

<p>CV_ErrorHandler (planned)An error handling class that works with set_error_handler and set_exception_handler . It will offer the following features: </p>

<p>allows to specify include/exclude rules based on path and error code respects the @ operator to oppress error messages creates a snapshot of the variable state, when the error occurred for later analysis send E-Mails to a specified address accumulates several errors into 2 emails (2 not 1 for technical reasons) waits for a given time until it sends the next mail provides a GUI to analyze the variable state snapshops for a specific error   </p>

<p>CV_Controller (planned)A very light-weight controller class as in Model-View-Controller. </p>

<p>CV_View (planned)A very light-weight view class as in Model-View-Controller. The class makes use of CV_OutputFilter to provide convenient and secure views. </p>

<p>CV_TranslatorA class that assists in very easy to implement and yet very flexible localization. It provides support to be integrated into CV_View. </p>

<p>CV_Singleton / CV_Multiton (planned)Abstract classes to rapidly implement the Singleton or Multiton design patterns for new classes.</p>
 summary : <p>It&#39;s a project from ITA - Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica - Brazil, that is concerned about making a software for the Object-Oriented Programming and Database courses of the class 2009. </p>

<p>In this project, 31 students will do a team work to deliver a software to help NGO&#39;s donation control. </p>

<p>Database Teacher: Eduardo Guerra </p>

<p>Object-Oriented Programming Teacher: José Maria Parente</p>
 title : The doacoes Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The edge2d Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Edge2d Game Engine Edge2d version 0.1.0   Copyright © 2007-2008, Kevin Lynx. All rights reserved.  </p>

<p>OverviewEdge2d is a very object-oriented and plug-in-based 2d game engine. As a result of strict software design edge2d will be an easy extended, cross-platform and independent from any other 3rd libraries engine. 
<br/>  </p>

<p>Edge2d is absolutely plug-in-based. What plug-in-based here mean is that all the modules except the basic module of edge2d (also called abstract level) is plug-in enabled. For instance, you can develop your own graphics module to be an Edge2d plug-in and register it into Edge, and then Edge will work with your own graphics plug-in. </p>

<p>The original developer of Edge recommends users to develop their own plug-ins. That’s the main design purpose of Edge. That means you can develop your own plug-ins easily but not modify the Edge’s basic module. 
<br/>Edge2d is open-source. The original developer tries his hard to show his experience on OOP to every engine user. 
<br/>I don’t want anything, I only want to share my little experience on programming especially on Object-oriented programming. I hope you will enjoy this library from my deep bottom of hear.  
<br/>FeaturesStrict focus on 2d games, even if the graphics plug-in uses 3D low level API, you don’t need to know any 3D information. The core of Edge is designed to function-based, so it’s very flexible for you. But the helper library also provides an easy framework so that you can use the engine easily. What I really want is to provide convenient for you besides flexible. The engine is easily extended by its plug-in design. I will provide enough documents to teach you how to program yourself plug-ins. Edge2d is absolutely free. The graphics plug-in recommend the plug-in developer to use 3D low level API like Direct3D and OpenGL to develop graphics module. That means Edge2d will use 3D hardware to accelerate its rendering. ArchitectureThe release version of Edge2d includes three parts: Edge base, Edge helper and any kinds of plug-ins. 
<br/>The Edge base (also called abstract level) is mainly to provide your interface to use and some other basic functions like IO, log system and exceptions. 
<br/>The Edge helper includes some static library that has an easy framework, frame animation, resource management from xml and some other libraries taken from other library( like particle system in HGE) 
<br/>The plug-ins are many dynamic libraries in fact. These plug-ins implement the basis of Edge like Graphics, Image Codec, Input System, Sound System, IO reading from any kinds of compressed data files, Font, Operation System dependent modules etc. 
<br/> </p>

<p>DownloadsEdge VS2005 Binaryhttp://edge2d.googlecode.com/files/Edge_vc8_bin.zip </p>

<p>Edge Documentshttp://edge2d.googlecode.com/files/EdgeDoc.zip </p>

<p>Edge Examples(bin and source code)http://edge2d.googlecode.com/files/EdgeExamples_Full.zip </p>

<p>Edge Full Game Demo : Crazy Eggs Clonehttp://edge2d.googlecode.com/files/EdgeExample-CrazyEggsEdge_v3.zip </p>

<p>Edge Full Game Demo : Popo Clonehttp://edge2d.googlecode.com/files/EdgeExample_Popo_Full.zip </p>

<p>Contact the original developer (Kevin Lynx)zmhn320@163.com</p>

 summary : <p>Ener-J is an open-source JavaTM-based object-oriented database system (ODBMS). It implements the ODMG 3.0 Java API along with full OQL capabilities. The entire system is pluggable and extensible. By exchanging plugins, the database can morph from use in embedded applications to enterprise applications. </p>

<p>In the near future Ener-J will also implement the Java Data Objects (JDO) 2.0 specification. Ener-J also extends the ODMG and JDO APIs to resolve the vagueness and ambiguities present in both APIs. Other extensions provided by Ener-J allow for account authentication, privileges, transaction logging, auditing, and classes for more robust programming. An implementation of the EJB3/JPA API is also planned. </p>

<p>Ener-J is a exclusively designed for the Java environment. It is written in Java and</p>
 title : The ener-j Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Estela is a Domain Specific Language for ML model implementation (and testing). It is an Object Oriented Language (but not Object Oriented Obsessed like Smalltalk). Estela&#39;s API is composed by two parts: small generic API (e.g. Generic types like Integer, Double, String, Date and Object) and a extensive ML API (e.g. Classes like DataSet, Classifier, ClassifierEvaluation, Instance, and so on). Besides that, the language offers declarative constructions for some tedious tasks, and of course, a good array  manipulation support.  </p>

<p>Estela is a dynamic (interpreted), strong typed, not fully Object Oriented language. A dynamic language is the best tool for experimental computing. They provide you with a simple way to load and unload data structures (e.g. Easily dynamic class loading).   </p>

<p>Estela Virtual Machine (VM) will run on top of a Java VM. No ML algorithm run in complexity time less than Ω(MN) in which M is the number of attributes (columns) and N is the number of records. The Estela Virtual Machine has lots of opportunities to explore parallelism (e.g. Threads running in a multi-core machine) processing and reduce complexity time to Ω(MN/p) in which p is the number of processor. Usage of threads and concurrent algorithms should be transparent to the user.</p>
 title : The estela Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The fb-gtk-iwrap Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The flioops Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Why FLiOOPS?There are several programming languages not having native definitions for the whole set of Object-Oriented Programing structures (features). </p>

<p>This project&#39;s been created mainly to emulate those structures (features) not included in a wide range of object oriented languages (prioritized considering members&#39; free time and motivation). To achieve this goal, we will state a set of requirements to be imposed in order to enhance user&#39;s (programmers) source code and models. Also a minimal set of links, free articles and/or comments will be provided for the native features of selected languages. If previous free solutions are found for an specific feature and language, they will be either compared (may be re-implemented) considering suitable requirements or, if appropiate, referenced including hyperlinks to third party sites or by any other means. We discourage to include third party artifacts among project downloads. </p>

<p>We plan to provide the previously mentioned solutions and also simple usage examples and automated test artifacts (preferently </p>

<p>Unit-style tests...) in order to show the benefits offered to programmers, assure artifacts quality and ease users learning process. </p>

<p>As a consequence of member&#39;s coding efforts, some supporting libraries, code and/or utilities may be generated as well. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Por qué FLiOOPS?Existe un alto número de lenguaje de programación que no incluyen entre sus elementos sintácticos soporte para todas las estructuras de la Programación Orientada a Objetos (POO). </p>

<p>Este projecto ha sido concebido principalmente para emular las características que no están presentes en un amplio grupo de lenguajes con orientación a objetos (considerados de acuerdo al tiempo disponible y motivación de los miembros). Para lograr estos objetivos, se definen los requisitos a considerar para mejorar los modelos y código fuente que obtendrán los usuarios (programadores) al utilizar el código fuente y otros artefactos generados por el proyecto. También se pretende incluir un número mínimo de hipervínculos, artículos y/o comentarios acerca de los elementos que si están incluídos en estos lenguajes, para motivar la rápida comprensión de las potencialidades de la POO. </p>

<p>En los casos en que se hayan aportado anteriormente otras soluciones no privativas con objetivos afines, o bien se compararán (pudiendo aportarse nuevas soluciones) considerando los requisitos antes mencionados o de ser apropiado, se referenciarán mediante hipervínculos a los sitios apropiados u otro medio. Los miembros no deberán incluir entre los artefactos que ofrezca el proyecto otros de la autoría de terceras partes. </p>

<p>Las soluciones introducidas estarán disponibles junto con ejemplos simples de su uso y artefactos de prueba (preferentemente al estilo </p>

<p>Unit...). De esta manera se mostrarán las potencialidades de las soluciones, se asegurará la calidad del código propuesto y se acortará el tiempo de aprendizaje. </p>

<p>Como resultado del trabajo de los miembros también se obtendrán librerías, código y/o utilidades que darán soporte a la construcción de sistemas con especificaciones más formales. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>FLiOOPS... Pour quoi?Aujourd&#39;hui ils sont nombreux les langages de programmation qui ne contiennent pas toutes les éléments définis pour ceux orientés objet. </p>

<p>On présente-ci le projet FOOPS, lequel a été créé pour émuler les caractéristiques qui ne sont pas définis par défaut en chaque langage de ce type (en les considerant selon le temps libre des mêmbres et leur motivation). Pour réussir ce but, on choisit les exigences qui doivent être imposées sur chaque caractéristique afin améliorer les modèles et le code que les utilisateurs (dans ce cas les programmeurs) obtiendront après utiliser toutes les composants que nous offrons. On désirerait aussi inclure assez de liens, articles, peut-être remarques, tous en rapport aux particularités vraiment définies par la syntaxe. </p>

<p>Dans les cas où on ait ailleurs apporté d&#39;autres solutions pas restreinte en ayant un but similaire, on essaiera soit de les comparer (en puvant apporter de nouvelles alternatives de résolution) en considérant les exigences déjà prevues, soit de les faire référence en présentant des liens aux pages où on puisse en savoir plus. Parmi les composants livrés par le projet on ne trouvera aucun dont les auteurs ne soyent pas de mêmbres du projet. </p>

<p>Les composants livrés par le projet seront acompagnés par exemples d&#39;utilisation et épreuves (préférablement celles du type </p>

<p>Unit...). Ainsi on assurera la qualité du code proposé et les programmeurs pourront voir leurs bienfaits, en les utilisant plus rapidement. </p>

<p>En conséquence on aura à la main aussi d&#39;autres composants et code d&#39;aide à spécifier les logiciels plus corrèctement.</p>

 summary : <p>This project has been moved. Its current name is FLiOOPS.</p>
 title : The gasprog Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Academic project on object oriented technologies subject.  The main goal of this priject is to show main principles of object-oriented design, analysis and programming. </p>

 title : The gel2 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Google Experimental Language #2 (GEL2) is an experimental general-purpose object-oriented programming language.  GEL2 is essentially a subset of C#, extended with an ownership-based type system which allows GEL2 to free memory safely and deterministically without using a garbage collector.</p>

<p>This implementation of GEL2 includes an interpreter and a compiler which generates C++ code.  The implementation is mostly intended as an experimental prototype intended to demonstrate the viability of a type system based on ownership.  The language is large enough to write useful programs, such as the GEL2 interpreter/compiler itself.</p>

<p>GEL2 originated as a research project I developed while working at Google.  I&#39;d like to thank Google for allowing me to release GEL2 as open source.</p>
 title : The giocondo Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Giocondo allow you to easily create GUI applications that runs both on the web and standalone with the same code. </p>

<p>You only need to know PHP. No knowledge of HTML, CSS, Javascript and AJAX is required, except for defining the static content of pages or changing the default style. </p>

<p>Giocondo follows the KISS principle and uses an object based (not full object oriented) API for constructing GUI by composition (a la Tcl). </p>

<p>Ancillary libraries provided are: </p>

<p>a database library which doesn&#39;t use any abstractions (e.g. relational to object mappings). You just code queries in an almost-standard SQL which is then parsed and converted to the specific implementation dialect automagically. At last the full power and simplicity of SQL are in your hands regardless of the RDBMS you have. a privilege system to check and grant privileges in your application without having to code a certain test twice. It allow fine grane control.</p>
 title : The gmegoal Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Generic Object-oriented Adapter Language (GOAL) is a Generic Modeling Environment (GME) paradigm for building applications in abstract and then generating C++ and Java code from the model. </p>

<p>The roadmap for GOAL currently includes four adapters that other DSMLs or paradigms may contain or have models inherit from: Module Adapter, Class Adapter, Code Adapter, and Conditions Adapter. Of these adapters, the last two will probably be the more interesting adapters for other DSMLs and paradigms. Module Adapter and Class Adapter are more standalone adapters for people constructing solutions with GOAL exclusively. </p>

<p>The core interpreter for GOAL will likely be written in C++ using either BON2 or the UDM framework.</p>
 title : The gnupool Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>POOL is free software product, POOL is under development in WikiOcean, Pune, India. We call it as Pure Object Oriented Language.. </p>

<p>POOL is completely developed in JAVA programming language. For the GUI we used HTML, JSP, Servlet and Postgre SQL as Database. </p>

<p>This product is based on Object Oriented concepts for the data. The objects and its properties are stored as Master-PL. Each type of object is stored in Master and its properties in property Detail. </p>

<p>There are two ways of giving input to the system and taking output from the system. The first one is through SMS(short message service). There is a command format for adding, modifying, deleting and retrieving from database. It?s like a SMS Server. The receive thread reads incoming sms and forwards it to Control Module which after processing it generates response and passes it to sending thread. The other way of interacting with the project is through web. Every web page displayed is a webreport which uses one or more reports to display data. A webreport can contain other webreports in it. When each time a request comes by clicking a link or a button the incoming request parameters are passed to WebReportGenerator Module which depending upon request generates a string of html tags which is sent to client browser.</p>
 summary : <p>Pseudo-spectral methods library, </p>

 title : The greqo Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Greqo stands for Google REQuest Object.  It provides an object-oriented library for accessing Google services in PHP.  It uses the Google Client Login interface with the PEAR HTTP Client under the GPL license. </p>

<p>Greqo 4, a greatly improved branch of the Greqo library that has been developed specifically for PHP4, has been released.  See the README file for installation and basic usage information. </p>

<p>Every effort has been made to keep the code clean, readable, and well-commented.  For usage details, review the unit and acceptance test scripts included in the test directory. </p>

<p>Latest Updates greqo 4 released (2009.05.23)  Now available for download. </p>

<p> deprecated downloads (2009.05.09)  With the pending release of Greqo 4, I&#39;ve deprecated the existing downloads.  If you need something for immediate use, I suggest checking out the source directly from the svn repository.  For the old downloads, see the deprecated section under downloads. </p>

<p> php4 branch (2008.12.23)  One of my New Year&#39;s Resolutions is to get this project cleaned up and order.  The first step will be stabilizing a php4 branch.  Once that&#39;s complete, I plan to move to PHP5 development as the sun has just about set on PHP4. </p>

<p> v0.9 tagged (2008.08.16)  May start making some new updates.  Locally, I&#39;ve added a couple new features, like publication date settings.  But before I committed anything new, I wanted to make sure that I tagged v0.9.  It also remains available in the download section.</p>

 title : The helpr Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Drawing on ITIL fundamentals, helpr is a lightweight object oriented helpdesk solution powered by PHP and MySQL. Extensions can be written to enable new functionality.</p>
 summary : <p>Hyper Object Table: HOTThis project intends to implement a database engine for the Common Language Runtime. </p>

<p>The objective is to meet the following objectives: </p>

<p>Object-oriented model, with multiple inheritance. Allow fields to be decimals, dates, strings, discrete values (enumerations), references to other objects, bags, and lists. Be ACID compliant. Allow persistence. </p>

<p>First release expected in Summer 2008.</p>
 title : The hyper-object-table Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ISARA is a file manager written in PHP. </p>

<p>(Planned) Features:cut, copy, paste, create, rename, view and edit files and directories (not complete implemented) set file/directory permissions (planned) zip/unzip files (planned)  uploads (planned) php5+ compatible / as much as OOP as possible (rewrite in progress) I18n (english, german etc.) mimetype icons / images thumbs (in progress, by antibushist) Security:Works with PHP classes only (no shell/exec) input filter (planned) Standards:outputs clean XHTML Code XML export of whole directories (planned) AuthorI started this project because the projects out there were not exactly what I had in mind. Some are too complex to use, others have a huge filesize and some projects don&#39;t care about  aesthetics or usability. </p>

<p>I&#39;m no full-fledged programmer, so don&#39;t bawl my project out. If you think the code could be better, feel free to enhance it and join the project. </p>

<p>FAQQ: How do I join the project?
<br/>A: http://groups.google.com/group/isara_php - join the group and contact me </p>

<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;13.6.1		File
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;13.6.2		Methods:

<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;13.6.3		ByteStream:

<p>Introduction
<br/>Important Terms
<br/>&amp;nbsp;
<br/>Thread	Beans	Native Code	Object
<br/>Class	Method	Parameter	Constructor

<br/>Bug	Compiler	Interpreter	HTML
