<br/>Super	JVM	Parameter</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;</p>

<p>Object: Object is a living run-time entity .We can clearly understand what an object is by examining various objects .A cycle is an object .A Bike is an Object. Man is an Object and so on …let us see what made it as objects
<br/>&amp;nbsp;A Cycle has a name (attribute).A cycle has a chain (attribute) .A cycle contains pedals (attribute).we can use cycle for some functions like riding.(function). When we consider a man he will he will have a name(attribute),hands(attributes),legs(attribute)
<br/>Using his hands he will do some work (function)using his legs he will walk(function) and he has some more functions like running ,eating ,talking, sleeping, and so on(functions)…
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Man Object</p>

<p>Name
<br/>&amp;nbsp;Eyes
<br/>Hands	Legs
<br/>Walk()
<br/>Seeing()
<br/>Sleeping()
<br/>Eating()</p>

<p>So man cycle are Objects because they have some attributes and functions</p>

<p>Object= variables(attributes) +methods (functions)
<br/>&amp;nbsp;Functions are called as methods in java</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;
<br/>&amp;nbsp;
<br/>Therefore we can define an object as a runtime entity (which will be created in the program execution</p>

<p>Class: Before knowing about a class first you should be familiar with object, which I explained above. A class is proto type or blue print of an object
<br/>Which are mostly equals to structs and unions in C++ C languages, with little differences
<br/>Class defines the object. The definition of object is class
<br/>Consider the following code in  JAVA</p>

<p>class demo1
<br/>{
<br/>int var1;
<br/>String var2;
<br/>void method1()
<br/>{
<br/>//method 1 Code
<br/>}
<br/>void mathod2()
<br/>{
<br/>// method 2 code
<br/>}
<br/>}
<br/>here demo1 is class name ,var1,var2 are variables of type int and String(don’t be confused or temper you will come to all these in following sections) and  method1(),method2() are methods</p>

<p>Data Types:</p>

<p>In our daily life, we use many things for many purposes .we use calculators for calculations. we use *** for ***.and so on. Like that , we create objects for several purposes which are described according to class definition. Therefore, that object is data type of that class .java provides eights built in data types or simple data types, or primitive data types. They are
<br/>&amp;nbsp;
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Diagram		Primitive data types
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Numbers	Characters	Boolean
<br/>Integers		Floating points	char			boolean</p>

<p>byte short  int long 	float double</p>

<p>Operator precedence.
<br/>Operator 	Notes
<br/>. [] () 	Parentheses (()) are used to group expressions and to pass parameters;
<br/>&amp;nbsp;dot  (.) is used for access to methods and variables within objects and classes
<br/>&amp;nbsp;square brackets ([]) are used for arrays
<br/>++ -- ! ~
<br/>&amp;nbsp;
<br/>* / % 	Multiplication, division, modulus
<br/>+ -	Addition, subtraction
<br/>&lt;&lt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; 	Bitwise left and right shift
<br/>&lt; &gt; &lt;= &gt;= 	Relational comparison tests
<br/>== != 	Equality
<br/>&amp; 	AND
<br/>^ 	XOR
<br/>| 	OR
<br/>&amp;&amp; 	Logical AND
<br/>|| 	Logical OR
<br/>? : 	Shorthand for if...then...else (also Called Condition Variable)
<br/>= += -= *= /= %= ^= Various assignments
<br/>&amp;= |= &lt;&lt;= &gt;&gt;= &gt;&gt;&gt;= 	More assignments</p>
 title : The javascriptbase Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>JSBaseJavascript Object Oriented Programming made easy </p>

<p>JSBase is based on the implementation of simple concepts, and the maximum use of the Javascript language strengths; creating a simple, clean, methodical and easily extensible development process to programming in an object oriented way in Javascript. </p>

<p>Main conceptsMembersAn object member is the generalization of properties and methods, so if we talk about an object member it could be a property or a method of that object. </p>

<p>Object PathJavascript implements objects as associatives arrays, so why don&#39;t we just exploit this   functionality ... </p>

<p>Let&#39;s take a look at an example </p>

<p>var myObj = {
<br/>   member1: {
<br/>      submember11: &#39;submember11-Data&#39;,
<br/>      submember12: &#39;submember12-Data&#39;
<br/>   },
<br/>   member2: {
<br/>      submember21: &#39;submember21-Data&#39;,
<br/>      submember22: &#39;submember22-Data&#39;
<br/>   }
<br/>};If you want to assign a value to member1 in myObj, you have two ways </p>

<p>This one </p>

<p>myObj.member1 = {
<br/>   submember11: &#39;new-submember11-Data&#39;,
<br/>   submember12: &#39;new-submember12-Data&#39;
<br/>};Or This one </p>

<p>myObj[&#39;member1&#39;] = {
<br/>   submember11: &#39;new-submember11-Data&#39;,
<br/>   submember12: &#39;new-submember12-Data&#39;
<br/>};The second way provides us a dynamic member setting. In the example we used &#39;member1&#39; but we could have used &#39;member2&#39; or even &#39;member3&#39; and Javascript would have created the new member with the value passed. This use of the language provides a way to decide which member should be set at execution time providing an extremely powerful tool for programmers. </p>

<p>This is a great functionality, but it has just one problem; for each level we will have to write a pair of brackets containing the member name. </p>

<p>So, if we want to assign a value to submember11 at execution time we have to use </p>

<p>myObj[&#39;member1&#39;][&#39;submember11&#39;] = &#39;new-submember11-Data&#39;;If we take a closer look, we will notice that we have used two pairs of brackets; this makes it impossible to vary the number of levels dynamically. </p>

<p>Here is where JSBase comes to provide a solution. Let&#39;s take a look at an example </p>

<p>JSBase.setObjectPath.call(myObj, [&#39;member1&#39;, &#39;submember11&#39;], &#39;new-submember11-Data&#39;);&#39;submember11&#39; is an Object Path </p>

<p>Checking functionsIn most of cases, you have to do certain validation process to data before setting it. It could happen that some of your data could share some validation process with other data of the same class or perhaps another one, maybe the type checking, or something else not so obvious. For example you could have two classes and both of them have an email field, so the validation process for both fields would be the same. Apart from this, if you separate validation from the main implementation of the class, you are giving to the class a more tidy and cleaner definition, and also, you can reuse your validation functions in other classes. </p>

<p>Let&#39;s Imagine you have a class member like this </p>

<p>someMember: {
<br/>   someSubMemberOne: &#39;someValue&#39;,
<br/>   someSubMemberTwo: 0,
<br/>   someSubMemberThree: {
<br/>      someSubMemberThreeOne: &#39;someValue&#39;,
<br/>      someSubMemberThreeTwo: 1
<br/>   }
<br/>};Now, let&#39;s imagine the user wants to set &#39;someMember&#39;, so you will have to check the following things </p>

<p>The user pass you an object The object have all the mandatory submembers Each submember has the right type. For example in the case of &#39;someSubMemberThree&#39; you will have to check that the user pass you an object and then recursively check all the sub-submembers to acomplish the corresponding checking process. If you make all this validation process not in an orderer way, it could finished in a lot of program lines making things that are implemented in other places, or perhaps with a great amount of &quot;ifs&quot; and &quot;switchs&quot; that could be avoid. </p>

<p>JSBase provides the programmer a member checking process that could be easily molded to acomplish not only an easy checking process but a really big and recursively one, in a very orderer an easy way.</p>
 summary : <p>Java 1.5 library for mapping classes to binary message formats.  Uses an annotation driven approach for mapping class fields.</p>
 title : The jcoder Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The jmonster Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>English: </p>

<p>JMonster is a oriented object development architecture. Developed in Java this architecture permits the development a n-tiers oriented use case software. This moment contains: </p>

<p>-Version core (With JPA 1.0, pure Hibernate or pure JDBC); 
<br/>-Version integrated with AdobeFlex; 
<br/>-Version integrated with JSF 2.0 (RichFaces); 
<br/>Português: </p>

<p>JMonster é uma arquitetura de desenvolvimento orientado a objetos. Desenvolvida em Java esta arquitetura permite o desenvolvimento orientado a n-camadas orientado por caso de uso. Neste momento é composto por: </p>

<p>-Versão principal (Com JPA 1.0, puro Hibernate, ou puro JDBC); 
<br/>-Versão integrada com AdobeFlex; 
<br/>-Versão integrada com JSF 2.0 (RichFaces);</p>
 title : The jnwscript Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project target is to provide a way to create nwscript from java code.  </p>

<p>I found myself very frustrated while playing with nwn toolset and trying to do some script. I was missing so much an Object Oriented language and a packaged code structure that I did not go further with nwn coding.  As I discovered the nwn2 toolset I get more frustrated when discovering the same script language and its crappy notepad . </p>

<p>So I decide to write a code generator engine to let me code nwn with object as it should be. </p>

<p>This is not a code wizard like lilac’s soul, but a framework that allow you program with Object and generate nwscript from your source. </p>

<p>Please note that the project is at is early start and is more a toy than a mighty tool. But it brings me some hope to have fun with the nwn2.</p>

 title : The jyingo Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Jyingo is a PHP object-oriented ajax event programming library. It enables the user to make PHP event programming by converting the HTML page into an xml where each element of the page is an object. Like in ASP .NET this library introduce the concept of &quot;postback&quot; that permits to manage events (for example if an user clicks a button) and the postbacks  are obviously sent through AJAX. </p>

<p>Versione italiana: http://code.google.com/p/jyingo-it New Domain! http://www.jyingo.org Try an online example Download (1.2 Beta version) Table of ContentsGeneralIntroduction Setting up the environment Components Known issues Extending the libraryIntroduction  Creating a new component MoreCredits License</p>

 title : The kafeh2d Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Kafeh2D is a simple and object-oriented 2-dimensional game engine for the Java Platform. The goal of the project is a reusable and high-level development framework for 2-dimensional game programming in Java or Java-compatible scripting languages (such as JavaScript, JRuby, Jython, and Groovy). </p>

<p>Kafeh2D also includes three other modules, the first called KafehTiled, a light-weight implementation of a Tile-based game, with planned support for 2D, isometric, and hexagonal tiles. The second is KafehNet, a light-weight and high-perfomance networking client module with TCP, UDP, and HTTP support. Finally, included is KafehServ, a dedicated game server base. </p>

<p>Additional tools called KafehTools are also planned, including a MapEditor, MapGenerator, and JavaScript-based PluginSystem.</p>
 title : The kipler Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Kipler is an object-oriented tableau framework for rapid development of (modalized) description logic reasoners.It also comes with readily implemented decision procedures for some of these logics. </p>

<p>A decision procedure for such a logic can be implemented by (programmatically) extending the classes provided by Kipler and thus making use of object-oriented programming techniques. It is not our aim to develop a general tableau definition language for these logics. </p>

<p>Kipler is under heavy development. Currently it supports SHIQ ABox reasoning and experimental SHOIQ reasoning. These logics are the underlying formalism of Web Ontology Language: OWL and thus are included in Kipler&#39;s profile to demonstrate its capabilities. These implementations also employ some optimization techniques, e.g., semantic branching and backjumping, to make them &quot;practical&quot;. The facilities provided by Kipler for optimizations can be extended to modal description logics as well. </p>

<p>The first alpha version is planned to be released when integration with an OWL parsing API is completed and more tests are done. </p>

<p>The name Kipler means &quot;modalities&quot; in Turkish.</p>
 title : The libone Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ONE (Object-Oriented Network Engine)</p>
 title : The los-lib Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>（2009-9-16：已恢复下载，更新至 0.45 版本，并可通过检出功能同步最新的源码） </p>

<p>概要 </p>

<p>Los 对象集合库 0.45Los 对象集合库提供一组 Windows 应用程序开发所需的对象化类型。 </p>

<p>该库遵循 GNU LGPL LICENSE Ver.3. 以进行分发。 </p>

<p>该库具有进化的消息映射、命令映射、多线程等模型。它的程序设计界面相当清晰，任何人可以立即使用它来开发高效的 Windows 应用程序。 </p>

<p>los::blaze 子库支持 3D 渲染，具有一个简易的 GDI 渲染器以及灵活的 Direct3D 渲染器，支持场景管理，精确碰撞检测，蒙皮网格动画的播放，动作混合，音频播放线程等内容。 </p>

<p>项目信息项目： los-lib 版本： 0.45 建立时间： Jan. 15, 2008 最后更新： Sep. 16, 2009 code.google.com/p/los-lib 电子邮件： loserwang at gmail.com 编译和运行环境编译器 Visual C++ .NET 2003 及以上兼容版本 操作系统 Windows 95, 98, ME, 2000, XP, Vista 及以上兼容的 x86 版本 DirectX DirectX 9.0 Software Development Kit 及以上兼容版本 为了满足相应的一些特性，los-lib 使用 Visual C++ .NET 2003 及其后续版本进行编译，使用该编译器附带的 Windows Server 2003 Platform SDK 进行开发，编译生成的运行时库默认支持 Windows 2000 及后续的操作系统版本。Windows 9x 及 Windows NT 等版本需要重新编译运行时库并指定相应的版本号，编写程序库时已经对版本声明进行有效检查以启用或屏蔽部分功能，但是我没有对此做任何的测试，并且不作任何承诺。 
<br/>此外，Direct3D 渲染器实现应能支援任一份 DirectX 9.0 SDK 及兼容版本以进行编译，但截至 2009-1-3 发布的源代码，使用较早版本的 DirectX 9.0 SDK 将产生极少量编译错误且未经检查修正，强烈建议下载 2005 年 12 月份乃至最新版本的 DirectX SDK。 
<br/>谁需要它？如果你对以下的情况都是持肯定的态度，那么这份程序库便是为你准备的 </p>

<p>熟练地使用标准 C++ 语言 希望有信心地设计有效的图形化应用程序 希望向 Windows 用户提供服务 不打算编写冗长的 Win32 API 代码 希望得到更好的设计建议 如何扩展服务事实上，如果你认真地使用这份程序库写一些有用的应用程序，不久你会发现有些服务并没有完整实现，你可以这样做： </p>

<p>在个人下载的代码副本中扩展服务，并打算反馈给我一份有关更改 直接提出感兴趣的内容，希望我在下一个版本中补充 需要修改或者抛弃的不合时宜的内容 提出一些你不能认同甚至证明是效率低下的问题，框架方面的缺陷，设计的不足 加入开源项目组，和我一起工作（你应该首先对本程序库有比较全面的理解，并能找到参与的意义） 以上和其他的任一种情况，只要需要和本人通信，请发送邮件至 loserwang at gmail.com，包括批评的意见 </p>

<p>更新2009-9-16 .x 文件读取错误 动作混合 水平面越过障碍策略 A 星查找算法 SystemUVN 的 CloseUp_U等函数运算错误 2009-2-8 改进 Skinning mesh 性能 统一结构成员对齐 DXSDK 9.0 早期版本的兼容性问题 2009-1-3 Direct3D 渲染器 碰撞检测 动画 音频线程 2008-11-25 场景管理 2008-10-23 GDI 渲染器 2008-8-19  序列化 组件设计 2008-8-1 序列化 2008-7-27 停靠栏 状态栏 滚动窗口 分页窗口 序列化 2008-7-16 RichEdit 编辑框 字体类 2008-7-10 完整的消息路由 树形控件 工具栏 2008-6-30 停靠栏 滚动窗口 分割窗口 层次结构Hierarchy</p>

 title : The manticorecms Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The mctprep Open Source Project on Open Hub

<p>2008 Mar 20 </p>

<p>First tests with Drop-Cutter together with a kd-tree for finding which triangles are under the cutter. </p>

<p>2007 Aug 08Initial tests with Drop-Cutter. Surface-normal data needs to be re-calculated for some strange reason. Only 5% of drop-cutter calls are useful, need a kd-tree search to speed up algorithm. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>2007 JulyThe first milestone (July-August 2007) for this project is </p>

<p>All of these components exist (sort of) by themselves so it should not take too long before we have our first rudimentary MonoCAM going!</p>

 title : The mussel Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mussel is an object-oriented framework for creating domain-specific languages and interpreting them either from an interactive shell or in batch mode.</p>

<p>Mussel has been implemented in a first prototype, using the Python language. We also provide the implementation of a shell, along with some commands for experimentation.</p>

<p>Mussel has no need for specifying a DSL in the form of a grammar, but this feature can be programmed by using the API it provides.</p>

<p>Mussel has been used as the basis for the load-balancing shell (lbsh), as proposed in the SANE2006 paper: &#39;Non-stop Provision of Internet Services via a Reflectively Load-Sharing Architecture&#39; (http://www.sane.nl/sane2006/program/abstract.php?eventid=17)</p>

<p>Please note that Mussel was initially code-named Oyster but it turned out that this name is registered by another project.</p>
 summary : <p>In addition to a GUI, Veritas&#39; (now Symantec) NetBackup suite comes with a large collection of command line utilities to inspect and manipulate its workings.  These tools allow for sophisticated reporting and work-flow solutions but are non-trivial to use. </p>

<p>This set of object oriented modules, written in Perl, fronts these obscure CLI tools making possible very sophisticated scripts with relatively little effort. </p>

<p>Various releases of this NBU code base have been made available on CPAN by PBnJ-Solutions since 2002.  Now, a decision has been made to make it possible for other to contribute more easily to their development by hosting the project on Google Code. </p>

<p>If you&#39;d like to contribute, please contact Paul Winkeler</p>

 title : The nh3d Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A coupled mesoscale object-oriented model </p>

<p>Developed using original Fortran code of NH3D model by : </p>

<p>P. Miranda, M. Teixeira, R. Room, et al. (Univ. Reading, Lisbon and Tartu), V. Stepanenko (Moscow State University) </p>

<p>ContentsMotivation Overview Equations Active Work References MotivationOverview </p>

<p>The model includes : </p>

<p>The 1-dimensional lake model - Lake [6] The atmosphere shortwave (Clirad-SW) and longwave (Clirad-LW) solar radiation, [7-8] The specific aerosol advection-diffusion - SmolarkiewiczTEScheme - an object-oriented implementation of MPDATA [9] </p>

<p>EquationsThe model solves the set of atmosphere hydro-thermodynamics equations in sigma-coordinates defined in [1-5] : </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Here t — time, x, y — horizontal coordinates, σ = (p - pt) / (psurf - pt) — vertical σ-coordinate, other variables and notations see in Model Definitions. (1) - (3) are the flow equations, (4) — the heat transfer equation, (5) — the continuity equation, (6) - (8) — equations for atmospheric moisture (vapour, rain and cloud drops).  </p>

<p>Values of Di, where i = u,v,w,Ѳ,… define the turbulence diffusion of the corresponsing variables, Ri, i = u,v,w,Ѳ,… — an additional terms denoting external driving forces. Thermodynamical variables are measured in mesoscale deviations from the background state. </p>

<p>Applying the divergence operator to (1) - (3), as shown in [1] leads to : </p>

<p> </p>

<p>where L and M are the 2nd order linear differential operators, and </p>

<p> </p>

<p>f = f(x,y,σ). </p>

<p>Active WorkReferencesP. M. Miranda. Gravity waves and wave drag in flow past three dimensional isolated mountains. - Phd Thesis, University of Reading, 1990, 191 pp. M. A. Teixeira, and P. M. Miranda. The introduction of warm rain microphysics in the NH3d atmospheric model. - Technical report, University of Lisbon, 1997, pp. 22. M. J. Miller, and A. A. White. On the non hydrostatic equations in pressure and sigma coordinates. Quart. J. R. Met. Soc., Vol. 110, 1984, pp. 515 - 533. В. М. Степаненко, П. М. Миранда, В. Н. Лыкосов. Численное моделирование мезомасштабного взаимодействия атмосферы и гидрологически неоднородной суши. - Вычислительные технологии. 2006. Т. 11. Избранные доклады Международной конференции по измерениям, моделированию и информационным системам для изучения окружающей среды: ENVIROMIS-2006 (Томск, Россия), часть 3. С. 118-127. В. М. Степаненко. Численное моделирование взаимодействия атмосферы с водоемами суши. Диссертация на соискание ученой степени кандидата физико-математических наук. Москва, 2007. 153 с. E. Dutra, V.  title : The object-md Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ObjectMDThe molecular dynamic class library, written in C++. All the entities are encapsulated in the object form. The class library contains &#39;plug-able&#39; classes, the gadgets, which can be embedded to an application when needed. The design provides a simple programming interface to create an MD simulation, both in serial or parallel computing environment. </p>

<p>Base objectsAtom keeper Keeps the atom data structure: allocation, expansion, deletion.... 
<br/>Atom container Manages atom data: import, save, create crystallite structures.... 
<br/>Unit converter Handles unit conversion in simulation 
<br/>Gadgets Integrator, Conditioner, Detector 
<br/>Main classSimulation system class (SimSystem) MD main loop. Type=Atom container 
<br/>Parallel MD class (SimSystemGrid) Parallel version of SimSystem</p>

 title : The objectkitchen Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>In its simplest form, ObjectKitchen is an embed-able database used to store hashes. In its more advanced form, it can be run in client-server mode--or even as a distributed service supporting data split over a cluster of servers. </p>

<p>All data is stored in the form of a Document. A Document must have a unique string-based id. Documents can contain both key-value pairs and attached binary files. </p>

<p>Python is used as the primary scripting language in ObjectKitchen. It can be used to query large data sets, to modify data sets or to collect aggregated information.</p>
 title : The objectreach Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ObjectReach is an application,  that you can use to create and manage  data in a object-oriented form,  using inheritance, polymorphism and  many-to-many relationships. Objectreach will have three different UI types, including web, desktop and eclipse plug-in. Users can model their data, insert data to the model, generate queries and forms. Objectreach will also include an abstraction layer library, so users can use different types of object databases as the persistent storage.</p>
 summary : <p>What is OceanOS ?OceanOS is an Open Source project, to provide a new generation blogging platform, based on the concept of Resource Oriented Computing and featuring strong and weak modularization. </p>

<p>Component-based development is a common pattern in software development, but it is mostly used in a strong form of dependency. When you import a package or a library in your application, you are creating a strong dependency between your code and the imported functionality. </p>

<p>There are several examples in the Open Source world of weak modularization, but probably the most successful project is Eclipse. The Eclipse plugin architecture allows plugins to colaborate without knowing each other in advance. This provides increased flexibility and stability in a large complex systems. </p>

<p>OceanOS aims to be to Blogging software, Resource Oriented Computing and the web, what Eclipse is for IDE and Object Oriented world and the desktop.</p>
 title : The oceanos Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The ocfdb Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Database system written in python for small applications that want to store small ammounts  of data (0-30k rows). Parsing file, searching and changing couple rows in table with 30k rows takes around 0.3 second.  </p>

<p>Features: </p>

<p>Small query language based on python conditions. Dependancy free. Object oriented. </p>

<p>Current version: 0.1 </p>

<p>Copyright (c) 2006, IF Research Polska (http://www.ifresearch.pl) </p>

<p>Examples of usage: </p>

<p>    
<br/>    from ocfdb import ocfdb, OCFDBError
<br/>        
<br/>    # packages file format:
<br/>    # MODIFYDATE:123456789:
<br/>    # TABLE:packages:
<br/>    # id;name;version
<br/>    # 1;clamav;2.0
<br/>    # 2;dspam;3.6.4
<br/>    
<br/>    # file is packed with gzip
<br/>    # $: gzip packages
<br/>    # /\ this will output packages.gz
<br/>    
<br/>    # database initialization
<br/>    try:
<br/>        db = ocfdb(&#39;packages.gz&#39;)
<br/>    except OCFDBError:
<br/>        print &quot;Database Error&quot;, OCFDBError
<br/>    # getting rows, this will return rows internal IDs in list, not column values nor objects    
<br/>    rowids = db.packages.getrows(&#39;int(__row.id) &lt;= 2&#39;) # we have to remember that all columns values are strings
<br/> 
<br/>    # to get objects we have to fetch them from database:    
<br/>    rows = db.packages.getrowsbyId(rowids)
<br/>    
<br/>    #now when we have rows we can do something on them:
<br/>    
<br/>    for row in rows:
<br/>        print row.name, row.version
<br/>        
<br/>    # let&#39;s now update name column in first row    
<br/>    
<br/>    rows[0].name = &quot;clamav&quot;</p>

<p>    print rows[0].name
<br/>    # returns: clamav
<br/>    
<br/>    # so when we do any changes, we have to save database, so they won&#39;t be lost at another opening of database
<br/>    
<br/>    db.savedatabase()</p>
 summary : <p>octalforty Syndication Framework is an effort to create a reusable library which would allow users to parse and create syndication feeds (RSS and Atom) in format-agnostic manner as well as to use blogging APIs.</p>

 title : The ooglue Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ooglue </p>

<p>This library is one of my solutions to the ORM model. Rather than generating code or providing deep in depth descriptions in external resources. I plan on design and developing a tight, yet flexible and granular coupling between data and objects.  </p>

<p>Also, another problem with most popular ORM tools, that I find is the inability to use stored procedures and efficiently design  data. This solution is to allow that functionality. It&#39;s the best of both worlds, O/R Mapping and efficient data.</p>

 title : The oopap Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Object Oriented Program Analyzer Program (OOPAP) has two primary goals: </p>

<p>Provide a basic system for User Fredericks to assess several quality metrics for the programs individual students. Design the system so that it can be extended based on User Fredericks’ experience. The OOPAP shall be a software tool to calculate metrics to help User Fredericks guide student programmers by determining the characteristics of the programs they develop.  For example: </p>

<p>LOC—a metric for the size of a program  Comments—a metric for the percent of comment or commented lines Class counts—a metric for the number of classes in a program Variable counts—a metric for the number of variables in a program, class … Therefore, these metrics may be of value to Software Engineers when they design programs and later when they seek to modify, extend, or improve them.  With the aid of these metrics, engineers and teams can identify components that are likely to have design problems and fix those problems.</p>

 title : The openspace-components Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Openspace is a web application and services framework that is based on object-oriented software engineering concepts. Applications are developed in Openspace via a browser-based graphical IDE. Developers focus on creating object classes, each with it&#39;s own set of attributes and methods. The collection of classes, the relationships between these classes and the possibility of creating persistencies by instantiating objects provides the tool for solution modeling. All development takes place in a dedicated realm, as managed by the developer/realm administrator. Users of the realms can use classes within the realm to organise, store, manage, contribute and share information to achieve the purpose of the realm. </p>

<p>In design pattern terms, Openspace is based around the Active Record pattern, named by Martin Fowler in his book &quot;Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture&quot;.</p>

 title : The pejs Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>PEJSPython Executed by JavaScriptThe project aims at implementing a Python VM in JavaScript, enabling Python on web pages in browsers all over the world :) </p>

<p>For now, this is done by executing Python Byte Code Instructions as outputted by the standard CPython implementation, but the perspectives are laid out by HotRuby, where nested Ruby code is run straight out of the HTML. </p>

<p>This project is sort of a Python equivalence to HotRuby. </p>

<p>School projectAt the moment, this is a school project as part of the course Design of Virtual Machines for Object Oriented Languages at DAIMI, the computer science department at University of Aarhus. The course is held by Lars Bak and his staff at Google Aarhus, the V8 team. </p>

<p>DetailsOur aim is to implement an object-oriented subset of Python bytecode. </p>

<p>Our approach is as follows: </p>

<p>We&#39;ve started by implementing a simple interpreter (src/interpreter.js) which simply switches over the bytecodes and implements only some very basic language constructs. The Python bytecode is actually generated by a Python program (tools/pejs.py) which outputs it in JavaScript arrays.The JavaScript file containing the bytecodes is then referenced in an HTML-file which also references our interpreter and thus the Python code is executed in the browser. </p>

<p>For a complete Python implementation we would have to write a Python compiler as well as the virtual machine we are doing. </p>

<p>Milestones</p>

<p>Week  Milestone  Details   44  Up and running  Simple interpreter operating on a stack   45  Basic constructs  Implemented jumps and loops   46  Object and Memory model  Decide on object representation and heap layout   47  Object and Memory model  Implement classes and objects   48  Garbage collector  Simple garbage collector if needed   49  Library calls  Handle calls to python library somehow   50  Performance evaluation  Report   51  Deadline  Report  </p>

<p>We aim to finish the basic language features (variables, conditionals, loops, functions) and then design and implement classes and objects which implies designing an object and a memory model. This is the most important part of the project. </p>

<p>After that, we would like to handle garbage collection as well as library calls. It is not yet clear how far we will get with regard to these two issues. That depends on how complex the object implementation turns out to be. </p>

<p>Finally we document our implementation with performance evaluations where we would like to consider different JavaScript VM&#39;s for executing our own VM as well as implementation alternatives inside our VM.</p>
 title : The perlchina Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>see perlchina.org for more details. </p>

<p>projects: </p>

<p>p6l10n - translation of syn of Perl6. </p>

<p>POD2::CN - translation of perldoc.</p>
 title : The permafrost Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>WHAT IS PERMAFROSTPermafrost is a suite of tools motivated by the need of Java application developers for a transparent means of storing hierarchical/binary data. Permafrost plans to provide three key components for developing an application-specific data store: </p>

<p>libjhdf; a JNI binding for libhdf5. libjhdf has a simple Java-oriented API for working with the HDF5 native object structure library. It is NOT the HDF Group/NCSA Java HDF Interface (JHI). libjhdf is a ground-up project to develop a new JNI/Java library for HDF5 support. 
<br/>libjhdf is unique from other HDF wrappers in a number of ways: 
<br/>It is SWIG based We are using SWIG to generate the basic wrapper code. This leaves us free to work on other parts of the project and allows the possibility of producing wrappers for other languages later.       
<br/>It is a complete wrapper No other HDF wrapper we are familiar with exposes the complete HDF API. We use comparatively simple wrappers to expose the HDF C API rather than the object-oriented HDF C++ API. An object-oriented layer is implemented in pure Java on top of these wrappers. This has the advantage of giving the library a more Java-like feel.      
<br/>Error handling is done through Java exceptions We provide custom JNI for commonly used library callbacks, including the error handler.   No need to check return values. 
<br/>permafrost core; a Java persistence framework. The permafrost core is planned as an annotation-driven persistence framework designed to run on top of libjhdf. Classes are annotated to indicate which members are persistent and how data should be mapped to the HDF structure. No mapping metadata is stored in the HDF structure, so Java entity classes can be designed to map existing HDF data. Annotations are similar to EJB 3.0/JSR-220, but not identical. 
<br/>hoarfrost; a flexible HDF5 editor hoarfrost is planned to application developers to create and edit HDF5 data files. This mitigates the need to write custom importers for testing or one-off configuration data. It also is useful for viewing data when debugging HDF applications. 
<br/>STATUSYou may wish to check the News page for the most current status of the project. </p>

<p>LIBJHDFWe are currently implementing the SWIG Java wrapper for this component. HDF5 API documentation and unit tests will be ported at the same time. </p>

<p>CAVEAT EMPTORThis project is somewhat understaffed. As such, it will undergo periods where development work is slow/non-existent. However, we will do our best to document times when the project is idled and inform our users. In addition, we will always respond to support requests (at least with advice). This project will not become abandonware. </p>

<p>LICENSEPermafrost is licensed under the New BSD license.  </p>

<p>In addition, we kindly ask you to acknowledge Permafrost and its authors in any program or publication in which you use Permafrost. (You are not required to do so; it is up to your common sense to decide whether you want to comply with this request or not.) For general publications, we suggest referencing:  </p>

<p>Solomon Gibbs, &quot;The Permafrost Suite of Tools&quot;, http://code.google.com/p/permafrost, Downloaded [DATE].</p>
 title : The persistantbunnies Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>An Open Source Java Persistence Framework ProjectOverviewProject Status: Release Candidate. Project Frozen. </p>

<p>A 4th Year Object Oriented Software Engineering Project. The paper was provided by Massey University, Palmerston North campus, New Zealand. </p>

<p>The project is designed to provide an alternative persistancy framework API to help other programmers save Java objects to a Relational Database. Specific goals are to get an understanding of the mechanics, but basically it&#39;s for fun. </p>

<p>Expect the project to freeze from the 30th of May, 2008 because that&#39;s the deadline for this project (Unless any of the members feel passionate about keeping this thing running).   A better implementation (current etc.) would be Hibernate http://www.hibernate.org/. </p>

<p>ObjectivesCOMPLETED The framework support the mapping of objects to relational databases. i.e. add, remove and update objects, and find objects by id (primary key). COMPLETED The framework should work for all objects that follow the Java Bean Specification a.k.a. PLOJOs. COMPLETED The framework should work with any JDBC database. The API should be threaded. The framework should be able to generate database schemas (DDL). Technical DetailThis API uses Annotations to describe mappings to an RDBMS. Test cases use Hyper SQL databases, but it should work with any JDBC driver. </p>

<p>Dependencies:  </p>

<p>Java 6, or Greater (We use funky-awesome Annotations) Apache Commons Database Connection Pool (DBCP) API 1.2.2, or greater. Apache Log4j 1.2, or greater. HyperSQL (HSQLDB) 1.8, or greater. JUnit 3.8, or greater. An implementation of JDBC type 3 or 4.</p>
 title : The php-ldap-library Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>An object-oriented LDAP Library for PHP.</p>
 title : The php5classgenerator Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>PHP5 Class Generator like it&#39;s name, it&#39;s a PHP5 class generator.  This script reads a database(using pear&#39;s MDB2) and generates a PHP5 compatible class. </p>

<p>Requirements:PHP 5 PEAR PEAR MDB2: http://pear.php.net/package/MDB2 Class Features:Basic class functions: construct(), destruct(), get(), set() Basic database functions: Insert(), Update(), Delete(), Select() Creates maxlength properties PHP5 Compatible Object Oriented PhpDocumentor Compatible Database abstraction layers with PEAR&#39;s MDB2 (compatible with MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL etc ...) Error management with PEAR&#39;s PEAR_ErrorStack class</p>
 title : The phpsavant Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Savant: The Simple, Elegant Template System for PHPSavant is a powerful but lightweight object-oriented template system for PHP. </p>

<p>Unlike other template systems, Savant by default does not compile your templates into PHP; instead, it uses PHP itself as its template language so you don&#39;t need to learn a new markup system. </p>

<p>Why Use Savant for Templates?You don&#39;t need to learn a new language or markup to create a template. The template language is PHP, and the template file is a regular PHP file. You don&#39;t have to worry about separate directories (or permissions on those directories) for compiled template sources, because Savant is not a compiling engine (the template scripts are already written in PHP). Even though Savant is not itself a compiling system, you can write your own compiler and plug it into Savant; this means you can use any template markup system you like. The Savant source code is easy to read, understand, and extend, because it is exceptionally well-commented. The object-oriented plugin, filter, error, and compiler classes for Savant are easy to use, understand, and extend. Because your template script is a regular PHP script, you can sprinkle it with comments and use phpDocumentor to document it.</p>
 title : The phpsprockets Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>phpSprockets provides an alternative to string manipulation for applications that generate HTML, XHTML or XML.  For a quick intro, check out our screencast! </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Sprockets are hierarchically created objects that can be progressively, logically defined and then rendered when needed. Sprockets play nice, coexisting with other code generators and template systems, and provide a great addition to MVC frameworks. </p>

<p>phpSprockets is sponsored by Innova Partners, the software development company in Columbus, Ohio.</p>
 title : The poe-component-dirwatch-object Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>POE::Component::DirWatch::Object is an object-oriented POE component which triggers events when on changes to the contents of a directory.</p>
 title : The poodle Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Python OODBProvides a Pythonic Object-Oriented BTree Database that stores pickled Python objects using a variety of Object Picklers ranging from the Python native cPickle to a Safe-Serializer that stores Python objects in a safe manner thus allowing Objects to be stored under Linux and retrieved under Windows and vice-versa. </p>

<p>poodle also supports json for those who just have to have json. </p>

<p>The goal of this project is to take the current oodb and embellish it to allow multi-user access as well as a more powerful Cython based Safe-Serializer. </p>

<p>The goal of this project is also to build a SQL front-end for what will become a powerful multi-user database every bit as powerful as ZODB from Zope. </p>

<p>This project must support Stackless Python 2.5.2 as well as CPython 2.5.2 on both Windows XP/Vista and Ubuntu/CentOS Linux.</p>

 title : The protaeus Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ProtAEusPurpose:To produce an object-oriented framework and multi-platform tool suite to ease prototyping and testing of new elements and approaches in the Analytic Element Method. </p>

<p>Planned Features:Python implementation of a versatile Analytic Element framework. High-resolution numerical differentiation operators. Specialized subclasses for modeling in the horizontal plane. Clear dichotomy built into the framework between the models of the physics and Mathematics. Swappable solver mechanism to relate Physics to the Element model. medium term Plugins for elements defined by functions contained in a dynamic linkage library. long  term Potential field / vector field visualizer. long  term Automated plugin generator. Requirements:Python 2.5 Numpy 1.0.1 wxPython 2.8 unicode All features will be implemented on at least the following three platforms: Mac OS X (Leopard), Kubuntu Hardy Heron (8.04) and Microsoft Windows XP SP2. </p>

<p>Status:ProtAEus is still in design phase. The implementation is still subject to discussion. Any code posted until release 0.1 is subject to change.</p>
 summary : <p>DescriptionPscrobbler is a Object-Oriented PHP5 interface to the Audioscrobbler Webservices API. The implementation is not complete yet, but many feeds are already supported. The requests are cached, wich means it loads faster and is doesn&#39;t overload the Audioscrobbler servers. </p>

<p>With the release of verision 2 of Last.fm, the webservices from Audioscrobbler has been changed which caused scrobbler to not work. I&#39;m working on a almost complete rewrite of pscrobbler. Stay tuned for updates. </p>

<p>It works as simple as this : </p>

<p>$User = Audioscrobbler::User(&#39;danielpunt&#39;);
<br/>$Profile = $User-&gt;Profile();
<br/>$TasteOMeter = $User-&gt;TasteOMeter($You);</p>

<p>print_r($Profile);
<br/>print_r($TasteOMeter);RequirementsPHP5 with the SimpleXML library PEAR Http_Request package And please check my own profile.</p>

 title : The pyserver-oos Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>PyServer is a experimental server based of the BaseHTTPServer provide in the standart lib. </p>

<p>Where classical server use file to give a response, PyServer use Python object. </p>

<p>PyServer is an Object-Oriented server. That mean you use object and oriented-object practice for write response, for write server configuration, and you can simply customize any part of the server by subclassing the class provided with PyServer.</p>
 summary : <p>Factory is an object-oriented approach to partial function application, also known as currying. The Factory module is a more powerful implementation of this pattern. Some improvements include: </p>

<p>safer, as invalid arguments are detected immediately, instead of at call time intelligent support for classes, instance methods &amp; all other callables bound arguments can be inspected and modified as attributes several convenient methods for (re)binding arguments no &quot;Russian dolls&quot; of nested lambdas Using Factories can: </p>

<p>simplify writing callbacks reduce bugs in concurrent applications  provide easy lazy evaluation For downloads and more information, please see the Cheeseshop</p>

 title : The rebel-php-framework Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Welcome to Rebel PHP FrameworkRebel Php Framework is an open source project based on PHP5.2&#39;s Object Oriented features. </p>

<p>It was designed and developed by Emanuele Colonnelli. </p>

<p>Using this framework, you&#39;ll be able to rapidly and easily develop and maintain your web applications. </p>

<p>XMAP based RPC, is a kind of remote procedure call based on URIs. </p>

<p>Using XMAP you can bind a specific URI on your webapp to a specific method call, handling with ease user authentication, request and session variables validation.</p>

<p>Chapter 24 Java Interview Questions</p>

<p>Chapter 25 API Packages</p>

<p>Chapter 26 Real Time Java</p>

<p>Chapter 26 Java Projects</p>

<p>Object: Object is a living run-time entity .We can clearly understand what an object is by examining various objects .A cycle is an object .A Bike is an Object. Man is an Object and so on …let us see what made it as objects
<br/>&amp;nbsp;A Cycle has a name (attribute).A cycle has a chain (attribute) .A cycle contains pedals (attribute).we can use cycle for some functions like riding.(function). When we consider a man he will he will have a name(attribute),hands(attributes),legs(attribute)
<br/>Using his hands he will do some work (function)using his legs he will walk(function) and he has some more functions like running ,eating ,talking, sleeping, and so on(functions)…
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Man Object</p>

<p>Name
<br/>&amp;nbsp;Eyes
<br/>Hands	Legs
<br/>Walk()
<br/>Seeing()
<br/>Sleeping()
<br/>Eating()</p>

<p>So man cycle are Objects because they have some attributes and functions</p>

<p>Object= variables(attributes) +methods (functions)
<br/>&amp;nbsp;Functions are called as methods in java</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;
<br/>&amp;nbsp;
<br/>Therefore we can define an object as a runtime entity (which will be created in the program execution</p>

<p>Class: Before knowing about a class first you should be familiar with object, which I explained above. A class is proto type or blue print of an object
<br/>Which are mostly equals to structs and unions in C++ C languages, with little differences
<br/>Class defines the object. The definition of object is class
<br/>Consider the following code in  JAVA</p>

<p>class demo1
<br/>{
<br/>int var1;
<br/>String var2;
<br/>void method1()
<br/>{
<br/>//method 1 Code
<br/>}
<br/>void mathod2()
<br/>{
<br/>// method 2 code
<br/>}
<br/>}
<br/>here demo1 is class name ,var1,var2 are variables of type int and String(don’t be confused or temper you will come to all these in following sections) and  method1(),method2() are methods</p>

<p>Data Types:</p>

<p>In our daily life, we use many things for many purposes .we use calculators for calculations. we use *** for ***.and so on. Like that , we create objects for several purposes which are described according to class definition. Therefore, that object is data type of that class .java provides eights built in data types or simple data types, or primitive data types. They are
<br/>&amp;nbsp;
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Primitive data types
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Numbers	Characters	Boolean
<br/>Integers		Floating points	char			boolean</p>

<p>byte short  int long 	float double</p>

 title : The shunde Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This framework allows you to rapidly create Models for your project.  Using SQL Server, it automatically creates tables and saves the data in an Object Oriented fashion. </p>

<p>This means you can create and use OOP without worrying about the incompatibilities of a relational database! </p>

 summary : <p>The project is a simple extensible object-oriented JavaScript library for validating HTML forms on web pages. It differs from some other projects as it is fully extensible through an inheritance-like structure where custom validation routines can be created without having to modify the main validation class.</p>

<p>The core library consists of two classes; FormValidator and ValidateItem.</p>

<p>The FormValidator class is the main class which controls which form fields to validate and how to present the error message upon failure of validation.</p>

<p>The ValidationItem is an interface specifying how a certain type of validation should be implemented. The only requirement to implement the ValidationItem interface is to include a validate() function which must return a boolean value.</p>

<p>The validation library comes with a set of common ValidationItem classes for various type of validation such as e-mail addresses, URLs, IP addresses, and numbers.</p>

 title : The somenewlang Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>In our oppinion, many of today&#39;s popular programming languages have their pitfalls.  We want to try to implement a contemporary, compiled language which allows static typing, at runtime (unlike C++), of object oriented code; in addition to a feature-ritch syntax, intuitive garbage collection, and many other improvments over C++.  We want to give portable, yet native, object oriented code, a clean slate to grow off of.  We plan to write our compiler and tools as a frontend to GCC in order to take advantage of it&#39;s ability to build code on a plethora of host systems with out the need for any of _our_ developers to port a thing.</p>
 summary : <p>Today&#39;s software packaging and distribuition is too system addicted than users&#39;s one.
<br/>We need a more object oriented vision into manipulation of software.
<br/>NextStep Bundles do it from the time being but with too much complexity inside.
<br/>The centre of our bit universe it&#39;s not the system but the user and in this direction we need to go...</p>

 title : The sphereos Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Sphere is a next-generation object-oriented operating environment intended to be suitable for general-purpose programming. Sphere is a capability-based system strongly influenced by managed-code systems such as Java and .NET and intends to take the useful aspects of these environments (memory management, managed code, platform independence, and others) and push them as far down into the operating system as possible while still maintaining a useful and responsive environment.</p>
 title : The springphp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Spring PHP emerged from my need for a true Web MVC framework that was deployable on a shared LAMP hosting environment.  After looking at many PHP frameworks, none seemed to fit the requirements: </p>

<p>PHP4 &amp; PHP5 Object Oriented - work with objects rather than global arrays and functions MVC2 design model - controllers push the model to views IoC Container - to eliminate implementation-specific dependencies between objects Light Weight Simple Installation - no complex deployment, no command line, no compilation No use of large-scale libraries like PEAR No templating language to learn - uses native PHP for views Completely flexible Easily portable to Java (Spring Framework) Broad compatibility - able to be deployed across many environments Performance - but not at the cost of flexibility Self-contained and configurable libraries for specific features No &quot;spaghetti code&quot; processing flow to understand Fosters, if not demands, clean, maintainable, and TESTABLE code Integrated logging for easier debugging Able to quickly integrate external libraries The goals of the Spring Framework for Java hold true for Spring PHP: </p>

<p>Make developing a complete webapp in PHP easier and LESS COMPLEX Promote good programming using best practices &amp; proven design patterns Reduce the need for &quot;reinventing the wheel&quot; Make existing technologies easier to use Provide one consistent method for configuring the application Whenever possible, your application code should NOT depend upon SpringPHP APIs</p>
 summary : <p>Efforts from this project have been integrated into the objeck-lang project.  Please feel free to browse the existing source code.</p>

 title : The swampy Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Swampy is a suite of Python programs used throughout the Engineering with Computing curriculum at Olin College. It was written by Allen Downey. </p>

<p>Swampy includes these components: </p>

<p>Lumpy Lumpy stands for &#39;UML in Python&#39; It is used in Software Design to provide a model of execution and to teach UML object and class diagrams. 
<br/>AmoebaWorld Used in Introductory Programming to provide practice writing Python expressions and to introduce object-oriented programming. 
<br/>TurtleWorld Used in Software Design to teach procedural interface design and object-oriented programming. 
<br/>TurmiteWorld Used in Computational Modeling to demonstrate and allow students to experiment with cellular automata and finite state machines, including Langton&#39;s Ant. (The misspelling of &#39;termite&#39; is deliberate; it is a tribute to Alan Turing). 
<br/>Sync Sync is a simulator that demonstrates the execution of multithreaded programs that interact through Semaphores. It is used in Synchronization to help students test solutions to synchronization problems.  
<br/>Swampy is supported by two textbooks (both available under the GNU Free Documentation License): </p>

<p>The exercises in TurtleWorld follow the order of presentation in &#39;How to Think Like a Computer Scientist&#39;. Sync is designed to simulate the examples and solutions from &#39;The Little Book of Semaphores&#39;.</p>

 title : The Mozbot Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The vartypes Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>VarTypes is a feature-rich, object-oriented framework for managing variables in C++ / QT4. </p>

<p>VarTypes allows hierarchical organization, thread-safety, load/store to/from xml, QT4-based signals, QT4-based model/view visualization.  </p>

<p>VarTypes aims to make it easy for application developers to integrate automatic settings loading/storage, even for complex trees of settings. At the same time it allows a user to comfortably edit such settings in real-time without any risks of concurrency problems. </p>

<p>Among supported base types are int, bool, double, string, string enumerations, lists, binary data, and triggers. More complex types can be added easily. </p>

<p>To download, simply check out the latest version in the SVN trunk, by clicking on the &quot;Source&quot; tab above. The current version in trunk is considered stable and is fairly well tested. </p>

<p>This project does not release other downloads under the &quot;Downloads&quot; tab, please use SVN instead.</p>
 summary : <p>Free DHTML, Hierarchical, Object Oriented, Open Source Menu. Compatible with Netscape 6+, Mozilla 1+, MSIE 5+, Opera.  title : The adsl-ajax-lib Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>an ajax-like web framework specialized on webmail service solution
<br/>This is an ajax-like web framework specialized on webmail service solution. It is based on ajax principle, but dislike other normal ajax framework. It focus on maximumly decrease the webservice and database interaction between client and remote server by applying RCP client via running predefined javascript functions on client browser. This tech. solution can make much better performance especially in webmail service case. Theoritically, it can make a much better performace and greatly decrease the service loading. Currently this work is under developing. The early tech. document will be uploading soon.</p>

 title : The ajax-alexa-thumbnails Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project is being deprecated because Amazon&#39;s AWS Alexa Site Thumbnail service is being deprecated. </p>

<p>Webpage Thumbnails — Screenshots via Page Glimpse in JavaScriptAjax Alexa ThumbnailsA JavaScript module built on the Yahoo! User Interface library that allow asynchronous (Ajax) usage of Amazon&#39;s Alexa Site Thumbnail web service. </p>

<p>The project consists of a server-side component written in PHP which makes the cross-domain request to Amazon&#39;s Alexa Site Thumbnail web service, and a JavaScript component which makes Ajax requests to configured server-side component and caches the results. </p>

<p>FeaturesUses YUI library and registers itself as a module 1.4kb minified version Caching to reduce number of server and web service requests Ajax request queue to prevent multiple request for the same resource Configurable (in JavaScript) for small/large thumbnails, and wrap with anchor (link) YUI Logging support for development and testing ExamplesResume&#39;s Projects with thumbnail tooltips Hovering on a listed Project link shows a tooltip that fetches a thumbnail of the website. Uses the YUI Tooltip Widget Simple examples showing how to load and initialize the project Usage with standard loading Usage with YUI Loader RequiresAmazon Web Services account YAHOO! User Interface (YUI) 2.5.2+ Running web server with PHP It is required for you to have an Amazon Web Services account signed-up with the Alexa Site Thumbnail service. The AWS configuration resides in the alexa_service.php file; here is where your AWS Access Identifiers are set. </p>

<p>Usage Overview</p>

 title : The ajax-rotating-banner Open Source Project on Open Hub

 summary : <p>Ajax Syntax HighlighterAjax Syntax Highlighter is a small Javascript utility designed to highlight code embed in a web page in a standard compliant way. It automatically looks for source code in the page, send it to a server-side highlighter and display the highlighted code. It also has a &quot;view as plain text&quot; feature and support internationalization. </p>

<p>Ajax Syntax Highlighter is built with Yahoo! UI and uses JSON for serialization. It is wrote by Kévin Dunglas. It currently includes GeSHi as server-side (PHP required) highlighter but it can be easily used with others such as Pygments. </p>

<p>See a demo. </p>

<p>InstallUnzip the archive or get Ajax Syntax Highlighter via Subversion. Put the resulting directory into your Apache document root with PHP enabled (for GeSHi). </p>

<p>Try to load http:////ajax-syntax-highlighter/test.html to check if your installation is correct. </p>

<p>In your HTML file add the following lines in the HEAD section to active Ajax Syntax Highlighter: </p>

<p>Is is also recommended to use the Yahoo! UI base, fonts and reset CSS files. Put before the previous lines: </p>

<p> 
<br/>Now add your snippets to your page like this: </p>

<p>&amp;lt;?php
<br/>echo &#39;Hello, World&#39;;
<br/>?&amp;gt;You must use the code tag with a class attribute following the HTML5 language- convention. You can add a pre tag if needed. </p>

<p>If you want to active an interface translation (here in French) edit ajax-syntax-highlighter.js and replace this.lang = &quot;en&quot; by this.lang = &quot;fr&quot; in the HighlighterConfig function. </p>

<p>That&#39;s all folk !</p>

<br/> processing and DOM scripting to swap style sheets on the fly with the power of Ajax. 
<br/>If JavaScript? is disabled - UDASSS degrades gracefully to improve your website 
<br/>accessibility. Needless to say, it is very sexy indeed.</p>

 title : The Etherwatch Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The prototype-ajax-tree Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Ajax.Tree lets you create super-versatile trees (visually hierarchical user interface) that can load content via Ajax, with the page load, or even add and remove any number of tree nodes directly through Javascript. The API separates styling, markup, user-interface and data very nicely, but does not get in the way. </p>

<p>The API uses a class factory so that a tree class supporting one set of nodes can be created independently of a tree class supporting a different set of nodes. Just define the properties of the nodes, build the data as a native Javascript object (JSON if using Ajax) and the tree class will build the nodes using your node type definitions! Expand/collapse is handled automatically as well as mouseover and mouseout bindings. Proper cleanup is performed, and easy to use hooks are provided for mashing up Ajax.Tree with your own project.</p>
 title : The splunk-ajax-sdk Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project provides a library with source code and examples written in Javascript for coding against the Splunk Platform APIs. </p>

<p>More information on coding against Splunk is hosted over on the Splunk Labs pages at: http://code.google.com/p/splunk-labs/ </p>

<p>Splunk AJAX SDKSplunk&#39;s AJAX SDK is a public domain library providing Javascript development wrapper for projects based around Splunk&#39;s search engine.  </p>

<p>Please note this an early beta release of the SDK, and as such, hasn&#39;t been throughly tested.  If you find any bugs, or need assistance feel free to leave a comment on the Splunk Labs list, opening a ticket, or check out the code yourself and get busy!  Note: Don&#39;t email Splunk directly about support for this library - your requests will go unanswered if you do. </p>

<p>You can request to join the Splunk Labs project here on Google Code by emailing your Gmail email address in the SUBJECT line of your email to splunk-labs@splunk.com. </p>

<p>IntroductionSplunk AJAX SDK is a wrapper around Splunk&#39;s REST API, providing a model for the major functional components of the Splunk server. The following components are currently accessible via the SDK: </p>

<p>Authentication Search </p>

<p>We continue to work on implementing the wrappers for the other components of the server, including user roles and permissions. </p>

<p>There are many levels of possible Splunk integration, so we provided developers the ability to communicate with the Platform API - from raw http streaming to custom-tailored objects and SQL-style components. </p>

<p>RequirementsTo run the Splunk AJAX SDK Library you will need the Java runtime library installed: </p>

<p>Jquery  - http://jquery.com </p>

<p>Installation  Splunk AJAX SDK is a js module. Make sure that you have downloaded: </p>

<p>Splunk AJAX client module, JQuery library Sample HTML file from http://code.google.com/p/splunk-ajax-sdk/downloads/list</p>

 title : The vxjs-ajax Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>the vX javascript library is awesome, but many people still only need that ajax function. the modern vX library has several bytes in just headers for the library. </p>

<p>The entire function is 270 bytes. </p>

<p>vX=function(u,f,d,x){x=this.ActiveXObject;x=new(x?x:XMLHttpRequest)(&#39;Microsoft.XMLHTTP&#39;);x.open(d?&#39;POST&#39;:&#39;GET&#39;,u,1);x.setRequestHeader(&#39;Content-type&#39;,&#39;application/x-www-form-urlencoded&#39;);x.onreadystatechange=function(){x.readyState&gt;3&amp;&amp;f?f(x.responseText,x):0};x.send(d)}</p>
 title : The woext-ajax Open Source Project on Open Hub

Its goal is to inspire others and to compare notes with similar frameworks meant to integrate AJAX with WebObjects component actions.  It is written so that it can easily be adapted to any javascript AJAX library.  For example, jquery, prototype or ext, etc.</p>

 title : The as3-simplemvc Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>UPDATE - Check out this project too: http://code.google.com/p/as3-commoncode/ </p>

<p>Keep in mind this project is mainly for projects with just &quot;Pure Actionscript&quot; at heart, this project would need some modifications to work within the &quot;Adobe Flex Framework.&quot; It&#39;s setup more for a project with the IDE and .fla files. </p>

<p>For the most part this project implements the Model, View, Controller - a Design Pattern that is scalable for most projects using an OOP process. It&#39;s a basic MVC structure with a method to apply, with assistance from the Preloader and Application classes. It&#39;s also very handy for productive workflow; as a good practice you can setup your model logic and application logic first once your data is ready. Then it&#39;s just a matter of displaying and controlling the representation of that model. So if needed, more than one developer can work on an application. Each developer can work on different views or components or states of the overall view. Without depending on controllers or other views, each view just has to listen for what it wants to from the model. </p>

<p>Preloader </p>

<p>The Preloader for the Application class best practice is to extend this class for your own preloader class and then add the frame command to your own application class which is extended from org.simplemvc.core.Application. Look at the example flash application directory for further explanation. </p>

<p>Application </p>

<p>This is the specific class that starts an application. It adds all the necessary views and sets the model up. This is where you will pass to the model what data to use and you will also pass the model to all the views in their own constructors. </p>

<p>Model </p>

<p>The Model component of the MVC design pattern handles and stores the data and application logic for the interface. It is recommended that the Model utilize a push only dispatching protocol in which it dispatches information to it&#39;s listeners through the event object. This happens without any knowledge of who or what is listening. It is recommended that this class is sub classed in order to communicate and manage application logic, however you can use it directly as well. </p>

<p>View </p>

<p>The View component of the MVC design pattern is a distinct representation of a Model&#39;s data and or logic. A view listens too and represents changes to the model for states of the application or logic. It is recommended that the views in an MVC system be unaware of the inner workings of the system&#39;s Model (ie. utilize a push only dispatching protocol in which the Model pushes information to it&#39;s listeners through the event object). It is the responsibility of each view to make sure it has a controller. The controller can either be passed in to the constructor or it will be automatically made by the view&#39;s. To create an MVC relationship; a model is created and a view is created which is then added as a listener of its associated model. The view primarily creates its own controller, but can use an existing one, this is not recommended. It will be necessary to extend this View class and the core controller method in order to make more specific view objects for specific view/controller pairings. </p>

<p>Controller </p>

<p>The Controller component of the MVC design pattern responds to user inputs by modifying the Model. A controller listens too its view for user inputs. If the data submitted by the view, affect the data and logic, it will report that information up to the model. Otherwise it should act directly back upon it&#39;s view ( i.e. onRollOver ). A Controller has a direct relationship with its view and the model the View represents. A Controller is generally only created by a View that will accept user input, and in some cases the View won&#39;t have the need for a Controller. If a view does not accept user input, and the default controller method is called, a null controller will be returned.</p>
 title : The as3-wowarmory Open Source Project on Open Hub

<p>Status: Development in progress.</p>
 title : The as3-ziparchive Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ZipArchive是一个Zip档案处理类，可读写各种zip格式文件。 </p>

<p>功能： </p>

<p>轻松创建或加载一个zip档案； 多种方式读取和删除zip档案中的文件； 支持中文文件名； 非常容易序列化一个zip档案，如有AIR、PHP等的支持下就可以把生成的zip档案保存在本地或服务器上。 </p>

<p>用法： </p>

<p>var zip:ZipArchive = new ZipArchive();
<br/>zip.load(&quot;test.zip&quot;);
<br/>zip.addEventListener(ProgressEvent.PROGRESS, onProgress);
<br/>zip.addEventListener(ZipEvent.ZIP_INIT, onInited);
<br/>zip.addEventListener(ZipEvent.ZIP_FAILED, onFailed);
<br/>zip.addEventListener(IOErrorEvent.IO_ERROR, onIOError);</p>

<p>private function inited(evt:ZipEvent):void 
<br/>{
<br/>	zip.removeEventListener(ProgressEvent.PROGRESS, onProgress);
<br/>	zip.removeEventListener(ZipEvent.ZIP_INIT, onInited);
<br/>	zip.removeEventListener(ZipEvent.ZIP_FAILED, onFailed);
<br/>	zip.removeEventListener(IOErrorEvent.IO_ERROR, onIOError);
<br/>	
<br/>	//添加ZIP_CONTENT_LOADED事件侦听器
<br/>	zip.addEventListener(ZipEvent.ZIP_CONTENT_LOADED, onImageloaded);
<br/>	trace(&quot;原始zip文件内容\r&quot;, zip);</p>

<p>	//读取zip中的xml文件
<br/>	var xmlFile:ZipFile = zip.getFileByName(&quot;sample.xml&quot;);
<br/>	var xml:XML = new XML(xmlFile.data);
<br/>	trace(xml);</p>

<p>	//根据字符串内容创建一个新的txt文件
<br/>	var txtContent:String = &quot;这是一个测试文本文件&quot;;
<br/>	zip.addFileFromString(&quot;测试.txt&quot;, txtContent);
<br/>	//trace(zip.getFileByName(&quot;测试.txt&quot;).data);</p>

<p>	//复制zip中的&quot;girl.jpg&quot;为&quot;张曼玉.jpg&quot;
<br/>	var zmy:ZipFile = zip.getFileByName(&quot;girl.jpg&quot;);
<br/>	zip.addFileFromBytes(&quot;张曼玉.jpg&quot;, zmy.data);
<br/>	//加载zip中的新生成的图片文件的Bitmap对象
<br/>	zip.getBitmapByName(&quot;张曼玉.jpg&quot;);</p>

<p>	//删除图片文件logo.gif
<br/>	zip.removeFileByName(&quot;logo.gif&quot;);
<br/>	trace(&quot;\r修改后的zip文件内容\r&quot;, zip);
<br/>}</p>

<p>private function onImageloaded(evt:ZipEvent):void 
<br/>{
<br/>	zip.removeEventListener(ZipEvent.ZIP_CONTENT_LOADED, onImageloaded);
<br/>	var img:Bitmap = evt.content as Bitmap;
<br/>	addChild(img);
<br/>}</p>

<p>private function onProgress(evt:ProgressEvent):void 
<br/>{
<br/>	//trace(evt.currentTarget, evt.bytesLoaded, evt.bytesTotal);
<br/>}</p>

<p>private function onFailed(evt:ZipEvent):void 
<br/>{
<br/>	//trace(evt.content);
<br/>}</p>

<p>private function onIOError(evt:IOErrorEvent):void 
<br/>{
<br/>	//trace(evt);
<br/>}</p>

 title : The as3cannonball Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>UpdateI&#39;m breaking the CSS engine off of this beast and organizing it as a separate project. This will allow me to focus on documentation, examples, and tests for the most viable part of this silly idea and actually, just maybe, get something useful out there. As for the rest of it, let&#39;s just say it was never meant to be. </p>

<p>The CSS engine has seen a lot of progress, including full shorthand property support, HSL/RGB color handling, selector improvements, @import loading, and bug fixes. I&#39;ll get something put up on a separate project page within the next couple of weeks. </p>

<p>If anybody has use for any of this stuff, please contact me and let me know (john at newgonzo dot com). Just telling me a little about your project can be a huge motivator. </p>

<p>Cannonball is an implementation of the DOM Level 3, HTML and CSS3 core specifications written in ActionScript 3.0.  </p>

<p>Cannonball as a whole is not functional, but some of its components are usable as separate libraries: </p>

<p>CSS: The CSS engine in com.newgonzo.cannonball.css.* Scripting: JavaScript/ActionScript/ECMAScript scripting support with as3scriptinglib DOM: The DOM implementation in com.newgonzo.cannonball.dom.* (needs work) The CSS package is the most complete and provides: </p>

<p>support for many of the CSS3 selectors, based on The Simple API for CSS an API for exposing any object as a CSS-selectable node style cascading with respect to document origin, selector specificity, and declaration priority (!imporant) You can explore the CSS selector engine here. </p>

<p>The JavaScript engine is provided by an API for using the ECMAScript compiler from the Tamarin project in Flash. It&#39;s hosted at as3scriptinglib. </p>

<p>A proof-of-concept for using !HTMLTidy in Flash (via Alchemy) has been posted at the as3htmltidylib project page. It&#39;s fat and slow. </p>

<p>This project is under active (slow) development. Interested in contributing? Contact me at john at newgonzo dot com. </p>

<p>This project is incomplete and has very little documentation. Proceed at your own risk.</p>

 title : The kisstest-as3 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A minimal unit testing framework for AS3.  This is a less complete framework than FlexUnit, ASUnit and others. It&#39;s, thus, not appropriate for most people. </p>

<p>I&#39;ve created this codebase basically because current unit testing frameworks in Actionscript seemed way too complexed, and none of them supported asynchronous tests with asynchronous setup. </p>

<p>In kisstest (Keep it Simple Stupid Test) all setups&#39;s are asynchronous.</p>

 title : The LostHero - Story of Gilgamesh Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Lost Hero - Story of Gilgames is an isometric RPG game, where you go with your character through few levels, you fight with the monster, traps and logical puzzles. You are rewarded by experience point to improve your character and items to make your life</p>
 summary : <p>ROSA - Remote Object Services Architecture for AS3 RemotingROSA is a Flash Remoting Framework developed to integrate Flash Remoting in your AS3 applications. It has no dependeces on the Flex framework, so you can use it in Flash CS3 transparently. It also features: </p>

<p>Auto view event wirer, so you don&#39;t need to subscribe to events if you dont want to. Only use naming conventions. Inheritance based implementation for typed services methods Proxy based implementation for untyped service methods Remote call queueing or parallel calls Rich event arquitecture Still documenting. Reference almost complete. </p>

<p>You can find some early examples in the Wiki and in the source trunk. </p>

<p>You can send a suggestion to 7daysofrain (at) gmail (dot) com</p>

 title : The vkontakte-as3 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is an Actionscript 3.0 API to access all the available Vkontakte web services. This should hopefully save some people time from doing all the grunt work. It is currently a work in progress so not all the services are currently available. </p>

<p>Usage: </p>

<p>import ru.vkontakte.VKApp;
<br/>var func:Function = function(res:XML):void { 
<br/>    if (res.name() == &quot;response&quot;) { ... }
<br/>};</p>

<p>var vk:VKApp = new VKApp(__this_Application___.parameters, __app_id__, __app_secret__, __test_mode_on___);</p>

<p>if (!vk.is_valid) {
<br/>  Alert.show(&quot;This is snatch copy, see original at #api_id&quot;);
<br/>}</p>

<p>vk.putVariable(566, &quot;some value&quot;, null);
<br/>vk.getVariable(566, func);</p>

<p>vk.setMaxScores(16, null);
<br/>vk.getHighScores(func);
<br/>vk.setHighScore(777, null);</p>

<p>....
<br/>vk.viewer.putVariable(1300, &quot;some value&quot;, null);</p>

<p>vk.user.getVariable(1300, func);
<br/>vk.viewer.getVariable(1300, func);
<br/>vk.get_user(123456).getVariable(1300, func);</p>

<p>vk.viewer.getUserInfo(func);
<br/>vk.get_user(123456).getUserInfo(func);</p>

<p>....
<br/>vk.session.putVariable(4000, &quot;some value&quot;, null);
<br/>vk.get_session(123456).getVariable(4000, func);
<br/>vk.session.sendMessage(&quot;some message&quot;, null);
<br/>vk.session.getMessages(func);
<br/>vk.get_session(123456).getMessages(func, 10);</p>

 title : The gnome-mysql-manager Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MySQL ManagerSimple tool for managing MySQL databases. Features include managing databases, users, and permissions. The tool is written using pygtk, python-gnome, and python-mysqldb. </p>

<p>Why Use MySQL Manager?I wrote this tool when I was working with Ruby on Rails, and Drupal. These require MySQL databases, but constantly creating and removing databases and users from command line was, and still is, a hassle. This tool is intended for easy management of MySQL databases and users, and it does this task well (am I being bias?). </p>

<p>Using MySQL ManagerTo install, run the following commands: </p>

<p>./autogen.sh --prefix /some/path
<br/>make
<br/>make installTo run the application, issue command gnome-mysql-manager. There is a usage tutorial on the project&#39;s wiki. </p>

<p>Error handlingWhen an error occurs, the user is notified via an error dialog. There are no undo, backup, or restore options. </p>

<p>Reporting bugsIf you find a bug in MySQL Manager, or would like to suggest (implement, maybe?) a feature, please file a bug. </p>

<p>Rouslan Solomakhin - 2007-08-09</p>

 title : The mysql-filesystem-engine Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OverviewThis is a project for the MySQL Filesystem storage engine.  It translates normal files on your server into relational tables inside of MySQL.  It is a very alpha project at the moment, but works for basic usage.  You can see details of installing it and using it here: </p>

<p>http://mysql-filesystem-engine.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/README </p>

<p>Examplemysql&gt; CREATE TABLE LoadAverage (
<br/>       load1 DECIMAL(3, 2), 
<br/>       load5 DECIMAL(3, 2), 
<br/>       load15 DECIMAL(3, 2), 
<br/>       active_processes VARCHAR(12), 
<br/>       lastpid INTEGER) ENGINE=FILESYSTEM connection=&#39;file:///proc/loadavg&#39;;
<br/>Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.00 sec)</p>

<p>mysql&gt; select * from LoadAverage;
<br/>+-------+-------+--------+------------------+---------+
<br/>| load1 | load5 | load15 | active_processes | lastpid |
<br/>+-------+-------+--------+------------------+---------+
<br/>|  0.00 |  0.00 |   0.00 | 1/97             |    6061 | 
<br/>+-------+-------+--------+------------------+---------+
<br/>1 row in set (0.00 sec)SecurityAnyone who can create tables on your MySQL server will be able to read any file that mysqld can read!  Hopefully this will be fixed in the future, but remember, even temporary tables could be used, so proceed with caution. </p>

<p>DownloadingClick the &#39;Downloads&#39; tab at the top for the latest alpha release. </p>

<p>Questions, ProblemsFeel free to email me (cturner@pattern.net) if you have any questions or problems.  Or, better yet, if you have ideas for improvements or even patches!</p>
