<p>Regards </p>

<p>David </p>

<p>PD: If you want to know something more about me, see my profile.</p>
 summary : <p>This project provides support for variable size records (aka dynamic row format) in MySQL Heap (Memory) Engine. </p>

<p>Contributed under GPL2 by eBay, Inc April 2008 </p>

<p>As of March 2008, MySQL Heap Engine of any version is limited to fixed row format. It allocates fixed memory size for each record stored in a given Heap Table. For example, if table A has a VARCHAR(4000) column, MySQL will use at least 4000 bytes (plus other columns and per-record overhead) for every record regardless of whether it has that much user data. In this example, the table will use 4GB memory per 1M records. </p>

<p>Assuming that actual data in a VARCHAR varies (average data length is less than maximum), it would be best if Heap Engine could optimize its memory use. In the example above, if average VARCHAR data was 1000 bytes, the memory consumption would be 1GB rather than 4GB. </p>

<p>This project changes memory allocation mechanisms used by the MySQL Heap Engine. Each Heap Table uses separate area of memory for its own private use. When inserting new records, previous versions of MySQL would always allocate areas of &quot;reclength&quot; size. Reclength equals to maximum space that could be ever needed by one record in a given table. </p>

<p>The new approach adds a &quot;create table&quot; option to set chunk sizes. When inserting a new record, Heap Engine will analyze actual record data and calculate the number of &quot;chunks&quot; needed for a compact form of that record. It will then allocate the necessary chunks, link them together into a chunkset and store data in these chunks. </p>

<p>Variable size records provide &quot;dynamic&quot; row format, as opposed to &quot;fixed&quot; row format. For backwards compatibility, Heap Tables default to fixed row format. The project&#39;s scope is Heap (aka Memory) Engine/Table only, MyISAM and other engines do not have similar limitations. </p>

<p>For added flexibility, project introduces new HP_DATASPACE construct to MySQL Heap Engine, which should greatly simplify future BLOB support. Essentially, all BLOB&#39;s in a table would share their own HP_DATASPACE instance. Unfortunately, the author of this project did not have time to add BLOB implementation. </p>

<p>All the interesting technical details are provided in a big comment section in the beginning of hp_dspace.c, which documents design. The same information has been copied to the project&#39;s Wiki. </p>

<p>This project has been implemented by Igor Chernyshev of eBay Kernel Team. </p>

<p>UPDATE (July 30, 2008): Larry Zhou from Google and author of this project have contributed a few bug fixes. The diff and zip files have been updated accordingly. Original diff can be found in &quot;Deprecated&quot; downloads. </p>

<p>Here is a list of related Web pages: </p>

<p>eBay Wins Application of the Year at MySQL Conference &amp; Expo (The patch you&#39;re looking at was one of the two patches, which were critical to the success of that project) http://ebayinkblog.com/2008/04/15/ebay-wins-application-of-the-year-at-mysql-conference-expo and  http://en.oreilly.com/mysql2008/public/schedule/detail/1240 </p>

<p>MySQL Internals thread where Sergei and I discussed some elements of the design: http://lists.mysql.com/internals/35491 </p>

<p>Bug #25007 memory tables with dynamic rows format: http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=25007 </p>

<p>WL#1041: Blob &amp; dynamic row format support for HEAP tables: http://forge.mysql.com/worklog/task.php?id=1041 </p>

<p>&quot;MEMORY FORMAT=DYNAMIC&quot; discussion: http://forums.mysql.com/read.php?92,130771,130771#msg-130771 </p>

<p>First blob implementation for heap engine from May 2007. That implementation uses my_malloc for blobs, which cannot handle large number of rows and may cause massive memory fragmentation: http://lists.mysql.com/internals/34486 </p>

<p>&quot;Varchar patch for MySQL memory engine&quot;, by MySQL employee, referring to this patch: http://fallenpegasus.livejournal.com/707874.html</p>

 title : The mysql-killquery Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Note, this project was formerly known as &#39;check_mysql&#39; - the name has been changed to avoid conflict with the (more accurately named) Nagios plugin used to check MySQL&#39;s status.. </p>

<p>A sort of extension to MySQL&#39;s long query log, the script runs as a daemon with a continuous connection to MySQL, watching the list of running queries via SHOW PROCESSLIST. It enforces a timeout for queries - if a query runs too long, it is killed and a report, including the query and EXPLAIN output, is emailed to someone. </p>

<p>It does this using a continuous connection to the MySQL server. Periodic SHOW PROCESSLIST commands provide a list of running queries and how long they&#39;ve been running for. The KILL command is used to kill off queries that run longer than the timeout. </p>

<p>The script sets a configurable timeout, 60 seconds by default. If a query runs past the timeout, it is killed and a report is emailed out. The report includes the query and EXPLAIN output to use in debugging or optimizing the query. </p>

<p>Its probably not something you&#39;d want to use on a production system, but it is very useful during development and testing phases.</p>
 summary : <p>The lbpool project provides a load balancing JDBC driver for use with DB connection pools. It wraps a normal JDBC driver providing reconnect semantics in the event of additional hardware availability, partial system failure, or uneven load distribution. It also evenly distributes all new connections among slave DB servers in a given pool. Each time connect() is called it will attempt to use the best server with the least system load.</p>

But the problem is they are very complex for non expert user. That is why I decided to create user friendly web application for basic management of MySQL.  </p>

<p>It is meant to be plug and play application - just copy files on your server were is your MySQL database placed. </p>

<p>Go to index.php and login with your database username and password. </p>

<p>How this application works? </p>

 title : The mysql-log-filter Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>PurposeThe script filters the MySQL Slow Query Log to show queries which impacted performance most and is intended to be used by DB admins and application developers. </p>

<p>The log file is analyzed and processed as a stream, line after line, so there is no need to load the whole log file into memory. </p>

<p>--no-duplicates is a very useful option to see only necessary statistics. </p>

<p>--incremental remembers last input file positions and statistics in a SQLite 3 database, so periodical executions on the same files run much faster. </p>

<p>The Python version is usually 3-5 times faster than the PHP5 version. </p>

<p>You are welcome to contribute a version translated into your favorite scripting language, just open a feature request under Issues i.e. to add a Perl version. </p>

<p>Usage Examples# Filter slow queries executed for at least 3 seconds not from root, remove duplicates,
<br/># apply execution count as first sorting value and save first 10 unique queries to file.
<br/># In addition, remember last input file position and statistics.
<br/>php mysql_filter_slow_log.php -T=3 -eu=root --no-duplicates --sort-execution-count --top=10 --incremental linux-slow.log &gt; mysql-slow-queries.log</p>

<p># Start permanent filtering of all slow queries from now on: at least 3 seconds or examining 10000 rows, exclude users root and test
<br/>tail -f -n 0 linux-slow.log | python mysql_filter_slow_log.py -T=3 -R=10000 -eu=root -eu=test &amp;
<br/># (-n 0 outputs only lines generated after start of tail)</p>

<p># Stop permanent filtering
<br/>kill `ps auxww | grep &#39;tail -f -n 0 linux-slow.log&#39; | egrep -v grep | awk &#39;{print $2}&#39;`Filter Options-T=min_query_time
<br/>-R=min_rows_examined</p>

<p>-ih, --include-host
<br/>-eh, --exclude-host
<br/>-iu, --include-user
<br/>-eu, --exclude-user
<br/>-iq, --include-query</p>

<p>--date=date_first-date_last Include only queries between date_first (and date_last).
<br/>                            Input:                    Date Range:
<br/>                            13.11.2006             -&gt; 13.11.2006 - 14.11.2006 (exclusive)
<br/>                            13.11.2006-15.11.2006  -&gt; 13.11.2006 - 16.11.2006 (exclusive)
<br/>                            15-11-2006-11/13/2006  -&gt; 13.11.2006 - 16.11.2006 (exclusive)
<br/>                            &gt;13.11.2006            -&gt; 14.11.2006 - later
<br/>                            13.11.2006-            -&gt; 13.11.2006 - later
<br/>                             earlier    - 13.11.2006 (exclusive)
<br/>                            -13.11.2006            -&gt; earlier    - 14.11.2006 (exclusive)
<br/>                            Please do not forget to escape the greater or lesser than symbols (&gt;= 5.1.21 (or patched): 3 seconds = 3000000 microseconds
<br/># long_query_time=3.000000  # minimum: 0.000001 (1 microsecond)</p>

<p># Activate the Slow Query Log
<br/>slow_query_log  # &gt;= 5.1.29
<br/># log-slow-queries  # deprecated since 5.1.29</p>

<p># Write to a custom file name (&gt;= 5.1.29)
<br/># slow_query_log_file=file_name  # default: /data_dir/host_name-slow.log</p>

<p># Log all queries without indexes
<br/># log-queries-not-using-indexes</p>

<p># Log only queries which examine at least N rows (&gt;= 5.1.21)
<br/># min_examined_row_limit=1000  # default: 0</p>

<p># Log slow OPTIMIZE TABLE, ANALYZE TABLE, and ALTER TABLE statements
<br/># log-slow-admin-statements</p>

<p># Log slow queries executed by replication slaves (&gt;= 5.1.21)
<br/># log-slow-slave-statements</p>

<p># MySQL 5.1.6 through 5.1.20 had a default value of log-output=TABLE, so you should force
<br/># Attention: logging to TABLE only includes whole seconds information
<br/>log-output=FILE</p>

<p>## Admin query for online activation is possible since MySQL 5.1 (without server restart)
<br/>## SET @@global.slow_query_log=1
<br/>## SET @@global.long_query_time=1</p>

<p>## Show current variables related to the Slow Query Log
<br/>## SHOW GLOBAL VARIABLES WHERE Variable_name REGEXP &#39;admin|min_examined|log_output|log_queries|log_slave|long|slow_quer&#39;</p>
 summary : <p>Simple set of scripts to add semi-multi-master replication functionality to MySQL server. This could be used effectively to create backup server which would aggregate data from more than one master server with low or moderate insert/update traffic.</p>
 title : The mysql-mmre Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The mysql-monitoring Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Monitoring and statistics for MySQL servers using rrdtool and custom scripts. Currently monitors activity and replication stats.</p>
 title : The mysql-php-migrations Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project was created to address the problem of maintaining database changes within an actively developed PHP/MySQL project.  Frequently, multiple developers need to be able to quickly update their local sandboxes with the latest DB schema changes and also add their own without creating file conflicts in repositories such as CVS and Subversion. </p>

<p>MySQL-PHP-Migrations includes the following features: </p>

<p>command-line only utility migration files are stored using timestamps to reduce repository conflicts ability to list, migrate up, migrate down, run a specific migration, and migrate to latest database version each migration is wrapped in a transaction to ease error recovery migration information stored in database table to support interleaving (insertion of migrations between migrations that have already been run) in-line help support for PDO with MySQL driver or mysqli can store an initial DB schema which allows entire database structure to be erased and rebuilt from an initial schema and existing migrations</p>

 summary : <p>A java.util.logging Handler for sending log messages via SMTP, </p>

 summary : <p>The MySQL Query Analyzer is a Google Summer of Code 2008 project., </p>
 summary : <p>use standard Rails migrations to handle mysql5 stored routines, </p>

 title : The mysql-server-bottlenecks Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is a project that uses the PROFILING API of MySQL in order to find some bottlenecks or simply some modules whose execution takes long</p>
 summary : <p>mysql-storagemysql-storage is a PHP application that can store any size file in a MySQL database by splitting it into multiple chunks and rejoining when users attempt to download the file</p>
 title : The mysql-storage Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The way this tool will work is similar to any MySQL client. It will connect to the MySQL server and allow the user to create, delete, and update databases and tables, make queries and issue commands recognized by MySQL and the user will receive the output.  The main difference is that every command issued will be recorded in a serialized log, using MySQL Proxy; if more than one instance of the tool is open, it will record the commands from each instance within the same log as to simulate a concurrent connection. When the user has issued all the commands for inclusion in the test case they can use the tool to read the log, insert the necessary mysqltest commands, and output a .test and a .result file. </p>

<p>Developed as part of the Google Summer of Code 2007.</p>

 title : The mysqlicious Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>AboutMySQLicious provides automated mirroring/backups of Delicious bookmarks into a MySQL database. </p>

<p>Note that MySQLicious does not provide a mechanism for displaying bookmarks after they&#39;re in your database; that part is up to you. </p>

<p>RequirementsPHP 4 with cURL support MySQL Access to cron (or pseudo-cron). A Delicious account and some bookmarks. UsageMySQLicious is designed to be run as a cron job. See the tutorial for more information. Here&#39;s a quick example of how MySQLicious is used: </p>

<p>mirror(&quot;deliciousUser&quot;, &quot;deliciousPass&quot;, &quot;MySQLtable&quot;, &quot;deliciousTag&quot;);
<br/>?&gt;WarningDo not run MySQLicious on every page load or you&#39;ll get banned from the del.icio.us server. See the tutorial for information on proper setup.</p>

 title : The mysqlreplicationmanager Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OwebPHP is a self-contained website development kit (Web SDK) which allows you to run AMP-based (Apache/PHP/MySQL) pages and services from Windows with little or no configuration. </p>

<p>1. Unzip OwebPHP-20081211.zip to C: </p>

<p>2. Run C:\Start.cmd (double-click in Windows Explorer) </p>

<p>3. Visit http://localhost:1979/ </p>

<p>Really, that&#39;s it!  You can start putting files into the ./website/ directory or edit ./conf/httpd.conf to change the port to something else. </p>

<p>Stop the server by running Stop.cmd (see Issue #1 for notes on this). </p>

<p>PhilosophyI intend this to be a template for all new PHP/SQL projects, something that I can maintain centrally.  The whole thing is small enough to include with any enlistment and doesn&#39;t require any services to be installed; so you can keep your desktop/gaming machine nice and clean when you&#39;re not working on your web projects. </p>

<p>Disclaimer: This is not intended to be a production-quality package, but merely something which allows you to run and develop PHP websites locally, swiftly, and easily. </p>

<p>MySQLOwebPHP as of revision 6 comes with both the MySQL server (daemon) and the PHP modules to utilize it.  Since this runs as a separate service, you&#39;ll have to run an additional program to make the database available. </p>

<p>To start MySQL run ./mysql/MySQL-Start.cmd. To stop MySQL gracefully run ./mysql/MySQL-Stop.cmd, or just close the window (warning: this will probably cause database corruption). </p>

<p>Default information: </p>

<p>Port: 11979 (not the default of 3306) Database: mysql User: root Password: none (blank/empty) Host: localhost:11979 User Tables are unmodified from the distribution.  This means that while you can connect as root with no password, it only works when you are doing this on your local machine. </p>

<p>Restore a Dump by running the following from a command prompt: mysql --port=11979 -u root mysql &lt; filename.sql.  Change filename.sql to the name of the dump file you&#39;re importing. </p>

<p>VersionsHere is a list of the software components included and their current version. </p>

<p>PHP 5.2.3.3 w/ GD, SQLite Apache 2.0.63 MySQL 5.0.45 (Community Edition for NT) ContactFeel free to email me with suggestions for improving this little package: weenie(nospamkthx) gmail dot com.</p>

 summary : <p>The default MySQL client is nice, but I wanted to add some features to it, like command aliases.  I also wanted to be able to be in my normal shell and quickly grab stuff from a MySQL table without switching terminals.  So, I wrote a couple extensions to the psh (Perl Shell). </p>

<p>Two new commands are &quot;dls&quot; and &quot;dhead&quot;.  dls lists all the tables in the current database, but feels like a &quot;ls -ltr&quot; in that it sorts them by last-modified time and shows the sizes.  &quot;dhead&quot; just peeks at the top 10 records of a table, and it compresses long fields when possible so that it can try to fit on a page. </p>

<p>This is an alpha version but I use it quite a bit.</p>

 title : The auroraborealis Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Introduction </p>

<p>The basic idea here is to develop a web-based integrated development environment for the Java programming language that would provide all the basic tools of a classic IDE, and then provide a plug-in architecture to extend that platform to support more features. Much like how the Eclipse framework made a mark in the desktop IDE segment, this IDE will be the first, one-of-a-kind application that will kick start the web-based IDE segment. </p>

<p>Background </p>

<p>Have you ever found yourself programming on a machine that does not have a Java Integrated Development Environment (IDE) such as Eclipse or even the Java Development Kit (JDK) and with hundreds of megabytes to download? It is often extremely inconvenient! Since the new generation of smart phones and PDAs that support AJAX and Java, plus many desktop tools that are supposed to be only run on our local disk drives have been put on the web and achieve huge success, e.g. Google Doc, it makes sense to take advantage of the B/S structure and keep the hundreds of megabytes of IDE and JDK on the server side. Moreover, it offers opportunities for live collaboration with other team members on open-source projects. </p>

<p>Goals </p>

<p>Provide a web site with these components:  •	A simple source code editor with intelligent syntax highlighting •	The code editor uses technologies similar to Google Suggest  •	A build-automation tool so that debugging can be done on the fly  •	The IDE will also include calls that will provide for compilation and/or execution of programs •	A solid framework that includes a well-designed plug-in architecture for a web-based IDE •	A plug-in to the framework that will allow for development of projects that use the Java programming language (for testing the above component) •	… project management, task management etc. </p>

<p>Project Details </p>

<p>The environment will consist of a number of the most useful features that are currently provided by applications such as Eclipse. Firstly, a simple source code editor with intelligent syntax highlighting. Secondly, using technologies similar to Google Suggest, we can introduce a notion of auto completion by letting the user know which methods and variables are in range based on the current context and certain trigger characters. Finally, we build a build-automation tool so that debugging can be done on the fly. Once the code has been produced, the compiled class files can be executed on the client side/server side.  </p>

<p>This project does not intend to reinvent the wheel. On the server side, we can interact with an existing open source IDE such as Eclipse through writing a plug-in that is able to make use of some of the well documented modules. I believe that this project could result in a highly useful tool and change the general perspective on what an IDE should be.  </p>

<p>Background Needed </p>

<p>AJAX, GWT (Google Web Toolkit), web programming, database experience, an idea of what makes a good Java IDE</p>

 title : The cooltada Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A task list (also to-do list) is a list of tasks to be completed, such as chores or steps toward completing a project. It is an inventory tool which serves as an alternative or supplement to memory. </p>

<p>Task lists are used in self-management, grocery lists, business management, project management, and software development. It may involve more than one list. </p>

<p>When you accomplish one of the items on a task list, you check it off or cross it off. The traditional method is to write these on a piece of paper with a pen or pencil, usually on a note pad or clip-board. Numerous digital equivalents are now available, including PIM applications and most PDAs. There are also several web-based task list applications, many of which are free.</p>

 title : The domainevolution Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Open Science project on domain family expansionSome domain families of similar function have expanded more than others during evolution. By expansion it is meant changes in the number of domain instances for each domain type. Different domain families might have significantly different constraints imposed by their fold that could explain these differences. This project aims to understand what properties determine these differences focusing in particular on peptide binding domains. Examples of constraints to explore include average cost of production or capacity to generate binding diversity for the domain family. </p>

<p>This project is also a test for using Google Code as a research project management system for open science. Wiki pages will be used to collect previous research and milestone discoveries during the project development and to write the final manuscript towards the end of the project. Issue tracking system can be used to organize the required project tasks and assign them to participants. The file repository can hold the datasets and code used to derive any result. </p>

<p>This project is open to anyone interested in the subject that would be interested in contributing. Have a look at the wiki and pending issues and send an email to pedrobeltrao@gmail.com with the type of analysis/literature research that you would be interested in contributing with.  </p>

<p>  </p>

<p>The SH2 domain is an example of a peptide binding domain</p>
 title : The dshistory Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>What It IsdsHistory is a small, cross-browser JavaScript library that can be used in web applications to handle the browser&#39;s back and forward button events. As the back and forward events are raised, functions that the developer had previously pushed onto the internal function stack within the library are executed. </p>

<p>Take a look at the demo. I encourage you to check out what makes it different from other browser history managers. </p>

<p>Is It Stable?dsHistory is currently in beta and has not yet reached version 1.0. The first release occurred in April of 2007. That said, the code is functioning in production without problems on a number of different sites. </p>

<p>It should be noted that, in the case of all browser history managers, the term &quot;stable&quot; is used loosely. Browser history managers are based on a number of different oddities (euphemism for hacks) in each browser. Even though dsHistory only supports four different browsers, the number of complexities are already very high, and thus even the most basic functionality takes a great deal of effort to achieve. Increased complexity is always directly proportional to increased failure. </p>

<p>Where (Else) Can I Get Help?If you&#39;ve already ready the Usage wiki and you&#39;ve taken a look at the Examples wiki, you can post in the dsHistory-discuss Google Group. If you still can&#39;t figure it out, I&#39;m more than happy to help where and when I can. You can email me at amattie-attt-gmail-dottt-com. </p>

<p>Getting UpdatesI&#39;ll be posting information about major releases on my blog. I&#39;ll post new downloads and other project-specific updates on the dsHistory Project Updates blog. Otherwise, you can check back here for updates. </p>

<p>Current Browser SupportFirefox 2, 3 : Yes Internet Explorer 6, 7 : Yes Safari 2 : No Safari 3 : Yes Google Chrome : Yes Opera : No</p>

But we need a community of software developers working on the same code base in order to assimilate the multitude of stand-alone apps out there that all do the same thing: prepare for, mitigate, respond to, and recover from disasters. emcode will become the hub to this network of disaster management and software technology. </p>

<p>Call for ParticipantsAre you a software developer? Do you want to contribute to the future of technology-based disaster management? Do you have application ideas for: logistics, decision support systems, web-based emergency operations centers, mitigation and business continuity software? Then join the emcode group and get involved in our roadmap activity. </p>

 title : The emcode Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The erlang-t-build Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>WelcomeAs presented on Wednesday 27 February 2008 at the Erlang London User Group meeting at the offices of Skills Matter, 1 Sekforde Street, London UK. </p>

<p>http://uk.groups.yahoo.com/group/erlang-london/message/15 </p>

<p>&quot;The T-Build system simplifies and automates the creation of new Erlang/OTP projects, automates the build and packaging process, and automates the deployment of software onto the target systems. The T-Build system will assist any developers who have discovered Erlang, and are now prepared to use it for industrial purposes. It fills the gap between learning the language and deploying it.&quot; </p>

<p>RamblingsThere&#39;s also a podcast of my rambling talk advertised on the SkillsMatter website. I recommend a visit there, the other podcasts are far more interesting than mine! </p>

<p>In case SkillsMatter decide that there are far more interesting talks to advertise, considering the calibre and stature of the other speakers who can blame them, the direct link to Google Video </p>

<p>My fifteen minutes of fame, not! </p>

<p>BlogI&#39;ve half-heartedly started a related blog to accompany this project. </p>

<p>Similar ProjectsA different approach to project creation can be found at Erlware. The Erlware philosophy is different, and aims to be a far more dynamic development model than T-Build aims to be. I&#39;ve met Martin and Eric, and these guys are hard working individuals who have put a lot of love, care and attention into Erlware. Check it out, and say I said &quot;Hi!&quot; </p>

<p>RequirementsYou will need: </p>

<p>Subversion, but I expect other version control systems can replace this hard-coded dependency on svn the very latest GNU make, otherwise make will break under the stress bash sed Erlang OTP, any version will do. </p>

<p>DownloadT-Build is laid out differently to the traditional style of Subversion repositories, and following the instructions on the Source Checkout page will result in a big fat nothing. Sorry, but I haven&#39;t yet found how to change the Google default message. </p>

<p>If you Browse the source you will see three top level directories: </p>

<p>Applications Projects Tools </p>

<p>To begin you may have to register yourself as a project member, since committing projects to the repository require this. Without membership, you will create a project, but some files will not have the correct permissions (yes, this is a bug). This is fixed in revision r13 and later. </p>

<p>Checkout the top level non-recursively, then inside the project checkout Projects/, again non-recursively: </p>

<p>~$ svn checkout -N https://erlang-t-build.googlecode.com/svn/ erlang-t-build --username phmander
<br/>Authentication realm:  Google Code Subversion Repository
<br/>Password for &#39;phmander&#39;: 
<br/>Checked out revision RRR.
<br/>~$ cd erlang-t-build/
<br/>~/erlang-t-build$ ls
<br/>~/erlang-t-build$ svn ls
<br/>Applications/
<br/>Projects/
<br/>Tools/
<br/>branches/
<br/>tags/
<br/>trunk/
<br/>wiki/
<br/>~/erlang-t-build$ svn up -N Projects/
<br/>A    Projects
<br/>A    Projects/create-new-project
<br/>Updated to revision RRR.
<br/>~/erlang-t-build$ cd Projects/
<br/>~/erlang-t-build/Projects$ ls
<br/>build-everything
<br/>create-new-project
<br/>create-new-project-2.0
<br/>create-new-project-2.1
<br/>merge-wizard
<br/>norm-src-files
<br/>Template
<br/>Template-2.0
<br/>update-OTP-versionsThere should be a create-new-project-2.0 script available for action. Have a look at CreateNewProject for instructions. </p>

<p>StatusRevision 13 and laterThe version committed to Googlecode as of 2008-August-21 (from revision 13 onwards) tracks changes made since Friday 2008-March-07 inside T-Mobile during the course of day to day development. </p>

<p>One &quot;feature&quot; has been removed: it is no longer necessary to commit the newly created projects to enable them to build. Projects will build immediately after being created. </p>

<p>Another benefit added is that the scripts and created projects work on Apple Mac OS X, in addition to Linux and Solaris. </p>

<p>Up to revision 12The version committed to Googlecode as of 2008-Feb-29 (up to revision 12) is not optimised for use over the Internet. Running the Create New Project script will be ve-e-ery slo-o-ow. T-Build as used in T-Mobile is executed on a repository on a fast local network, and pushing T-Build onto Googlecode has revealed how painfully dependent it is on a fast network. Apologies for this &#39;feature&#39;. I plan to find ways of improving matters, possibly with a repository cache, or simply better algorithms. </p>

<p>LicenseLicensed as Mozilla Public License 1.1, with additional provisions stated in the Erlang Public License which is a derivative work of the Mozilla Public License, Version 1.0: </p>

<p>http://www.erlang.org/EPLICENSE</p>

 title : The etomite Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Etomite is an adaptable Web Content Management System plus a robust Content Management Framework. Written in PHP and using a MySQL database back end, it provides an intuitive &#39;manager&#39; in an effort to make creating web projects faster and easier for end users. Its flexible API aims to provide developers a straightforward way to change the core functionality or behavior of the application without having to resort to hacking the core code itself. It therefore allows for customizations as well as a more straightforward, simple future upgrade path.</p>

 title : The flagstaff Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FlagstaffGovernment&#39;s New Best Friend on the Web.Federal, state, and local governments have done a poor job of keeping up with the times.  In an age of communication powered by global electronic networks, accessibility to public information is becoming less of a luxury and more of a requirement.  The U.S. federal government has taken great pains in attempting to put a huge amount of public information online to make it accessible to the general populous, most notably through the Bureau of Labor Statistics&#39; site (http://bls.gov), and yet information overload - making too much data accessible online without highlighting the most relevant information for the average citizen - has emerged as a new problem. </p>

<p>Flagstaff addresses these problems by packaging together a set of robust tools that are easy for any human being to deploy, use, and understand.  Presentation is key to producing a product that is both easy to leverage and learn from.   </p>

<p>Flagstaff is:Turn-key web presence specifically designed from the start for townships, municipalities, and other organizations focused on providing transparent communications with the general public. Accountability features, including update blogs, gantt charts, public task tracking, and calendars. Simple, sensible, and potent document management. Financial/budget visualization tools for quickly discovering &quot;where the dollars go.&quot; Content management for pages, information, and people profiles. Mobility features for access to information on the go from smart devices.</p>
 summary : <p>Freelance Project Manager is a simple system allowing developers and clients to use one central location to create new deals, and discuss projects.</p>

<p>A fuller description will come when the project is completed.</p>

 title : The gearquery Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Gearquery is a lightweight library that wraps Google Gears for easy querying and manipulation.  Some project goals: </p>

<p>Be lightweight Make CRUD dead simple Make DB code more DRY To meet these goals, gearquery provides a module that takes care of: </p>

<p>creating/dropping tables the four CRUD operations transactions before/after hooks for each CRUD operation Here are some examples: </p>

<p>// create a project table and project Manager
<br/>var project = new gearquery.Manager(&quot;project&quot;, {
<br/>    id: &quot;integer not null primary key&quot;,
<br/>    name: &quot;varchar(40) not null&quot;
<br/>});</p>

<p>// select all projects whose name is gearquery
<br/>project.read({name: gearquery});
<br/>project.read({}, {where: [&quot;name = ?&quot;, &quot;gearquery&quot;]});</p>

<p>// create some projects within a transaction
<br/>gearquery.transaction(function(){
<br/>    project.create({name: &quot;Pye Automation&quot;});
<br/>    project.create({name: &quot;Gearquery Code&quot;});
<br/>});</p>

<p>// update and delete a project
<br/>project.update({name: &quot;Gearquery V2&quot;}, {where: [&quot;id = ?&quot;, 2]});
<br/>project.del({id: 2});</p>

<p>// add hooks into gearquery&#39;s CRUD system
<br/>project.before(&quot;create&quot;, function(data){
<br/>    data.name = data.name || &quot;Default Name&quot;;
<br/>});</p>

<p>project.after(&quot;create&quot;, function(data){
<br/>    projectCount++;
<br/>});To get started, read GettingStarted. </p>

<p>If you run into any bugs or want to give some feedback please email me at hugh (at) hughbien (dot) com.</p>

 title : The generic-libraries Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>PurposeAs I find I have rewritten nearly identical code for many projects, I figure it is time to put them into a repository and keep improving them instead of rewriting them. </p>

<p>RoadmapGeneric Utilities, Advanced Tagging, a clean, stable source repository and more. This project is composed of sub-projects ranging from mundane to (hopefully) groundbreaking: but all should be useful to a variety of developers on all kinds of projects. See the SubProjects page for more information. </p>

<p>LicenseThe license for the project is the Apache License 2.0 because I believe that, while acknowledging original authors is appropriate, it is perfectly OK to take code, improve or adapt it and apply a new license or new terms to its use. In this light, you are of course more than welcome to use this code for commercial purposes. However it would be greatly appreciated if you could please drop me a line to let me know that you have found my work to be useful. Thanks! See the License page for more information. </p>

<p>ManagementContributing and Project ManagementSee the page on Contributing and Project Management for more information on those topics. </p>

<p>Code / File ManagementSee the page on Code / File Management for more information on the structure of the SVN repository, how to get code and how to contribute code to the project.</p>
 title : The gmslpm Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The gmslpm (groupmsl project manager) project is based off the gmslappcore. It will allow users, teams and projects to all be administered from a web interface. </p>

<p>This project is designed to help any coordinators of any type of project. It is intended for online project management. Whether it is an online open source project/s to managing all of the departments in a school, hopefully this project will be for you!! </p>

<p>Features WILL include:   (when it is first released) </p>

<p>A file storage section for each user, team and project, including files everyone can access, and files members of project or the team can access. An issues section, where users can log issues related to a project. A pages section, where users, teams and projects can host pages of information. A Question section, where users can ask questions to teams and projects. For a full list of proposed features, visit the MainAims wiki page to the right. </p>

<p>This project will not be finished unless the gmslappcore is finished alongside it. I am working on both projects, and am using this project to dragg along the gmslappcore project. If you wish to help with this project, please help the gmslappcore project, as it is necessary for the functionality of this project. ANY HELP WOULD BE GREATLY APPRECIATED!!</p>

 title : The hackyapp-projstatus Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Project Status ApplicationThe purpose and aim of the Project Status Application has always been to provide metrics data to both developers and management in a meaningful, constructive fashion. </p>

<p>The primary goal of this project is to provide an application to interpret metrics data in assisting tech leads to provide detailed high level project information to upper management.  The primary portion of this project includes a web application that provides project leads with the ability to generate emails containing metrics data reflecting the projects which they own.  The application differs from the traditional email alert function in that the data it presents is encapsulated and presented in HTML format instead of traditional text. </p>

<p>Project Status NewsVersion 3.0 has been released.  For the class work this represents the final production version but with respect to the customer&#39;s need this version does not actually represent the final product.  The site will continue to be updated as I complete this module as well as update it with anticipation of Hackystat Version 8. </p>

<p>Visit the News Page! </p>

<p>Project Status LinksVersion 3 is now available! </p>

<p>Version 3 administrator guide is now available. </p>

<p>Version 2.0 Use Cases are now available. </p>

<p>Version 2.0 has been released! </p>

 title : The hitlist Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Hitlist is a simple Pylons application that allows for tag based task management.  Todo items are created and tags are associated with each of those items.   </p>

<p>The task list can then be sorted by tag, status (complete or not) or multiple tags. </p>

<p>This can be useful as a personal task keeper, as well as a good learning project for Pylons. </p>

<p>The code used here is a precursor for the genoa project management system (also hosted on google code).</p>

 title : The hotelrsf Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Here is the code for the Hotel Management Program. For the project management course in ITESM.</p>
 summary : <p>People always thought of a method of sharing details Project Management, Collaborative Writing and Efficient Document Sharing and I found out XWIKI as a great choice for document sharing. Normally as software developers we mostly involve in team work. To become a good team all the members should carry the responsibilities and everybody should communicate efficiently. The communication will reduce the duplication of work and increase the efficiency of a team work and increase the responsiveness to changes. </p>

<p>XWIKI can play a key role in communication and sharing documentation. XWIKI has capabilities of online presentations that will make the life of the user easy to understand there work. Event calendar can have the schedules of the activity of the projects explaining milestones deliverables and deadlines. Adding RSS feeds will provides the recent changes to RSS readers. </p>

<p>Most software developers hate to do documentation. Using XWIKI developer can document the work and publish it easily. More importantly if this can be done on your favorite IDE then that will ease this task more. Most of our developers prefer to work using Eclipse as it has quite a lot of plugins. So developing a plugin for Eclipse that can edit XWiki pages directly from the IDE will be a great choice for a developer to share the details progress of work done regarding the assigned task. </p>

<p>The ultimate goal of this plugin is to provide the following basic features as requested by the XWIKI. By using the plugin the user will be able to edit, save, rename, delete, and add comments. I will also like to add the advanced features of grabbing a wiki site locally so that one can work offline. Since most of the JAVA developers uses Eclipse as there favorite IDE and if XWIKI and Eclipse can get tide with this plugin that will increase the usage of XWIKI also. The increasing number of users of XWIKI will strengthen the community around it and help to improve with new features.</p>

 summary : <p>limedog is a web based project manager that hurts. Poor doggie. </p>

<p>It&#39;s supposed to be a general purpose kind of project manager. There&#39;s plenty of Free Software project managers around, but they either suck or is the software-projects-only kind of project manager. </p>

<p>At the moment, this project has one developer and maintainer, and the source isn&#39;t stable or ready for production at all. </p>

<p>When managing an open source project, it&#39;s important to get your priorities straight. This is why I created a logo draft at this stage of the project (currently revision 5 of the trunk). </p>

 title : The melies Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Melies is an online non-linear creative editing and visual effects platform for film, standard- and high-definition video work. </p>

<p>Note: This project is only on the planning stage with only some demos going live soon, more or less coded and held together by duct tape. </p>

<p>The project source code is managed by darcs, a distributed revision control system, and not by Google Code Subversion. But the main developer repository will be publicly available in the near future. </p>

<p>The projects initial goals are far from ambitious, instead we embrace constraints:  </p>

<p>Build a simple digital film editor iola doing nothing more advanced than what a Moviola can do. Only work with image sequences with no need to mess around with video codecs. The origin of the source image sequences are outside the scope of the application, it doesn&#39;t need to know. Work with progressive images of any resolution at any fame rate only limited by the end-user hardware.</p>

 title : The mijob Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MiJob is a project &amp; hour management system written in PHP using MySQL. Its main goal is to be such a system that seems more like a genuinely handy tool, that is to say, to attrack the users. </p>

<p>Arguably, the most gruesome problem with project management systems is getting people to actually use it on a regular basis. The MiJob philosophy is that the user should feel like he is really using a tool that makes things easier and clearer, not a tool where at best, he doesn&#39;t screw up. MiJob is supposed to be person-friendly, in the way that if you create a project in MiJob (which everyone can do), no one else has access to it unless you specifically give them the access. That is a typical design principle in MiJob; cutting the user a great deal of slack.</p>

 title : The mobilegtd Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A free GTD (Getting Things Done) application for mobile phones (Series 60)MobileGTD turns your Series 60 phone into a GTD notebook on steroids </p>

<p>NEWSIRC ChannelWe have an IRC channel now! It&#39;s called #mobilegtd (irc.freenode.net). Come over and be productive ;) </p>

<p>MobileGTD be sexy!I am currently thinking about giving MobileGTD a new flash lite based user interface. I have done a major rework on the back-end, so new features will be easier to implement here. But we also need a nice UI for all of this! David Allen said something like: Buy the yourself a really good pencil then you will be more likely to write things down with it. And MobileGTD definitely needs work on this end. </p>

<p>Get involved!I challenge all users of MobileGTD to think about how a nice UI for MobileGTD would look like. Send me whatever comes to your mind in the form of sketches, pictures, mockups. Maybe someone even knows some flash lite? I am really looking forward to seeing your ideas!! </p>

<p>What are the features?Based on a simple file and directory structure (easy synchronization with PC) Use your favourite file explorer to browse your actions Usable as a simple inbox, allowing you to create projects on the fly Searchable project list view Project editing functionality (add/remove actions/infos) Processing functionality (automatically find done actions) Review assistance (find projects with no active next action and projects that have not changed for a certain time) Compatible to GTDFiles Show me something!Ok, have a look at the brand new screencastScreencast </p>

<p>Or some screenshotsClick on the images to see the original Flickr page with explanations. </p>

<p>The project list view </p>

<p>The project details view </p>

<p>Creating a new action </p>

<p>How does it work?MobileGTD uses simple text files for projects. Each line in a project file can be either an action or an info. When adding an action to a project, a new line is added to the project file and a file is created in  a directory structure corresponding to your contexts.  If you e.g. create an action &quot;Computer Download new version of MobileGTD&quot; MobileGTD will create a file &quot;Download new version of MobileGTD.act&quot; in a directory called &quot;Computer/&quot;. You can also use nested contexts, e.g. &quot;Computer/Online/&quot; to further structur your contexts. To avoid too much typing you can define abbreviations for contexts, you could e.g. define &quot;26&quot; to be expanded to &quot;Computer/Online/&quot;. </p>

<p>You can then use any file explorer to browse through your actions and delete done ones.  When processing projects MobileGTD automatically searches for deleted actions and sets them to done in the project file. </p>

<p>How do I install and use it?For installation instructions see Installation. For an explanation of how to use MobileGTD I am planning to make a video, but I&#39;m not sure when I will have the time... </p>

<p>SummaryIf this sounds rather complicated, fear not!  It&#39;s dead simple! All you have to do is use the graphical interface to create and manage your projects and any file explorer to browse through the actions and delete the ones you have done. </p>

<p>DonateIf you like MobileGTD and it helps you in Getting Things Done you may also consider making a donation. This is a motivational thing, so don&#39;t ruin yourself financially ;)</p>
 summary : <p>Monkey Project is a management system for projects. In short it enables users to create projects and manage some aspects of it. </p>

<p>Monkey Project is a modular system which means that the core infrastructure is very generic and extensible. However, the first goal of Monkey Project will be to facilitate the creation of software projects by initiating an SVN repository and a Trac installation for each project that is created. </p>

<p>Monkey Project handles all the &quot;paperwork&quot; such as project creation requests, project approvals and such and provides a set of &quot;hooks&quot; for scripts that are responsible for instantiating the necessary environment.</p>

 summary : <p>Open-CRM is a open source CRM for enterprise (Customer Relationship Management) written in PHP&amp;MySQL. It is a web based system for contact management, marketing and sales support, project tracking and other CRM (customer relationship management) related tasks.
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Open-CRM is based on a highly scalable open source software stack, known as LAMP (also WAMP): Linux (or Windows) operating system, Apache webserver (IIS possible), MySQL database, PHP language. The system can be installed either at your hosting provider&#39;s webspace or on your company (intranet/internet) server. Runs on all major platforms like Unix, Linux, Windows, Mac OS X, Novell(6.5).
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Current modules include: CRM/Address Book/Dashboard, Calendar, Content Management, Wiki, Project Management tools, Email Ticketing, Website News, File Sharing and Accounting/ERP</p>

 title : The patternnotes Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>PatternNotes provides Java annotations for design patterns and coding idioms. </p>

<p>These annotations are valuable for concisely expressing a developer&#39;s intentions. For example, suppose that you are maintaining a project and you encounter code like this: </p>

<p>public class Foo {
<br/>    ...</p>

<p>    private Foo() {}</p>

<p>    private static final class FooHolder {
<br/>        public static final Foo INSTANCE = new Foo();
<br/>        private FooHolder() {}
<br/>    }</p>

<p>    public static Foo getInstance() {
<br/>        return FooHolder.INSTANCE;
<br/>    }</p>

<p>    ...
<br/>}You might wonder about the purpose of the nested class. You may recognize Foo as a singleton, but the nested class gives you pause. Maybe the nested class seems extraneous at first glance, but the original writer probably had some good reason for putting it there. You certainly don&#39;t want to break anything, so it would be valuable to understand what the original author was thinking. Maybe this is some &quot;special&quot; form of singleton that you&#39;ve not seen previously. </p>

<p>Now look at this annotated version: </p>

<p>@Singleton
<br/>public class Foo {
<br/>    ...</p>

<p>    private Foo() {}</p>

<p>    @LazyInitializationHolder
<br/>    private static final class FooHolder {
<br/>        public static final Foo INSTANCE = new Foo();
<br/>        private FooHolder() {}
<br/>    }</p>

<p>    public static Foo getInstance() {
<br/>        return FooHolder.INSTANCE;
<br/>    }</p>

<p>    ...
<br/>}Now you are sure that Foo is intended to be a singleton, as you suspected. Also, there is an annotation on the nested class. You jump to the source code of the annotation and read the annotation&#39;s Javadoc to learn that the technique is discussed in the popular Java books &quot;Effective Java&quot; and &quot;Java Concurrency in Practice&quot; and on blogs. </p>

<p>You consult these references and learn about the synchronization issues involved. Confident in the knowledge that you understand the situation, you make your changes while retaining existing functionality. </p>

<p>Copyright © 2008, Iparelan Solutions, LLC. All rights reserved.</p>
 summary : <p>For us to use</p>

 summary : <p>Welcome to the home of an open source php trouble ticket system. PhpTroubleTicket is a personal project developed by Fabio Bedini aka whisher. For everything from bug tracking and customer support to project management and to-do lists. </p>

<p>Mark up -  Valid css and xhtml strict using unobtrusive Javascript with jQuery framework. Multilanguages -  Using a simple xml file Group Mode -  Allows assigning an operator to one group and smart ticket routing based on the ticket&#39;s group attribute id. Group Privileges -  Every group can be hold different privileges (CRUD). Unlimited operators/users -  Create as many operator/user logins as your business needs. Ticket monitoring -  Customers and operators are always able to see ticket status and ticket owner info. Highly customizable -  Template driven software for easy customization to match your web site appearance. Unlimited categories- Unlimited and nested categories. Paging, searching and table sortable - In the operators, users, categories, workgroups and tickets sections. </p>

<p>It&#39;s released under MIT license. </p>

<p>You can find a demo at  http://www.blogial.net/demo/phpTroubleTicket/www/admin/login.php </p>

<p>Username: operator_7 </p>

<p>Password: operator_7 </p>

<p>Best wishes. </p>

<p>Fabio Bedini aka Whisher ;)</p>

 summary : <p>The first goal of the Project Management Web Application is to be highly user friendly. The application will leverage the rich client technologies (such as Ajax) to create a pleasant user experience when engaged in the grueling task of project management. The application should allow multiple users to manage a project and see the tasks, milestones, and their status. Additionally the application should allow resource management among multiple projects or tasks. For example, if the UI indicates that a certain task is running behind schedule, the project manager should be able to easily move a resource from one project to another. It should be as easy as drag and drop.</p>

 title : The powermgrprx Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>PSP Power Management PluginThis plugin has been designed and coded to optimize the energy consumption of the PSP while we stay in the XMB. </p>

<p>This plugin has 4 main functions described here. </p>

<p>Music Mode: To activate this mode you have to press L+R, this performs an underclock to 60Mhz for the CPU and 30 Mhz for the main system bus, suitable  to listen to your Mp3 and even ATRAC music files. Pressing again L+R will set the CPU/Bus speeds to the ones you had previously configured. Toggleidle: This mode disables the autoidle feature of the console (not of the screen) this mode can be toggled on/off by pressing R+START, useful when watching pictures of any kind (even pr0n!). Powerlock: Pressing R+NOTE you will lock the console power switch in order to prevent an accidental turn off of the system, if you toggled it on and you attempted to turn off the console it will simply don&#39;t, but when you unlock it, the console automatically will turn off (if you did not touch the power switch it will unlock but it won&#39;t turn off the system). Black Screen Mode: Pressing L+START we turn off the PSP Screen until we press L+START again, the screen will turn on and set itself with the previous brightness level you had. Useful used toghether with Music Mode it can save you a lot of battery! Software power off: Pressing R+SQUARE, the system will turn off totally, this feature was too easy to implement, I left this here because you liked it, and if it is useful to someone I won&#39;t remove it. Contributing to the projectYou can contribute to this project by leaving feedback at http://erchampi.wordpress.com or opening a new issue at this project page at the Issues tab. </p>

<p>If you want to improve the project&#39;s source, you&#39;re encouraged to do so by checking out the trunk of the projects or the branches corresponding each version starting up from 0.2.3 and submitting a patch with your changes to 3rCh4mp1@gmail.com it will be tested and reviewed and then it will be integrated into the project&#39;s source tree</p>
 title : The ppc-orders Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project is a test only.</p>
 summary : <p>Project Management Software System (PRMSS) is a Project Management software that allows you to manage your projects and provides simple communication between your team.  </p>

<p>PRMSS is made using Java and the GUI is Swing. It has a client-server architecture where the communication between the client and server is Remote Method Invocation (RMI).  </p>

<p>PRMSS is currently still under development where in future version, it would suport plugin framework and may release an SDK where developers can script their own plugins and customize their own PRMSS (client and server) to how they want it. </p>

<p>The default database for PRMSS is H2 database system but in the future version, it maybe able to support any database using JDBC to connect in and also to an extend, some custom SQL statements of individual databases.</p>
 title : The prmss Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The proctorticket Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ProctorTicket v0.4Copyright (c) 2008 Zachary Voase  </p>

<p>AboutProctorTicket is an application, written in Python, which allows you to read a parseable proctor output log, or run a proctor test, and import all generated errors as Trac tickets. Tickets are the equivalent of issues, tasks or bugs in other software project management systems. ProctorTicket will determine the test class each error belongs to and group them accordingly. In addition, ProctorTicket can tell when a test has already been carried out, and it will not add the issue. If a test has been carried out before but the results vary, then it will automatically update the tickets to reflect this. </p>

<p>ProctorTicket was created as part of the Google Highly Open Participation Contest, and can be found at http://code.google.com/p/proctorticket. </p>

<p>InstallationTo install ProctorTicket, ensure that: </p>

<p>You have the latest versions of both Proctor and Trac installed. You have a Trac environment already set up in a directory which you can write to. The executable proctorbatch is available on your system path variable. The modules trac and proctorlib can both be imported from your Python interpreter. To install, just type: </p>

<p>sudo python setup.py install 
<br/>from the directory to which you extracted the tarball or checked out the latest revision from Google Code SVN. </p>

<p>UsageThe command line interface to ProctorTicket, named proctorticket surprisingly enough, was written using optparse, so it has extensive documentation just by typing proctorticket --help at the command line. All of the functions and classes in the Python API have docstrings, so you can explore those from the interpreter or browse the included documentation, which was generated by epydoc. </p>

<p>An example of usage may be the following: </p>

<p>    proctorticket --keywords --log-file=example.log --env-path=/usr/share/trac \
<br/>        --reporter=zvoase --update proctor tracWhat this just did was: </p>

<p>Specified that there were going to be keywords coming up after all of the options. Used the Proctor output log file example.log. Used the Trac installation housed at /usr/share/trac. Set the reporter of all of the generated issues to &#39;zvoase&#39;. Set the keywords to &#39;proctor&#39; and &#39;trac&#39;. Told ProctorTicket that, should it find that the same test class has already been carried out, but there are differences, it should update the pre-existing ticket to reflect the changes. Play around with the --help option and see what else you can find.</p>

 title : The project-sdlc-lifecycle-management Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Initial Target: </p>

<p>1. SDLC Definition 2. SDLC Customization by Project 3. Tracking SDLC by Project so all requirements are completed. </p>

<p>Larget would be to make sure once SDLC is defined, it can be used as a template for any project. These projects created in system will then be linked with one of the SDLC definition. Then, the system will track all different phases within SDLC, all required documentation, etc. </p>

<p>Target Audience is medium to small companies which can install software and quickly define SDLC or use a predefined SDLC for their companies. </p>

<p>SDLC can be defined so it may match any of the predefined standards like CMMI, etc.</p>

 title : The projexion Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Projexion is a Project Management tool that uses Scrum methodology. You will need to get a grasp on Scrum first before using Projexion. </p>

<p>Here is a good resource about Scrum: </p>

<p>Scrum Development Process </p>

<p>Projexion also uses the best breed Java framework found in the industry: </p>

<p>Hibernate. For the persistence layer. Springframework. For the business layer. Tapestry 5. For the web layer. Maven 2. For the project build tool. TestNG. For unit testing. Groovy. For dynamic pages JSecurity. For security. Mockito. For mock object. </p>

<p>This project mostly use JDK 5 features such as Annotations and Generics, though there are still some configuration from Spring that still uses XML. </p>

<p>I created this project because I could&#39;t find a decent scrum based project management tool for me to use, even though there is you would require to buy it which in the end would not be approved by my boss. </p>

<p>If you can lend your hand with this project, please send an e-mail to joshua.javaREMOVE@gmail.com </p>

<p>Thank you</p>
 summary : <p>This project manager aims to an easy to use project manager, i know there&#39;s a lot of pm software , but i wanted do create one to apply the mixing knowledge i have of pm and software development. </p>

<p>It uses spring, hibernate, flex, xfire and others. it aims to be  a mixing of cool technologies. </p>

<p>it has no relation with the dog food. ;-)</p>
